First of all Gordon, please give Scott (our waiter) a raise!!! What a great experience we had at your restaurant.  We loved every part of it.  Ordered the fish and chips and everything was perfect.  Cooked just right.   We would come here again next time in Vegas!!

I am here at the restaurant and wanted to share me experience. We ordered the Mule and it was good.  We also ordered the Lamb Burger "Med Well" and pigs in a blanket. The Lamb was over cooked. It took the server more than 10 minutes after we got our food to ask how the food was.  I told him that I asked for the burger to be med well and it was more than well done.  He said well med well is some pink and it barely past that stage. I said there should be pink for med well and red for med. He offered to get me a new one but we had plans to be somewhere with friends.  The manager or supervisor past is more than 8 times and never acknowledged us and never said hi. He would spend more time with the girls that worked there talking and laughing by the table then supervising. We got our total bill and he never apologized when giving us the bill or fortune our payment. We still tipped him 15%  for someone who has worked in hotels and has managed a restaurant I know i can be critical but bad service is something I don't deal well with.  I watch Gordon Ramsey show all the time and I admire what he does but I don't think he would be very happy with the strive provided here. The lamb was over cooked and had no flavor.  Well. It actually tasted very lamby if that's a work. Lol.  I expected so much more from this restaurant.  We were going to order dessert and shots of tequila but after my experience I did not want to give this restaurant more business.

Awesome.

Would love to give this place a five, but I can't. And here's why.

The location is right on the casino floor and for me, this is not a good thing. The service was also pretty slow and more importantly, the portions were not mindblowing; especially compared to similar restaurants nearby.

The menu was compelling, and the cocktails were outstanding. A really enjoyable meal.
The food was alright. I got the pesto chicken and it was nothing  amazing. Probably wouldn't come again which is a shame

The skins on the Bangers in the Bangers and Mash were very tough. The mash was very sloppy. The gravy not too bad. I had apple and rhubarb crumble for desert  which was dry and needed custard. All in all, expensive mediocre simple food. I'm disappointed Gordon.

My wife and I went here on 8/11/2016 for appetizers, and we're very disappointed. We checked in with the hostess, and were told it would be a fifteen minute wait. After several other patrons without reservations were seated, we asked on the our status, and they forgot about us. After being seated our service was slow, and I found the menu to be overpriced. We each ordered a Sierra Mist that were $5 each, and our two appetizers were $18 each with small portions. Service was slow, and our server was slower. The food was good, but you can get much more for your money at other places. Do yourself a favor and go to BurGR. That was light years ahead of this place.

Wow! I have never had a Burger that was this amazing, tasty, and delicious.

Sat at the bar here in Ceasars Palace to enjoy the last period of playoff hockey.

Ramon, an awesome bartender who went way out of his way to create an amazing bourbon drink, shared with us some of the cool insider stories that understandably has led to a terrific camaraderie here in the restaurant.

Staff is all pleasant, energetic, friendly and really love what they do. Easy to understand when you hire right and inspire the best.

Ok, enough of the overkill, but seriously this place is a lot of fun. Good British Pub food with the master touch of Gordon Ramsay.

Definitely check it out if you come to Las Vegas and consider sitting at the bar if you're solo or just the two of you.

Awesomeness.

There is nothing special about this restaurant.  I'd actually give it 1 1/2 stars if I could.  

First, the only appetizer they were out of was the pot pie sampler - our server only told us that when I attempted to order it.  Oops - it would have been nice to be told that before getting my heart set on it.  

We ordered the chicken pesto sandwich, which came with french fries. and the lobster roll.  The highlight of the meal were the fries, very crispy and served with a ketchup/horseradish condiment.  The sandwich was dry and not very flavorful.  The lobster roll had more roll than I would have hoped for and more mayo than needed.  

The service was merely adequate - our server took the order, delivered the order and then brought the check.  Hmmm... as a local, you kinda expect at least a check-in by your server to find out if you need anything else.  

I guess Mr. Ramsay figures that tourists will eat at his restaurant because of his fame and then, who cares.

I have to note that I never review Vegas restaurants, the quality of food is "suppose" to be good. 

I loved our experience here.  We went for lunch, the drinks came out quick  the food was delicious and the service was on point. If you go get dessert!

Egads this place is a hot mess. The service was atrocious. We waited an hour for the spouse's food and when we asked what the problem was the waiter said he had no clue and the kitchen must have screwed up the order but he'll put it in again as a "rush". No offer to comp the delayed food or even spring for a beer. We cancelled his food asked for the bill and then the douche had the nerve to charge us for the food that never arrived. Oops he said - my bad.  Very disappointed because I love Gordon Ramsay and wanted to love his restaurant.

I'm a fan of Gordon's shows, but not this Resturant.  Took 7 minutes once we were seated for someone came by to take our drink order. Decided to order our food at the same time as it looked like they were overwhelmed.  Well my surprise when the bangers & mash and scotch eggs showed up in 5 minutes, before our drinks arrived!  We guessed it was all precooked which was supported by the attached picture off the partially cooked yokes on the scotch eggs.  Also, I've never had sauerkraut in the mash of bangers and mash...but I did here.  The experience was more what I expect Gordon to critique rather than put his name on.

While we love Chef Ramsay, this place is just okay.  Nothing to write home about.  It is in Caesar's Palace and therefore, way way over priced.  My husband had a burger, which again, was okay, but a whopping $19.00.  I had the chicken salad sandwich and it was fine, but I've had better.  We tried the "toad in the hole" appetizer, again, okay.  Rather bland.  It was a very expensive lunch; not worth the money spent and would not recommend trying it.  Finally, I just did not understand the "trendy" atmosphere, with the young women in strange "uniform", if you can call it that.  Yuck.

First, the positives: I had Shepherd's Pie. It was perfect. The meat is "melt in your mouth" good. Also, we got an order of English Chips to share. They were amazing. Very good. The negatives, however: Extremely small portions. When my Shepherd's Pie arrived, I thought it was a kids meal. Tiny. Very tiny. And don't expect a visit here to be easy on the wallet. Very expensive. Especially for the size of the meals.

I got the Chicken Curry - It tasted like Hormel canned chili. Not impressed. The menu stated the curry was made with yogurt, though it has a tomato base. It was served with quarter sliced pita bread; curry is usually served with naan flat bread.

Saw three couples sit down and walk out while I dined. Guessing the price was a shock. 

This is just another famously named restaurant with average food, overly priced that tourists end up paying for  #touristtrap
Good portions & attentive staff. I don't follow his show so I'm not familiar with his particular cuisine but the menu is a little more than the usual you'd find in big fancy restaurants.
Very disappointed...calamari was salty & Cesar salad had a bottle dressing not good. Overall food was average not worth the premium price!!!
Customer service was on point. There appetizer were all amazing. We had deviled eggs, wings, the pigs and blanket. The sandwiches we ordered for dinner was awesome as well. Very tasty and filling

Very good food and we had a great waiter as well. However, it is a little overpriced in my opinion. My husband and I went for lunch and our bill was $100. We got a burger, sandwich, a large beer and a mixed drink.

Gordon needs to come down and re train his staff, when asked, the waitress told me marjoram was a mushroom (it is a spice). The pie came stogey and dry as hell, I didn't mind the small portion if it was going to be tasty. Then we were handed someone else's bill at the end to pay - what a waste of a meal that could gave been had elsewhere!

Gordon Ramsey, you need to rescue your own restaurant!  I love to watch your TV shows so had high expectations. So disappointed!!!!!

We made reservations for 7:30pm, arrived 20 minutes early so were shown to the bar. After waiting until 8:00 pm, and having to check with the hostess, we were finally seated at an empty table that we noticed was empty the whole time we were standing bar dodging the waiters/waitresses coming through with trays of drinks. 

As soon as we sat down, a waiter tried to deliver a yummy looking dessert, but we hadn't even ordered yet!

Three of us ordered the fish and chips and the other ordered mixed grill. After about 45 minutes, two fish and chips and the mixed grill were served. We all sat there for another 15 minutes for the last poor guy to be served.  By the time all the food was served, everything was barely warm. The fish was only so-so, "the chips" (big fat fries) were very good, but not chips! The peas were good. On the mixed grill, the shrimp was tough, and the pork belly was fried so long it was hard.

I think this restaurant is overpriced, but great service and great food are worth it. Unfortunately, Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill had neither.
Sat at the bar for a quick meal. Chicken pesto sandwich was very good and served quickly. Great atmosphere and quick service. A little pricey though but it is Cesar's Palace. Expected.

Wow. 

My friends and I had dinner at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill inside Caesars Palace and it was incredibly disappointing. Our waitress forgot our drink orders, so she came back to ask us what they were 15 minutes after she promised to get us some glasses. We decided to cancel our drink orders right then and there, because hey, why spend $11 on a beer when you can get drinks for free while gambling? She then brought out our canceled drinks 5 minutes later, reminding us that she had in fact remembered to enter in our drink orders. Uh, what the !@#$? We asked that she take them back.

Other than the strange drink order situation, the food was nothing more than mediocre. But ridiculously expensive. My stupid salad was $17. The scotch egg appetizer was $11. For one egg. I know prices are high in Vegas, but for the spotty service and so-so food, this is a big no-no.

I still can't believe this place exists. Shame on you, Gordon Ramsay.
Great Decore and more of the great simple food I Expect from any thing with Gordon's name on it

I had had a negative experience here that I posted in August of 2014 and, was completely impressed with their response to it. The GM contacted me to apologize, explained that he would be working with his staff to rectify my complaints and, offered to have me come back so he could  make my next experience a better one. I was taken a back and thoroughly impressed by this; it says a lot about this business and how they represent themselves. 

Almost 6 months since my contact with the GM, I reached out to see if the offer was still on the table. And on March 28 I had an amazing 40th birthday filled with great friends, incredible food, wonderful sevice and a restored, impressive experience at Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grille! I went with no expectations and told my friends they might send out a special appetizer or dessert, but they went above and beyond my/our expectations! Our server talked about the menu and
 answered our questions expertly, the drinks were delicious,  the appetizers and main cooarse were incredible (I suggest the lamb burger!!!!), and the dessert was UNBELIEVABLE; sticky toffee pudding with one of the most delicious house made caramel sauces all of us had ever had! Then to top off our experience we got to meet the winner of Last Year's Hell's Kitchen, Scott Commings! I'm embarrassed  to say I cried, I was so over joyed!

Aside, from all the generous things done for us, I have to say I cannot wait to go back to Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grille the next time I'm in Vegas. It truly is a great restaurant with traditional pub food that is made expertly with a presentation that sets them apart from many restaurants. You can tell they take pride in every thing they send out. I highly recommend you visiting this restaurant when you are in Vegas, and don't forget to get the on tap Guiness and sticky toffee pudding with house made caramel sauce!

I've been to this restaurant a few times now and never have had a bad meal. It's set in the heart of Caesar's Palace Casino. They have a good selection of beers and drinks. This time I had the chicken wings which are crispy and super flavorful. The bleu cheese that comes with is about the best I've ever had. We had the hummus and olive appetizer. Again, the hummus is the best I've ever had. Lots of flavor going on here. The Mac and cheese comes in a smaller portion but is good.  

On prior visits I've had the steak which is a great choice and worth the money. The hamburgers are smoked and quite enjoyable. 

This place can fill up so maybe try coming on off hours. The one complaint I have about Gordon Ramsey's pub is that the service can be slow. I've noticed this with all the times I've been here. The staff is friendly, but you may not see them for a bit between courses. If you're not pressed for time and just want to relax and enjoy your meal, the slow service may not bother you.

Overall, superb food and drink. Not a bad thing on the menu. The level of flavors in every dish are incredible.

Well, in direct comparison to the Wolfgang  Puck Bar and Grill, Gordon Ramsay's joint suffers a bit. We came in late one evening, and the place was absolutely packed. Now, I understand the place is not geared for kids, there was no kids menu available. But I really appreciated their accommodating our little party. The manager made a special point greeting our little munchkin, and made her day by giving her a Gordon Ramsay pen...it instantly became her favorite art instrument of choice.

The deviled eggs were expensive, at over $3 per bite, but really surprisingly bland. Fish and chips consisted of two huge fillets of crispy but bland fried cod, a nice version of mushy peas, and large serving of steak fries that were just meh. The $45 ribeye was a perfect medium rare, but was marred by being excessively gristly and fatty without being particularly marbled. The accompanying bear aide sauce was a cold, congealed mess. Come on Gordon, at these prices you can afford to serve better quality than this! 

Speaking of prices, single bottles of hard cider were $11...a "special" was a bucket of five beers for the low, discounted price of...$40!  Whoa!

Alex, our server is the reason for this low review. 

Service:

Alex did not have a professional demeanor but rather was condescending in his remarks to our simple order of 2 items - the beef burger and calamari. He commented "3 people for 1 burger, really?" When in reality, we wanted to sample the food & order more if we were still hungry.

The 5 STAR SERVICE goes to YOUR WATER BOY who was available when we needed to make our order To Go. (We almost missed our flight due to the delay) He was PROMPT, POLITE, and PROFESSIONAL. 

Food:
Tbh, the burger was salty. There was nothing extraordinary about the fries, either. 
ALSO, Alex took our order of 2 simple items, incorrectly. 

Summary:

NO, we would not return nor recommend this location due to Alex's service, unnecessarily snarky remarks and poor attitude. The food was below average. 

For a great burger go to In N Out, Bin 38 or RN 74 in SF.

Pricey beers, but I didn't care. My bartenders Gene and Keith were so good that I would have paid $20 for a Guinness. Just a great overall vibe and I got it and I rolled with it. Food all looked good from afar.

I don't understand the terrible reviews, it's a pub-and a great one at that! I think people are forgetting what it is-it's not fine dining, it's casual. The atmosphere is fun, and hip and is reflected in the menu. The fish and chips were excellent.
Bottom line: I thought their beer selection was the best I've seen in Vegas, the fish and chips were excellent and the atmosphere enhanced my experience.

Amazing drinks and the bartender is down to earth and friendly. We had such a great time surrounded by a laid back atmosphere.  The menu looked amazing, but we had just come from lunch at Gordon's burger restaurant so we stuck to drinks. We topped off the experience by meeting chef Scott!  He was so nice and talked about show and took photos with us. For a Hells Kitchen fan this was an amazing birthday gift. 

Thanks to the amazing staff for making us feel so special!

Not gonna lie. It's expensive for "pub" but that lamb burger was on pointe!! First of all, the doneness of it. They got decent chefs there. I asked medium rare which most restaurant mess up (at least in my novice experience), they done it RIGHT! Texture of the lamb patty was very carefully crafted. Condiments, just adds more texture and intensifies favors. Our starter was lolipop wings with bacon blue cheese dipping sauce. I didn't get much bacon flavor. Wing itself wasn't too spicy or too sweet. Very mild yet good kick of spicyness follows. 
Again, for wings and burger, it is expensive, but it's the price tag for the experience. It's fun to eat good food watching people blow their money on slots :D i

Restaurant was okay. I think the GR association had my expectations fairly high. Had the burger with jalapeños and guacamole. It was tasty...messy but tasty. The Brussel sprouts were nothing to brag about and lacked seasoning. 

Overall, it would good to say I've been there. But nothing to brag about. Good food...but not exceptional.

Walked in with trepidation given the other reviews, but...

- Impressive beer on tap list but crappy wine list
- solid and unpretentious food including tasty fish and chips (thought the fish portion was small), yummy pork belly, and perfect Caesar's salad
- perfect pub waiter who recommended a dish which we ordered, didn't like, and the waiter immediately removed from the table and the bill

Well done, good place for comfort, pub food.

Amazing! If you only order one thing here make it the sticky toffee pudding! Most delicious desert of all time. However, my lamb burger and truffle fries were pretty damn good as well. Delicious cocktails, and my husband said his bangers and mash were excellent.  I loved the ambiance of this pub, and our waitress was outstanding. You can't go wrong at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.

Well starters this place has a nice atmosphere but the food is crap.  I got the Bangers and Mash was normal sausage and instant mash potato.  Very surprised my wife got the Pub burger meat was extremely bland bacon was over cooked and didn't taste very well French fries where cold. I would save my money and eat at the buffet.

I was really disappointed in my experience at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. 

Firstly, the service was terrible. It seemed like you had to ask for every little thing (refills etc). Mostly importantly, we ordered 1 salad and 2 entrees. Over an hour later we finally get the salad and about 5-10 mins later we get the entrees. We noticed it was taking a long time and inquired but just got a passive "it should be coming out real soon!". We noticed from afar the manager (which we found out later) was peeking at us to see if we got our salad etc. It wasn't until I went to the hostess and asked the manager to come over that he finally did. He didn't introduce himself as the manager, just came over and said, sorry the salad took so long. He didn't even initially address why it was taking so long for the entrees. Also, we noticed tables around us getting their entrees way before us. Rather than trying to defuse the situation, the manager seemed to try to defend the poor service. "I don't know what the people around you ordered". "Your entry is late because your salad was late and that caused your entree to be late". He left the table and said he would subtract the salad. Finally, the entrees came and they were mediocre at best. The chicken pot pie was mostly gravy and hardly had any chicken in it. It also was rather smallish for the price (I'm not a huge eater either). The steak seemed like a poor quality cut and was overcooked and not tender at all. After everything was in the ditch, there was no follow-up. The management doesn't seem to understand "writing the best last chapter". Things WILL go wrong in the service industry, but it's how you handle it and how you send the customer away.

Gordon Ramsey needs to have more quality control. He needs to pay this place a visit and throw the book (soup?) at them. 

So my biggest gripe was the service followed by less than mediocre food. I might as well just went to the quick food place next door (Cypress?). They are located across from the Colosseum. I would never chance going to that restaurant before a show.

There are some awesome places to eat in Caesar's Palace but I would definitely skip this one.

Stopped in Vegas for lunch on the way home from a trip and tried this place. I love Gordon so I wanted to give this a shot. We shared the deviled eggs, duck poutine and heirloom tomato sandwich. The food was fine across the board. Just fine. We each made comments sharing what we'd do differently, which made me pretty sad. 

The main distraction was the terrible uniforms the staff is made to wear. Totally uggers and unnecessary, but I guess when in Vegas-style Rome...

Me and wife order steak. Med well. My was cook fine. Hers was cooked well done!! Took over 45 min for her to get another steak. Obvious I was done with my meal. Calamari was OK. Suppose to have bacon on the dish. I seen maybe at best three crumbs. This pub does not live up  to Gordon Ramsey quality or name. Service was ok. Wound not recommend or return.

Food and drinks are overpriced and the service was terrible! The staff are indifferent, unfriendly and don't appear to realize they are working in the hospitality industry! 
Don't waste your time or money here, there are so many better options in Vegas that are a much more pleasant experience!

My partner and I recently visited Las Vegas and were excited to try Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. We had made a reservation and were seated immediately upon arrival. 

Our server Alex was wonderful and took great care of us. I ordered the shepherds pie with a side of creamed spinach, and my partner ordered the pork belly with fries. We also enjoyed some tasty complimentary breadsticks with butter and cheese.  Everything was wonderful and the portions were perfectly sized.

I would return if I am ever in Las Vegas again. I continue to hope that Gordon will open a restaurant in Seattle.. ;)

My husband and I went there for our first year anniversary. Too many negatives and no positives. When you bother the hostess by being there, leave. The place had about two other tables, our table had a bench seat. I sat on the bench, my chin hit the table, the hostess said oh that seat has a whole. She offered a chair off to the side but wouldn't be close to the table. Should have left, my husband changed seats. One time I was taller than my husband at the table. We ordered fried oysters, crunchy yes like pretzels, not good. Fish and chips were horrible. No flavor, greasy, and not crispy. Just pathetic. Went and had a slice of pizza at secret pizza shop, it put our dinner to shame.

I wish we would have gotten to try it! No service was given for a good 20 minutes...and then the server helped the table next to us that was seated after us! We had to cut our losses and check out Mesa Grill across the casino floor! I'll never understand why these restaurants have 4 hostesses at the hostess stand and people aren't getting service!!!

The menu wasn't that tempting anyways and the items that I looked up online and on yelp that I was looking forward to weren't even on the menu ;( 

Maybe next time Gordon... I really want to try Gordon Ramsay Steak though!

My sister and I came here for dinner this evening and were very impressed! We made a reservation for 6:30 and were seated immediately upon arrival. Our server was great - friendly and efficient. The food was served incredibly quickly - we were shocked by how fast it arrived! I had the beef tenderloin and lobster mac and cheese; my sister had the shepherd's pie. All our dishes were delicious! My steak was cooked perfectly and was melt in your mouth tender. It came with 4 stalks of asparagus, which were also cooked well.  The lobster mac and cheese, however, was the high point - eating it was a spiritual experience! My sister raved about her dish as well. For dessert, we shared the potted chocolate trifle - it was a perfect end to a great meal. Was the meal expensive? Sure, but it was delicious and filling. We'd definitely come back again!

Some additional information on our disastrous service:

The pepper debacle part II: Our waiter came by after I was told the restaurant ran out of pepper and I asked him if maybe I could get some pepper.  He disappeared and a while later I saw him and asked again.  He told me that the dispensers kept getting clogged and that's why they didn't give it to people.  Wait, so did you run out?  Or are the dispensers clogged?  If the dispensers are clogged I'd like to suggest the following... since they are essentially metal creamers with a hinged, unlatched top that has holes, just open, put some in a rammekin and bring some over.  

At the end of our meal we had to ask for our check several times.  When it came we gave two credit cards (not uncommon) and asked the bill to be split 60/40.  Our waiter looked at us like he had no clue what that meant and then about ten minutes later came back and said, "So, if I put 91 on one and 71 on the other is that right?"  WHAT?!  This is a very basic math problem.  And, in case math is not your forte, you can use the POS computer or a calculator (or a PENCIL) to figure out that it's $64.80 and $97.20.  Now, we didn't need it to the penny but seriously?

Having been to Vegas many times for business and pleasure, I have had my share of good and bad eats. Reading the reviews - the Fish and Chips are "AMAZING," I am not sure where these people have had fish and chips before, or maybe the Chef forgot to drain the grease from the fish before plating - in any case - not impressed. Two of the Three Filets were a bit overcooked, and the Third Fillet was dripping with grease, which left a pool into my Mushy Peas.

Service - meh. Typical Vegas, seat you when available, give you a beverage menu, return 10 mins later, take the beverage order, and if you are not ready to order your grub, then be ready to wait at least another 10-20 minutes to order when your beverages arrive. At one point I am pretty sure our Server was too concerned with her co-workers conversations instead of our table with empty glasses and dirty plates.

Reccomendations if feeling the need to experience - the soft warm pretzel appetizer (best spicy mustard!), and the Pear Cider was a winner too!

Our Bill for a party of Two (we shared) - Pretzel App, Fish and Chips, and 1 Pear Cider = $52.00
Not worth it.

I came for happy hour on a Thursday at 4pm. Delicious! The deviled eggs are so good and so was the lobster and shrimp minirolls on brioche. I am a happy girl! Try the Goodbye Blue Sky cocktail, I'm told its great, as well. Not very strong, sweet, and yummy. I was making a spa day of it at the Qua bath and spa at Caesars and got hungry. So glad I chose this place!

Second time here overall, and first time here for dinner. 

I was less than impressed. I ordered the Spots (sliders) and the meat was not seasoned at all. It tasted like plain hamburger meat and the oily grease dripped down my hand as I took a bite. Furthermore, there was no sauce on the spot and cheese was no where to be found which made it very dry. :(

The truffle chips were good. It was served with ketchup and a truffle aioli sauce. Now the aioli, I could spread on almost anything and enjoy it. At the same time, condiments shouldn't taste better than the food itself.

Finally, we tried the sticky toffee pudding for dessert. A small container of caramel came on the side so we poured that over the bread-like substance. This dessert has to have been the best part of my dining experience here. Although it could do without the brittle that was placed in the ice cream. The brittle was not sweet and just tasted like nuts. I felt it didn't really belong in this dessert.  The rest of it though was so delicious!!! 

This Pub & Grill is an over priced Celebrity restaurant. I don't feel the quality is up to par with other restaurants in Las Vegas that are cheaper. Sorry, not sorry Ramsay.

Ray Ray is awesome. If you come to the pub, make sure you sit at the bar with Ray Ray as your bartender. 

I asked for a Pimm's Cup and he gave me a few options to see which way I would like it. I remembered having him before and him asking which way I would like it before as well. Most bartenders just make it however they make it and sometimes it's not how you want it.

Super friendly and on top of things. He gives great food recommendations and is always keeping and eye on you to make sure you have what you need.

He knew we were heading to the airport and without my asking, he put my water in a to go cup and even added a lemon. Amazing!

Visited a few months ago while on vacation.  I was really impressed with the beer selection, and the food was fine, nothing too exciting.  We were there for happy hour and had nachos (meh), truffle fries (meh), deviled eggs (everyone else loved them, I don't like deviled eggs), toad in a hole (meh), and the chicken wings (not good).  Service was also not good.

I ate here for lunch and overall good experience. Both of us had the burger and for med well, they cooked it awesome. Temperature was correct yet it was still juicy and had great flavor. The fries are good too. I will say the menu is limited so I would suggest looking before you go, for me there was not much more than the burger I would eat. I gave 4 stars because the service was slow. Very friendly but slow.

Wow!  Great place.  Great food and great staff!  Make sure you get Heather as your waitress.
She really took care of us.  We had a time crunch for a concert; food came out in record time and she made sure we were out on time.

I became a fan of Ramsay's when I watched a bunch of food shows, and wanted to go to his new place when I saw it. The atmosphere was inviting, the waiters and waitresses were nice, and the food was great. We didn't wait long, even with a bit of a lunch rush, and the iPad thing for viewing and picking out drinks and dessert was interesting (a bit confusing at first, but our waitress explained it to me quickly). If I go back and have a friend, I would totally take them to this place for a lunch.
The beer-battered fish & chips was a bit sweet for me, but generally good. The chips were cooked well and the smashed peas tasted nice. I had a specialty drink (forgot which one) but it was great as well - enough alcohol to make me happy, not too much to overpower.
I may also now be a fan of trifles after the one I had. Perfect amount of chocolate to make it sinful, but not overpowering. 

...also, I want the waiters and waitresses outfits. they're awesome.

When you are in Vegas eating out is a chance to have a one of a kind experience, which is why my mom, brother, and I chose this place when walking through Caesar's Palace. Well, clearly we should have kept walking. The service was not good, I don't think our waiter smiled once during the entire meal, and didn't offer any suggestions, and it took a for him forever to even come over and take our drink orders when we first arrived. Come to think of it the service was slow the whole night.

I won't complain about my meal because out of the three it was by far the best. I got the fish and chips and it was really good, and a huge serving. There were three cod fillets and a large helping of fries. The tarter sauce was probably the best I've ever had. That being said my mom ordered the scallops, and the presentation was awful. They brought it out in a large bowl probably three sizes too big for the amount of food that was in it. There were only five scallops sitting in a broth with carrots. No presentation at all, and for the price of that meal with absolutely no side included it was far from worth it.

My brother ordered the lamb burger and fries, and his serving of fries was about half as much as I got, which was a little confusing. The burger had too many flavors that did not mesh well together. The menu selection didn't offer enough choices in terms of meat, there was only once chicken dish. The drink menu was pretty good, but they were all pretty pricey, and for the amount of wine my mom got in her first glass it was not worth the price at all, I think it counted as "half a glass of wine" so it should have been half the price.

The interior was very nice and very "British." Our chairs were arm chairs that you would normally think of for a restaurant but they were very comfortable and made waiting for our food relaxing. All in all I wouldn't go back or recommend it to anyone, there are so many better places to eat on the strip.

Being a big fan of Gordon Ramsey and his steakhouse, I had high hopes for this place. My wife and I ate there on Christmas Eve.  Very disappointed. We sat on the pub side and we were not even offered to look at the pub menu. It wasn't until we ordered that I realized there was a second menu. We both chose the fish and chips. Greasy thick batter on flavorless fish. Chips were these thick cut and I don't mean steak like fries, I mean these block rectangular potatoes with no seasoning.  If you want fish and chips go to his steakhouse at Paris!!!  Also, the place just opened and Vegas was packed but this place was half empty at 9 pm.  Lousy vibe and music. The only positive were the cocktails.  Much better choices in Vegas.

Went here for lunch with my boyfriend, since we had other obligations during our stay we couldn't visit a restaurant for dinner so we decided on a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. My boyfriend he is a huge fan of Hell's Kitchen so I picked this place since it was open for lunch. The decor was really fun and it had a British punk vibe. Our server was incredible sweet and nice.

Main lobster roll appetizer - two mini Lobster rolls, kinda felt like what sliders are to hamburgers. Very delicious and buttery.

Fish and chips with mashed peas - my boyfriend loves fish and chips so he ordered this classic. He isn't a huge fan of tartar sauce but really liked the kind served here, it was so fluffy like butter! The mashed peas were a surprise hit for him, since stateside they do not serve mashed peas. they really paired well with the giant pieces of fish.

Rib eye steak - it was good, but a little oversalted for me. I thought about sending it back but it was still decent and I was lazy and didn't want to bother. I was also hungry. The bearnaise sauce was good but too rich to go along. I wish I got a different sauce. It was served simply with asparagus. Not sure if I would pay $45 for it. Eh, I probably should have sent it back.

Sticky toffee pudding - my first time trying this! It was sickly sweet but delicious. The caramel topping had a deep flavor that added to the decadence of the cake. It reminds me of a very moist cake. You can taste the dates in it, but it's well blended, no chunks of dates it's just a well soaked cake. If you have a sweet tooth I wouldn't skip it. Sugar load in the best way!

All in all we had a good experience, I would round to 3.5 stars but rounded down due to my indifference about the steak. Should have been perfectly seasoned for $45,

Hosted a small reception in the bar/lounge area. The space was not as private as one would hope, and not having seen the space prior to arriving I wasn't aware of that. The restaurant is located in Caesars directly across from the Colosseum. However, it ended up working out wonderfully. We were a group of 30 and the waitresses took superb care of us! The three of them were constantly making sure everyone had drinks and that the food was replenished accordingly. With the pre-set group menu we had the sliders, nachos, fire wings, pigs in a blanket and shrimp. Everyone loved the food, I heard various comments that it was all excellent. 

The management staff was great as well, very helpful and nice. Everyone took such great care of us!

So you would think a very public british chef that makes a tv career reforming failing restaurants with "Kitchen Nightmares" or spends his time mentoring (read: for the most part screaming at and using a marine sergeants approach in the kitchen) up and coming chefs would really have a venue baring his name locked down tight.

Sadly no. Just no. In fact "HELL NO".

I came in with a group of 5 people to celebrate a birthday and try an early dinner since the latest winner of Hell's Kitchen had arrived 2 weeks ago. From my experience I feel like a bad friend for suggesting the place.

Really when you goto a restaurant there are 3 different things that you rate the place by: atmosphere (looks), food, and service. You measure your expectations of these things by location, chef, and price. So lets run down the list shall we?

The place itself is on the main casino floor of caesars casino and they had a great time decorating it with a lot of british pub flair that still is up beat and modern looking. So really they nailed it here. The bar area is very inviting and tvs on the walls make it comfy and the restaurant area is equally inviting. 

The problem of course is when you go to order the actual food. As I said we came in for an early dinner (6pm) so the venue was fully staffed and maybe only 20% full with patrons. This should be an easy task for the staff. But, my experience rendered that assumption otherwise. To be fair our waiter was extremely up beat and full of suggestions and we were sat quite quickly so I can put most of the onus of service issues on back of house. But upon ordering it took almost 30 minutes for the table to get their alcoholic drinks. That just doesn't ring well with anyone. Especially a group of people that are in the mood to celebrate. Whats even worse is the food took well over 40 min before appetizers and starters came out with one of the more attentive managers checking in on us the entire time being very shocked that food was moving so slow that I could have walked into the mall, ordered food at any other place, taken it to go, and eaten it before our starters came out. 

So lets talk about whats really most important, the food! Since we were in a group of mixed friends that all love to eat we kind of did a one of everything approach to our starters and shared whatever came out. This would be cool if there was some hit or misses but, in our case the entire table just got more disheartened right up front after the long wait which is kind of a great way to crush the excitement and spirits of your guests prior to the main course I guess. The sliders were way over cooked, the fried calamari was bland, the scotch egg was downright forgettable, the toad in the hole should have stayed in whatever hole it came from as it was absent of any real flavor, and the lobster roll had an odd after taste to it (more on this later). The only positives here were the fries and the lollipop wings. In fact we scarfed the fries because they were the only thing stood out as not just edible but tasty with the included aioli. 

So lets say if you order starters the only thing nearly worth while are the fries. From a british gastropub? Wrong on so many levels.

So now lets move onto the main course. Something you would want to do in a decent time after the first round of food. But, the kitchen staff had the idea of letting us wait till we were really hungry for it before serving it. Yes I am being sarcastic, no it wasn't cool, and as you can guess it was far from worth the wait. So the main course comes after 2 more rounds of drinks that took to long and a manger was still "shocked" at the food service time. If you're counting at home do the math and you can see this is entirely too long. The next round of food included the wedge salad that wasn't even a wedge and the dressing didn't even have the right to call itself Bleu Cheese as it lacked any flavor and was so watery we wondered what the dressing did to offend the chef, the scallops that hey were cooked perfectly yet lacked any trace of seasoning, the lobster mac & cheese that we all agreed should have skipped the lobster, the chicken pot pie with a perfect crust yet lacked any flavor from the inside ingredients and the short rib that was so unbelievably void of the texture and flavor that it was sent back with the question of why a place like this would serve something that is supposed to be flavorful and tender but comes off like a bad croc pot version of pot roast. The one shining positive was the BLT which we all agreed just nailed it.

So after trying almost half the menu we are left with fries and the BLT being the only things that are positive standouts? At this price point?!?!? Are you kidding me? 

When it comes to dessert the sticky toffee pudding was however to die for. 

Oh remember the lobster? Yeah all 3 people that had it felt slightly ill after. This place is a kitchen nightmare. Such a let down and a terrible experience.

The service was fantastic. Our server was friendly, funny and professional. 

He and some of the other staff made sure that our water and cocktails were never empty.

He did forget that we had ordered an appetizer, but it wasn't a problem because our entrees were served really fast. 

I ordered the wedge salad and it was really good. My friend ordered the chicken pot pie. Of course I had a few bites and was shocked at how good it was. 

 He always orders the really tasty stuff.

I will definitely be visiting again.

Do not use high tables, the stools are much lower than high tables. Not easy to eat while you are sitting, only fine for standing around the table.

Asked server to change the seat and they never followed up they had plenty space open. Ketchup that came with burger was a sampler. As a server when you bring fries and burger better to know how much ketchup to serve with the food.

I wouldn't try this place again.

Nope.  Sat at bar and watched each order get screwed up mine included.  Steak was tough and salty , veg over cooked. Fries wilted.  Honestly, I have been to Ramsay at Clairidges and doubt he has ever set foot in here recently.  Oh yes very expensive. Las Vegas always falls down on food.

The third time is the charm for three stars! (Or now my average rating of this place!) The first time was fabulous, the second time it was awful and the third time (you ask, why we even gave it another chance? We had friends who really wanted to try it) was A-OK. 

We made reservations for a late dinner for four people and we were shown to our table promptly when we arrived. I will say, we were seated at a 4 (low) top in the center of the restaurant and the chairs were 'sunken'/ worn (?) which doesn't really work well for a 5'2" lady in a dress and heels trying to eat a meal. I felt I needed a booster seat and a bib. 

Our server was pleasant and attentive and the food was good. We all were happy and tasted the meals amongst ourselves. What really made my day? Our guests enjoyed the event when I was worried about it. 

Why only 3 stars you ask? This place is super inconsistent with it's food and service (plus the whole chair thing).

The manager Randall Goldich was extremely nice and professional greeted our table and made us very welcomed.. The food was amazing and I got to meet Scott Cummings the winner of hell's kitchen....We will differently come back...

Hubby and I came here for lunch. Great service and food. The Deviled Eggs were amazing. Hubby had the Beef Rib and Cheek Sandwich. I had the Fish and Chips. Both were delicious. We will definitely be back. Of all the celebrity chef restaurants, this had the best overall dining experience. And if you come for only an appetizer, get the duck confit fries....the gravy is the best gravy anywhere.

Extremely disappointing experience. Avoid this overpriced dump at all cost. The food wasn't even edible. I can't believe the they charged me $4.00 for each soda when I couldn't even eat the disgusting food/slop they set in front of me. The manager came over to ask if I wanted to be subjected to more of this typhoid contaminated garbage they call food, but I figured I had better not even smell the hazardous waste their pushing unless i wanted to vomit. All in all, my recommendation would be to bulldoze this swine infested dump, and replace it with a more desirable place to eat; a hot dog stand would be an improvement. Please, if you care about yourself, your family, your friends, and prefer not to have your stomach pumped while in Las Vegas, DO NOT EAT AT GORDON RAMSEY'S PUB & GRILL CAESARS PALACE.

Awesome food.  Their shepherd's pie, bangers and mash, and fish and chips are great.  Ramsey's favorite beer Innis & Gunn is great too, can't find it other than at Ramsay's restaurants.  My second time back and Matt the bartender made great recommendations for the food and beer.

It's sad to see anyone not have a great experience, as we did here on our most recent visit. We had reservations and were seated immediately. There was a line to check in. Thankfully, our table was ready.

I love the modern old pub feel with images of London all around. Gosh, we ordered enough to share and seriously, everything was so good! I had he'd the pork chops with a chunky apple sauce- chops were cooked perfectly. Fish and chips we're not oily and had just the right crunch-the fries are just the way I like them crunchy in the outside and soft on the inside. Braised pork belly- oh yeah a winner. I can't even deep scribe the taste really just that I was so happy eating it. We also had the home made pretzels with the mustard dipping sauce. Great with beer! We shared the toffee pudding and I had to stop myself from finishing it had to share win other, plus I was so stuffed that I didn't want to roll out of there!

The service was excellent and entertaining. I think the waiter knew what he was getting himself into when he first met our party. This was such a great time you can only go in and experience it yourself.  Definitely visiting again on my next trip to Vegas. Love the pups painting at the bar!!!

I'm going to take a shot at gordon. You always yell at your chefs for seasoning, but your pea soup had zero salt in it! Your bangers and mash, amazing, best dish I had there. Loved loved the onion gravy. Great beer selection too! Just add salt gordon, please! (Imagine me yelling this like he does)

Went as party of three, seated for about 10 mins with no water nor menu, we decided to call the waiter and see what the deal was since the place wasn't that pack. Waiter came up to us with nerves and indescribable expressing in his face, right away he handed us the touch pad menu(drink) and the rest of the menu and said that he was really sorry for the wait around here. It's alright we said, and let him started the explanation for the menu.

We soon decided to order the Shepard pie, braised beef(forgot the full name) and lamb burger(medium with goat cheese). Check around the drink menu I then decided to have a glass of organic apple cider to go with my lamb burger, which turned out to be a perfect pair. Friend ordered the pear cider and was pretty good as well, for $9/glass there were no complains. 

After ordering our foods and drinks, my friend noticed that the other tables received their complimentary breads which i thought we have to place an order on but should be giving first thing as seated along with waters, we then call the waiter once again, and he responded to us like he knew exactly what we were going to ask before we even said anything.... that was weird to me, if he knew what we've been waiting, how come we were still seeing tables after tables came in after us getting their breads before we even did. I believe that's when a table got totally left out and poor coordination with the front house. Not to mention there were this suited guy who seemed to be the manager that's warmly welcoming the other tables and have couple eye contacts with me but never crossed his mind that he might want to check on our table and see if there are anything he can help us with. 

I've been as a waitress once, I understand the struggle working as one as a start-up and if that's what happened on that day on the guy who served us, I'm more than understandable, but seemed to me, there are really little support by the management around the front house anyway, that's a shame as my first GR's dining experience.

The part with foods were great, all of the orders were wonderful except my lamb burger tasted burned a bit, and it was too dark in the dining room that I wasn't able to identify the surface of the burger before my first bite. As I made my complain to the waiter, he told me this is grilled and can't avoid the burn on top of the surface. I told him I'm fully aware of that but this is just too burned for me to bare. He accepted the plate and turn it back to the kitchen. I have not gotten the order until everyone else finished with their orders, but it was worth the wait, second time's a charmed... I loved everything about that lamb burger and the goat cheese has given the burger even better flavor than it already were.

Shepard pie was satisfying, my boy friend was aiming for this order before we came and was pleased. Braised beef was cooked beautifully and flawless, any more words would be over analyzed. 

Overall we've had a great time enjoying ourselves, if only the service can be a little bit more careful. Will return for a second try for sure.

This should be rated ten stars. Gordon Ramsay's restaurants are always so good. The menu is simple, the food is extra flavorful, and yummy, yummy. You can never go wrong at one of his restaurants. 
The ambiance is nice, and staff is extra nice, and on their game.
Looking into the restaurant you would never guess the place is as large as it is. Don't let it fool you. The rooms seem hidden, and trying to get to the restroom is like following a maze. 
This is a really great restaurant.
I love it here.

Contrary to most of the reviews for this place, I found GRPG to be a refreshing change of pace to the stuffiness (or severe lack thereof) of most Strip restaurants.

What I found most impressive was that they cater to everyone. If you're looking for a fine dining experience, get a bottle of meritage and the veal chop. If you want a beer and some fish and chips, they can do that too.

Speaking of fish and chips, they were phenomenal. Fat pieces of cod, seasoned perfectly, coated in boddingtons beer batter and fried to a perfect crispness. The homemade chips are tossed in herbs and Parmesan. Ask for a side of garlic aioli to dip them in. It's a revelation. But honestly, the best thing on that plate were the bright green and buttery mushy peas. They had such a beautiful freshness to them and really tasted like...well...peas! But the best peas you've ever had.

We also had the shepherds pie. Down home goodness with a British flair. The use of lamb along with beef adds such a depth of flavor. Also, instead of using ground meat, the chefs braise it, so you get a nice stew like texture and flavor galore. The potatoes were creamy and rich and the vegetables inside were a perfect al dente.

We finished this feast with the sticky toffee pudding. Just get it. You are missing something divine if you don't.

Our server, Elyse, was kind, quick witted and on top of it. She anticipated our every whim. And a huge shout out to Raul and the amazing bar staff for such genius cocktails. These guys know what they're doing.

All in all, this place rocked it.

We wandered into Caesar's Palace hoping to eat at their top rated buffet but found the wait time was 200+ minutes. This was a nice place with a shorter wait and we got to learn how to play roulette in the time during. 

We ordered truffle fries as an appetizer. They were delicious! Perfect thing to start off dinner. My husband got the lamb burger and I got the braised short rib. They were both really tasty! 

Dinner was about $100 including tip. Not bad for Vegas.

Came here for the first time on the 16th of December 2015, for my friends birthday. The server Adam was good; prompt for the most part and polite. There was somewhat of a long wait to get drinks, which didn't seem quite right for a slow Wednesday night. Appetizer took long to come out and so did the food. That wasn't the problem... For a Gordon Ramsey restaurant I expected things to be a little more perfect and orderly. I ordered a burger medium rare, thinking, hey, it's Gordon Ramsey, they can probably be trusted... No. Burger came out medium well/Well done and the wrong fries and not a huge deal, but no ranch that I had also asked for. After a 2+hour service, partly my groups fault, I didn't have time to stick around and wait for the manager to show up and had to leave. 
Overall, the service was okay but I was unimpressed with the food and wait times not to mention the overpriced menu.

Went on opening night dec 18, 2012. It was certainly an event! The food was excellent. I recommend the short rib and cheek sandwich. Get the draft sampler, it's a good deal for a casino restaurant giving you eight 5 oz pours of any drafts available for $15. Also got to see Guy Fieri and Iron Chef Morimoto enjoying the opening night. the service staff was very nice each greeting us with a handshake and welcoming us to opening night. We will be back next time we're visiting vegas.

Gordon Ramsey's in London was one of the most exquisite dining experiences in my life. The "Pub & Grill" was not. It is competent food, served efficiently, in a fun atmosphere. It is a step (or two) up in the quality and inventiveness of the food of Chili's or BJ's, with a more "sophisticated" beer and wine list. They handled our group of 14 even better than expected. It was impressive; Ramsey really does know how to run a restaurant. They messed up some items on our order, and more than made up for it by comping those items and apologizing. Our total bill was around $860, including tip. (~$61/each). If you expect haute cuisine, try one of Ramsey's other places. For well-prepared pub food, the Pub & Grill is a good, but pricy spot.

I was here a week ago for dinner. The food was good. I have the brick braised chicken and my girlfriend had the mussels. The drinks tasted good but I didn't feel like there was enough alcohol in them for the price they charged. My main problem with this restaurant is the speed of service. When you're in Vegas, you don't want to be wasting time waiting for a server to come take your order or bring your food. You want to be in and out and on the way to the tables, clubs, shows, or whatever else you're planning on doing. We were seated quickly but then had to wait nearly 15 minutes before our waitress came to the table. After she finally made an appearance, service speed improved but when it came time to pay, we had to wait again. After giving her my credit card, it took her nearly 15 minutes to bring it back. The restaurant wasn't that busy and it seemed to be fairly standard as other tables had to wait for their server to arrive as well. 

Other than the speed of service, the food was delicious and the atmosphere fun and lively. I would definitely return, just wished the service was faster.

On our trip to vegas we booked reservations here before flying out. Make sure you get reservations because there was a long line on the weekend.  The nachos are awesome.  The Shepard's pie was very good as was the bangers and mashed.  To finish we had the sticky toffee pudding per other reviews on here. We were not disappointed. Our waiter was very nice and attentive without being annoying. 

For the bad.. 
I realize this is a pub theme but with a bill for 2 @100+ the tvs everywhere make it much less special. Especially  on the dinning room side. March madness bs didn't help either. We had a female server come to our table on 2 occations with dishes that were not ours and she seemed completely lost. We also over heard two waiters standing directly behind me talking about rude customers. They very well might be rude but talk in the back. 

Overall we might go again but then again for the price it makes it hard to be a favorite.

We sat at the bar to ensure attentive service.  Team service was excellent.  Ordered the prime rib, it was cooked to order, and I was pleased.  I previously had the fish and chips here and I was disappointed, but this visit was okay.  I think that this place just performs well enough to get by with over-stimulated vegas visitors.

This was one of the worst restaurants ever. The food was great and juicy but the portions of the food was bad. We ordered the lamb ribs and they only gave us 2 tiny ribs the size of our pinky. Then we ordered this other dish that had steak, shrimp and ribs for $44.00 but they only gave us 1 shrimp, 1 riblet the size of my little pinky, and a tiny piece of steak. What a rip off if you guys haven't eat here yet don't they charge you a lot of money for just little portions of food.

It's a-ok. We made a reservation and were seated promptly. Our server was friendly. The food was tasty enough, but not crave-worthy or exceptional.

The ambiance is upscale pub. Overall, it's got a nice vibe.

The beer list didn't do much for me as there wasn't anything particularly notable. But all the standard ones you'd expect at a pub are there.

We ordered the calamari, fish and chips, English ale onion soup, and lobster mac 'n' cheese. Our server somehow forgot the lobster mac 'n' cheese and brought us fries instead. She promptly fixed the error, leaving the fries and putting in an order for the lobster mac 'n' cheese. But then she added the fries to our bill! Seriously. 

The calamari was alright. Good enough to eat when you're hungry. Not good enough to ever order again. The fish and chips were good. They're fish and chips - nothing particularly notable, but the fish was battered and fried well. The English ale soup was quite tasty and the best thing of the night. The fries were alright. Would never actually order them. The lobster mac 'n' cheese was tasty. But I've had far better elsewhere and probably wouldn't order it again here given the price for the small portion.

Aside from the order mix-up, we had a pleasant evening here. It's a perfectly fine place. Good enough food, but not the wow food that one often comes to expect of Vegas dining.

Neat atmosphere, think they are still working out some of the new restaurant kinks. Service was not so great but she had a great attitude. Seemed like she was a little overwhelmed. I requested a birthday desert to be brought without having to ask...said to just add to the bill. The server said "So, we are celebrating a birthday?" Then never brought desert! Ugh! She had to circle back again and again to double and triple check what was ordered. We had to chase our drinks! Never brought one beer then she brought it and another server brought one (not as sweet as it sounds...all got added to the bill LOL!) But she did smile the whole time. Frustrating but still fun. Believe it or not, we would go back! Burger was da bomb! The fries were totally unique..."I only had 4 fries" but they were 4 fries on steroids...more than enough! LOL Perfect light crisp outside and soft hot potato inside, served with seemed like a ketchup / horse radish side...WHY is there NO menu anywhere online? Oh we started with the pretzels breadsticks with a ground mustard sauce and a cheese sauce...yuh to the um!

It would be 0 stars if possible. I've never been to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant before, but for our last night in Vegas (all other meals were great!) my girlfriend and I decided to check out his Pub and Grill in Caesar's. Hands down worst meal of the strip. Service was friendly but every course was wayyyyy over cooked. Buyer beware, if you want medium order extra rare! Smallest wings of my life and as dry as the nearby desert, medium rare prime rib more like well done, over salted everything, and medium strip steak was well done and charred (sorry for repeating myself but overcooked is the theme of this review). The manager offered to "take care of us on our next meal here," but there is no way I'll ever be back, or any Ramsay joint for that matter. Sorry Gordon, you lost me at hello.
Disappointing at best. Food cold. I sent mine back and they microwaved it I think. Unremarkable in every way except the overpricing. Boo.

Very good. The waiter was very helpful and friendly, and the food was great. Our table had the fish and chips, shepherds pie, shrimp salad and their equivalent of french onion soup. Everyone tried everything and everyone was very pleased. Good drink selection. Would recommend coming here.

Despite poor reviews, we went to Ramsey's pub and grill in Caesar's and we had the BEST time. Food, Fish and Chips and Scottish Salmon were delicious and cooked perfectly, service was fast, our waitress was bubbly and knowledgeable. We ordered coffee and got a full pot which has never happened before in any restaurant in Vegas. Great music and ambiance. We will definitely go back there.
Had steamed mussels and clams, which were good. Toast that came up it was too salty and not much flavor. Service was fine. Casual atmosphere.

This was a little bit of a disappointment. The food is very over priced for what it is. We had the fish and chips and lamb burger, both were good but not worth $70.00 and the flavor was nothing out of the normal - I've had similar good with better flavor a for a third of the price. The service was pretty poor as well, I had to ask 3 times for drink refills which can be frustrating when you are spending so much money... If your going just for the experience, just expect to pay more then it's worth. Cool looking restaurant though...
Impeccable service at the bar. Recommendations were thoughtfully considered based on our preferences, and the meal preparation was without flaw. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit.
Had the beef and vegetable pot pie and spotted dic for dessert. It was so amazing. I would eat here every day If I could!!!

With a limited menu the flavors should have been amazing. I guess our expectations were too high as we were expecting the same Gordon Ramsay expects of his chefs. And why the fish and chips are twice the price of the rest of the menu but absolutely nothing special about them. The Dublin sourkrout sandwich was good. The lamb burgers unfortunately we're lacking and palet did not sit well. Without the name I'm sure as a pub it's nice however we are still disappointed and won't be coming back. Left feeling a little queezy. 2 stars for our nice waitress who kept our glasses full.

Something different from the pretentious* upscale restaurants in Caesars Palace.

I was looking for a relaxed atmosphere to just unwind with a beer in casual attire and happened to walk by this place. There was so much I enjoyed about this place, but let me highlight the one thing that really irritated me about this establishment. The hostesses wear the most hideous dresses! So try not to mind the outfits, you may lose your appetite.

Instead of the beer, I ordered the "Goodbye Blue Sky" - so sweet and refreshing and crisp! I also got the soft pretzels, which were how you'd expect soft pretzels to be, and a burger. The service and the drink really gave this place four stars - he constantly checked up on us and helped us charge it to our room in Paris when someone at the concierge made a mistake on the name of the room.

The burger was really dry so minus .5 stars and the hostesses outfits were nauseating so minus another .5 stars. Other than those two things, I can't wait to go back!

*Beijing Noodle No. 9 - c'mon really? Upscale noodles? No no, just upscale price.

Eaten at a lot of Vegas places, including Ramsay's burger joint, a bunch of wolfgang pucks and batali/bastianich places.  This is another overpriced celebrity chef restaurant that hasn't received enough love and attention from it's celebrity chef.  The decor tries to be an english pub, but ends up with a lot of low arm chairs that make eating uncomfortable.  Really it's an American interpretation of a UK pub and is hardly authentic despite the authentic name.  The food was boring and underwhelming, certainly not inedible but disappointing for the price, and doubly disappointing given the name.  I've had plenty of better meals in real English pubs for far less.  Of course it beats the batali/bastianich joints, but that's not saying much.

We had a late dinner here on our first night in Vegas - around 9:30 or so. No tables and the hostess said they basically wouldn't have any tables available for the rest of the night - so luckily we found two spots at the bar. We shared the Scotch Eggs, Lobster Rolls and Fish and Chips. Everything was just OK - I was expecting more from Gordon Ramsay!!! The Scotch Egg was basically just one egg, cut in two. At most pubs, when you order Scotch eggs, you usually get at least two eggs - for half the price of what we paid for this one. As far as taste, it was just OK - they put some kind of sauce on it that was almost a little too much. The lobster rolls were pretty flavorless, in hindsight I'm not even sure why we ordered them. I guess it sounded good at the time. The fish and chips was the best thing we ordered - and also the most expensive fish and chips I've ever had. The fish was actually the best thing - the chips were just mediocre. The fish was really good though - and the tartar sauce was tasty. Also, they close at 11:00, which was weird to me for a pub in Vegas. I definitely won't be back and wouldn't recommend it to others. So many better places to eat in Vegas!!

My wife and I came in for a lunch. Wanted to experience the place.  The location is great.  You can sit in the back if you want to escape the casino, or sit by the Bar in a high top if you want to still be a part of the casino.  I'm 6-3 so we opted for a high top.  Service was excellent- very attentive.  We had the Hellfire wings and split a burger.  Wings were very good- loved the sauce.  The burger was good as well.  Temp was wrong so they corrected and comp'd a dessert- sticky toffee, which the wife loved.  3 beers a Moscow mule, wings and a burger -$96.  Do I like the place, yes.  Do I feel it's overpriced- yes.   Yes I know your paying for the location and name.  Still felt like the bill should have been $60-70.  Pice dropped it from 4 stars to 3.   When we come back it'll just be for a beer and wings..

We were lucky yo find seats at the bar...since the wait was about an hour.
We ordered the Flank Steak with Mashed Potatoes and Brussel Sprouts.
OMG!!! The steak was so tender and juicy.
The potatoes were scrumptious.
The brussel sprouts were awesome..  
Everything was soooooo good!  I'd go back for sure!
Love Gordon Ramsay!

I'm not sure I went to the same place as others. Either that or some people get some kind of weird thrill out of nitpicking celeb restaurants rather than reviewing honestly) We ended up here Christmas Eve after deciding that the 4 hour wait for Bacchanal wasn't putting us in the holiday mood. We asked for specific seating (not  wanting to sit at the pub tables) and received it with a smile. 
We started with the pork and duck rillettes, which were delicious and well prepared.
Our table of 3 had the hangar steak, the scallops and the pork belly with the baby carrots and potato puree to share. Steak was flavorful and tender (the server did suggest my Mom order it no more done than medium which was a good call), the scallops were very well done and the pork belly was yummy.
Desserts were beyond good. We had the triple chocolate trifle, the pear crumble and the spotted dog.
Total for our table with 3 entrees, 2 sides, 1 app, 3 desserts, 2 glasses of wine and bottled water was $240. Service was impeccable and friendly.
This is pub food at its best. English pubs, by the way, are not known for huge menus, so to expect a Cheesecake Factory type menu here is ridiculous. It is actually a fairly extensive menu for a pub. Prices were in line with other casino restaurants of the same pedigree.

Thought we would try this place looking at previous reviews but were sorely disappointed. The hostess was so nice and welcoming, but sadly this feeling was short lived when our server took over. He was rather abrupt taking our orders, not once did he smile. Left us for long periods of time, didn't check our drinks once or top us up. He made us feel as though we were an inconvenience just being there, which I have never experienced while dining in Vegas, which I do frequently! I work in customer service and so I was even more annoyed at how we were treated. I will never go back here, food was average, warm not hot, and nothing special - not worth the price. Bangers and mash and a Diet Pepsi - total $40. Sorry to say your server 'Michael W' lost you future business from me and everyone I tell.
We had the braised short ribs and the shepherd's pie.  Both were perfectly cooked and amazing.  The service was also friendly and location/ambiance nice.

Came here honestly with no expectations. Ended up here because all the restaurants around had a long line. I ordered a french onion soup and butter chicken. The soup was great, I can't complain about it. On the other hand the butter chicken was completely tasteless. Seriously, getting a butter chicken at India Jones (the LA food truck) is waaaaay better than this. When I told the waitress about how bad the food was, she called the manager. The manager came to the table and offered 50% off of the dish that I didn't eat. When I told him that you come here trusting the "name", you expect something a bit better than this. He told me that I have to understand that chef Ramsey is not in the kitchen cooking or yelling at people. What a lot of crap.

Save yourself time and money and avoid this place even is there is no other place to eat.

We stopped here after seeing Jerry Seinfeld and as we expected there was a wait, and it would be an hour. We returned about 40 minutes later and the friendly hostess remembered us and had our table ready. 
The dining room was very dark. I had asked our waitress what kind of beers were available and she put an iPad at the table to scroll through and walked away. 
It was a bit awkward since she didn't tell me if I was to follow the directions and select my choice, or if she was to do that. 
She was a bit slow to return, but was very knowledgable of the menu and our drinks arrived quickly. 
I ordered the Yorkshire Fish and Chips and my son had the Bacon Wrapped Shrimp. 
We were then served warm soft pretzels with a cheese spread and a mini loaf of bread with whipped butter. Honestly, I could have just had the pretzels and been perfectly happy. 
Our meal arrived and my son's shrimp were huge. Usually I'm worried they won't be flavorful when they are so jumbo, but these were great. Cooked just right, and I didn't try the sauce they were in, but he loved it all. 
The fish and chips were very good. Nothing extraordinary, but I did notice they were less oily than most. The tartar sauce was the best I've had, and I don't usually care for tartar sauce. I eagerly tried what I thought was cocktail sauce in the other ramekin and was disappointed that it was just ketchup. 
I really wished there was malt vinegar offered for my fries, but by the time anyone was available for me to ask, I was already too full to be able to eat them, so I didn't bother. 
Even though our sever was slow, she was very friendly and I assume that the disorganized atmosphere was due to it just being open a few days. 
The prices were in line with most Vegas casino dining.
We would eat there again.

2015 YELP 100 CHALLENGE - 073/100

We were starving after the Mariah Carey show, and this was right across from the theater, I'm so glad we stopped by because there was no wait, and the food was incredible. I suppose I wasn't expecting much because it was about 11:00p and they were packed, but it was a really good experience. Firstly, I really love the way the restaurant is set up. So awesome to see different style tables and chairs. Everything from high tops, to couches, to stools and love seats around tables, very charming. Unfortunately we were seated at a high top table lol but that's ok because the atmosphere was great, lots of people at the bar, lots of good looking waitresses and bartenders, and our waitress was very sweet. I ordered the fish and chips, and my friend ordered the salmon and both were incredible. My fish was crispy and so tender on the inside, the plate came with seasoned potato wedges and mashed peas. The peas were very different, interesting taste but I liked them. My friend's salmon was thick and it melted in your mouth. They didn't have an extensive wine list but we made it work. Salmon plate was 36.00 and fish and chips was 30, add the wine and we spent over 100.00! But the portions were large and the food was great. I'd recommend this place!

Gordon Ramsay would be embarrassed of this own restaurant. By name, it's Gordon Ramsay. By food, it's slightly better McDonald's. Service was almost non-existent. I get that we are young and filthy rich enough to continuously order glasses of wine, but we deserve to be treated well.

Good was absolutely mediocre. I ordered the two mini burger side and fries (I have small portion size) and my boyfriend ordered chicken sandwich with kettle chips. My mini bacon cheeseburgers were a joke. The picture will show their ridiculous use of ingredients. I paid extra for that bacon. I get that it's a mini cheeseburger, but I think it deserved more cheese and bacon than that. The fries were soggy and not great at all. I had to dunk them in aioli to get decent flavor. My boyfriend's sandwich was eh (according to him) and his kettle chips were stale.

I won't be back. Sorry Gordon.

Wow Gordon you really need to do a field trip visit to your Pub so disappointed I don't know where to begin.  Firstly hubby  and friends ordered the fish and chips I had the butternut squash soup.  Within in four minutes of ordering our food even before out drinks showed up out comes our food.  So hear we go  you can't call garden peas bashed with a spoon mushy peas anyone who knows anything about British food knows mushy peas have to go through a process to be entitled to that name.  The food tasted reheated which it had to be unless they have the fastest deep fat fryer known to man.  Chips were soggy French fries and I won't even try to describe the tasteless mushy Cod (peas mushy fish not is a good way to go.  Soup was ok just ok but for $13 I was expecting some flavour.  Thought I would mention to the manager how disappointed we were and not Yelp.  He was so not bothered and I was very diplomatic he said he would look into and just walked back to the front desk.  Come on people show you at least care and Gordon if you are going to put your name to something please at least check they are doing your name some favours I am a huge fan but not of this place.  We sat at 8.15 and were out of there by 8.50 these guys make MacDonalds look slow.  Give it a miss folks.
Simply put..... "Not impressed". Unimpressive menu and we won't be coming back, as there are to many truly better options in this amazing food Mecca.

Food was outstanding!  We had the soft pretzels, pub sliders and traditional fries. Loved all three. 

Amazing draft and bottled beer selection. 

The layout feels like a pub and the decor was fun. Plenty of TV's to catch a game. 

Service was good. 

Would totally grub here again!

Being in the restaurant industry at Caesars Palace, new restaurants have become common as of late, but Gordon Ramsey's newest endeavor has proven to be a gem among the rest. The environment was highly inviting and comfortable, a very beautiful modern restaurant with a British flair, not only in the decor but in the menu as well. The staff executed every stage of service flawlessly, with full knowledge of menus items and beverages. The iPad presentation of beverages and deserts added an extra interactive touch to service. The appetizers, bread service, beverages and entrees arrived with impeccable timing and were some of the most beautiful dishes I have seen. The overall experience was nothing short of what you'd expect from Chef Ramsey!

I don't know why the reviews seem so crappy. I had great customer service and excellent food served to me at a timely manner. The only thing that was weird was the pineapple juice. In the week I stayed I made it here a total of like 3 times! I couldn't resist! But that goat cheese burger was effing nasty way too over powering I recommend HELLS KITCHEN, the egg appetizer and the sticky pudding cake(:!!

This was my first time at one of Gordon Ramsey's 3 restaurants and it was a pleasant surprise.  Randy was very hospitable and seated us quickly.  We started with nachos which were amazing!!  Never was a huge fan of corn beef until now.  For my main course I ordered bangers and mash which was delicious.  The sausages were tasty and the mashed potatoes were perfect!  My lady ordered the steak ale pie which I almost ended up eating all of it jk.  It was fantastic the meat was so tender you gotta try it.  We were full but had to try a dessert so we ordered chocolate truffle.  It came in a little container and was the perfect size after such a hearty meal.  All in all it was a great experience and I look forward to coming back again and again!!

First - the food is exceptional. The problem is with the front-of-house and overall presentation. Arrived 6pm and the place was 75% empty. Seating only by reservation! We had to cool our heels 15 minutes because they do not accept walk up business! I suppose this keeps out the riff-raff but it also keeps out customers. The bimbo squad that act as greeters/seaters are just that - bimbos. Fairly attractive and none too smart or just not well trained. Or both. The drink menu is presented to you on an iPad but the size of drink involved and the pricing does not match what they offer you! Attempted an $8.75 25oz. Newcastle draft off the iPad but could only order a pint at $7.75! Pints were not even on the iPad menu! They mention that this is a 'craft' beer place but it must be relegated to the bottled section as the draft selection is pretty pedestrian. Did I mention the food is outstanding?
