No doubt, this is what kept this at a 4-star rating. But they serve the entrees in a plate that is almost like a bowl. This makes cutting meat a bit of a challenge. The 2-seat tables are pretty small with little room to manage all the glasses, bread plates, raised wooded placemats, etc AND the freaking iPad. Service was decent by the wait staff. The decor does not match the hype. It is pretty boring and almost ugly unless half-kegs of beer as wall art is your thing. From place settings to 'reservation only' seating this is as far from a friendly, down-to-earth pub as one can imagine. I suspect Gordon Ramsay was involved in the menu and the overall licensing of his name/image and that is about it as part of his overall Harrah's deal. This location in Caesar's was Bradley Ogden's which was an overall brilliant restaurant across the board. Too bad it was replaced with this - which boasts as friendly and inviting but really isn't. But this is all about the food and the food is OUTSTANDING. Just don't expect a Michelin experience.

We ate here on the 21st and 22nd, 3 days after the opening on the 18th.  Both times we ate at the bar, so can't comment on the restaurant side.

First night we came for drinks and a snack.  We had the Vic Queen Chips and Deviled Eggs.  Both were excellent.  The Chips were very delicate - thinly cut and perfectly fried - served with a side of malt vinegar for dipping.  Just excellent!!  The Deviled Eggs were served in an interesting way.  The egg whites were served separately, sprinkled with parsley, and the yolks were served in a small cup for you to scoop out and put as much as you wanted into the egg whites. The yolks were smashed and mixed with smokey bacon and cheese.   They were by far the best deviled eggs I have ever had.  In all, this experience was 5 star.

The second night we came shortly after 5 PM for the dinner menu.  We again sat at the bar.  They were out of the first beer that I ordered, but offered me a sample of another beer that I might like.  The bartender was very helpful.  We ordered the Fish & Chips.  It took about 25 minutes for us to get our food, which is a little long, but we thought it might be due to a lot of folks ordering right around 5 PM when they start the dinner menu.  I figured if anyone could do fish & chips right it would be Gordon Ramsay - however, I was disappointed in this meal.  It was definitely not the best fish & chips that I had ever had.  The fish was OK, the batter was really good, but the fish was a little dry & tough - like it had been overcooked.  I prefer fish that is more moist and flaky.  A thicker piece of fish would probably have held up better to the cooking.  The potatoes were the biggest disappointment, though.  We expected chips (french fries) what we got were big blocks of potatoes - hand cut in rectangles - which had been boiled and baked and fried into a state of blandness that I would never expect from a Gordon Ramsay product.  They were hard at the ends, like they had been overdone.  They were not seasoned at all - no salt when they were removed from the deep fryer - and no flavor at all.  However, the mushy peas were outstanding!!!  I have never really liked mushy peas - I mean, really, who would like anything called mushy peas?  However, this was a combination of whole baby peas and mushy peas with some seasoning that had me eating the entire portion (a first for me.)

In general the bartenders were very helpful and friendly.  Would have been nice had someone checked on our dinner and let us know the status when we went so long without getting our meal, but that's a small point.

I liked the decorations.  It's pretty noisy with music playing but not so much that we couldn't hear each other or talk to the people next to us.  It was pretty busy for 5 PM.  Probably even busier later on.

I would go again, but not for the Fish & Chips - definitely for the Deviled Eggs though.

I just had the Scottish Egg accompanied by  the refreshing cucumber and St. Germain liquor, Ramsay Tonic - delicious! 

The egg was soft boiled and wrapped in thinly sliced beef and dipped in a flour batter and baked...it was served with balsamic caramelize onions and some micro greens...all I can say is that the photo I included, does not do it justice, as it was layered with different textures and flavors, and I loved the kick and zing of the tasty mustard sauce.

Adam, the server, was terrific, and knew all of  the ingredients of the Ramsay tonic and the Scotch Egg, and enthusiastically explained how they were made. He was also personable a friendly, and I appreciated his interest in what I thought of each dish.

The Shepherd's pie was good after adding a bit of salt and pepper. Made of ground lamb, carrots and peas in a mild sauce, it came piped on top with creamy mashed potatoes. As a basic meat and potatoes type of dish, it was filling, however, I do not think I will order it again, as, to me, there just was not a lot of flavour going on in the dish. I think next time I will try the Ramsay signature fish and chips.

I decided to order the sticky toffee for dessert, as I had heard so much about it.., and Wow! Was it ever good!
It was so creamy and delicious with a moist date cake base, topped with a sweet cream ice cream and Florentine cookie, that I almost wanted to order another.

Adam came table side, and slowly drizzled the luscious warm toffee syrup over the top. This dessert together with rich hot coffee, was such a perfect ending to a tasty adventure in Gordon Ramsay's Grill and Pub!

Food way over priced, burger had no flavor. I like most other Ramsey properties, by this is a typical tourist trap. Table looked worn out, dirty and disgusting. Please see picture. We have higher expectations for what we paid. Would recommend Bobby's Burger Palace which is far better.

After a big meal the night before, I needed something lighter for lunch, so I got the Pub Chopped Salad here. Holy cow this was good. Nice large salad with lots of meats and other fixins. The "Apple Cider Vinaigrette" complemented it perfectly, without being too sweet or too vinegary. It was expensive for a salad, but it's one of the best I've had.

Strip casino dining in its purest, most naked state of corporate cynicism. Enormous space packed with unsuspecting diners, a cautiously daring menu, an army of impersonal wait staff buzzing to and fro, European sports on surrounding flat screens--everything about this place feels like it was washed through a series of trend spotting gastro-bots. But at least you get to wait way too long for your food, and as a special feature it's all ridiculously over priced. A pint of bass will run you ten dollars. Ten. Dollars. For a pint. Of Bass. Let that sink in. Two of us ordered fish and chips and one went with hangar steak, all served with French fries. Thirty minutes later plates arrived with luke warm, flaccid fries and serviceable proteins. The fish is substantial yet flaky and comes with a tarragon tartar which is a nice touch, but the whole thing lacks any kind of contrast in flavor or texture. Hangar steak was cooked properly, end of story. Hardly deserving its thirty dollar price tag. The table shared a sticky toffee pudding for dessert, which I have read much about. Moist cake, small scoop of generic vanilla ice cream, and standard warm toffee--enjoyable, but unexceptional. Overall, the "pub" fails miserably for how much it promises yet doesn't even attempt to deliver. More proof of the inherent evils of scaling ever upward. Everything about this place, the size, the insane prices, the vague service, the thoughtless dishes, exists merely to support its own fat, bloated fanny.

Service was incredibly slow. All 4 people at the table complained their food was bland,tasteless,overpriced and just"meh." The pretzels were decent. I'll give him that. For someone that prides himself on helping others to cook and be the best. Maybe it's time he make a visit to his own restaurant.
Had the salmon served on braised cabbage flavored with bacon.  It was fabulous!  Had to go back and have it again before I left Las Vegas.

We were passing through Ceasars palace and saw Ramsey's place and decided to try it for lunch.  I give it 4 stars but be advised its based only on what we ate - the burger.  I can't speak for any of the other food.   The burger is really good!  Perfectly seasoned, moist and the smokieness of the smoked apple bacon was perfect.  Fries are amazing too.  Thick, fresh cut, and potatoey.  If you want a good burger, this is the place.  Service is excellent too.  My wife and I shared the burger and the waiter kindly had it split up for us.  He was honest up front and told us it was big enough to share.  Give it a try for lunch if you are there.

Exactly what we expected from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, basically perfection.  We had reservations before the Rod Stewart show, and were originally seated at a pub style table with stools.  However, when we asked to be moved to a "real" table with chairs, they were accommodating and moved us without any issues.

Our waiter, and all the servers, were fantastic.  We never had to wait for refills and the food was served promptly.

We started with a calamari appetizer, and it was as good as calamari gets.  We had recently watched an episode of Kitchen Disasters where Ramsay was brutal on the chef that made greasy calamari, but this plate was perfect.

I followed that with the classic - fish and chips - and it was also as good as it gets.  My wife had the chicken Caesar salad, and was not disappointed.

 The only negative was the noise level from the casino, but that's expected.  We would not hesitate to eat at the Pub again.

Made reservations in advance to try and get good seating and they threw us in the aisle! The waitress had to check to see if the chips portion of fish and chips was made from "real potatoes"! They weren't even chips they were cheap frozen fries! Not British at all! My wife was sorely disappointed as for me I was talked into a $35 ny strip steak, very very small and very very dry I would have sent it back but that would have meant we had seen our waitress again! The table next to us was having similar problems! Oh yeah and they were out of scotch eggs! Not what you would expect from chef Gordon Ramsay. The service was equally as bad as the food by far the worst $100 I ever spent! And I left hungry! Thanks for ruining me and my wife's ten year anniversary Gordon!

I came here for their happy hour and really enjoyed it. Can't say much about their food (only had their truffle fries) but their service was great. 

When I first sat down, the bartender asked me if I was right or left handed, and placed the napkin/coaster on the appropriate side...who does that?! I felt pretty special and appreciated it.

The truffle fries were everything I would hope for and a little more (ketchup and honey mustard sauces really good). Crispy, truffle flavors, and good body of potato. 

They had a decent selection of different beers and the bartender was helpful in recommending certain beers if you weren't sure what you wanted.

DISAPPOINTMENT!

The cheeseburger was dry and tasteless. It came with nothing; no lettuce or tomato. I had the choice of putting ketchup or garlic aioli on it but nothing else. 
The fries were OK but nothing special.
I was lucky enough to have the one server behind the bar who really took care of his customers but the rest of the Hipsters working behind the bar, they were more interested in talking to and impressing eachother than taking care of the customers. There was a definate lack of Management on my visit.  
A pint of draft IPA $13, I could buy a 6-pack of this beer for $10.
Cheeseburger and fries $19. I would rather have a 5-Guys burger with it's better tasting meat and many toppings and bigger, better tasting fries all for half of the price.
I just can't believe that Chef Ramsay has tasted and approved of this food. But after eating at his namesake Gordon Ramsay Restaurant at the London Hotel in Hollywood (Restaurant has closed) maybe he has found a way to make money on hipe alone. 
So everyone, don't waste your money here. I guarantee you that if you order the cheeseburger at the hotel coffee shop you will be eating better than at GR Pub and Grill.
Someone conduct this burger challenge and post your results on Yelp. I would like to know how it goes.

My boyfriend and I are big fans of this past season of MasterChef Junior so we knew we had to make plans to eat at one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants in Vegas. We chose the Pub because they had Shepard's Pie and also because it wasn't too fancy. 

The restaurant is located inside the Caesar's Palace casino right next to the Forum Shops and the Colosseum. I loved the decor as it really transported you to Great Britain. Our server was great and was quick and friendly. I ordered the Steak and Ale pie and my boyfriend had the Shepard's Pie- we shared a side of Green Beans. Everything was great! The flavors in my dish grew as I continued eating and though the portion doesn't look like much, I was stuffed!! We were so full but our server highly recommended the Sticky Toffee Bread Pudding, which was their specialty and since we were on vacation, we couldn't turn it down. It was delicious! It sounds super sweet, but it actually wasn't. I would definitely recommend it.

We really enjoyed our time here and would love to try some of his other restaurants next time around!

Dining here felt like we were on an episode of Hell's Kitchen! Both blue and red teams have failed miserably! I was waiting to hear yelling and screaming from Chef Ramsay from the kitchen.

My cousin wanted to dine here before we proceeded with his bachelor party evening. We didn't make reservations here, so we ended up with a wait of forty five minute to an hour. When the estimated seating time came, we were seated promptly. While browsing our menus, our drink orders were taken and water glasses filled. I was very anxious and excited to try Chef Ramsay's favorite dish, beef wellington. Apparently, it wasn't on the menu. So, I ended up getting the roast prime rib entree, medium rare.

After twenty minutes had passed, we were told our entrees would be out in five minutes. Then ten, fifteen, and thirty came and went. Still, no signs of our entrees. Yet, other customers who were seated after us had their entrees served. We were all ready to get up and leave and dine else where. But, we all just decided to stick it through. Once our entrees were being served, they were served in waves. I was the last one in our party of seven to receive my entree.

For a $40 entree, I'll admit the entree looked hearty. The prime rib was cooked to a medium rare and accompanied with some glazed baby carrots, brussel sprouts, and mashed potatoes, and Yorkshire pudding. I had a side of creamy horseradish sauce, but no au jus for dipping. I would say that the prime rib was comparable to other dining establishments in Vegas. I would've been better off with the $10 prime rib dinners and paid way less than $40. But, I guess it was for the name and experience, right?

At the conclusion of our meal, my cousin went to place a complaint regarding our dinner service. The server and hostess were great, but not sure what was going on in the kitchen. I really wanted to like this place, but I wasn't impressed at all.

Hmmm I think my entire food experience in Vegas is SALTY. Please Vegas chefs, cut down on the salt! I did enjoy my food here but it was definitely on the salty side. They start you off pretzel bread and some butter and cheese sauce. I didn't love that cheese sauce but bread was good. We ordered the kumamoto to start. Oysters itself were not bad, but definitely could use a better sauce. I ordered the sliders as my entrée and the hubs ordered the shepherd's pie. I actually loved my sliders. I thought it was pretty tasty especially with the mayo based sauce. I didn't even ask for ketchup. The shepherd's pie looks small but is a lot of food and quite tasty as well with tender meat and delicious mashed potatoes. We decided to go all out and get dessert. The sticky toffee pudding looked really good in the picture. We were not disappointed. In fact it really made our meal quite enjoyable. Service there was good as well. In fact, Vegas overall provided excellent service.

I am not a Gordon Ramsay fan at all, but stopped in here because we were so hungry. It was fantastic! The pea soup was creamy and flavored just right. No dairy, by the way either - just the way I need it to be. Toast/bread was crispy and fresh and so good in the soup. We also shared the olives - amazing! And the salmon spread was to die for. Beers were cold and refreshing and service was very very good. We waited a bit between visited from our waiter, but that was okay. Very good.

Incredible! The food was amazing. Our waiter, Joshua, was fabulous. The atmosphere was great. We have now visited two of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants and know that whenever one of his restaurants is an option, that will definitely be where we go. So happy with our experience here!

This restaurant was a great lunch experience. Our waiter,Rodney, guided us to great food, drinks and a awesome desert. The hellfire wings were some of the best wings I have ever have. The goodbye blue sky was my wife's favorite drink on our vacation so far. Definitely will come here again on our next visit to Las Vegas.
this is review for the lamb burger only. really enjoyed it, not greasy but juicy. cooked to near perfection.

My husband and I ate at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill for lunch on 2/16/13. It was by far my LEAST favorite meal we had in Vegas.

We had the deviled eggs to start with. They were just ok, way over priced. I would have thought for somewhere around $12.00 we would have gotten more than two boiled eggs ( 4 halves) the taste wasn't anything special.

My husband had the fish and chips, he liked the fish fairly well but some of the chips/fries were way under cooked. He couldn't even eat all of them due to the fact that the potato was hard in the middle.

I had the chicken chopped salad. The dressing was flavorless, the flavors all blended together, (what little flavor there was) I wasn't even certain that there was chicken in the salad until I was able to finally spot  it, once I tasted it, I realized that it wasn't worth looking for. There were large chunks of hard lettuce mixed into the salad that was fairly bitter.

All in all, I'm glad I went so I can say that I went to one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants, but I do not plan on making a return trip, to this location or any other of his brands. Very disappointing.

Family going to dinner? Don't got here unless everyone is over 21 and look like they are big drinkers. As other reviewers noted, there is discrepancy in service.  We waited so long for drinks - one cocktail, soda and water - that we were putting our coats on when they arrived. The waiter said, "don't blame me I only put the order in." Really? Food was so so. Scratch that. The dressing for my salad was gross because it was so vinegary. And we waited forever for it. We were starving and I asked the waiter if he could bring something out quick. Quick turned out forever of an appetizer. Our water glasses were filled once by a hostess. Our waiter was too busy fawning over a six top of drinkers. Thank God we had a $100.00 voucher. Had I paid for that service I would have been really angry. Ironically we chose the restaurant because my son is such a fan of Gordon's show. P

We waited for 5 minutes for a booth, pretty great start. Then we ordered, food didn't take long at all to arrive, and when it did, the food was superb. We had the chicken wing appetizer, a cheeseburger, and a corned beef sandwich. YUM! Only flaw I would say is the waiter. Noticed him giving more attention to other tables and then would take forever to come back to us. Didn't quite appreciate that. Also, this restaurant did not have ranch or BBQ sauce. Otherwise, the food was amazing. I plan to return in the future.

This is our 2nd time going to that place. The first time was amazing. We were excited to get the bacon burger again but the burger was not good and did not taste like it's the same burger  we had before. I don't know what changed but something about the patty is off. Unfortunately, I won't be ordering this again. Very disappointing.

Was excited to be going to a Chef Ramsey restaurant since we are huge fans of his show.   Wasn't that impressed.   Started out good with super friendly wait staff, but when we had to ask three separate servers for more cocktail sauce we started to get disappointed.  We were going to go see Rod Stewart last night, so were kind of distracted.  The server recommended prime rib since they offer that on show night.  When she said it was market price and $48, I think we really didn't hear that part.   Expecting an enormous slab of meat with lots of potatoes and veggies, we were surprised to get an average size of meat and two small discs of potato along with 8 asparagus sprigs.   Granted it tasted good, but not $48 good.   No salad or soup offered as part of the meal or even bread.  To top it off, our friends ordered Shepard Pie and it was so small we thought it was out mashed potatoes!   They said it was extremely tasteless and were extremely disappointed.  I'm only giving 2 stars because the ambience was nice and the dessert was the best part of the meal.  Oh yea, calamari was just ok.   Not a great impression Chef Ramsey.

Given that this is Chef Ramsay's Resturant, I can't expect anything less than perfection. Fish and chips were out of this world. My friend ordered the burger, which looked amazing. 

Nothing better than enjoying great good food and hearing the slot machines go off. 

That's Vegas for you!

Awesome service followed by great food. My cousin and I eagerly made our way to this location after coming from Rehab at the Hard Rock Cafe and we were not the least disappointed. Our bellies and thirst were quenched. 

I ordered one of the popular burgers, which was the Euro Burger which was very good with sweet potato fries and the combination was definitely a winner: sweet on top of sweet. Would highly recommend this place!

So if you want to spend $25 on two lousy sliders and a domestic beer, this is a place  you should go.

Sliders were very small, dry no flavor, one had too much lettuce the other hardly any.  One with cheese the other I couldn't find any, the bun wasn't fresh.

Very disappointed .

I was in Vegas last weekend. We had dinner at Ramsay's place. I had the fish/chips and was very disappointed. My fish fell apart when I cut it. I couldn't spear it with my fork without it falling apart and as a resul...unable to dip in in the tartar sauce. The potatoes where under cooked.
On a positive not. My wife had a sandwich that looked amazing.
You would think that Gordon Ramsay would expect better. Maybe that's just a TV thing.

You can easily find this pub & grill when you make your way from the main casino area to the Forum shop in Caesar's Palace. There was quite a line already at 6pm. The ambiance was casual and great for chilling. 

This is the second Gordon Ramsay restaurant I've tried. The first one was the GR burger in Planet Hollywood. It doesn't make sense to compare the two as the menu and the dining experience are completely different. I got truffle fries and grilled salmon, which was like a seasonal special dish. The seafood was really bomb to my surprise! Service wise, I have to say that Planet Hollywood does a better job. The staff there are passionate and responsive to your request or questions. Here they are busier and less attentive. 

Overall I had a amazing time here. I'm excited to come back next time!

We are enthusiastic Ramsay fans and finally got a chance to try the Pub & Grill. The first thing that struck me was how comically low the chairs are compared to the tables. My husband is 6-feet tall, and the table top lined up with his chest. I'm 5'1" so you can imagine that I simply had to slide the food in a straight line directly from the plate to my mouth. 

We started with the Ramsay Tonic & a Moscow Mule. Both were just okay. My Moscow Mule tasted mostly of lime, and my husband didn't even finish his drink. The calamari was also just okay. It wasn't crispy, almost chewy, although it was seasoned well. And they served it with tartar sauce and ketchup. Ketchup...? 

Husband ordered the Fish & Chips, and I got the Braised Short Rib. The chips (or wedge fries) that came with his were seriously under-seasoned and slightly under-cooked. My Short Rib was the highlight--it nearly melted apart before my fork even touched it. The potato purée was tasty & smooth. Small sad face: the three carrots were still raw. Then came the Sticky Toffee Pudding. We've been obsessed with it ever since our first visit to Gordon Ramsay Steak. This one tasted great, but it didn't have the same sticky consistency I love about the one you can get at Steak. This was more like a cake.

The least desirable part of the whole experience was the service. The hostess was cold and didn't even look at me. However, the hostess assistant that sat us was friendly and engaging. Our server was fine but insincere. When he came to take our entree order, he just approached the table and stood there looking at us expectantly. I had to say, "I think we're ready to order," just to break the awkward silence. Again, he was fine; I wouldn't classify it as rude. Just not attentive or warm.

Overall, we had a decent experience. Looking back, I would rather have spent our 7-year anniversary and hard earned money at Steak again because the pricing is nearly the same, and the experience at Steak is significantly better.

We had a very poor experience. Gordon needs to pay his own restaurant a visit. This was a kitchen nightmare!! They served is cold nachos, undercooked and cold sliders and then one burger had a hair in it. The atmosphere was fun and our server was good, but not great. The other items were okay but not worth the $20 per appetizer that we paid. Don't go. Go somewhere else. There are just too many places in Vegas you can spend your money! Like Bobby's burger palace near cvs and Monte Carlo. Much better and only about $10 for a burger!

Not as good as his other local eateries but the same high prices.  Nice ambiance in the heart of Ceasar's palace with pub food and drink.  I don't like paying $30 for fish and chips but, hey, it's a celebrity chef.   Better for the Hell's Kitchen happy hour than dinner.  However, the food is damn good and the service is first class.  Salads, appetizers and sides are all good.

First time I have had "Innis and Gunn" ever and hopefully not the last.  Went strictly with the yelp recommendation and had the Fish n Chips.  One of the best Fish n Chips I've ever had.  Not greasy at all.  Crispy exterior, tender on the inside and excellent flavor.

The service was horrible! The last time we spoke to our server was when he took our orders. He never came back to check up on us. And he wasn't busy at all running orders and checking on his tables because the times I did see him on the floor was when he'd bring the bill to his tables and serve them water. We were able to catch another waitress that was serving the table next to us to grab us more water and steak sauce, and she wasn't very pleasant. Our bill came out to $225. No gratuity. Sorry, not sorry.

The food was OK. I ordered the prime rib. It could've used more seasoning. The restaurant was laid back. This was definitely not a place for kids.

Goodbye Blue Sky- Delish!

Time for some Truffle chips and Lamb burger. Don't forget the toffee pudding!

The restaurant is very nice inside*
The staff was very courteous and attentive.
I had the sirloin steak... Perfectly seasoned , quality beef flavor,awesome asparagus and mashed potatoes. The dish was excellent and all balanced out great.
I tried the lollipop chicken drummets and they were great* nice bleu cheese sauce .
The sticky toffee pudding was amazing as well. I sampled some beef sliders, and they were also very good

Since I've eaten at pubs throughout England I was a bit disappointed.   Obviously,  you are only paying for ramseys name, because if this is how he cooks then he needs a new profession.  We ordered pretzel sticks, bangers n mash, and fish n chips.  I've fried fish that tasted better.  The fries were so limp they should be put down.

A testament to my Yelp loyalty. I should have read some reviews. 

Our server was extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. The unfortunate news is that this review solely reflects the food. 

The scotch eggs were a good starter (I love HP sauce), and it all went downhill from there. We also ordered the pretzel starter, and there was no warning on how hot the mustard was! I love heat in a dish, but there should have been some warning. I dunked that sucker all the way in not realizing that it would take my breath away. It came with 3 under seasoned pretzel sticks, and the cheese sauce was nearly tasteless. 

My pulled chicken sandwich came out soggy from the kitchen. The over application of cheese and sauce created a gooey sandwich I was not expecting; The ciabatta bread did not hold up. If they had grilled it on a panini press, it would have been a different story!

I had a few bites of my boyfriend's fish and chips. It was better than my sandwich, but there was no seasoning. To their credit, the fish was fresh and flaky, but there was no flavor to it at all without the tartar sauce.

The meal was a surprising disappointment.

I might go 3 but since this has Gordon's name on it ill make it 2. Frisée salad was underseasoned and bland. Mussels and clams showed up with a bunch of unopened ones. Service was a tad slow. Second time I've been underwhelmed by a ramsay restaurant. Pizza Antica in lafayette ca has better salad and mussels. 

Definitely not Hell's Kitchen craziness worthy.

The atmosphere of this restaurant is fantastic. While the prices are quite high at about $17 per person, the meals are all great. Each entree tastes like the real deal and has an alcoholic pair that is recommended. I highly recommend this place and the pesto chicken sandwich in particular.

I have eaten at his steak house and it got great marks. His burger place is good. the pub sounds like a grand concept but it does not measure up. food is average at best and that is stretching it. The prices are over the top. 4 beers and appetizers at lunch and a bill of 140 at lunch for 2 people.... I seldom comment on price-- more than willing to pay for good food but this was not good while being over priced. Vegas has many better choices.

Food was ok, but the service was awful. We asked for lemon with our water on the first and infrequent visit by our server and asked again at water delivery only to wait 10 minutes more. My wife is pregnant and when ordering a lemonade he actually chuckled. Entrees arrived and the server was no where to be found to see if we had what we needed. Turns out my steak wasn't delivered with a steak knife so I asked the guy who I'd seen make 4 rounds and figured was the manager, even though he never actually talked to any of the tables, for a knife since I couldn't seem to find my actual server. 5 minutes later I had what I needed to eat my meal. No doubt that the lack of service starts at the top. 

Like I said, food was ok, but way overshadowed by the lack of service. I would figure that a Ramsey restaurant would pride themselves on that front but i figure Gordon is too busy with TV shows and opening a plethora of joints while his stock is worth anything. Great corn soup with crab, smashed fingerlings are awesome, just wish the staff wasn't disaffected like their attire.

Very disappointed for a Gordan Ramsay restaurant. Worst service I've encountered in a long time and I could have ate better food at a bar. First off there was 5 of us and the hostess said 30 minutes. 15 minutes later I went up and told her it will only be 4 people now so she said ok it will be 20 minutes more. My other friend came up to her at the 20 minute mark and said are we next it's 4 people and she said oh it's only 4 people okay give us 10 minutes. Finally, we got sat to a 7 top table and we said there's only 4 of us and she said oh opps sorry and we asked for a smaller table so we could actually communicate instead of yelling across from each other at the table. We ordered are appetizers and we got everything but our pretzels. It took 20 minutes for them to send out the pretzels. We ordered alcohol and one of the beers was not what we ordered and we wanted chilled glasses. It took another 20 minutes to get it and glasses weren't chilled. 45 minutes later we get our entrees and their luke warm not hot. I've never had such bad service of such plain jane food. Our server seemed lost but he was nice and actually admitted that he didn't provide great service but I give him credit for being honest. The only positive is the manager comped our meal and that was very kind of her. Hopefully they will work out the tweaks and maybe I will return since I do enjoy Gordan Ramsay steak at Paris.

PROS: Price, service, unorganized, food, communication
CONS: Ambiance, decor, cocktails

Highly recommend the sticky toffee pudding (quite possibly the best dessert I have ever had!). The complimentary pretzels with rarebit dip were really good, too. The fish-and-chips, though lightly breaded and fried perfectly, was a little on the salty side. Good coffee. Good selection of beers.

I normally don't write reviews about restaurants on Yelp, but I visited this location on 5/2/15 for dinner and I must say that the food in this place was very good.  The service was second to none and the vibe was very fun and energetic.  From the appetizers to the main course, I must say the food was incredible.  I will be back to this location the next time I am in Vegas.

Meh...is right. I had scallops...the bread tasted better. The food...salad,entree,had no taste. Thought the server (who seemed overwhelmed,and not very attentive.. would have a fit when my dining partner asked for salt.) Service needs some service. The food tasted like nothing. No flavor...The place has great atmosphere,and that's about it. I don't know why Gordon Ramsay is so bitchy on the TV show about flavor and texture of food...he needs to pay attention to his own cooking....never should have wasted 175.00 on dinner for two here. Should have gone to Trevi
.

First of all, do not go here if you're looking for a fine dining experience. This is a pub. Expect a high noise level and pub food.

With that said we had an ok evening. Food was good. A bit overpriced, but good. Best was the sticky toffee pudding (highly recommended) and the salmon with a lovely crispy skin.

How do I describe my experience here? Horrible and pathetic. If my name were on the place, I'd verify the quality. First, took and hour to get appetizers. Second, two hours for good with a "medium" requested burger clearly "rare."  I would not only not recommend this place, I would persuade people against it. Horrible worst burger I've ever had.

Went there on May 26th, 2013 at 7pm.  There were 3 in our party and we were asked to wait 45 minutes.  When we returned, we were promptly seated.  About 10 minutes later, our waiter showed up for the first time to take drink orders.  By that time, we had already decided what we wanted for dinner.  Another 10 minutes later, the waiter returned with water and took our order.  Our appetizers arrive about 10 minutes later and the food was excellent.  

Now for the not-so-excellent part.

After we finished our appetizers, we waited an additional 40 minutes before I started trying to find our waiter and ask him where our food was.  We noticed several other groups of people come in and get their entrees less than 20 minutes after they were seated.  Once I finally found him, he said he would check on it, and returned 5 minutes later with "You food is next up, I just checked".  20 minutes later, I was ready to leave and got up to find our waiter for the bill. I tracked him down again, and reminded him that we'd been there for almost 1.5 hours.  He gave me the look, then disappeared.  Another 5 minutes goes by, and finally our food shows up, right as we were about to bail.

The food was hot, outstanding and completely awesome.  It just took forever to get for some unknown reason, and I don't need to tell you how frustrating it was to watch people come in 10 minutes after you, get the same food you ordered, finish their meal and then leave, all before your food shows up.  Even though it was completely awkward, our waiter did apologize for the delays, but made no effort whatsoever to make it right.  No manager, no reasonable explanation, nothing.  Just a $144 bill.  It took us less than 15 minutes to eat the food that took them more than an hour to prepare.

So, the food was awesome, but the service was absolutely awful.  It was actually like participating in an episode of Hell's Kitchen, wondering if you'll ever actually get the food you ordered.  Except in this case, we got the "pleasure" of paying $144 for "participating" in this rather disappointing episode.

Gordon Ramsey seriously needs to tune this place.  Incredible food coupled with incredibly awful service essentially equals an awful experience.

With so many other awesome choices available for an outstanding dinner, I absolutely cannot recommend this place.  Even though the food was outstanding, we still left disappointed, and no one should pay $144 to come out of a restaurant disappointed.

We ordered:

Corn Soup
English Ale Onion Soup
Sheppard's Pie
Filet Mixed Grill
Fish'n Chips

NOTE: The Sheppard's Pie was the best we've had EVER.

I  had the pleasure of visiting this pub and grill on March 22, 2015. First time in Vegas and celebrating my best friends retirement from the US Army. We were greeted at the entrance, hostess sat us at a table and waiter (Adam) was immediately at the table ready to take our drink order. The  bar manager (Randall Goldich) was visiting each table to insure that everything was great. He proceeded to talk to us and went above and beyond of being a manager. He introduced the head cook which was season 14s  Hells Kitchen winner. Great atmosphere, great service, great people. I will return when I visit Las Vagas again.

The shepherd pie with potatoes was incredible. The sticky pudding and ice cream heavenly. The chicken pot pie had no flavor essentially but the pastry crust good. It is expensive but in line with Vegas prices.

OK I'm going to keep this simple -

Food:  OK.  Scotch Egg (yes, just one lonely egg) was decent but served cold, Fish and Chips were average (but $29 for two pieces of fried cod and a handful of fries? REALLY?), braised short rib was quite tasty BUT the risotto it was resting upon was extremely undercooked.  Not al a dente but damn near raw.  Sticky Toffee Pudding was pretty darn good.

Service:  OMG how slow can we go????

Atmosphere:  It's a pub. Really, it's a pub.

Beer:  Selection isn't that great.  About $12 per pint.

Value:  You have got to be joking!  I know that this is a celebrity chef owned establishment on the Strip, but almost $150 before tip for the above mentioned meal (oh, and two beers and one cocktail)?  I mean come on, you can get basically the same thing at many other on-strip pubs for half the price. If the food was exceptional, the price may be justified.  Unfortunately it wasn't.

Bottom Line:  Good but flawed food (the food does prevent a 1-star rating).  Poor service.  Way overpriced - even by strip standards.

Don't even think about eating here without a reservation! Although Gordon Ramsay has several restaurants in Las Vegas, they're all super packed as everyone anticipates to dine at the hyped up establishment of Hell's Kitchen's superstar.

Located inside the Caesar's Palace casino, you may be tempted to put some bills into those slot machines while waiting for your table. Thankfully, our wait (with reservation) wasn't too long and we were seated near the kitchen that had a huge painting of Gordon's menacing face. 

I'm sure if Gordon was there in person, the employees would have provided better service. Our waiter did not appear too happy about doing separate bills, even though we advised prior to ordering our meals. He said the best he can do is separate our table of 11 into four separate bills, so we gotta partner up with someone.. 

I have no complaints about the food, but it wasn't so amazing I would go back and try other items. I ordered the pork belly - the serving size looks small but because of how fatty the meat was, the dish was actually very filling. We weren't allowed to substitute the sides - but if I could, I would have gotten the mac and cheese, which according to my coworkers are amazing. 

The ambience was a little like a jazz bar, except that it was extremely loud - you'd be shouting all night long. So would I come back? Probably not. 

My tummy deserves better than an A-OK when in sin city.
The food was pricey but excellent! We went for simple, classic pub foods- Hubs had the fish & chips, I had the shepard's pie- both were incredible.

I'm such a Gordon Ramsay fan & love watching him tear apart restaurants and egos on Kitchen Nightmares. Pub & Grill was actually my first Ramsay dining experience and it totally hit the spot.

Caesars Palace is a busy place, and Pub & Grill's central location on the casino floor makes this restaurant a really busy place too. On a Tuesday evening around 8p, we were quoted a 45 minute wait for a party of two. Ugh. Too hungry for all that, we scoured the bar for a couple stools and luckily found a spot at the back end. We squeezed-in near the drink pickup station, so it was definitely a busy spot. Even though the restaurant was buzzing, we were promptly helped by both a bartender and server. Overall service was quick & friendly-enough.

The Maine Lobster Roll Minis are super tasty & ideal for sharing since they are plated in pairs. The Shrimp Cocktail's also great - six massive prawns perfectly poached and served with a delicious horseradish-spiked cocktail sauce.

Vegas can get a little stuffy when it comes to dining, so turn to Pub & Grill for a casual, delicious meal.

for a chefs restaurant it was incredibly disappointing. Horrible service-it took the food 45 minutes in an empty restaurant, and when we finally received our food it was mediocre at best. I won't make the mistake of thinking that a Gordon Ramsay restaurant will be good based on the name again.
Poor service, bad menu, and worse food. It's no wonder the UK is not known for their food. A disappointing dinner experience. Never again!

We came here on a whim, because this is the point where we were so tired from walking and stopped and decided that this would do. Our waiter was busy but nice enough to check in on us and make sure we got what we needed. We were impressed by the quickness in which our food got out. We had just ordered the wings and nachos which had a different take on flavors. It was good, but nothing that was very impressive. The prices were just too exorbitant I don't think we've ever paid $22 for a dozen wings. The nachos were like $15 or $16 and that seemed too high as well. I understand that this was on top of kettle chips and it was short ribs, but that was a bit crazy. I can appreciate the creativity but it comes with a cost. This also seems to be a popular spot for birthday celebrations and there were 2 right next to us, and we were here at like 9:45pm.

Went there last Thursday for dinner. We didn't make reservations and just happened to pass by and decided to eat there since we are both fans of Gordon Ramsey. We were seated immediately. 
I ordered the Caesar salad and the salmon. Salad was nice and fresh. The salmon originally was undercooked and was sent back. The next serving was delicious, just wish it was a bit bigger.
The wife ordered the fish and chips. It was excellent. A lot of fish and the chips were good just needed a few more seconds in the grill. 
Our waitress was very courteous and apologetic about my dinner dish. We would recommend the restaurant but if your hungry then don't get the salmon you will leave still hungry.

Scheduled a business lunch here and was able to get their back room (seats 8).  I mentioned beforehand that we'd be meeting while eating and the staff was very gracious in coming in, doing what needed to be done and then leaving us to talk.  Admittedly this wasn't a busy time but they never made us feel rushed or that we were a bother.

Had the pot pie and it was amazing!  Complex flavors and perfectly tender meat - getting hungry just thinking about it!

Ask for Sarah if you want to taste of Las Vegas at G. Ramsasy Pub. She is one of the most attentive,professional, and passionate servers you can encounter in Las Vegas. She brings tremendous positive energy on the floor as well. My Caesars salad was outstanding with anchovy and love to go back anytime soon.

I lived in England for 4 years and my husband is English. Despite this we've never made it to a Gordon Ramsey restaurant and after this probably won't ever again. The fish and chips was tasteless soggy batter yet dry in the center. The calamari was bland. The bartender was incredibly rude to my friend. The waitress didn't understand boundaries - she just kept interrupting. The only redeeming thing was the fact the fact that they serve strawberry beer. It was overpriced entirely. I don't understand how someone so opinionated about others have such a crappy restaurant. It's really a joke.

Eating here was a bit of a let-down for me, as I am used to the most delicious food and superb service in Vegas. I've been to my share of the "pubs" in town, most notably the pubs by Todd English and Michael Mina, and was expecting a similar experience. 

The drinks were delicious, most notably the Pub's version of a Moscow Mule, but my food was mediocre at best. Perhaps I ordered something really random in the Pub's version of Butter Chicken with basmati rice, but the sauce was bland and way too peppery at the same time. The rice was tender and well-cooked, but so drenched in butter that it appeared yellow. Other friends ordered fish and chips, the pea soup, the sliders, and fries. The fries were soggy and limp, which was a huge letdown. Everything was else was fine, just nothing to write home about.

The atmosphere is fun, but that was probably the best part.

On our most recent trip to Las Vegas, we stopped in to have a bite and relax the feet from walking all day and decided to try another Gordon restaurant. We were seated very quickly and was greeted immediately by our server, Yaneisy. She quickly brought us a round of drinks and added a couple of glasses of water. The mad Russian had Mule's Hind Leg and I chose Goodbye Blue Sky. Both drinks were good and refreshing.
For food, we had a classic bar menu taste in our mouths and ordered Nachos, deviled eggs, and Fish and Chips. The food came out hot and was well presented. The order of nachos was large and the fish was well cooked. No complaints about either the food or the service.
All told, it was a good experience and we wouldn't shy away from coming back. Prices are a little steep, even for Vegas. $30 for fish and chips.... I don't mind spending money on a good meal, but let's keep it reasonable. Two drinks and bar food was $93. The reason for the three stars was not the service or the quality of the food, it's for the value of the whole meal. Seems to me that being in the center of a casino, and a winning brand, ought to make it a volume restaurant, not a place to make a killing on low traffic.
We'd come back for sure as we had a nice meal and you won't regret coming here if you're hungry.

It's pretty obvious Gordon Ramsey has never been to his own restaurant (or has not for sometime), because if he did--I don't think he'd be very happy. 

Eclectically designed in pub fashion, its vibe and energy is right on point to what you'd imagine for a celebrity chef's venue. However, the menu choices and cooking execution is no where near what'd you imagine. 

Let's be real: it's a pub. And the menu greatly reflects that. I think I just hoped for a better culinary experience than traditional burgers and fries or a turkey pesto on wheat. 

I will say that it was extremely nice that they seated a group of 5 right away without a reservation, considering that's often a rarity on the Strip. But our food took over an hour and a half to come out, and our server seemed really flustered that we asked him to split the bill. 

I'll give Ramsey the benefit of the doubt; I'm certain he's an amazing chef. I just wish that he'd put some TLC into his restaurants. That's all.

Food was very good - scotch eggs, pretzels, tomato soup, sliders...we loved it all.  Took a while to get, but it was worth the wait.
We had an awesome server, Jamie - she was super attentive and made it a fun experience for us... make sure you ask for her!

As a Vegas local and someone who enjoys finding great spots to frequent, I had not yet tried Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill so decided to give it a try before a show this weekend. Celebrity restaurants in Vegas are definitely hit or miss and while there were aspects of Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill that were excellent, the service left something to be desired. First off -- since the service is what is giving this review poor marks let me start out by saying that our server had zero personality and was seldom seen or heard from. Service is the hallmark of a great restaurant, so even with the best food you can mess it up quickly with bad service. Our server should definitely find employment elsewhere. Now, on to the better part of the review - the food. The food was overall good. The short rib was extremely tender and tasty as it should be and it was atop an amazing risotto and the pearl onions were a very nice touch. The cheddar cauliflower was also very nicely done. Sticky toffee pudding is one of my favorite desserts and theirs was amazing. Cocktails were also great. Prices were high for what it is. I don't mind paying and you do expect to overpay on the strip, but this was a bit much. So, up the ante on service and you'd win me back -- not sure I'd give it another try based on what I experienced, however.

Second visit occurred 5-7-2014. Dined for two with reservations which made wait time excellent as well as food delivery time. I enjoyed beet salad,which was best experience. Pretzels were old tasting and dry. Beef sliders dry and over cooked. Deviled egg filling was very dry and not creamy in consistency; however the vinegar on egg white shells were good. We asked waitress if Mr. Ramsay was involved in restaurant operations and we were advised he most certainly is; however, it would be beneath him to consider "amateur" reviews on Yelp. Waitress indicated the people who work at restaurant are best equipped to know what's good versus customers. 

First visit occurred on 5-4-2014 with group of six. Service took 2 hours but food seemed better, lamb burger was reported by my table as delicious. I didn't order food but reserved my opportunity 3 days afterward.

I gave this place 2 stars since the waitress' comments suggest there is no place in their business for customer feedback since owner is celebrity chef and has "better things to do with his time than to look at Yelp or hear from amateur food critics."

Place is not worth the expense.

If our server treated us better I would have give it a 3 stars. But, the only thing he had done is greeting, taking order that's about it.and the only time he show up is when the food is here. Sure, that sounded fair. But, we are running low on water and condiment and would love to ask for the check and he is no where to be find.

My husband still left him with decent amount of tips because it is Christmas eve( maybe that's the whole reason for inattentive  service?!)

Food is ok.  I ordered the steak medium rare which comes out surprising rare and dry?!
My husband ordered the chicken Breast thankfully it is nice and tender. 
The dessert straight forward dead sweet. And it takes about a good 20 mins wait ,but it felt like an hour to me.

the food is below average and bland ! from watching is shows i expected something spectacular, i was wrong, for a guy who likes to tell people on his show that they are terrible cooks he may want to pay closer attention to his own restaurant, i know its not "fine dining" but the prices sure are ! i miss the old vegas when food was great and cheap and they made money off of gambling, now corporations own it and they do the bare minimum, i liked it better when mobster ran it !

Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill was so great! We were greeted with great big smiles from the hostesses in the front, we had great service from the waiters. We came on Friday night and the place was booming and our food came out very quickly. We were so surprised we didn't have to wait. As a huge fan of master chef and kitchen nightmares and all of Gordon's shows I had to go to a Gordon Ramsay resturaunt to celebrate my 30th Birthday. I was not at all disappointed with anything, everything was perfect!!!

The sticky toffee pudding was AMAZING! I went with my family during our vacation in Vegas and we all enjoyed our meals. It's a cool atmosphere and the service was good. Maybe a tad overpriced but to be expected for Vegas. The drinks here are pretty good too...we got the mocha martini, two Belgian margaritas and a wheat beer. All of us were happy with the drinks. Though we all agreed the dessert was our favorite thing :)

March 12, 2016
Dear Mr. Gordon 
I live here in Las Vegas and I had friends come in to town from Corpus Christi, Texas we had gone to Ceasars to eat the buffet but found ourselves having to wait for 2 hrs in a half just to get in so instead my husband was looking through the Internet and found that you had a restaurant there at Ceasars so he knows I watch you all the time on T.V. and came up with the idea to let's try it so we did as we were greeted with a well manner manager I told him I see you all the time on T.V. and he told me I had just miss you that you had been there the day before so I was sad but I just wanted to tell you that we all really enjoyed everything we ordered my husband ordered a burger with bacon and of course I had the rib eye steak and a salad everyone was very nice and in great spirits I just wanted to say it was the best food I have had in a long time that I can't even remember when I had a great time and eating great food I will definitely go again and try something else next time I mean no words can't describe how great your food really taste like until they have had it I was also so amazed when I took a bite off my husband's burger it didn't smell like a burger it smelled and taste as you were eating a great piece of steak it was awesome I will give you 5 stars and  A plus plus plus plus plus plus that's how good it was thank you so much for bring great food to vegas I think others need to learn from your restaurant so we can have better food here in las vegas home of the world!!!!

Always Sandra Cano
P.S. and trust me I will tell you the truth and not be shy to say what needs to be said like i have with other restaurants.

Food was absolutely delicious.. mini mac was yummm.. and the vegetarian dish - saffron rice and veggies were awesome.. And our server, Adam was quick, witty and fun.. 10 stars.. but guess can only give 5 here !! Highly recommended !!

Maybe we ordered the right things. Maybe people are too harsh because it's Gordon Ramsey's restaurant so they hold it to an unobtainable level. Who knows??

Our server was very friendly and was able to get everything out in an hour on a Friday night. We let him know we had a show to catch and he put a rush on everything. Was very friendly as well. 

Apps we had the mini lobster rolls and the truffle chips. Lobster was very good. Chips were a waste of money. I'm sure my wife got them since a friend of hers got truffle popcorn at Hearthstone last week and they were awesome. 

I had read enough reviews to make me nervous of some items so I ordered a burger, my wife ordered the lamb burger and my buddy had salmon. The burger was excellent. My wife said her lamb burger was great. And, every bite was gone from my friends salmon so pretty sure he was happy. 

For dessert we had to try it. We ordered the "spotted dick", jokes and all. It was excellent. Described by the waiter as similar to bread pudding but steamed. It came out, and was a warm sugary bread pudding in a liquor cream sauce with ice cream. It was surprisingly good. 

All in all a very good meal. Good food, good service. Any complaints on price hasn't eaten on the strip. It was in line with anywhere else on the strip. At $80 a foot in rent and 10-25% of sales to boot going to landlord, what do you expect?

Wow!!  This place has gone down hill!  The pretzels and cheese that used to be free are now $10 for three pretzel sticks. When we asked the server, Tayler, why they are now charging for bread he said " we are trying to run a business and people would come in, eat the free bread sticks and then leave".  I stated maybe they should give the bread after the order is put in. He stated "you know our rent is $250,000 per month".  My thought, you can't argue with stupid. They also removed the truffled fingerling potatoes, that was my favorite, from the menu. We ordered fish and chips and sliders. The fish and Chips were $30 and are only average. When some of us were done with our subpar meal the bus boy began removing plates and reaching right over my plate as I was still attempting to eat. I suggested to him that maybe he should wait until we are all done.   Tayler, in all his brilliance, decided to come over and tell us that the bus boy was the best they had, blah,blah, blah. In a nutshell Gordon Ramsay needs to bring kitchen nightmares in to his own place and Tayler, you need to learn that the customer is always right and to shut your stupid mouth.  Skip this place Vegas is full of top notch restaurants fantastic food and stellar service.

Fantastic service and food recommendations from Brianna. 
Just finished another week of projects in Vegas and wanted to find a good spot for lunch this past Thursday. Was central strip and thought I would see what was in Caesars Palace. Went to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and After being seated asked my server Brianna what I should try. She suggested the nachos to start and they were great. Great crunch from fresh made chips that stayed crunchy. I liked the combination of flavors and how well the dish was made. Brianna suggested the curry dish for my main and I enjoyed greatly and finished lunch with the cheesecake she suggested. Great service and nice having someone who knew the menu and could help me with selections. 
Looking forward to my next trip and lunch again at Ramsay's 

Here for CES and looking forward to returning.
Went in for drinks. My drink was wrong and severed without a smile and got doubled billed. Talked with manager he said well we are training it happens.
Mini lobster rolls, rib eye, short ribs, shepard pie, coktails, all prepared under Gordon standards. Friendly service and a lively atmosphere. All good in Hells Kitchen at the pub n grill ;)

We did family style and ordered the chicken, fish and chips, mac n cheese, and lamb burger.  For me, I would just go back for the fish and chips. Everything else was just mediocre. However, for lunch it was quite expensive. The waiter was nice. Not sure if I would come back.

I've been looking forward to eating here for literally months. I browsed the menu online and arrived expecting to be quite happy. Unfortunately, the best I can report is that I left full. 

Our flight was delayed, causing my spouse and I to be about 30 minutes late for our reservation. Not a problem- they were able to seat us after a 10 minute wait. Unfortunately, after that we kept waiting. It took another 15 minutes to get water. 10 more minutes after that before our waitress arrived to take drink orders. We ended up placing our meal order at the same time, just to cut down on the delays.

As a starter, my son and I shared an order of the Warm Pretzels....which arrived stale and significantly less than warm. The accompanying cheese sauce was glorified velveeta. My entree, the Steak & Ale Pie was okay. The description said the pie contained "root vegetables" so I'd been eagerly anticipating a pie rich with steak, potatoes, parsnips, turnips...all those lovely British veg. But no...I got a basic stewed beef with a couple of sad little carrot bits, topped by a crust that left my mouth coated in lard/shortening film. 

My spouse and son both ordered burgers and raved about them...but they both agreed that the fries reminded them of Burger King. Not what an English pub should aspire to emulate.

Overall? Horribly overpriced (we paid over $100 for 3 entrees, 2 apps and 3 sodas) mediocre food. Cannot recommend.

Let me begin by pointing out we had lunch at GRP&G. A dinner experience is most likely different. The atmosphere definitively rings pub. Kegs are used in lieu of wall separations and the table we were seated at was really "homey" This was my first Ramsey experience so I was anxious to see if his establishments could hold up to the cartoon scrutiny he puts the contestants through on his over wrought Hell's Kitchen show. Are his restaurants held to the same standard? I would have to say GRP&G is up to snuff. The menu is interesting but smallish even for a lunch but it certainly does not lack variety. Chicken pot pie and a beef pot pie are available as well as the expected Shepard's pie. .We saw several burgers being served and they were huge! Nice touch adding beer suggestions with each dish. I did not partake but thought the beer pairing idea was genius. We choose to start with a Scotch Egg that was delightful but the chipotle and mustard sauce took took it to another level, We also tried the shrimp cocktail that was ....a shrimp cocktail...Not bad,  just not special. I tried the braised beef rib and it was very good.It was served over a risotto (and no...I heard no screaming coming from the kitchen) that was nice. Desert however went to a new level of decadence.  A brownie, topped with cheesecake, topped with Rocky Road ice cream, covered in chocolate and to add to the party a magnificent caramel sauce on the side. No fellow Yelpers, this is not Gordon Ramsey light! Service was ...interesting. Good, fast, ..really spot on with the timing ....but...well..leave it to say our server was ....interesting. I've seen a few trash reviews here complaining about 12 dollar fish and chips? Come on ...it's a celebrity chef venue inside Caesar's Palace!  Were you looking for a Denny's? All in all a pretty nice experience and I would try dinner next time. ...If you do get the same sever we got ...and you will know if you do ...Let me know if the word interesting applies!

We did a pop in, as we were doing some shopping around the city today. It was after lunch on a Saturday, around 2pm- waited about 2 minutes for a 2 seater. The decor is comfy, and the place was rather busy. Our server( I wish I caught her name.. ) was adorable and super friendly. We waited no time for some water and gave a a chance to see the menu. I wanted something light, as we were planning on gelato at the forum shops. I decided on the wedge salad- I can honestly say, with out taking a piss, it was clearly the best salad I have every eaten. I's scouring the internet as we speak looking for his vinaigrette recipe. My husband had the banger's and mash, and since he is straight out of London, he knows what is a hit and what is a miss. Definite hit. We added a couple pints and I have to say, it was a terrific meal. We had no wait on the food and I think if we had, so what~ Perfect place to people watch. Very Chill ! Go, relax, and don't rush! Enjoy your experience.

Everything was perfect!

I got the salmon, which I adored.  Our server was amazing and the appetizer of three pies was perfect!  

All of our desserts were yummy as well.  Definitely want to return!

I give it a 4. I probably give it 1 star higher because Gordon Ramsay is awesome and my wife and I are huge fans. However, i did expect a little better. . Don't get me wrong, i got the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was good-it just wasn't super spectacular as i would imagine Ramsay's restaurants to be. 

I guess what hurt it was a few things. . .the portions are small. the prices were high but i was able to expense it through my company. . . it felt rather cramped inside. . . my server was kind of rude. .. . the other server that was helping other people around me was MUCHH nicer. . 

the Pros were : cool decor, the other server actually came to talk to me as well and was very cool to talk to, the food was good. .  

i think i'd go again, if not for a break from the huge feasts at the buffets in LV

I always thought that Gordon Ramsay  was a stickler for getting food out on time. If that is true, then he should probably check-in more with this restaurant. 

We had a table of 5 for a 10:15pm reservation. We were seated promptly and had our orders taken. Our soups seemed to come out at a decent time but we didn't get our entrees until at least 50 min after that. In that time I had lost my appetite from waiting so long. The restaurant occupancy was as expected for a Thursday night but not all the tables were taken. Maybe the kitchen was short-staffed, I don't know. I would have given 1 star because you shouldn't lose your appetite while at a restaurant, but my fish and chips were pretty good. However, they were not good enough to make me come back and wait that long (or pay that much again) for them.
Seemed like an ice place, ordered the fish & chips. It was just OK, the fries were not very good. Afterwards I got sick and had diarrhea, thanks Gordon.

My sister and I had dinner here and I was so excited to experience Chef Ramsay menu. The pretzels were great but that is all I can say about the food. We ordered the beef check and I had a steak. The beef check was so salty and the veggies (2 slivers of potatoes & carrots). My steak had no flavor and was tough. The service was amazing and the manager did apologize for the quality of food.  I would have expected much more

3.5 stars for the food
4 for ambience/decor
2 for the service!

Long story short, you can count on less than one finger on the number of times our server came to our table after taking our order--ZERO!  Not sure if a rude server coming frequently with a bad attitude would've been better lol.

But that's ok, didn't want to let him ruin our first meal deal after landing.  Since GR steakhouse and burgers were either sold out from Opentable or too late of a time, this was the next best thing, and I had to get my celebrity chef itch out of the way.

The good:

prime rib: super tender, big chunk, maybe even 16-18 ounces, and not too fatty either.  Yorkshire i've had better

mashed potatoes: ordered another full serving.

the average:

server said the fish and chips were popular, I've had better.

Staying with the server, the bus boy gave us better service, thus he deserved the 15% tip instead, which we gladly gave cash when we left lol.  Our server barely deserved his 5%!

P.S.  took him 10min to get our bill, while he was setting up 2 tables around us....

Disappointed! The food was average at best and maybe my expectations were just too high. Ordered a burger, medium to medium well, that was seriously close to rare. Ok, the made me a new burger but that's not the point. I just expected more. The menu was limited. I supposed to be an English style pub and the much of the food is British (and I'm not a huge fan of English food) but there just weren't many appealing options (at least on the happy hour menu). Would pass on this place next time.

my husband and I had lunch at the pub and had a great time. the bartenders were excellent. our meal was great, I had the lobster mac and cheese, delicious! the atmosphere is very cool. overall, a great choice!

Been here twice..food and service are always great...lamb burger was great and I highly recommend the Innis and Gunn beer...the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the fries that came with my burger were crap...oily, limp and no flavor...very disappointed with the fries...the lamb burger and beer made up for it

Didn't think much of this place.  Staff was generally unfriendly.  It seemed like they all thought they were doing us a favor.  Had high expectations for the food.  It is gordon ramsay so expectations are high.  Had the fish and chips and it was just ok.  For 30 bucks expected more.  Fries were nothing special either.

Was gambling with friends and we all wanted to take a break and just relax with some beers.  We were next to GR Pub & Grill, and they had a decent enough beer selection.  

I was hungry, so we ordered calamari and a salad for the table to snack on and I ordered the lamb burger.  The calamari and salad were just average and nothing to write home about.  But the lamb burger was fantastic.  The meat just juicy and savory, with just the right amount of gaminess to remind you that you are not eating a basic burger.  The goat cheese melded really well with the burger as well.  The french fries were thin and dull, and got cold pretty quick.  

So the lamb burger is a 4.5 star meal, while everything else was 2 stars, so I ended up giving the place 3 stars.  I was also disappointed that the lunch menu only had about 4 sandwich options.

We enjoyed our dinner here. Pretzels and bread was good, salad was ok, Flat Iron Steak was solid, English Chips were great, and the Strawberry tart was outstanding!!! The wife's Fish and Chips were pretty good too! It was a bit touristy, but I liked the atmosphere.

I did not know what to expect coming here... but I was definitely satisfied with what I had. More than satisfied!

I wanted to try the poutine... but they were out :( Me sad.

I ordered the fish and chips as an entree, and the table ordered the pretzels with cheese dip, deviled eggs, and sliders to share. I got to try every appetizer, and they were all delicious. Except the cheese was a little gritty. I like my cheese sauce smoother... but the flavor was pretty good.

My fish and chips were so good! Well, mostly the fish because the chips were big, fat potato pieces that are fried... pan fried? Haha I'm not a big fan of thick fries, I like them a little thinner and crispier. But the fish was flaky, crispy, moist, and fresh af. MMMMmmm and my bf ordered the pork belly.... omg............. It was SOO delicious. It's very rich, fatty, melty in your mouthy, and maybe a little too salty but overall it was really bomb. I don't think I could finish one by myself, so I'm glad I got to try his :)

DESSERT: Sticky toffee pudding - ORDER IT! It's soooo decadent, warm, caramel-y, gooey, and sticky, and topped with ice cream = heaven.

Lovey food here and not as busy as Gordon Ramsay's burger joint. The fish and chips are fantastic and I highly recommend them. The steak ale mini pie was better then the larger version. Salmon was good, but not my favorite.
I have only had their Mac 'n Cheese and Shepards Pie...both were AMAZING! I would go back for those two dishes!

LIFE CHANGING!  No joke, everything we had here was amazing and the people that ate on both sides of our table couldn't stop talking about how great their food was.

Our appetizer was the pretzels (so soft and you have to get it off the Pub Menu) with the housemade mustard and cheddar ale dip.  Then we got the bangers & mash (amazing), truffle mac & cheese (so good) and the sliders (on the Appetizer section of the Lunch Menu) which were so good because they were charbroiled.

The desserts we got were the pear cobbler and sweet cream (whipped cream) which were really good but the best part of the entire meal was the sticky toffee pudding.  When I said life changing I mean LIFE CHANGING!  I've never had anything like it and I'm pissed that I probably never will again!

We put in our reservations through Open Table and I'm glad that we did because there was a 30 minute wait.  At the moment we couldn't find the restaurant on Caesar's map layout online but it's right outside the entrance to the Forum Shops.

Always a great time , drinks and food!  Everytime we go , it never disappoints ! Service is great especially at the bar .. Our last visit this weekend was great and "G" took great care of us ! Had us go back for one last drink and bite before we left town! Lamb Burger and Wings are AMAZING .. Along with the sliders , fish and chips , pretzel and French onion soup .. AND THE DRINKS! Made with great enthusiasm and deliciousness ... Everytime ! Can't wait to go back!
Ordered lolly pop wings, was served plain dings, no wings: had sherpered pie: it was bland: i was very disappointed ? Very very disappointed.  Does Gordon eat here?
I would say the pub is a cool little spot to eat price are ok. The waiters are good and friendly. The fish and chips are really good

Just have to say happy hour is he best time to go! The apps are amazing and the service was outstanding! We had a very attentive server followed by a manager that came around after the food was delivered assuring us to find him personally if we had any concerns. First time in Vegas and will not be my last, look forward to eating there again and receiving the same great service.
Upscale British pub food! Great drinks! Bartenders are always fun!

Let me start by saying the food was great! Small portioned but great! However the prices and the lack of service really drove down my rating for two stars. We had to flag down the waiter to get water/tea refills. The prices are typical vegas but I mean come on for the small portioned and no presentation I am not sold. I was half tempted to get a dessert however when I saw the portions I did not want to spend the extra dollars. My advice would be to go somewhere else where you can leave and be full. Still hungry and spend way too much for the little you get.

The food was good, the service was great, but nothing was exceptional. 

The menu is very limited so consider checking it out before you head in. Maybe the name "Gordon Ramsay" attached to the restaurant title raised my expectations a little, but overall I wasn't that impressed. I ordered a cheeseburger that came with fries and it was definitely good and satisfying but this isn't a place I would choose to come back to.

The only way to get in to this restaurant is to be a cardholder for Caesar's Entertainment. Otherwise, the wait is always very long. Additionally, if you have a diamond membership you get excellent customer service.

It's right in the middle of Cesars and someone help you if you get seated right at the railing, it's like you are an animal on display and all the people waling by stare at you while eating.  The atmosphere is pretty chill for a trendy pub.  It was pretty noisy while we were there but the service was great and the sliders were outstanding, best sliders I have had to date.  They have a great beer selection, including some of Ramsay's claimed favorites.  I tried them all a couple times, it was good.

Overall its worth a trip, but you better get reservations in advance or you will be waiting a half hour or more.  Reserve online and you get right in.  Like I said, the service was awesome!

Wow! The food here is really worth the wait. There was a line of people waiting and we waited about a half hour for a table. Our server was friendly and welcoming although very hurried. 
We decided to start with the deviled eggs and am glad that we did. They are really creamy with nice spice. I will say that I think the are overpriced due to the fact that you only get a few for the price.

I had the fish and chips as I see it on hells kitchen all the time and wanted to try it. It really is delicious.

My partner had a burger and said it was amazing and the bun was really great. 

The food runners are great and really attentive as the servers are so busy taking orders.

I think the prices are a bit steep but you are paying for the name and location. 

The space is beautiful and has a great pub feel.

We never saw Gordon or got to hear him call some one a " donkey" but had a good time anyway. I deducted one star due to the wait time and feeling a bit rushed after the meal. I know they had people waiting but felt they really wanted your seats right away. Maybe it was because it was a weekend. 

If you have the money and time, give it a try.

I'll probably check back in the next time I'm around (:

Pros: It's Gordon Ramsay lol. The food is realllly goooooooood. Ordered the grilled lamb burger and my SO ordered something else.. forgot what it was, but it was pretty darn good too. Quality if top notch and service is friendly, quick and attentive. Serving sizes weren't bad, the decor is nice, and the way the food is set up is near perfect.

Cons: Price obviously lol. $30 for fish and chips and over $20 or something for the burger. You have to pay to play at restaurants like this in Vegas lol. If this were just some random joint then the prices of the food would have more of an impact on my rating.

Bottom line: Surprised this place has a low 3 stars on Yelp!. Oh well lol. I'll most likely be back, but give this place a try if you're around.

We came here for a drink and snack while bar-hopping our way around the casinos. I'll also admit, we came here solely for the pretzels in cheese sauce appetizer we saw on the website!

There's not much to say about our short time here, as we were seated, placed our order, drank and ate when ti came out, then headed out. Service was good and pretty quick given how busy it was, and the food was good, although not overly large in portion serving.

I think the only reason I can't give this four stars (I reserve five stars for places that blow my socks off) is due to the size of our appetizer and that while it was good, it wasn't as good as I was expecting. Don't get me wrong, pretzels with cheddar beer sauce is *AMAZING* and the sauce actually was everything I was hoping it would be, it was just that the pretzels were lacking a bit of something, although I can't say exactly what. Maybe a bit more salt? I felt like I could have just used regular breadsticks instead of the pretzel ones as they just didn't have the pretzel flavour I was expecting.

Why does your food have to be so good, Gordo?

The mini sliders with the applewood smoked bacon, welsh cheddar and garlic aioli were amah-zing!
They took the split pea soup off the menu...my friend was so bummed..  The tomato wasn't that great,  but the Butternut squash soup was wonderful.

/TL;DR  Having seen Gordon Ramsay's shows, I expected to see a reflection of his indications for a good restaurant displayed here. Wrong. Obscene menu with a large array of choices.

/ATMOSPHERE  Large, open space with unusual dining tables and chairs. It's basically like eating while you're sitting in your favorite recliner. I liked it.

/FOOD  I went with the lamb burger. It was hella good. However, I went splits with another mate at the table who went with the fish and chips. Not so good. I was disappointed that I gave up half of my lamb burger. Chips are mediocre. That is sacrilege.
