/SERVICE  Very good and accommodating. Had no qualms splitting our check one thousand ways. However, they never indicated tip was included. It did show up on the main bill though, so I caught it before we also started writing them in as it does not show up on the split bills.

HOW TO READ MY REVIEWS:
1 Star - Does not approach edible. Enter at your own risk.
2 Stars - If I'm in the area, I'd pick something else.
3 Stars - I would stop by if I happen to be in the area.
4 Stars - I would pick this place out of other places nearby.
5 Stars - I would go out of my way to dine here.

My fiance and I came during happy hour, and it did not disappoint. The food was a bit expensive, although some of the happy hour deals were pretty good. Nice atmosphere, good menu selection, would definitely recommend!!
Way overrated burger. Hard to believe when paying 21$. The service was good it's a shame the food didn't match.

Worst experience in Vegas ever. Horrible wait staff, sub par food, hey Gordon why don't you actually inspect the place once in a while...to top it off my phone was stolen right off the table, manager useless. I would sooner starve to death than return.
Loved it! Friendly staff! Good food especially the pretzel breads. Too bad they were out of the shepherds pie :/  but I would definitely come back here for more fish and chips!

I wish I could give a place -5 stars! 

Spent $300 on drinks and food, and then was ASKED TO LEAVE. I was still not even finished with my wine. In 30 years of dining experience I have never been asked to leave a restaurant until now. I ordered 3 times in 2 and a half hours. WORST experience I have ever had.

Was also served stale wine, when I requested a new bottle, I was served wrong one.

Servers shift changed and a server never came to replace the other one. Even when I went to the MANAGER to ask for another server, I still never got one. I had to get my own server.

Along with this horrible experience, they also put $30 of beer that I didn't order on my bill.
After that, finally got a glass of wine after waiting 20 minutes. And then was asked to leave!

For added detail, we were sitting in the BAR AREA. Taking up only 2 seats (me and my husband.) 
 
Don't ever eat here if you actually want to sit and enjoy you food. Bad wine.

So enraged, it inspired me to create a Yelp account!!


If eating at Caesar's Palace is like staying at Caesar's Palace I wouldn't waste my money. 

Stay at an MGM hotel like Aria or Vdara. First class resorts. I personally recommend Carbone. 


UPDATE: I called to complain and they offered me 1 free drink. Ridiculous. I will be going to corporate with this issue.

Long wait ofcourse. I had the scallops it was good. My sister was satisfied with her burger. My brother didn't like the lamb but he liked the dessert, spotted dog and chocolate trifle. We expected better.

Okay if you were to ask my husband you'd probably get a rave review. I got banggers and mash which came with various flavors of banggers and I didn't care for that one of them was pretty gross, my daughter wouldn't even eat it and she's not picky at all when it comes to that type of food normally. My potatoes were good so I ate those, I also had some little sausage appetizer that wasn't great either. My husband liked his lobster roll and I'll admit his steak was much better then my food. We did get the Sticky Toffee Pudding which was really good. So Id' get that again. Over all I was disappointed and would skip this place to try other foods Vegas has to offer. It was also pretty loud and we had so many people bringing food or drinks I'm not even sure who our server was. It was kind of late and we were too hungry to wait for Creaser's buffet. I'd wait next time.

We dined here before seeing legend Elton John and how British it really was!! Considering we were seeing Elton John, it really completed a British evening. We made reservations on Open Table and like any place on the Strip on a Sat night, reservations are key. I overheard the wait was 30 minutes but we were seated straight away, due to pre-planning.

We started off with the calamari which was fresh, crisp and had a hint of heat due to the peppers. They were served with two types of sauces, a tartar and cocktail. The serving was a good size as it allowed enough room for the main courses.

I ordered the typical WWII patriotic English dish of Fish and chips. It was not served in newspaper, sorry folks. I was pleased to see the fish as one long piece which is typical in England. I've visited the UK about four times and when I order fish and chips it's always as long as my forearm. The fish at Gordon Ramsey was no exception. The chips were actually potato wedges and not your typical chips. I ate a few only because I don't eat a lot of potatoes, it's a personal thing :). It also came with a side of yummy mushy peas, another typical British accompaniment with fish and Chips. 

I highly recommend their sticky toffee pudding. For us Yanks, our pudding is different so don't expect the stuff you buy in cups and lick the lid. It's more of a sticky cake and served with a side of warm caramel and vanilla ice cream. It was sooooooooooooooo gooooooooood!!! Omg. It was moist, sweet, sticky and when you add caramel it takes it to a whole new dimension. 

So to round it up, experiment and go with the British dishes. I mean you are in a British pub/ restaurant!

This place was amazing. The decor was a little different but the food was amazing. And I rarely ever say this about a location.

We ordered the Devil Eggs which had bacon. And the lobster/shrimp mini rolls. Those were finished without any issues because they were delicious. 

I ordered the Short Ribs. The portion of that short rib was beyond what I could imagine. I had no idea it was going to be a huge portion. It was lacking a little salt and was a little drier than i preferred but it was still delicious. It came with some cheddar mashed potatoes which I enjoyed. Probably one of the best mashed potatoes I have ever tried. 

My girlfriend ordered the Scallops and she got 5 portions of Scallops with a succotash puree. She seemed to enjoy it.

Overall, I am glad I stopped at this location while casino-hopping. The food was amazing, the portion was good sized. The bill kinda sucked between 3 people but it was vegas and we did splurge a little lol.

I was not very impressed. They sat us at a high top table that had very hard chairs. Not to mention the food is very overpriced and not all that special. It tastes like something that I would get at any other Cafe. Nothing special like I said. I had chicken and it was extremely overpriced. Not worth the money that I paid for my meal, or anyone else's for that matter. But their desserts are really good.

We were curious to try out Gordon Ramsay's grill. I had planned to just get their fish & chips since I assumed that would be pretty good. When they mentioned that Beef Wellington was their special and that they only serve it about 10 times a year, I decided to order it knowing it's one of Gordon Ramsay's signature dishes.

Time passed. More time passed. After 1 hour, 20 mins we asked where our food was. The server finally went to see and they came out with our food a while later. Come to find out later, they lost the ticket for our table and had to rush an order. Beef wellington typically takes 30-60 mins to make. The right thing for them to do would have been to come out and tell us what happened and ask if we wanted to wait for another hour for them to make it properly or give us the option of ordering something else. Did they do that? No. Instead, they rushed the order and overcooked the Beef Wellington. If I wasn't so hungry I wouldn't have eaten it. It didn't have much flavor and it was really disappointing. Even the mashed potatoes was luke warm.

They ended up giving us 20% off and the manager came out and apologized. It wasn't enough to make up for it though.

I'd like to think if Gordon Ramsay himself had been in the kitchen and see the mess, he would have screamed "SHUT IT DOWN!".

Cool restaurant! Definitely makes me miss being in London. The food is really good and the cocktails are awesome. I love the decor so much too! Definitely a cool place to hang out for a bite and a drink.

Duck Confit Poutine was delicious and thankfully not too rich. Fish and chips were good, but the chips were the highlight with a garlic infused ketchup. The Irish Beef Cheek Stew was uber tender, but surprisingly not the best dish of the meal. It's like a fatty and tender version of pot roast without the benefit of the flavor and texture of carrots or onions (and potatoes if you like that kind of thing). The highlight of the meal just may have been the sticky toffee pudding with sweet cream ice cream. Soft, warm, moist and not overly sweet. Next time I hope to dive into the rest of their pub snacks and small plates.

A few of us met David S. here for a quick snacky-snack. Love the vibe they have goin' on....waitstaff in Brittish Punk looking attire complete with Doc Martens, newspaper print dresses sported by the hostesses, beer kegs on the wall, sweet lighting and woodwork throughout the restaurant, very cozy and inviting.

Our server Elise was awesome during our visit offering her expertise in food and drink selections, but the only bummer was that they were out of Duck Confit that day, so we couldn't feast on the very popular Duck Poutine..:( No worries though, we all shared the following off the Pub menu:

DEVILISHLY DEVILED EGGS
Self explanatory, good, but anyone can make this at home

SHEPHARD'S PIE
A hearty mix of beef, lamb and veggies combined with butterylicious mashed potatoes...One of Ramsay's popular signature dishes,very good and comforting

CLAMS AND MUSSELS IN SAFFRON BROTH
Cooked expertly, very delicious, and use the crostini to sop up all that saffron love!

SHORTRIB AND BEEF CHEEK SANDWICH
This sandwich is in its own category, possibly one of the tastiest sandwiches you'll ever sink your teeth into...Perfectly braised shortrib, deep-fried beef cheek with arugula, aioli, and sweet onion jam served with gargantuan steak fries as big as my hand? Definitely the star of the night! the Innis & Guinn went perfectly with all of these selections too.

Definitely returning for the duck poutine, that is if my opu doesn't pull a jedi mind trick into getting another sandwich!.....ALOHA!!!


YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2013-(12/100) "Gordon's Gastropub"

Where to begin.  Service is top notch.  Sat at the bar.  Friendly service from the bartender who recommended a hefenweizen beer I've never had.  That was smooth.  I opted for dessert only here as I had eaten lunch down the street already. I heard things about the sticky toffee pudding.  By far one of the finest desserts I've ever had.  I had the chance to speak to the GM and told him how good it was.  He told the chef of my kudos.  The place lives up to the Gordon Ramsay name.  Next trip I am trying the actual meals here.

--3.5 stars--
My first time at a Gordon Ramsey establishment. In all fairness, I was overly excited for this opportunity owing to the fact that I have been watching Ramsey on a number of TV programs for some time, and he is hands down my favorite celebrity chef. That being said, I was a bit disappointed that after an hour long wait for a table, it took another ten minutes after being seated to even be approached by a waitress, upon which we finally received water and a drink menu. I had the scotch egg appetizer and the mussels and clams, both of which I thought were delicious. I was surprised by the heftiness of the mussel plate...I'm guessing there was at least 2 lbs. of shellfish on there. Overall, good pub food, but service needs a bit of work.

Our group was attending a party when we all realized we were hungry.  Made a last minute reservation for 9 at this "Pub" looking for a more casual atmosphere.

We arrived a bit early and they weren't able to seat us, but they did seat us about 5 minutes after our reservation time.  Its loud in the restaurant, so no need to worry about shouting.  Right after we were seated, 3 additional people joined us.  The restaurant had no problem accommodating the add-ons.

Drink?
I tried the Goodbye Blue Sky.  It was way too sweet for me.  Only drank half of it.

Food?
Kettle Chip Nachos-so good and so bad for ya.  
Calamari-standard
Deviled Eggs-good and suprisingly has lump crab; taste is very subtle
Hell's Kitchen Burger-Very Good.  This is Spicy!  Ghost Pepper Cheese, Pickled w/Jalapenos, Avocado & Smoked Tomato Aioli.  Was only able to eat half.  Also added the Truffle Fries which were standard.

Our server was great and kept up with our group.  We were having such a great time, we were the last to leave.  

Fortunately, you can just shift to the next spot.

My expectations were a bit higher than the quality of food that i had. Quick recap:

Bacon Wrapped Date (2/5) - Two big let downs here. First of all the size and portions were super small. 4 super small pieces for an order that cost $9.  Second disappointment was in terms of flavor, it didn't wow me at all.  At other places I've gone this dish has been a hit and I think the missing ingredient is Goat Cheese.  It's not in it over here.

Hot lollipop wings (3/5 rating) - Northing extraordinary at all.  Just average. Lollipop wings so smaller in size as i expected.

Mini Lobster roll (4/5 rating) - This was my favorite part of my meal and I really enjoyed it. Plenty of Lobster and the quality of the roll was perfect.

I go to Gordon Ramsey pub and grill with a friend for lunch. I order the grill beef burger and my friend order Caesar salad with chicken breast. I like my beef burger very much. The beef is soft but with a little crispy edge, very well grilled. It comes with French fries, ketchup and garlic creamy sauce on the side. I think the tasty level of the burger is around the same as holy chuck. So if u love holy chuck (like me!) you will love this place too. My friend's chicken breast is also very tender, not over cooked at all. Overall if only considering the taste I will give them 4 star. Why I give 5 star then? Their service is great! My friend thinks her salad has a little bit too much sauce which makes it taste a little too salty. The server insisted on change a new one for us even though we said it is ok. So the server gave us a new salad with all request my friend wanted. And then the floor manager came short afterwards to apologize for our "unpleasant" experience and offer to provide us a makeup desert (although we refused since we were reeeeeeeally full!). 

Overall, it's a great restaurant to try. We had a good time here!
Slow. Had to ask and wait 30 mins for the check. Food was not even ok. Worst service ever.

i've always wanted to try one of the many gordon ramsay restaurants - finally got the chance!

i'd say the food is very average - got the pub burger and the beef patty was way too dry, fries were at a room temperature - perhaps it's been sitting there for some times? took a bite of my friend's fish and chips though - it is really good.

cocktail is something i'd come back for in the future - salted caramel apple martini - blew my mind! i had to get two at just lunch hour.... 

would try his other restaurants still next time!

I went there for lunch with a client a couple of days ago. The NY steak was chewy, I returned half of it. We ordered Ice tea twice. The first time the color was very light as if it was water and the second time it came almost black in color. When we complained they apologized saying that the waiter is new and they will tell the chef about the meat. 
Pro: great at excuses and apologies.
Con: Food sucks.

Can't really talk about much but the poor service. We walked out after 25 minutes without any. We even told the hostess we were headed to the showroom. She said she would tell our server. We never saw a server. Too bad, the menu looked interesting.
Way overpriced. Fish & chips were VERY salty. Very disappointing. Would NOT recommend. If you eat here you are just paying for the name.
The hot and salty pretzels were neither.  $11 pints, $30 fish & chips.  Chips tasted microwaved as did the fish which was mushy.  Over priced and under delivered. There are better choices.

I went to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill and had the worst experience. We were in Las Vegas for my sisters bachelorette party for the weekend, we went there for our last meal together. We had reservations for 9:15 and showed up at 9:10 and got seated immediately. Richard E was our server. He was fast about getting our drinks and complimentary bread and appetizers, but after that he rarely came to check our table. We waited well over an hour before our entrees came out. I confronted a bus boy about how long our food (because our waiter Richard E was nowhere to be found) was taking because we noticed a table of 4 that got seated at least 15-20 mins after us got served before us. He went in the back to check and came back telling me that the reason they got served first was because they have a smaller party and it takes longer for the kitchen to prepare all our meals to come out together....Once the food came out it was okay but definitely not worth the wait and rudeness we experienced. Richard brought one check over without asking us if we were all paying together at the end. We were a party of 8 so we asked if he could split the check for us and he made a huge deal about how long and difficult it would be for him to do it but he guessed he could. It took him 20 mins to do so..which we saw he had finished earlier and was waiting to bring us the split checks...Overall very disappointing for what we thought would be an amazing experience.

Really pleasant surprise.  We were a little concerned with the 3 star rating to even stop in. We decided to chance it though and were glad we did.  We shared the chopped salad, the tomato soup and the nachos.  The short rib on the chips was awesome, and the soup was really tasty as well.  We sat at the bar and I have to say Ray Ray was one of the nicest most genuine people we have come across in Vegas.  Total asset to the restaurant.  We are so pleased we stopped in. It is a bit pricey,  but not unreasonably so and the quality was there to back it up.  Ignore 3 star rating which I think is because some folks are hoping for food court pricing.  This is a fun, tasty experience.  We will be back.

We were hungry, recognized the Gordon Ramsay name and knew we could skip the line with our Diamond card so in we went.  We ordered calamari and with in seconds poof it was at the table.  Nothing special, but it was tasty.  Then we did not see the waiter again for at least 10-15 minutes and we wanted to order, ugh.  We ordered and then it was about 50 minutes before the food came.  My friends order was wrong and they had to fire up a new meal for her which took another 12 minutes and came out cooked incorrectly.  I went with simple sides and they were ok - cauliflower au gratin, creamed spinach/kale, mashed potatoes and brussel  sprouts.  My other friend had shepherd's pie and said it was ok.  Based on the poor service, wrong orders, incorrect cooking of orders and that the food was just ok they're only getting 2 stars.  Plus the prices are Vegas high and you can get a much better experience and food for similar price at so many other places in Vegas.
Solid choice for snacks and a beer. I highly recommend the Nachos as well as the Grilled Cheese and Tomato soup combo.

This is review is just for the cocktails and they were really good. All the 5 people who I was with here really enjoyed their cocktails. For me personally, the mocha martini hit the spot and I ended up having two. Located right next to the casino, if you are with people who are gambling, its easy for everyone to come and go between games. Definitely a place to try while in Vegas.

Came here to watch the end of an NBA game because there are plenty of TVs and ordered the chicken wing lollipops. The wings were poorly done. They were dry, the breading was thick, and there was barely any sauce coating the wings. I will not be back to try other items on the menu.

May have to be my go to lunch spot if all else fails.

Pub & Grill is a good alternative if you don't want to wait in the dreaded buffet line. They really got the ambiance right for an English Pub and Grill, and they make it fun and lively.

Good:
Decor/environment, staff, beers on draft (carlsberg,innus and gun), fries

OK:
Food (Burger needs more flavor, Fish needs more flavor the texture was good)

Came in around 3:00 pm on Sunday and although the food (we had burgers) was very good the service was less than stellar and very, very slow.  Waited 40 minutes and there were maybe 15 tables full at the time.  For the reputation and the price I would have expected more.  Also, watched a server drop two clean cloth napkins on the floor and set them back on the counter.  Now I didn't see her put them back on the stack but I didn't see her get rid of them either.  Just sayin' hmmm.
Grabbed lunch here with my 8 year old.  She recognized the name and wanted to give it a try.  One word can summarized the whole experience for me - meh.

The lobster bisque was amazing although the server didn't say it was in addition to the entree (still totally worth it).  The salmon with green stuff was really good.  I'd explain it but all I got from server was "amazing what can be done with butter and salt" 

Service was average to poor.  I tip high so 25% is low for me.  

The scotch eggs were decadent and tasty but did set off my stomach issues.  I was fine till those so... could have been the butter or ... but I left feeling totally nauseous which is too bad after what was mostly an incredible meal

I stopped by GR Pub for a quick drink with clients before they had to catch a flight home from doing a site inspection in Las Vegas.  Our experience with RayRay ("he's so big he needs 2 names" - his quote), was amazing!  I passed my credit card as we only had 45 min and knew we'd need to drink, eat and run...RayRay passed the card back but not before he slyly recognized my company name listed below mine.  He called me by name but also just before we left, had his manager come over and introduce himself.  They both said "Thank you for the business, not only today, but for all the business we bring to Las Vegas!" It took me a minute to realize that he had coyly notice I work for the Las Vegas Convention Authority.  This experience with that kind of attention to detail and personal service, is what makes every visitor return home with a great story and attributes to making Las Vegas the number one tourist destination that it is!  Thank you RayRay and team for making me and our city look fantastic.  

P.S. The customer brought a 20,000 person convention to town one month later. They told me they brought 6 groups of people to Gordon Ramsey Pub because of this interaction with RayRay!  Great job sir!

Gordon Ramsay is one of my favorite people ever!!!! So i hate to do this but we were seated right away we put in our drink order ordered our food and we actually got our food before our drinks. When i did get my drink it was horrible i had to send it back and the waitress explained they had new people she brought me another and it was pretty good. The food was a-ok my burger was cooked perfect kinda bland not the pop i was expecting! so all-in-all everything was ok but for $70+$20tip=$90 for two burgers four big french fries and two drinks i shouldve gone to lbs sorry Gordon But i cant wait to try his other resturants Oh and great job on uniforms they are hot!

Hit and Miss

My experience had  ups and downs. The decor is cool, the waiter was awesome and the beef Wellington was fantastic (probably not $55 fantastic, but hey it's Vegas). 

On the downside: the calamari was tiny and insubstantial, the deviled eggs unimpressive, but the biggest disappointment was the chicken curry dish. If G. Ramsey were to go into one of his Restaurant nightmare charity cases and be served that dish he would have unleashed an expletive laden tirade and screamed, "take it away," all the while going through his retching and gagging histrionics. It doesn't taste bad, it just doesn't taste at all! Unbelievable that anything so devoid of flavor could stay on a menu. 

Stick with a Wellington and a glass of Red. You will be full and broke, but not disappointed.

Wow. I'm a big fan of Chef Ramsey and the food here was a complete letdown. I know he isn't in the back cooking, but the food and service were well below par. My ribeye was medium rare and was somehow still chewy, thin, and lacked any flavor. We repeatedly had to ask for items our server failed to bring. Sodas were flat. Some items like the Shepards pie were so small, they shouldn't have been on the dinner menu and rather, belonged on the appetizers menu.

I cannot express enough how phenomenal my experience was here. 

To begin with, the entire restaurant is perfectly designed, down to the outfits worn by the hosts, waiters, bartenders. 

But of course the food is the real star. I ordered the fish and chips that was caught that morning, and it was absolutely divine. We also ordered the mushrooms which we could not get enough of. But then we met the top contender, the famous Toffee Pudding. 

The toffee pudding was absolutely to die for, and now tops my list of best desserts I've had in my life, and I'm a total foodie. It isn't really pudding at all, but a toffee cake with ice cream and hot toffee sauce. If you are in Vegas, you need to stop here JUST for this dessert.

The drinks are also incredible! I had the mocha cocktail (?) and it was delicious and worth the price. 

Finally, the service. Wow, so incredibly kind. They were so helpful as to walk us through a shortcut to our upcoming show in another casino. Overall they were just so friendly and fun that I would go back just to chat with them one more time. 

This restaurant really should not have less than 4.5 stars and that's a minimum. You won't regret your visit!

Way overpriced for what you get! Food is not that great and the menu is missing the famous Beef Wellington! The desserts are a real hit though but skip the meal and the drinks! Other Gordon Ramsay restaurants Are better!

I had the onion soup & the lobster mac & cheese and they were both delish. The blueberry cocktail I ordered was also tasty! Service was fast and efficient, I like that they open until late on weekends. Overall a good & convenient place to eat in the strip!
The service is exceptional, but the food is only average.  We had the crab deviled eggs & nachos.  The nachos were a disappointment.  The "cheese" was liquid nacho cheese and the chips were stale.

Was looking for something a little different and thought that we would try Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill.  The hostess was more interested in talking with her friend than paying attention to customers. Was told there was a 2 hour wait for food and thought that was weird as the place was barely half full. Said we just wanted drinks and was told go ahead and grab a table.  The floors were dirty with food debris and the tables weren't much better.  We found a table across from the bar and was told by a waitress that we can't sit here we need to shown to a table by the hostess. Tried to explain that the hostess had said we could come in and get a table was told that we had to leave and have the hostess show us to a table. We looked around the Pub to see what was on tap and decided that there wasn't anything that I couldn't get at a liquor store. Based on the rudeness of the waitress and the filth would never ever go back. 

Maybe this placed should be featured on Kitchen Nightmares?

Michael A.

Visited on February 23 and had a blast!  The wait staff Elise and Sam were very accommodating and answered a lot of our questions.  The food was delicious, of course it was a little more expensive than we are used to but we're in Vegas on the strip at a Gordon Ramsay eatery!  Hats off to the employees great job at making us feel at home!

Started at the Charlie the bartender greeted us well he recommended three IPA beers that they had to serve I had a dogfish head I highly recommend having one shortly after the rest of my party arrived we sat and had lunch we started off with two appetizers the pretzel sticks were amazing and the deviled eggs was like something I have never tasted they were phenomenal! Lunch came out I had their fish and chips the fish was so soft great taste are server was very attentive great costumer service I will be back soon.

Decent place and good service.

Had the lamb shanks. Very tasty. 

Also had pigs in the blanket. You get 3 but decent sized. 

Overall: pretty good.

Dark and comfy English pub-feel with cushy booths. The big chairs were beckoning my name. I sunk into them and drank my glass of wine wishing there was a nearby fireplace.  It wasn't upscale, it was an English pub just like ones in London except without the history. 

The menu did a great job at reflecting British fare.
Shepard's pie, steak and chips, fish and chips, and mashed peas were all present.

What we ordered:
Crispy white bait a traditional pub dish. Fried light and crispy with a creamy aioli. 
Duo rillette of pork and duck with brown mustard and pickled radishes and grilled thick toast.
Lamb shank with chickpea stew. Lamb had a tender "fall off the bone" meatiness and a hint of that masala in a tomato stew. 
Steak and fries were standard, true to form pub style.
All washed down with a bottle of Beaujolais. 

Solid and hearty food; more like 3.5 stars.
We ordered way more than needed. Didn't get a chance to try the sticky toffee, but there is always next time.
Overpaid dramatically for a glorified Applebee's meal. I hate giving money to people who don't deserve it. Not good for the money. Not my thing. No sir I would not like another.

Came here to have a late dinner with a girlfriend. 

We got some pretzel sticks, an IPA, the french onion soup and the main reason why she brought me here was to try their sticky toffee pudding. That dessert was really good!! I never ever order desserts-I don't care for sweets that much but she said it was a must try. The dessert didn't disappoint-You get a chocolate cake with ice cream and toffee slightly drizzled on top. Really yummy!!! 

This restaurant is right in the casino right by Omnia. The service was incredibly slow!!! But the dessert made up for it.  I will definitely be back to eat that sticky toffee pudding again :)

Would I recommend this? Yes, must try that dessert!!!

Came here with high expectations knowing that Chef Ramsey is one of the most talented and well respected chefs in the culinary world. What a huge disappointment! I stood for more than 5 minutes before the hostess even bothered to look up and acknowledge our presence. 
When she finally looked up without even greeting us, I asked for a table and she flat out said "45 minutes" in the nastiest most condescending tone while rolling her eyes! It was so disrespectful that we just walked away.
As we started to walk away we noticed plenty of empty tables.
Won't bother to come back until they lose the bad attitude and poor customer service!

I actually thought this place was pretty good. The whole restaurant remodel went over very successfully and it now boosts a large open floor plan.  True to form, all the staff still wear crazy outfits that just look silly on some.  

We got the Shepard's pie and the mac-n-cheese and shared these two items for lunch.   The Shepard's pie was AMAZING def get this.  The mac-n-cheese was just OK for me.  

Service was great and availability to make a reservation online on opentable is always a plus.

I did not remember what I ate the last time I was at the pub and was not too excited about eating their again. But it turned out to be one of the most memorable dinner at Caesars Palace during this visit to Las Vegas. I had the braised beef cheeks that melted like butter and paired with Lucky Beer. The service was great and friendly. Can't wait to go back and eat at the restaurant again.

This place was a terrible disappointment. My girlfriend and I stopped by on Friday night on our way back to our room for some drinks. We went into a nearly empty bar and sat at a table for two only to be chased away by a waiter who said tables weren't open seating. We should have left right there. Instead, we went and sat at the bar. I ordered a Goodbye Blue Sky and she ordered a Margarita. My drink was bitter and lacking in any other flavor. Hers was served in a small glass that was half filled with ice. There seemed to be very little alcohol in either. For this, we were charged $15 for each glass (one bad drink and one tiny one). I've paid more other places, but gotten more and better and I came away happy. The next night, we stopped by Numb instead. We had drinks that were better tasting, and stronger for less money. Don't go to Gordon Ramsay's!

Atmosphere and service good.  Food average to below average.  Price for 1 calamari appetizer, 2 burgers w/fries, chips w/fries, 4 drinks, and 1 beer came to $118 before tip. 

I'm hardly an expert but these basic entrees had little flavor.

Mr. Ramsay, this restaurant needs help!

Visited the establishment during a business trip - on the company dime, so why not try it out?  I was not let down, the food, service, and atmosphere was all top-notch!

First - our server Rodney made it a great experience and the reason for the 5 star review!  He was good sport when I misheard his name, fixed our table when it wobbled, and provided personal recommendations.  He also shared some fun stories with us and talked about his background a bit.  What a great experience, he's definitely among the top servers I've experienced around the world!

Second - the food was tasty and well portioned.  We really enjoyed the side order of fingerling potatoes, VERY well seasoned and pancetta, yum!  My chopped salad was good and my colleague's fish & chips was described as "very good!"

Overall - highly recommend, was fun to people watch in Caesar's Palace and the staff was all very friendly.  Thanks for making it a great experience!

Let's have a discussion about the term "over-extending."  Or if that proves to be a non-starter, how about "Celebrity Chef."

Was in Vegas on a recent guys weekend, and had set up a few reservations a month or so in advance.  This happened to be one of those "filler" nights where I tagged along with what was fast and easy before a show.  I should have known better.

Listen, it would be far more difficult to skewer a place, if its owner and Executive Chef weren't on TV every other night berating contestants over one flaw or another while simultaneously puffing his chest and pimping his brand.  

Either Gordon Ramsey has never eaten at Gordon Ramsey Pub & Grill, or he's full of shit.

For starters, the place is so fully "in the casino" you can't really differentiate between the scent of the beer steamed clams, and the cigarette smoke wafting around you as you attempt to chew.

Ordered the "Calimari and Bacon Crackle" for an app.  I'm not sure what exactly makes it part bacon, but I actually counted the pieces of finger-nail sized bacon in my cone of calamari and there were 4.  Besides marketing to a ravenous for all things pig consumer base, I can think of no worldly reason for the word "Bacon" to be in this dish.  The calamari were cooked well with utilitarian dipping sauces.

Sprang for the Herb Caesar Salad w/ Chicken for an entrée in a feeble attempt to incorporate a vegetable into a meal during the stay.  I am not kidding when I say that Applebees serves a better chicken Caesar salad.  This salad is 23 dollars.  Twenty three dollars. The chicken breast (and I use that term loosely) that came on top had the texture somewhere between a tire and a silicone breast implant.  If it was not cooked via microwave I will literally give Gordon Ramsey the entirety of my craps earnings. This salad was atrocious.  Minimally dressed and lacking in every viable flavor that usually makes its way into a Caesar.

Service started out decently, but then we turned into an afterthought.  Cocktails were surprisingly good.

This takes me back to my opening sentence.  This experience has soiled me on the name Gordon Ramsey.  I have zero desire to ever set foot in another one of his establishments.  For every contestant on another one of his shows, please point to this restaurant when you get scolded on the inadequate ratio of crust to filling in your apple pie.  That is all.

I recommend the salmon with fennel, asparagus, and mushroom, "Nicely seared with the right amount of crisp on the skin and well seasoned!" :-) cocktails here are great I had the Goodbye Blue Sky (I believe it was called that) cocktail....."Two!" Lol. The truffle fries are delicious and "WHATEVER" they give you in  that bread basket is delicious! :-) This restaurant is a "MUST TRY!"

We had an hour prior to seeing Mariah Carey and we thought this restaurant would be the perfect place. 

I ordered the NY Strip steak "medium"   To my amazement it was raw "cold" in the center. I made our waiter of the situation. They said they can redo but we did not have enough time. They took money off the bill because of it. Come on gordon, Rogelio Fernandez JR seems like he may not be in control of his kitchen !!!

I'll say upfront that I'm a huge Gordon Ramsey fan and that we only ate there at happy hour.  Our server Nicole was fantastic, so I cannot agree with the other reviews that talk about marginal service. The happy hour menu and prices were reasonable. We had the nachos, wings, toad in the hole and pub spot, all 4 items tasted great. Very flavorful, though the portion sizes were on the small side.  Overall very happy with our visit, we would go back again.

Last minute choice!!! Tired after 20 hours of travel - we were looking to eat and get up to room! Every where else wanted us to have a long dining experience! This seemed perfect- great hostess - but the fun began with Rodney! He cheered us up In a flash - so nice, kind and efficient!!! And then the food arrived - the butternut squash soup was fabulous!!! And the short ribs were just as yummy!! A light shared meal which was at we wanted! But Rodney made our night! He was beyond kind and energy to boot! Truly lightened our night!  Found the manager and told him and he was just as nice!  The food-  the staff - wish we had another night to have gone back!  We even loved the silverware!   Gordon knocked this place our of the park if you just want great food - great staff and to enjoy your dining partner in an atmosphere that lets you see the traffic of people but is not overwhelming!!! Thanks RODNEY!! We are coming back to you next trip!!!

walked in here expecting more since it was a Gordon Ramsey spot... was disappointed none the less.  The only thing I like was the place setting and silverware design.  Beyond that was all down hill.. 

I got the beer braised rib with creamy barry risotto.. the risotto was the only decent part of this dish... other friends in my group got salads, burgers, and steak but no one seemed happily satisfied with any of their dishes.  Just Pricey Pub Food with no flair or special touches.
Waited and hour for average food. Or maybe my expectations are a tad bit high for a celebrity chef...

We had reservations here last night and this was a special treat for us since it was our anniversary dinner and we really wanted to do something special.  

The hostesses were extremely nice and congratulated us on our anniversary, (thank you!!!!!!!!) our waiter (Ali) was awesome, extremely helpful, knowledgeable and very patient.  He was there all the time asking us if there was anything we needed.  Our food was delicious, I ordered the corn soup and the Iron Steak.  My husband ordered the summer salad and the Cheek steak,  everything was great, the food the service, the atmosphere!  

We will def come back again!

I would have to agree that the best word to describe our experience was "underwhelmed".  Absolutely love the decor, ambiance, staff uniforms, flatware, dishware, etc.  Aesthetically it delivered, especially if you're looking for that "adult theme park" feel from Vegas.  Our server Scott was very knowledgeable and professional.  He did point out some menu errors prior to us ordering.  He did a great job considering that his section was full and he was managing relocating a large party due to a leak in the ceiling (it was raining and we know from first hand experience that these things happen...absolutely no big deal at all$ and he was so pro in managing his guests.  Kudos to Scott and staff.  Drinks were good and timely but our food took a loooooong time....especially for lunch.  A party of seven with two rounds of drinks, soup for two as a first course and salad and sandwiches for entrees took over two hours before we left. The menu selections really were well written and tempting but the actual food just lacked magic, flair and spark.  I will say that if I was able to eat red meat I would have sprung for the burger as those bad boys certainly looked good.  I ordered the chopped salad without salami.  It comes with pretzel croutons and they were not what I expected--stale, small and flavorless.  Dressing was good and the dish was well balanced, but just fell a little short compared the environs of the restaurant.  I'm not going to let this impact my opinion and image of Chef Ramsay as I know this is a watered down corporate version of his award winning creations.  No Michelin star here.  Just some Vegas grub.  Bon ape tit.

Absolutely love this place. We eat here every time we're in Vegas. The ambiance is great, and the food couldn't be better. I absolutely love the Scotch Egg.  Everything I've had on the menu is great, especially the English Ale soup, which was recommended by the best bartender ever, Ray Ray.
Fish and chips was great, even the peas!! Lol drinks were spot on.  Order the Spotted dic for dessert!  Servers are very good and friendly.

I just came back from vacation with my BFF and we had the pleasure of eating in the Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill, not once, but, twice.  The first night that we went I ordered a steak and also the calamari.  I just can't say enough about the experience.  Not only was the food fantastic, but, also our waitress, Nini!!!  She was so fantastic and went out of her way to make sure the food was just the way we wanted it and she also gave us quite a lot of information about the Pub.  THANKS, NINI FOR TALKING WITH US and for being such an awesome waitress!!!!!  I also loved the way that once you ordered your food, someone else delivered it to you.  We thought it was the chef, but, found out that it wasn't.  Anyway, that is a very nice touch.

A little disappointment here. Perhaps because it's Ramsey, and who hasn't watched his show, my expectations were higher than usual. 
On the show he is a perfectionist, and expects that from his teams, and yes it's a show, but this resto has his name on it and it was not perfection. 
My burger was not overwhelming or juicy or delicious. That's what I expected. The truffle chips were actually my favorite here. We did not order any of the British staples like fish n chips or shepherds pie, and that may have been what all the great reviews were for. All I know is I did some major walking and shopping at the Forum Shops in Ceasars so when I saw Gordon Ramseys pub I walked in. I had such a taste for a great burger which I did not get.
After posting this review, a GM did message me and invited me to try them again. I was most impressed as this was not a terrible review at all. 
Apparently they care about the food they serve and about what customers think. Cheers to that!

Califlower soup: Just okay
Fish n Chips: One of the worst I've ever ate and way overpriced
Bangers and mash:  Good, but not worth the price for just a few pieces of sausage/mash potatoes/grilled onions.
Tourist trap.

Hmm, I have to say that this was disappointing. Yes, I know it's pub food, but I've had much better pub food. Calamari? 2 stars. Fish n Chips? 2 stars. Kettle chip nachos? 2 stars. Everyone in my party all said, "it was "OK" pub food".

So there is your verdict: it's "OK" pub food... nothing more.

The food and the service was amazing. I witnessed a waitress with a full plate of dirty dishes, drop some silverware- The fork prongs were facing up. She gently flipped it over with her foot and moved it to the side so no one would trip. THEN, one of the Bus Boys witnessed and ran over and took care of it. So Classy!!  I was super impressed!!

I was looking for a place to eat on my own and came across this place. Seems like there is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant on every corner in Las Vegas. 
I took a seat at the bar and was quickly served by one of the bartenders. The menu contains a lot of classic British pub dishes, so I decided to go with the Fish and Chips. I'm typically not a fan of mushy peas as you usually get so much in the UK, but the bartender assured me they would be on the side. 
The food came rather quickly and was an average portion size - 2 pieces of fish and some fresh cut potato wedges as fries. Mushy peas were like a condiment- the same serving size as the tartar sauce and ketchup. 
The fish was good - crispy batter and tender fish, but nothing more special than a good corner fish and chip shop could do at a much lower price.
Food is good. It is kinda expensive. Service was great! Did not like the French onion soup.. It was very sweet! Overall enjoyed it. :)

I came to Caesar's Palace Starving and I was headed for Bacchanal.  But, as I was deterred by long lines, I'm glad I made the detour for this restaurant.  I had better food, I had great service, and I spent less than I would have at the buffet for that weekend!

My girlfriend loved the braised pork belly dish and I was glad to have their Fish n Chips with a side of beer. The fish and chips was well prepared and it was a very generous portion.  It was served with a rosemary tartar sauce and garlic mayo.  I really enjoyed it.

My top recommendation is that you absolutely cannot miss Ramsay's sticky toffee pudding.  It was so good that I'm going to plan to stop at this restaurant the next time I'm in town.  I was happy to find out that this dessert is a staple at most of his restaurants.  If you have the opportunity...get that dessert!  It's a warm toffee pudding - the consistency of bread pudding - and it's served with a hot caramel sauce and cream fraiche ice cream.  It isn't overly sweet and it's a very well balance mixed of flavors.

Next time I come back, I really want to try their braised beef cheek sandwich and shepherd's pie.  Overall...my girlfriend and I were really glad that we made the detour for this pub!

This is pretty good, I got the fish and chips and they were just as I expected, which is weird because I was hoping they would be better than I expected, so I guess I actually expected better fish and chips? Yeah I did. The Server was awesome, bald white guy , wish I could remember his name. There is also a huge bar tender that works there, he's really cool. I like the "text me when my table is ready" thing they have there, it's smart. Beers are good, the price is high for the quality but the location is convenient...right in the middle of Caesars. I would go again maybe for lunch, not dinner, idk, I wish it was cheaper so I could try more of the menu. But yeah, if you're hungry and in Caesars go for it, but I wouldn't say you should go out of your way to try eat here. Done.

Great food.   A bit slow for us because we don't sit around drinking .... salmon was amazing, shepherds pie was a treat of course and the spare ribs mmmh. The chopped salad had tiny diced bits of Apple awesome great. Just like my own home salad.  Define comfort food=Pub&gGrill

I had to send my scotch egg back.   

I've sent two things back at two of four restaurants by chef Ramsay.  And this night there were four dropped bottles or glasses which is a clear sign there's too much bar time while waiting for the table.   Good times!!!!!

Still great though.  The deserts were exactly as described.    Love love the pieces of meringue in the strawberries.  Yes.  

Give it a bookmark and make it a choice!

We waited a bit for our table, but we showed up 12 strong with only an hours notice,  and they threw six apps at us to make up for the wait.  Bangers and mash turned out great and nobody walked away hungry.  Great bourbons (nothing really rare, just a a bunch of good ones) and good craft/import beer selection.

One of the best meals I ate in Vegas. Those deviled eggs were divinely sent. And the Brussel sprouts were the Bomb.com. My waitress recommended the Dublin and it was quite tasty. Healthy portions and worth every penny.

Best part of the meal was the bartender RayRay. He made the meal sooo much more enjoyable. He really knew the beers and could size me up, just by looking at me, what I was going to like. And he was spot on. So RayRay was the best part of the meal. 

But a close second was the lamb burger. One of the best things I've ever eaten. Highly recommended. 

We also had the butter curry which was very good. And the chopped salad which was ok. But overall an outstanding experience.
What I ordered was 5. Which was chicken pistachio sandwich, but the other ones my friends ordered were all okay or average. The burger was too plain and the lobster biscuits were sorta dry.

I tried the restaurant twice on my resent visit. The first time for lunch. as I approached the podium 4 women were talking and it took about 5 seconds for one of them who all had seen me approach them to ask can I help you.  Well yes you can I am hear for lunch okay lets seat him at table #, no put him at table are you kidding I was the only one in the restaurant at 11:45 others were eating in the bar.
I order the corned beef sandwich and the waiter Scott informed me that he would have to check to see if the bread is available. Scott returned and said you are in luck the bread is available, "why should I be in luck for an item listed on the menu". I wish the bread was not available and that I could have chosen something else, the bread was so soggy from being placed on the flat top to toast the bread that the sandwich fell apart.  I had to eat the sandwich with a fork.  Also the ends of the bread were so hard it was not a pleasant experience.

I returned to the restaurant again to give it a second chance. Normally I would not return but since it was located in the hotel I was staying at I decided to return.  It was dinner time and again I was disappointed. I sat at the bar this time to make the hostess job easy for them again 4 women standing at the podium. I witnessed the following from the bartender and others. The bartender after politely taking my order returned to the kitchen and returned with a cup of water melon as he ate it he did not was his hands that he used to stick it in his mouth. He also drank water from a huge water bottle at the bar. If that was not enough he continually checked his phone. As I waited for my food another employee stopped at the bar and informed the servers that the glass washer was not working. Some how he turned the conversation into I did not break the washer I washer I break hearts. Well this went on for a while and something I did not want to hear about after a long day sitting in a seminar.

Well not the food came and again it was very greasy, I order a burger and should be juicy but not to the point that the bun fell apart. I do not mind spending my hard earned money but $37 with a tip for a glass of Stella that was not cold and cheeseburger with fries is crazy. I also paid $35 for lunch which was below my expectations for the Great Gordon establishment.  

There might be a reason why the restaurant was not busy both times I visited and hotel was sold out per the front desk.

The less than stellar reviews on Yelp made us very wary and lowered our expectations sufficiently much before visiting the restaurant. 

We ordered the corn soup and crab salad which were both very very tasty. The fish and chips was perfectly cooked, with fries done the proper English way (not the American Mcdonalds way). It was a little weird to find green peas on the plate of fish and chips, but whatever, it worked.

Also, we told our waiter that we were sharing all 3 dishes, and he took the initiative to split all our orders. Awesome or what?

I'd say that this is authentic English pub food but at Gordon Ramsay prices.

Everything was PERFECT and DELICIOUS. Our server, Daisy, was great too. We all agreed there wasn't a single bad thing we could say about our experience. We had Lobster Rolls, ribeye steak, potatoes, and a steak and ale pot pie. Perfection at every turn.

After a long car ride my bf and I came here for a late night bite to eat. I am a huge fan of Gorden Ramsey food shows and I was excited to try his restaurant. So I came here with high expectations. The environment is great and I loved the feel of this place. The hostesses and waiters were all dressed in new paper costumes. 

Food 
First thing that came out was the hand made soft pretzel. The presentation was great  and it was good. I am not a big fan of pretzels but it was quite good. It came with a tray of spicy horse radish melted cheese and pub mustard or was it some sort of butter. 

Pork Belly: 
This was surprisingly pretty good. The flavor was delicious it had a fatty, crispy, and just enough salty flavor. I recommend this dish for those who are not afraid of a fatty dish. 

I ordered the Beef Cheek Stew. The meat was very tender and it melted nicely as it was in my salivating mouth. It was a bit on the salty side and it came with only four pieces of potato fries. I wish there was a little more starch in here to help balance the saltness. 

Sticky Toffee Pudding: I read yelp reviews about this dessert and I am so glad that I ordered it because it was food orgasm in my mouth. It was a warm ooey gooeyyy toffee pudding with a scoop of vanilla ice cream YUMMAY. Highly recommend this. I would just come here just to eat this dessert again. 

Our server seemed to be tired or ready to clock out. He was not very attentive and did not really describe how to use the ipad to order drinks. Lucky, being computer  savvy we were able to figure it out. I also ordered their whiskey sour. It was eh okay. 
Overall, the experience was nice but I guess I expected more because it was THE Gorden Ramsey. At least the place is clean, food was not over or under cooked, and the environment was great.
Awesome bartenders, awesome beer selection. The food is very good but a bit pricey. Try the shrimp salad or the sliders.

So sad.  After enjoying meals at Gordon Ramsay's steakhouse in Paris Las Vegas I had high hopes for this restaurant.  Because of the bad reviews my boyfriend said no, but I insisted.  The quality of the food is not up to par, but the prices were high.  We sent 2 out of the 5 things back and were still charged for the drink that we did not drink and sent back because it tasted bad.  The Mac and cheese was undercooked and also sent back.  After some argument about whether or not it was undercooked or just "al dente" with the waitstaff we felt so awful we wanted to just get out of there.  I know the difference between the two and felt insulted that they argued with me. We left and looked at the bill on our way out-- Unfortunately we were overcharged on our meal as well and had to go back for a $3 refund which was super emabarrasing and I wish we had just left with our dignity at a $3 loss instead.  The manager never came out to apologize for us having such a bad meal or being overcharged.  Even at low end restaurants they would do that.  Very disappointing.  We won't return.

My husband and I made a quick stop here while we were walking through Caesar's, and I'm glad we did.  We were immediately taken care of by Ramon - super cool.  I ordered the pub spots.  The spots were tiny but were definitely packing flavor.  We can't wait to return to try something else!

I actually wanted to give this place 4.5 stars but unfortunately yelp doesn't allow that :(

A date took me here for dinner two nights ago. I loved how decor was bright and colorful when we walked in. The server was extremely attentive and knowledgeable about the menu which was great since I couldn't decide what to get. We both loved the extensive amount of beers on tap!

We were served complimentary pretzel bread with a sharp cheddar cheese spread that I could have just eaten as my meal - Delish! Since it's pretty cold here right now I started with the english ale onion soup which was an even better version than french onion soup. It was rich and very filling. 

My date had the pub beef burger with ginormous fries..I totally wanted what he had. Sadly, he demolished the whole plate so I didn't even get a taste but that's what I'm getting next time. 

The server really sold us on the sticky toffee pudding with sweet cream ice cream. I was in heaven..

I took away half a star only because they have huge flat screen tv's at each table and my date was glued to it since the game was on. I think it took away from the experience a little bit but I was definitely pleased with the service and food.

Ya no, not impressed....

I was seriously expecting better... The deviled eggs and lamb burger sounded so amazing on paper but was really just a disappointment on arrival. The deviled eggs were too vinegar filled and tasted like they had been sitting in the fridge for some time. I was expecting an extra kick of flavor from the burger but nope, just tasted like lambs and nothing more... I have neutral thoughts about the fries.

Not saying this is a terrible restaurant but this is not on my "to return" list.

I love Gordon Ramsey so naturally I had to try this place out.  Pub and Grill is located right in Caesar Palace near the coliseum.  We came on Friday around 5:00 pm.  The wait was minimal and we were quickly seated.  I have to say I'm not really a pub and fish and chips kind of girl so I was happy to see a diverse menu. We ordered the potato chips nachos (very good) to share and for my entree I ordered the Butter chicken curry with basmati rice and naan.  My entree was phenomenal and the portion was big.  My daughter and sister ordered the burger and that looked delicious.  We all agreed this was a good solid meal.  Drinks were also well crafted and executed.  For four people, an appetizer, salad, 4 entrees and 2 drinks the total was around $200.  Not bad considering this is Vegas.

Okay. The staff was very friendly. I had the fish and chips on the recommendation of the waitress. For $30 it wasn't that impressive and honestly a little bland. Fun atmosphere, cool pub decor and again a great staff but just not that impressed. You are paying for the name, not the food.

Dined here for lunch on 06/04/14.

Ordered:
Mini Pub Burgers - (2) sliders with great taste and nice grilled buns
 
Loli-Pop Chicken Wings - I should have been suspect of Loli-Pop in the title. Only ordered 6. Teeny-Tiny Things. Stilton Cheese Dip they came with was incredible!

Toad In The Hole - Pastry wrapped sausage with a wild and crazy mustard dipping sauce. The dipping sauce was the star of this dish.

Lackluster waiter.

Husband ordered a beer. Total bill was $50.00.

Not bad. Not over the top wonderful.

I think my husband's thoughts of my becoming a food snob may be coming to fruition...

Loved everything about this restaurant! Atmosphere was lovely, our waiter was very engaging. We walked in during happy hour. Happy hour appetizers and drinks were priced right! The nachos were hand made chips with shredded pork and brisket. Corned beef sandwich   was tender and tasty. The lamb burger had an amazing  feta and goat cheese spread. Would love to go back!

So my boyfriend and I came here for my birthday ; I have been wanted to try this place since it has opened big fan of Gordon watch him in Hell's Kitchen so I couldn't imagine so where better to celebrate my birthday. Daisy was my server she is so sweet knows the menu very well and suggested great items I didn't even really have to look at the menu I had some fruity cocktail it was very refreshing and her server asst. helped by cleaning items off table and refilling our waters. I got the ribeye medium it was so good ! I ate all it's served with potatoes and my boyfriend had the chicken pot pie chicken was very juicy and gravy was top notch! She suggested the sticky toffee to top it all off it's the best dessert I have ever had I still dream about it served with a vanilla ice cream. I will be back !!!! Thank you daisy for making my birthday special

This place used to be one of our favorite restaurants, but recently it has taken a horrible dive. They don't serve the pork belly anymore (which used to be incredible), the service is now AWEFUL, and the food is borderline edible in some cases (I'm not joking - out of 6 of us eating only one of us found our food acceptable).

It was so terrible, that I will never step foot in one of Ramsay's restaurants again. You can be a jerk on your show if you are amazing, but Gordon - your restaurant sucks. Knock off the act, quit selling out, and fix your terrible restaurants and the associated business model.

How a cranberry vodka drink can taste so special is beyond me! The bartenders here are ridiculously good at what they do. They take their s*** seriously.  Everyone around us was in OOOHS and AHHS over the sheer perfection of their drink.  I had a moment (maybe a buzzed one) where I thought "Wow.... mixed drinks are an art".  I like it.  

And since I didn't want to eat a full meal, I decided to splurge on a few appetizers to share.   Deviled eggs (with bacon), pretzel, and olives. All fantastic - particularly the eggs; they got a little creative with them (but nothing too far out there!).  

Will be back!

Okay, so I think the beer selection is weak for it to be a vegas restaurant. The food we ordered was delicious! we had the sliders and yukon gold potatoes with chive oil. Those potatoes were phenomenal! Great service but over all I think it is a bit overpriced because it is the same type of food you can find a wolfgang pucks but it is more expensive and you get less of it.

The best restaurant period! I loved everything. The pretzel bread. The Sheppards pie. The chicken, the streak and fries. The mac and cheese. The best dessert I have ever had (I can't remeber the name). The waiters where super nice. The seating was amazing. The menu was short and sweet. Every detail of the place was presented well. From the menu that was on a clip boared to the  place mats that were made of wood. I will come back and bring my mom :)

We stop by last Sunday for lunch (10/23/2016). Before stopping by Gordon Ramsey I did what people usually do first which is to check the yelp reviews. After reading the reviews I was having a second thought wether I want to stop by for lunch. But thank god I did! Our server Sarah was amazing! She helped us order and everything was awesome! She's very funny and knowledgeable of the menu. For the appetizer she recommended the lobster roll that my boyfriend and I shared. Noted that my boyfriend doesn't like lobster but after trying the lobster roll he really enjoyed it! And for the main course Sarah recommended fish and chips and med rare lamb burger! And I have to say that it was one of the best burger that I have ever tried! After the main course we ordered sticky toffee pudding to share and it didn't disappointment us and it was delicious! Beside having the best food! The service was amazing! Our server made sure that we were having the best time and she gave 110% customer service! No complain we will definitely come back! Great food! Wonderful experience!
Yes it is not very clean as some people say in their reviews but I had the mini lobster rolls and they were excellent!

had a unique Xmas day dinner of fish and chips, mushy peas, carrots and sprouts....my wife had been wanting to try out a GR restaurant for a long time......he passed with flying colors. Our server, Natalie, was excellent ( friendly polite and professional .....could ask for nothing better). Ambience delightful.....lovely mix of seating, comfortable chairs, great pictures, good lighting, interesting tableware and obviously a great deal of thought had gone into everything...and I mean everything, including the staff uniforms
Without any doubt this was the best fish and chips we have enjoyed anywhere in America. Fish was fresh with perfect texture and the batter was crispy and non greasy...chips chunky, great taste and sauces were all fresh......not sure why anyone can't enjoy great pub food and friendly service in very comfortable and interesting surroundings 
we will return on every visit to Las Vegas

One of the better meals I've ever had in my life.  Came here as a large group for a fun dinner out. Server was awesome. He was outgoing and fun. Food was amazing. Everyone shared and we had a great time!!!
Ordered the beer braised short rib and it did not disappoint. My friends were all jealous. Compliments to the chef who came out to check on us. He talked with us and asked how we liked the good. Props man!! We were greeted by the manager as well half way thru. All around a top notch establishment.

The atmosphere is welcoming and the seating comfortable. We were seated promptly by a courteous hostess. Then the 15 minute wait, did not see the server until sfter i spoke to the hostess. Soon after the server appeared and the over the top bowing/scraping began. This was a trial after the first apology. This is the main reason 4 vs. 5 stars.

The food was especially tasty. The deviled eggs were scrumptious; the fish and chips perfection; the bangers and mash extremely tasty, and the sticky toffee pudding very well done. 


Will come again and look forward to the visit.

For the price, which was extravagant, I expected better.  The burgers weren't seasoned well, the fries were blah and gooey.  It was expensive and they squished us into a table that was so uncomfortable we asked to move.  Not worth the money.  Shame, Gordon, shame.  Makes me want to use your "f-word".  Come fix this place before it ruins you.

As a Brit I was embarrassed to eat here.. It was terrible. Overpriced ($10 for a side of chips/ potatoes) food not freshly prepared dry and not very warm snapper, mussels and clams old and cold. Very disappointing everything Gordon Ramsey tells establishments not to do. a wine lst that belongs in a 5 star  restaurant not a bar.  And I wish he would stop using the British flag he is not representing the average Brit.

La verdad me esperaba más este lugar al pertenecer al famoso chef Gordon, el lugar está muy bien decorado sin embargo el sazón no es el mejor que he probado en mi vida.

Hablo de sazón al referirme a mi platillo que elegí que fue un costillar de cordero, aunque si era de muy buen tamaño su sabor no era exquisito.

El personal muy atento a las necesidades de sus comensales ofreciendo una atención rápida y eficaz.

El costo es un poco alto para lo que se ofrece pero dentro del promedio de un restaurant en Las Vegas.

My husband and I go to Vegas all the time and have eaten here several times before. We were excited to go back but this time was such a disappointment. The fish and chips used to be awesome. Not anymore. Instead of large pieces of tender fish in a delicious batter, now you get a skinny flavorless greasy piece of fish. My expensive braised short rib tasted like bland pot-roast and there is no salt and pepper readily available. Our server was just okay and we like to tip well for good service. Not this time. And we wanted the manager to know we were disappointed and he didn't really seem to care. Getting offered a free dessert is not the solution (and we didn't take the offer). We said the solution is to let Gordon Ramsey know. Mr. Ramsey, you may not be aware that your menu has changed. but you should because there
 are too many other options for dining in Las Vegas.

I enjoyed the service and ambiance here but the food itself was average and overpriced in my opinion. Our calamari was a bit rubbery, our Caesar salads were pretty good, and our steaks came out over cooked with pretty bland sides. I was left thinking that Gordon himself would probably yell at the kitchen.

This place was amazing! Everyone was so nice and inviting. I went to many different restaurants during my stay and this one by far was the best. From the hostess to our waiter nothing but excellent service. Keep up the good work

I was here on 1/30/13. The wait time is about 45mins and we were seated once we returned on time. Our server is fantastic, very nice, recommended sliders, pork belly, and steak, so we go ahead ordered those. Now I clocked the time, we waited 30mins for food to come out, very slow. Our server keep checking on us and reassured us about our food which is very nice of her. 

When our food is served, nothing is really good. Sliders were dry, pork belly was decent but not great. Now the steak, that was way over cooked, seasoning is way too salty, to a point you can't even taste anything but saltiness. We ask our server to come take a look, she instantly apologize and told us she will speak to her boss to see if it can be take off the bill. and it was taken off the bill, which is about $40. We didn't ordered any replacement course cos we scare to wait another 30mins... 

At the end the whole dinning experience is a disappointment, that fact that food came out of Ramsay's kitchen is so sub par, here I will use his fav phase Dreadful!!! If wasn't for Ramsay's name..it will be a 1 star review, seriously!!

Went in for lunch at 2PM on Dec. 30.  Most restaurants in the area where swamped with the crowds for New Years, so it immediately scored points for availability.

Sat in the bar area, which is VERY comfortable.  Couches and chairs you'd find in a living room, kid friendly as well.

I had the Lamb Burger, which was AMAZING!  Probably the only thing keeping this from a 5 was that the fries were very bland, and my friends had dessert, and it was a bit underwhelming (but it wasn't the sticky toffee pudding, which I will have next time).

If there was a 4.5, I'd give it that.  Will come back again.

Just what I would expect from Gordon Ramsay.  This place was awesome, great atmosphere, drinks and good.  My wife and I just stopped in for apps and a drink. I had the onion soup and my wife had the pretzels, both were really good.  The bartender recommended a English beer if never had before that was really good, not something I would've normally ordered.  The   Staff was great.  We are a huge fan of his shoes do it was really cool to finally go to one if his restaurants. I would definitely recommend stopping in here.  The only drawback of any is it is a little pricy but it's worth it.

Good late night drink & snacks. Forget dinner.  Pub food not best when so many other choices. Fast service. Needed drink refills.  Salmon over cooked.  Cool Looking  place like hos other restaurants. Pot pie weak.

I have been there twice so far this year and each time it was great!  I was alone so I sat at the bar.  The bartenders were very attentive even though they were swamped with a full restaurant and people waiting in line to get in.  

I had the beef cheek sandwich with their home made chips on my first visit.  It was a great sandwich but I had never tasted beef cheek and did not really like the flavor but still finished it.  Their home made chips and onion dip were great.  My next visit I had the fish and chips.  Plenty of fish, very light and flaky well seasoned but not too much.  I recommend both dishes.  There are plenty of places to eat in Vegas as we all know, I recommend at least one visit here.  I'm sure I will go back again as a favorite.  I like the fact that if you are a Harrah's Rewards member you get a couple bucks off on the price and it's listed clearly in the menu.  Great job Chef Ramsey !!

Stopped in after several friends recommended it.  It was ok. The Caesar salad was run of the mill average.  Did not come with lemon.  The rack of lamb was good.  Tender. The sauce green bean mix that was the bed was soggy tho. The cherry custard was nice.  Hint of cinnamon was a nice surprise. 

On the negative side,  the water was warm.  I requested lemon and it didn't show up until half way through my meal.  The main course was brought out before I had hardly touched my salad.  They took it back.  Which is probably why things were soggy. It took over 15 minutes for the dessert to show up.  I enquired about an herbal tea. They didn't have any,  so I declined.  Then someone shows up with a green tea., which I sent away.

The kicker was the waiters comment when he brought my check.  He said I had eaten more than anyone he had seen that day and had taken my time.  How rude!  I didn't finish my salad or my dessert.  Not sure how 3 courses is excessive.  Rude!

Absolutely delicious! I had the lobster roll as an appetizer and it was perfect. The bread was outstanding, the flavor was light; it was delightful.

I had the fish and chips as a man course. The fish was airy, and fried to perfection without losing any of the fish's flavor.

For dessert, we split the spotted dic. It still makes me giggle, but that's because I can be childish. ;)
The bread pudding was extremely tasty alone, but with the sauce? Fabulous!

I can't eat a lot at once, and this meal didn't get me too full. Each course looked like it would be very dense, but it wasn't.

Our waiter, Ali (I think), was helpful and knowledgeable when we didn't understand what something was or what it was for.

We took a party of ten into this place, with high expectations based on Ramsay's excellence-demanding TV persona. We left disappointed with the bland food, high prices, and indifferent service.

Between us all, we tried a number of items. After being warned off the chicken salad sandwich by our waiter, we had a couple burgers, a couple tomato soups, a chicken pot pie, an chicken curry dish - by far the best, and a ny strip steak. Rather than go through item by item, suffice to say that the food lacked seasoning, was generally overcooked, and did little to distinguish itself beyond meeting the requirements of what we ordered. 

Between the ten of us, with a couple sodas, one beer (nine bucks) and a couple glasses of wine, the total came to three hundred bucks. While this was not intended to be a "highlight" meal for our trip, it was still disappointing. 

Finally, I don't know what horrible thing had happened to our waiter prior to his shift, but his attitude reeked of indifference to the happiness/satisfaction of his table. (Although he might have done me a favor warning me off the chicken salad, who knows.) Given other reviews I have read here, our service experience was not unique.

Don't waste your time or your money.....worst dining experience in Las Vegas! We arrived early evening to a fairly empty restaurant, yet the hostess and four waitresses hanging around the front desk were so engrossed in their conversation that we were a bother to them, imagine that!  We should have walked away then! Well, we were seated when one of them decided to do the right thing. We found the decor unimpressive, kind of old style, dark decor....didn't really appreciate it. The waiter came over and recommended a drink which we took his suggestion on. Might have been ok if they had put some alcohol in it, extremely weak, at $15.00 a pop. We each had a plate of 3 tiny sliders, fairly ok. Had to wait 20 minutes for a second drink, what were we thinking?! Bill came to $93.00+ tip. Unimpressive Gordon Ramsay, I think you need to start practicing what you preach, starting in this restaurant.
Had the truffle French fries & some drinks at bar. Very friendly bartenders

Haters gonna hate. Does not deserve the low reviews. Let me tell you why. 

People are complaining about service and steep price point. They do know they are in Vegas right? Also, the word PUB is in the name, that literally means that it's a casual ambiance so chill the hell down. 

Food was remarkable. Sister had the deviled eggs, I had the lamb burger, wife had the ale onion soup. All of which were perfect. 

I love lamb. You can say you love it more but I will disagree. I don't like the actual animal, I like the meat it gives. It's juicy. It has that remarkable taste. Leaves a taste that lingers in your mind.

This lamb was cooked perfectly. Great burger. Great price. You're in Vegas. It's in the middle of the dessert. Food isn't cheap. 

The ale onion soup lived up to its name and tasted like ale reduction. A fun take on the French onion soup. 

Service was FANTASTIC. I wish I could remember our waitress name but she was amazing.

Side note: if you're the manager reading this, she had blonde hair and was stationed by the kitchen entrance that served the booth with 2 love seats, on 8/08 , around 4pm. Give her a high five. 

- not five stars because the food won't blow you away but it will get the job done right -

Loved everything!
Calamari app was delicious! And the shepards pie was perfection! Nom nom nom. Great cocktails too!

Would never come back! Prawns were chewy, filet was sweet and wine has things floating in it. The only reason why I even gave it 2 stars is because the potatoes were good. Oh and our server was non existent.

I was here last night with two friends. Two of us ordered a New York steak one rare one medium well. They mixed up our order he got mine I got his. After 2 bites we realize the mistake so we bring it to the attention of our server. She takes them in the back and reappeared 3 min later with new steaks. That was a little quick. The steak was cold. So we send it back. Now on our third steak I get a rare when I wanted medium well. Sooo back it goes on my fourth steak. My friend on his third. The other person at the table finished eating 20 min ago. Bill comes full price on all plates and drinks. Absolutely terrible service and food! Never eat here!

I came here initially at the opening for a yelp event with my sister as her plus one.  It was memorable and the food was great.  I just returned since my first visit and unfortunately I can't give a rave review anymore. My sister's onion soup was delicious however at the bottom she found a little plastic surprise.  No good. Then our entrees came. She ordered the fish and chips.  The chips were stale,  not even warm. I had the Shepard' s pie.  Flavor was great however it wasn't heated all the way thru unfortunately.  I really wanted to like this place.  But between the very slow service and mediocre, overpriced food I will not return.  "Damn, such a shame" -Gordon Ramsay

Awesome!  Some friends and I had been wanting to go for awhile, finally went last night.  Sat at the bar and had 3 or 4 appetizers and some cocktails.  Staff was awesome, and our bartender, RayRay, explained everything to us about the menu and drinks (who knew there was such a thing as keg wine?)  Great experience, we will be back!
Lunchtime food was good but had a difficult time getting waitstaff's attention.  Too many customers; not enough staff.

Is there a zero star option? Because, that is my rating.  Extremely disappointed and offended. When I arrived at the Pub and Grill, I noticed that the establishment was extremely empty. I thought this was odd since it was New Years Eve and the strip was packed. the hostesses did offer an ala carte menu, as I was not interested in their main menu for the evening.
