We made reservations via Yelp, but we were running late because of Las Vegas so I called the restaurant and they were able to hold our table. That was really accommodating, but I just wished our server was as accommodating. Unfortunately he was really slow and standoff-ish. The table next to us I believe won a VIP dinner for Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill, so he was focusing his attention on them. The water wasn't refilled until we asked and this poor busboy came running to give us water. Food came out in good timing though. 
The food was good, but for the price I paid I expected more. We got the Bangers and Mash as well as Steak and Ale Pie. We also got the sauteed mushrooms and wings. The wings were great, but pricey. The portions were smaller than I expected, but I was full since it was full of mashed potatoes and bread. It was delicious, but it's the type of food that's not too hard to make so we weren't too impressed. 
The location is great as it is near the parking structure so you don't have to walk too far. The restaurant itself is pretty comfy, not romantic, so it's best for a group of friends or coworkers. Lots of TVs so it is also great to watch a game. 
A plus was that we got to see the Hell's Kitchen winner so that was pretty cool. Overall, it was A-ok.

I had the pleasure of eating here during a conference.  I had the fish and chips and wow was it amazing.  Super flaky fish with the perfect crispy batter.  Potatoes were perfect fried.  At $30, it was well worth it, I would definitely order it again.

I'm a Gordon Ramsay fan, love all his shows and his passion for excellence.  He reminds me a bit of myself in my college years striving for perfection over the cast iron grill at Buffalo Wild Wings.

Being a fan I was excited to try this place.  What to order?  this was the hardest question to answer since the ACT.  I wanted a burger but thought I should get out of my comfort zone and try something a bit more British, so I went with the pie sampler.  I thought this was a great idea so I could sample all the taste Gordon has to offer but it backfired a bit because it really is just an appetizer, so I was still a bit hungry afterwards.  Each meat pie was about as good as a meat pie can get, but that's not saying much.  Looking back I should have ordered either a whole pie or the burger, or maybe the sampler and a burger.  My friend had a burger and it looked amazing, I stole some fries when he wasn't looking, very good.  I will be back to try the burger.
What did I expect from Gordon Ramsey ? Perfection! And thats what I got. Great shepherds pie, great atmosphere and great service. I will most defiantly visit again .

I read all the reviews before I went - they all seemed mixed so I suggest you try it for yourself. I had the Goodbye Blue Sky cocktail and it was DELISH!  Fresh raspberries, blueberry vodka - crazy combo of stuff - to die for!  And they aren't stingy on the booze.  They started us off with pretzel bread sticks and an awesome mustard dip.  I'd buy these by the dozens to have them always.  GREAT bread for the table.  The service was fantastic.  Super friendly host, super friendly waitress - all the staff seemed happy and attentive.  People on Yelp commented on the uniforms - they are awesome, please - it's a pub, young, hip, England punk - totally cool, get over it.  I had the fish and chips and it was delish.  Awesome tartar sauce..can't say a bad thing.  A friend had the steak, side of mashed potatoes..again delish.  Mashed potatoes were really awesome.  Husband had the scallops - again delish.  Pricey, yes, but c'mon, you are on the strip in Vegas - if you want cheap, get off the strip.  It's for a night to splurge!

Not the best place for me. Cousins from NY come to visit us and going to see Celine Dion show and we reserve here. The interior style restaurant for younger people, not comfortable with small tables like Bar. And they bring the food in big square pieces of wood so imagine that (4 person) not to much space to look where I can put my drink, on the floor?
  Menu looks nice with a great variety of different tasty choices but the food is not good. I feel expensive prices if you compare this with the flavor. We ordered appetizer, entree, dessert. And no one said a word about how good it was.

Great food and great staff! We sat at the bar and the bartenders were awesome. My boyfriend ordered his usual beer and the bartender gave him a sample of the house recommendation beer: Innus and Gunn. He loved it and switched beers. We live in NYC and we are now on a search for that beer. I got one of speciality cocktails; I forgot the name of it. It had pureed blueberries in it. It was so light and refreshing!  For food, we had the prime rib and the pie sampler. They were delicious!  Definitely coming back here next time in Vegas!

Come on - Gordon Ramsay not being good? I don't know how that would be possible. 
Now to be fair - this is pub-style food, true to British form, so don't go expecting Americanized flavor-overload. That being said, the flavors were like simple taken up a notch and the spotted dic pudding was fabulous!!! Divine. Best. Ever.
If I'm in Vegas again, I'd jump at the chance to eat here again!

We were seated right away and then asked to move to a different table because the seats were to low and my wife is short, no problem! We had walked from our hotel in the busy downtown foot traffic, in the heat so my wife was a little abrupt and in a bad mood. It was like water on a duck and just rolled off, no problem. The service was amazing as was the food. We are definitely going back the next time we are in Vegas.

Worst food I have had in Vegas. SO dissapointing.I ordered the Fish and Chips and it was the driest chips I have EVER tasted. The fish was so tasteless I had to drench it in vinegar that I had to wait 10 minutes for because they could not find a bottle. The worst out of the whole experience is the manager offered a desert for my trouble. REALLY???  For a $30.00 plate that should've not been that hard to mess up and all you can do is offer a desert for the table to share! SHAME ON YOU!!!!!  I WILL NEVER STEP FOOT in that establishment again, expecially since Gordon has a reputation of supposedly taking NO PRISONERS  when it comes to food.

The Pub is next to the casino and has an open bar area, but there is also a dining room that is protected from the hoi polloi (and the smoke) and makes you feel like you are in a pub in England (except for the waiters lederhosen and newsprint uniforms - there are no uniforms at English pubs).  

We were seated immediately, but there was a slow start to our service which was always rather harried and not particularly friendly.  We started with the warm pretzels ($8) with a white cheddar sauce and seedy English mustard.  The cup with three pretzel sticks were perfect - a nice crispy skin and tender interior.  The creamy and slightly sharp cheese sauce and the gourmet mustard were plentiful and great for dipping (separately and together).  This was a great prelude.

For our entrees, we split the wedge salad and the mixed vegetable salad ($15 and $16 each).  The wedge salad was quite good - baby iceberg was sweet and crisp and topped with grated hardboiled egg, bits of blue cheese and bacon and crispy onions and sat in a bed of creamy blue cheese dressing with a drizzle of sherry vinaigrette on the top.  It was a hearty salad that was at once rich, sweet, salty and tangy.  I would definitely get this again.  The mixed vegetable salad was a mélange of spring greens with shaved fennel, carrots and radishes and bits of cucumber and halved cherry tomatoes that were overdressed with a white balsamic vinaigrette and finished with some crunchy caramelized cashews.  Other than the excess dressing, this was a very good salad.  

Overall, it was a 3.5 star experience.  I know from experience that the potted chocolate trifle is worth the trip, and the wedge was great as well as the pretzels.  The other salad and the service were not as wonderful, but such is the Vegas food scene.

A-okay nothing special. The entree I ordered was delicious, however, quite pricey. I ordered a BLT and it was over $20.

The BLT was really good and had a unique twist to it. It had basil in it which was a good surprise. The only thing I found odd was that the bacon was crushed or chopped instead of strips of bacon so the bacon kept falling out when I was trying to eat it.

Everyone else in my group said their food was good. No complaints. Service was pretty good. They were pretty attentive.
Ok food. Nothing special, very bland. Got lamb burger and the lamb Shepard pie. Good service, but disappointed in the food. Drinks expensive!!!!

The food was definitely great.  The wife had the lamb burger with goat cheese.  while it had nothing besides the goat cheese on it, I was skeptical as I like a lot of strong flavors.  But it was quite tasty, I was surprised.  I ordered the fish n chips.  That being said I'm not a big fish n chips fan normally because the breading never seems completely done to me.  However the fish n chips was really good.  The batter had just the slightest hint of being not quite crispy all the way through though.  So the 4 stars.
But the chips or fries were amazing!!  They are delicious and the size of landscaping timbers!  Someone on here complained about them which I thought was stupid.  
It did take about 15 min longer than I thought it should for the kitchen to get our order out though.  We were one of the first ones there and there were several other tables that got their food first.  All in all it was 90 mins start to finish for lunch.

Good was great quality meat and John our waiter made everthing even better. He was friendly made recommendations on food its great.. if you con you should try the nochos they are made with kettle chips..good call from our waiter John.. will go back and ask gor John and try what he recommends...thank you good food good service

I was invited for dinner. I watched his show so I was in fact curious to try. when I arrived the one hostess told another to take me there but she was doing her own thing with her bag facing her back toward me and then another guy came so the first hostess asked him to take me to table. He was not really greeting me and I kinda just follow him. Then he seemed lost and didn't know which number is located where. He showed me to a wrong table and asked if I know how they looked. Fortunately for him, I knew I was supposed to meet all Koreans so I could locate my own table. When they brought appetizers, they didn't bring extra spoons or forks so I had to use my personal fork to get food from the plate which was supposed to be shared with others. And then the main dish was not really more than average. Most dishes were too salty. He shouldn't expand fast and big if he can't find right management to control the quality. What a shame. I will never go back. Over priced. Dreadful food. Bad and unprofessional service. Food is too salty or too sweet.

Good service even when at full capacity. That's where the good ends. First of all $8 for a bottle of water!  8!  F u Gordon. That's almost as much as my entree, the duck poutine. I would have been better off sticking to water. The poutine was so salty it was inedible. Awful. And few if any curds. Two tiny slivers of dried out duck. Yuk. Do not want.

This is third time I ate here and first time for a review!! As far as the service goes Daisy was exceptional! The food was great... Ordered fish and chips and was best u have ever had! The Goodbye blue sky cocktail was amazing !!! All in all great time and great food!!

Was looking for a different spot to try out in Caesars before heading out for a show, and stumbled upon the pub.

Despite being 50% empty at 5PM, we ended up being told we couldn't be seated until 8:45PM. Still, 2 minutes later via use of the opentable app, I had a reservation in hand for 6PM and killed an hour at the tables prior to getting seated in a half-empty house.

Figuring we were at a british pub, I did the fish and chips w. mushy peas, and skipped a starter as we had an awesome lunch earlier and weren't super hungry.

Despite the pleasant service from the Gary Busey lookalike waiter, the food arrived scalding hot, as we downed our first pints. 

The chips were undercooked and scaling hot (as my buddy got a side of chips that were a bit crisper with his dish).

The fish was super-oily, and despite the newspaper themed dresses worn by the hostesses, it wasn't served over any sort of newspaper/newspaper style wax paper.

The mushy peas were pretty good.

As we were leaving after finishing dinner, the restaurant was still 1/3 empty. 

No idea what was up with their reservation system, as we were told we'd need to wait 3.5 hours for a table at 5PM, got a table via opentable at 6PM and were seated in a half-empty house, and when leaving at 6:45PM, left a restaurant that was 1/3 empty.

Also, given the pricing (significantly higher than Aria's Todd English P.U.B.), and non-quality of the food, I'm not looking to return on my next venture to Vegas.

Service was meh....I can't imagine people get anything other than fish and chips because it smelled like fish everywhere wafting into Caesars Palace casino. We had a table looking into the casino which was kinda cool to people watch.

They bring fresh rye bread and pretzel sticks to the table with a cheese dipping sauce. I was disappointed in the sauce due to some sort of horseradish taste to it. I didnt even really get to taste them because before you knew it the food was out at the table. 

Ordered fish and chips..you definitely get a good portion of fish which I thought was good.T he potatoes were ok . I prefer smaller fries these were 4 giant ones with a little parm on em. Again all dipping sauces included horseradish. YUCK!  

Overall not too impressed ..lets hope the new chef who wins hells kitchen can help. LOL
Service was on point and knowledgeable. I made a seat reservation, but arrived early and was seated. Had the pork belly which was amazing along with the sticky toffee pudding.

When we got there, we were seated right away even though we didn't have reservations. The server was friendly and there are lots of choices on the menu. 

The server suggested the deviled eggs, so I decided to try some. I've had amazing eggs at other places where they really jazz it up. These were literally just eggs you could make at home with bacon bits sprinkled on top. 

We just ate a few hours earlier so I wasn't really feeling a full meal. Thank god because my friend got the short ribs which were bland and lacked any type of appeal. My other friend got the fish and chips which was a big portion and tasted way better in comparison to our dishes. I got the Caesar salad. Let me start by saying I LOVE dressing and am often told I use too much, but there was so much it was so unbearable I had to ask for extra croutons just to finish half of it. The salad was drenched in dressing and wasn't even edible. 

We've been to other Gordon Ramsay places and I had my apprehensions reading all the reviews, but with all the other great places to eat on the strip...DO NOT eat here. Save your stomach space and money for something better.

Really good, strong cocktails. We had a great, attentive waitress. 
appetizer: The beet salad was good, nothing out of the ordinary for a beet salad, but pretty fresh. 
main: PASS on the fish and chips! cod tastes like it's a million years old, and the mushy peas side is so strange, it reminded me of hospital food for those that have trouble swallowing. no idea why it was $28--- decimal sign was probably misplaced, worth 2.80
Side: roasted baby carrots with brussel sprouts was suprisingly tasty for vegetables. well done. 
Dessert: sticky toffee pudding with sweet cream ice cream... should've had this for my mine course. yummm

Amazing Flavors!! 

Great service! Perfect place to people watch!

Truffles fries and Brussels sprouts are a must. Pretty much everything you order will be amazing!!

The food was just ok, really what makes this place so great is the bar staff! The guys in the bar were so much fun to talk to and hang out with that we ended up passing on our table and having our meal right there. 
Great selections of beer, they even have their own certified beer expert that lets you try his beer if you ask nicely!
The food was just ok, but really its the people that make this place so great. If the manager is reading this please please give your bar staff a raise! They rock!

Fist of all the decor in this place is pretty awesome, makes you wanna order a beer. Barrels hanging everywhere high tables. It is just pretty cool. 

As for the food, my hubby and I had a few things there. As we weren't that hungry we only had a salad (forgot which one) the 3 pies combo and a spotted dick. We were sharing everything. 

The salad was just a big waste of time, had some good elements but not worth the money or the time to chew it . 

As for the pies, now that's where the magic is. the combo is 3 pies, chicken lamb and the famous shepherd pie. Each one was absolutely great but the Shepherd pie definitely blew the others out of the way. So flaky, and warm, it was just perfect. So if you do try the place just trust me and order the Shepherd pie and you'll be like a happy little kid. 

As for the spotted dick, AKA bread pudding, it's absolutely and utterly amazing. Perfection on a plate. Don't you dare leaving the pub without trying it. It is just great!

I had already eaten at Gordon Ramsay's Burgr the day before, so when I ran into this place going through Caesar's Palace, I decided to try it. I had the Kettle Chip Nachos for an appetizer. I was surprised how large it was (his apps in Burgr were really small). I couldn't finish it, but it was amazing. For my entree, I ordered my favorite UK dish: Shepherd's Pie. It was served in a round bowl, which I felt looked a little small compared to other's I had ordered in other places, But it was a deeper bowl too. It was really alot. I did finish that because it was too damn good, but I did stuff myself. Funny, I was sitting next to a large group of Caesar's workers dressed as various Romans along with other impersonators such as Dean Martin, Elvis and Sammy Davis, all having drinks.  Weird but cool.

The food was delicious!  The mac and cheese was my favorite.  However, we were at our table for almost 15 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. The server that ended up getting our order and drinks wasn't even our server - our server wandered up about 10 minutes later and made a comment about how the helpful server wasn't suppose to be with our table. I did enjoy the # of TVs around - I was able to catch up on multiple games during the meal.

UGH this place is sooo good. The hostess, not so much, but our server and every other staff member we encountered were 100% on it. We came for dinner and YOU MUST TRY the beer flights. The cocktails were good too, but.... the beer flight....just do it. The food was excellent, we ordered the Lobster & Shrimp Rolls (one HUNDRED stars), the Mini Pub Burgers (you'd think once you've had a few sliders you've had 'em all, but you thought wrong; these were da bomb), the Deviled Eggs, the Fish and Chips, and the Hellfire Wings (the only thing we ordered that were average, but I mean, I still ate them all, so...), and you already know we sprung the calorie bank for dessert. Worth. It. We came back the next day for lunch and saw a different hostess, same bad attitude, but we this time we sat at the bar. The food was again awesome and the bartender, for an afternoon bartender, was hilarious. 5 stars!!! I don't love going to Vegas but I sure love going here!

We ate here for the first time last weekend and really enjoyed it! 

We started with drinks and they were excellent.  

We had the clams for an appetizer and they were the best clams I had ever eaten.

I had the fish and chips.  The fish was awesome, the chips just so-so.

My wife had the chicken pot pie and somehow it was very good.  I would have never thought chicken pot pie could  have been so tasty!

My son had the bangers and mash and he is a foodie and loved his entree!

My wife's friend had the rib and loved it also.

The sticky toffee pudding was insanely great!  Best dessert ever!!!

Service was good.

I had lunch here yesterday.   While this Date cake/ caramel dessert was very good!!! My burger was just okay.... I have had better hamburgers and was a little disappointed.  It tasted more like a chuck burger and was not that good.

The warm pretzel bread appetizer was good.  THe french fries were better than the hamburger............ I thought this place was known for their burgers so that is why I got one, I ate half of it and didn't really like it that much.

This place is OKAY but not phenomenal.

Wait staff was attentive but sloppy.  After the pretzel appetizer they took both our knives and forks and then brought the entree and no utensils?? Had to wait about ten minutes till he came back to ask him to bring us utensils.

Our family decided to visit one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants in Las Vegas for Christmas Eve and this one was more on the casual side.  We are local to Las Vegas, so it was fun to visit the strip for dinner.  We had 6:30 reservations but arrived at around 6 and was taken to our table without a wait.  The table and chairs were very comfortable and the big screens located throughout the restaurant provided for a fun, pub-style atmosphere.  Our waiter was very friendly and attentive and made our experience enjoyable. 

I had the fish and chips, my wife had the shephard's pie, my son the lamb burger and my daughter the butter curry.  All dishes were very tasty and met our expectations.  I paired by fish and chips with an Innus & Gunn beer which hit the spot.  We all shared a sticky toffee pudding for dessert - also tasty.

The only thing that was a disappointment was the fact that they discontinued the Total Rewards discount and they have nothing in place for locals (as many other restaurants in tourist areas do).  Nonetheless, I was expecting to pay Gordon Ramsey prices, so it was not a shock.  The food was good, service great and overall experience was fantastic.  Definitely a once-in-a-while only type of experience for us given the cost, but worthwhile!

Please save yourselves! I so wanted to like this restaurant. We were there for dinner on a Monday night. Arriving at about 9:15, we only had a 20 minute wait. The decor was really neat, from the lighting to the eating utensils. Even the servers and hostesses uniforms were nicely done. We should've known after waiting 15 minutes before anyone greeted our table that our night was doomed. Of course we were getting anxious and ready to leave but we wanted to try this restaurant so badly and we didn't want to look around for another restaurant and have to possibly wait again. So finally our server arrived. I had seen this server the whole time taking care of the table next to us, so clearly he had seen us as well as another one of his tables that was seated one minute after us. Unfortunately we were not given drink menus when we were seated. The server had it with him on an ipad when he greeted us. This could've taken another five minutes to put our drink order in because he tried to leave it with us and walk away. Fortunately my husband and I immediately spotted a couple of beers on the first paged and ordered before he walked away. When our server returned with our beers five minutes later, he dropped them off and said he'd be right back after he dropped off a menu at another table. Another few minutes later he dropped off some bread and again said he'd be right back to take our order after he dropped off another table's bill. Either this guy had far too many tables to wait on or he was the world's biggest idiot. He was very nice, and tried very hard to crack jokes and make us forget about the past 25 minutes of horrible service. I actually felt really bad for the guy. My husband ordered the lamb burger which was only available on the bar menu but our server made it sound as if he would do us the huge favor and get it for him anyway. Turns out we saw lot's of burgers being delivered to tables. So I wonder why they don't just put the $20 burger on the full dining menu. Anyway, my husband didn't care much for the burger but we both agreed that the fries were outstanding. I ordered the chopped chicken salad and honest to God have never had a worse salad. I think there must have been some sort of mix up or error in the kitchen with my salad because it was so bad. The dressing must've been mayonnaise or something worse. My biggest regret is that I didn't say anything about it to the server. Normally I have no problem with speaking up about bad food but I was mentally exhausted and so completely over this dinner that it was too much effort to say anything. My next regret is that I actually ate it. What is my problem? I ate this disgusting salad and what does that say about me? Gross! I guess I was hungry. Our server obviously felt bad about the service because after we finished eating, he dropped off our check and told us he was deducting $10 from it. We smiled and thanked him. Nope, no deduction, just our full price bill. Again, too irritated and over the whole experience that we just paid and left. On a more positive note, they had a great selection of beer. Overpriced of course, but so is everything in Vegas so we can't fault them for that.

Great food!
We ordered the shepherd's pie, some cherry dessert, lobster roll.

How dare you have the attatude you do on your show and have your name on such a poorly run restaurant!!!

Even the bathrooms were worse than a gas stations ...

Service was slow.
Drinks mondain.
Food pedestrian.

Close this place before more like me lose all respect for your talents!

My partner and I went to Gordon Ramsey' Pub on Valentine's Day. The atmosphere was very nice, and furnishings very comfortable. 

We were a bit surprised at the actual food unfortunately. My partner ordered the shepherds pie, and it was very salty. I ordered the fish and chips, and it came out on a plate with a sheet of newspaper between the food and the plate. When the newspaper started getting wet, any attempts at cutting the fish resulted in shredded newspaper. I ended up eating two or three news articles along with my meal. I understand the desire for the British chip shop "authenticity", however, if they had just put the food on the plate, I would have been able to finish my meal.

Fish & chips was so delicious!!! It was my birthday, and the waiter brought me a complimentary dessert. It was the toffee & date cake, & it was the most delicious dessert I have ever had. Service was exceptional & I will definitely be back!!'

Being Gordan Ramsey the food guru on tv, I would expect way more from his place. Service was good the food was nothing more then going to Apple bees . We ordered the salmon ,steak and Brussels sprouts. 
Salmon was fair steak was overcooked asked for medium rare came to be well done. Brussels sprouts were cooked in a steak sauce. Eh. I'm not the best cook but my girlfriend says mine were better. I don't know if she was trying to make  me feel good but I would also would have to agree.  We didn't finish them and we love Brussel sprouts. 

Definitely if you're going to order steak go to Ruth's Chris or another place known for their steaks.

The food was just OK. I had a pulled pork sandwich (it is a cold sandwich), and the bacon on it was cold and just tasted like grisly left overs.  It was bereft of seasoning, too. 
Our food came out fast however it was challenging getting the staff to provide a refill (it wasn't busy at the time).
With all the choices here in Las Vegas, I would not recommend!

We came here to take a break from walking and saw their happy hour sign as we walked by. It's located inside of the Caesars Palace. Happy hour is Monday-Friday from 2-5 pm. They had plenty of goodies for only $5: Deviled eggs, sliders, pretzels, truffle fries. The food was pretty decent, especially for the price. You can't beat it! Draft beers started at $5 and $7 a pint. The ambiance is fun, clean and service was great. There's lots of television screens for the sports lovers!

Service is great. The place looks amazing and like you could party there all night long but you're not allowed to! Haha!

The food is delicious, but not compared to BurGR or Gordon Ramsay Steak.

We also met Scott Commings, winner of Hell's Kitchen 12 which was pretty damn awesome! 

A must go if you haven't. You won't be disappointed.

I am a huge fan of Gordon Ramsey. I have to say this was a very disappointing experience. Food was mediocre. Service was not great.  Not at all what I would expect from Gordon. One word to sum it up would be OVERRATED!!!

Being a Vegas local who is English, I am very sceptical about the Irish and British pubs around town. Many rave that they have the best fish and chips in town or the best curry on their menu and all of them fail miserably at delivering to the high standards they hype the restaurants up to by serving frozen chips. That is, all of them but Gordon Ramsay's Pub. 

We started off our late lunch with the Lobster and Shrimp Rolls. Holy cow! These were the dog's bollocks! (For you Americans, that means they were BOMB!) Light and refreshing Maine lobster and shrimp served on a toasted roll. My friend and I both agreed we would be happy with just that every time we came. Then came the Sliders which were perfectly cooked and a decent size. 

Here's where we got a little greedy... Well, I got a little greedy. Back home I would always opt for either the fish and chips or the chicken curry and chips. Today, I opted for both... And shared reluctantly with my friend. Bloody hell, GR Pub know how to portion your food to feed you for a week. Let's start with the curry... The Butter Chicken Curry was served with basmati rice and a naan bread. The chicken was so tender it fell apart and melted in your mouth. Chef Otto Spohn came out to check on us and was saying they marinate the breast for a day in the curry base. This set the curry apart from other attempts to serve Indian in a pub in Las Vegas by miles. Normally I would do half and half (chips and rice) with my curry in England so I was looking forward to soaking my chips in the curry sauce. 

Now onto the fish and chips. This is where I am most critical. There's nothing like proper fish and chips from the chip shop or pub back home. I never order them in America because I'm always disappointed. Freshly cooked, they came out steaming hot with tartare sauce and mushy peas (a British staple side for fish and chips). The chips were not cut like a typical chip shop chip. They were miles better than the frozen chips or French fries every other venue serves up in America, but they just weren't what I was hoping for. They were bloody good, mind. Just not what I expected from a British guy's pub. The fish on the other hand was PERFECTION! Light, crispy, and huge pieces. I ended up with enough for lunch the next day as well. LOVED the recipe. 

We were celebrating my birthday and we were sent out two of the four desserts. The chocolate trifle which I had forgotten how much I loved back home. It was refreshing and delicious. The masterpiece however, was the good old fashioned Sticky Toffee Pudding. Oh. My. God. I was in heaven!!!! This was THE best sticky toffee pudding I've ever had... Trust me, I've had a lot of them. 

The whole experience from start to end was bloody marvellous. Our waitress, Yanesy was bubbly, funny, and very attentive. I will be requesting her every time I'm back. The decor has a very posh British flair with fancy upholstery and excellent uses of the Union Jack, British landmarks, and of course the signature newspaper print typically associated with fish and chips. I can't wait to go back.

We wanted to love it, we really did. Unfortunately we left feeling extremely disappointed. The food was just ok. It tasted good but there wasn't anything over-the-top about it. We would have loved to try the sticky toffee pudding for dessert (mostly to compare it to Bobby Flay's) but our waiter couldn't be bothered to stop by our table. We sat with our silverware on our plates after finishing our entrees for thirteen minutes and eight seconds before the plates were finally cleared away. Yes, we timed it. And then we sat for another eleven minutes and fifty two seconds before the waiter came over to ask if we wanted dessert. Nope, just the check now. Dessert probably would've taken another half hour! 

Each time we've been to Vegas, we choose to stay at Caesar's Palace because the customer service is superb. Mesa Grill, Bacchanal, Homestead, Hyakumi... five-star service. Even Munch Bar had awesome service. Ramsay's just didn't measure up. 

I still love Gordon but I think he needs to start yelling at his front of the house staff ASAP.

Just had my annual lamb burger and, as usual, it was cooked perfectly and delicious.  The service was quick and friendly and the truffle chips were good but not quite hot enough when served.  This is my 5th or 6th time here and it's pretty consistent.  I've had their sliders and corned beef sandwich as well and all were good.  Of course it's a little $$, but it's in Vegas so you expect to pay $21 for a burger.
Adam in the bar is AMAZING!! You have to go sit with him and get their version of a mint julep OR a Ramsay tonic!!! So so good! And their deviled eggs appetizer! OMG must go.

Our service was sub par for the $200 we spent on 4 people. We waited 30 minutes past our predicted seating time- I can understand this, as jostesses have no control over when people get up. But after waiting  a half hour over our wait time, we got no apology from management. Our waiter ignored us for the most part; the most active he was was when he failed to ask our beer sizes and automatically charged us for big beers. Our drinks, apps and food came out at one time- again with no apology from server or manager. I work in the service industry and can be extremely forgiving, but overall the food and service were far below par.

Gordon Ramsay needs to take his name off this mess. The beer selection is great. The service was decent. The portions were small... small portions at a pub? The food was nothing special. 4 non spectacular dinners and two small beers $140. Dollar for dollar the worst disappointment of the trip. We ate foot long hot dogs within two hours in the forum shops. Next time I will spend a little more money and eat somewhere nice or spend a little less and eat at a real pub.

I've eaten here half a dozen times, hoping that my experience would improve with each visit.  Unfortunately, that wasn't the case.  This is just another overpriced burger joint.  While the $19 Grilled Beef Burger looked tasty, it tasted bland.  Maybe Gordon Ramsay's BURGR at Planet Hollywood is better???

Extremely disappointed. Nice atmosphere, however the bangers and mash was average at best.  The meat and cheese plate to was just enough for one person let alone a table for two. Not the best place on the Strip for sure!

Three stars for the food, but the wait staff did a great job and did their best to make up for my cold food. We went in with high expectations given this is one of Gordon Ramsay's establishments.  There was a mix up in the kitchen so my meal was cool rather than hot. I have to say the flavor was there. I had the prime rib but they forgot to put the beef drippings on the Yorkshire pudding which left me with a partial meal. Mr Ramsay would have had something to say about it for sure. Natalie was a very good waitress and she went above and beyond to make sure I left the restaurant happy. Everyone else in our party was pleased with their meals. I will revisit and update the review based on my next visit. One more chance Ramsay.

I am very weary of "celebrity restaurants". We only went here for late night snack and also the hubby wanted to try a Scotch egg. The food was ok but not impressive enough to come here on purpose. Better off going to Earl of Sandwich for late night noshing.

I've given this place 3-4 tries and it continues to disappoint. Honestly think they're not evening trying to be good. I've had Shepherds Pie, sliders, calamari, Brussels sprouts - all terrible.  Fish and chips and burgers are not good either. Two stars as I do like the atmosphere.

This place was just "okay" nothing I tried wowed me. We ordered the fried calamari and chicken wings for appetizers. Both good, but not worth going back for. For my entrée I got the fish and chips; fish was good, but chips were weird and dry.

I wish I ordered something that wasn't fried haha. At the time it seemed like a good idea to eat some crispy/greasy goodness with my black and blues. 

Three Stars because everything about it was basic.

Took my brother in law here for dinner because he is a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay. We made reservations, asked to be by the kitchen, and also mentioned it was a birthday dinner. They didn't relay any of that information when it came time to dine but at least they had our reservation on file. 

Service was awful during our visit. My brother in law ordered the Onion soup and they brought it out to him without a spoon. We had to flag down our waiter and ask for the spoon. They were also "conveniently" out of their house wine so we were forced to spend more money on wine with dinner. 

When it came time for the bill we had to wait about 10 minutes for him to bring it. 

If Gordon Ramsay knew how terrible the service was at this place he might make a visit and set them straight. At no point should the waiter tell me that $17 calamari is justified no matter the quality because we are in Caesars Palace. To be fair, the calamari was decent. 

I am only giving 2 stars because of the terrible service. The food was good, not great. I can get better at my local pub for a lot less money.

Had the fish and chips, awesome. I lived in England for 4 years while in the military and these fish and chips are authentic. The wait staff are professional and beyond reproach.  Great place when in Ceasars Palace definitely stop in.

To preface, I will say that my review of the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill is based strictly on their happy hour.  The happy hour runs daily from 2-5 PM, nice because it is on the earlier side of some of the other happy hours in Vegas, allowing for optimal bar crawling if that is your preference.  In my case, I happened to stop in on my last day in town before getting on the road back to Los Angeles.  The bartenders were great, extremely friendly and very prompt when service was needed.

For food we ordered the Truffle Fries ($5) and Nachos ($7).  On the fence about the wings, we were proposed to give the wings a shot and if we didn't like them, we would not be charged for them.  Swayed, we gave them a shot.  Despite the name, they were not breathtakingly spicy.  They did have a tinge of Asian-style sweetness, but all-in-all were pretty good.  The nachos came with a good chunk of meet on top of potato chips.  A little different, more British style, but all around pretty good.  The truffle fries I was quite excited for given that I saw pictures of thick planks of fries on Yelp.  Unfortunately, they were the thin variation, not much different from fries you could get anywhere.  The aioli was good, but I was unimpressed by the fries, especially for $5.  However, my girlfriend enjoyed them.  Drinks were also on special, including champagne, to my girlfriend's pleasure.
Had the bacon cheeseburger was really really good! In fact enjoyed it so much came back the next morning for breakfast. Had corned beef skillet which was amazing but really filling.

Ok it's been a while since I actually stepped foot in this joint but I'd just like to share our experience from the one time I tried to eat here. 
My girl and I are at Caesars looking for a bite and I decided on Ramsey's pub n grill so we stood at the hostess desk for a good fee minutes before we were even spoken to by one of the 3 girls in miniskirts that were talking to eachother. Then we are taken to a seat in the bar area next to all the kegs that were used as the divider for the bar area and the seating area. We were not asked if we wanted to sit at the bar, my girl always will prefer a booth but we were not given that option. 
We were seated and left alone for about 5min before I had to flag down a busser to ask for a menu. Looking at the menu for about 5-10 more minutes we were never approached by another employee at all. We were not offered water or drinks or asked if we were ready to order. Now considering the fact that by the time we each have a meal and a drink we were looking to spend close to $100 for burgers we elected to just get up and walk out. As far as the food goes I have actually eaten wings and a burger from here while playing poker in Caesars poker room and it is pretty good food from what I have seen. Having said that I cannot say the same for their service in my particular case. I'm sorry with me you only get one shot at my business I really see no reason to go back after my initial experience. I would rather go to Bachi Burger by my house and only spend $40-$50 for an even better quality meal that you will get here. 

Sorry Gordon I just call them the way I see them , from watching all your shows I was honestly shocked by the service we encountered. End Rant!!

I am a huge fan of GR food shows and feel, if Pub & Grill were on Kitchen Nightmares, there would be some needed changes.   Perhaps he is just collecting the check and isn't as close to how the restaurant is being run?

While it wasn't a nightmare dining experience, it was disappointing because I know the hell GR puts other restaurants through.

Misses:  French soup was not a soup but an onion stew.  Way overdone on the onions and the bread was burnt on the edges.

Shepherd's Pie had greasy gravy instead of a well-developed flavorful, thick gravy.  

The service was fast on delivering the food and drinks but slow on clearing plates, not getting the right entree in front of the right person (that has to be an expected from GR!?) and checking back in, not bringing malt vinegar automatically for fish & chips nor a lime for a vodka and tonic.

Hits:  Atmosphere was fun, if a little loud.

Mini Burger Sliders were small but tasty.

Mashed potatoes on top of the shepherd's pie - so smooth and well executed.

Fish for the fish and chips.  Pretty close to the real thing!

Fairly varied drink/beer list.

Expect the typical LV jacked up prices.  It would have almost been worth it if all had been executed in true GR fashion.

This place was very good. Atmosphere was good and the price was little pricey though the food was plentiful and delicious. We had a god waitress that went through the menu well. The tomato soup is excellent!!!  Thank you

Me and my girlfriend were in Vegas for my bday. We were seeing a show at Caesars and decided to eat here before. I had the bangers and my girlfriend had the steak and ale pie. We were both disappointed with our dishes. My bangers tasted like frozen sausages/hot links from the market. We ate out all the time during our 5 days in Vegas and this is the only place we wouldn't visit again. The only reason this review isn't one star, is because the service was good.

The staff is very quick to inform that they do not have a children's menu or chicken tenders, snorting that it's "a British pub". They seemed insulted that I'd dared to even ask. I know it's Vegas, but plenty of people have kids there.

My wife and I recently visited Las Vegas for our anniversary. As HUGE Gordon Ramsay fans we had the goal of visiting all 4 of the Gordon Ramsay Vegas restaurants (Steak, Pub, Burgr, and Fish and Chips). Friday afternoon we chose to start our GR Tour of Vegas at the Pub and Grill. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted and seated. Within a few min we were introduced to our server Joe. For anyone reading this, please ask to sit in Joe's section. His friendliness, and knowledge of the menu was refreshing. He was able to make some suggestions that sounded amazing, however after seeing the nachos Gordon Ramsay posted on his Instagram we couldn't help but give them a try, and boy are we glad we did! They are out of this world! In addition to the nachos we enjoyed a chicken pesto sandwich. While the flavor was amazing I almost cracked a tooth about half way through on a chicken bone. I discreetly brought this to Joe's attention so he could give the chef a heads up for future sandwiches. What was impressive, is where most servers acknowledge and nothing ever comes of it, he immediately spoke to his manager Derek who came over to apologize and even went as far as offering us a dessert. To think I almost left needing dental work, but still feel compelled to give a 5 star rating should tell you how great Joe and Derek were! They both truly understand the meaning of customer service and I hope someone at the Gordon Ramsay Group reads this to provide them with the recognition they deserve! 

PS - The sticky toffee is to die for and personally I think it has Steak beat!

The specialty drinks are delicious, especially when followed by the fish and chips. Our server Nicole was awesome...knowing with just a glance whether we needed attention or a few minutes to peruse the menu.  The brussel sprouts were delectable...a perfect complement to the meal. Dont forget dessert!  It was jard to decide between bread pudding and sticky toffee pudding, so we had both.  And we were not sorry. Our only suggested improvement is purse hooks for the high top tables.  We look forward to our next visit.

Drinks great.   Food great.   Service , well theBest ever. We really enjoyed the great service of  David Su. He was very knowledgeable of drinks , food, even when we asked him why there was a big red dot painted on our table. He was there when we needed him   He could even get our jokes. I think I  surprised him by calling the manager on the phone to say how much we really thought he did a great job to take care of all 6 of us. 
David Su if you read this I pray only greatness and success in your life. You are a great employee. 
GREAT!!! We will be back

Such a Ripoff... The food here sucks.. Definitely not what I was expecting. We complained to the manager because not even a single entree we ordered was good. He gave us a discount initially but because the food and service was of such bad quality he assured us we would not be charged for the lunch. The next day there was a charge on my card which returned my money back to my account. I was Happy at least they are considerate about their customers  but no they charged me back the same amount week later and when chase disputed my charge they denied they had allowed a refund... What a bunch of D!%ks

And isn't Gordon Ramsey British ??? I guess fish and chips is their only Specialty......How can you fuck that up so royally ???? I think all that shouting on his shows has messed up the recipe for his Lamb Burger and the Pathetic dish which he assumes is Butter chicken (My Dog could cook better than that )

I rather eat on a Taco Stand in Vegas than come back here again .... Stay Away Guys ...

This place is absolutely amazing!!! The staff is on point, and very knowledgeable and attentive to guests needs and wants. I am a local and very rarely visit the strip, but we scored tickets to Mariah. We knew the pub would be busy based on location, and it was. We opted for the bar, due  to time restrictions. Evan was our bartender he steered us the right way with both food and beverage, and we were out on time. We also were visited by both the GM Louie, and manager Manny!!! If I were you, I would visit whenever in the area. This place was a huge hit!!!

My party were treated terribly here. We ordered a round of drinks which arrived very slowly. Much later we ordered our meal. When we tried to order a second round of drinks (light beer, not liquor) we were told we were too drunk!  When we asked to pay for our drinks and leave they tried to charge for the food which after 40 minutes had still not arrived.  When they finally brought the bill for the drinks only we were attended to by numerous staff, something that had been lacking all night.   So many better places to eat in Vegas. Don't go for the flashy celebrity name. Go somewhere with a good atmosphere and friendly service instead. (And where they don't charge $24 for shepherds pie. Ground beef and mashed potato - seriously?!?)

Thank goodness British cuisine has gone well beyond the disappointing renditions here. It's a sports bar, with the worst decor and rooms imaginable. Furnishings are deep chairs and an ad hoc selection of tables and other chair types - none of which are for dining.  The men's room had a latrine 'out of order' ... as well as towels strewn all over the bathroom. It was a bit shocking.

The food is unremarkable at best. The 'most popular dishes' are Shepard's pie and fish and chips. Well golly, who would have thought?
I had the pie....served truly scalding hot and more like a school lunch version. I also had a few chips...a bit limp and then lamp heated into a old fry. Dear God in Heaven - somebody either straighten this place out, or close it. Such valuable real estate across from Caesars Colosseum deserves so much better. I will never return, and suggest you don't either.
I feel so bad for the many nice people who work there.

Really poor experience tonight in Gordon's pub and grill at Ceasars. The food has taken a nose dive since the last time we came here in July.
The french fries were old, the steak and ale pie pastry was also old and had obviously been either standing for a few hours before it was served to my wife.
Sausage and mash - mash was really dry and hard.
The scotch eggs appetizer was pathetic.
The only savior for the experience was our server who was excellent, otherwise it would be a two star rating.
I hope someone from Gordon Ramsey's staff reads this and takes some action, but I'm sorry to say I wouldn't take the risk of going to this particular restaurant again. I'm sure If Gordon ate what we did tonight, he would be ashamed.

I've never written a review, but I felt very compelled to do so for this restaurant. Our bill for two was $127 including two glass of wine and no appetizers.  For this price we were expecting the food to be exceptional...and it definitely was not!  We left disappointed and unsatisfied. The food was mediocre and lacked flavor...it was very bland.  Service was also very slow and our pub table was very tall making it difficult to eat comfortably. We love Gordon Ramsey's tv show and were hoping for excellence. For a man who reprimands people for lack of taste, flavor, and service, we were expecting more. We will not be back to eat at this restaurant.

This place is awesome. Our server Travis was friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu. He always kept checking on us and kept the drinks coming. I Had the wings for appetizer and the Hell's Kitchen burger. Very flavorful and had the right amount of heat. For dessert the toffee bread pudding was very moist and tasty. I recommend you give it a try you won't be disappointed.

I have never been more disappointed in my LIFE!!! my first experience was so amazing I am now this thinking I imagined the the whole thing.  We were a party of 7 with reservations and we were completely forgotten about..... yes forgotten.... I guess other dinners were more deserving of our food. After 2 hours of being nice and waiting we all snapped and were ready to go. Our imcompentent waiter seemed surprised when we said we were tired of waiting of....REALLY???!!!!! if he had done his job we would have spent a fortune on alcohol while waiting but he didn't do that right either.  The only good thing he did was tell the manager we were leaving who had enough common sense to stop by and did comp what we did get while waiting.  We left and the tip is we should have gone somewhere else. The hubby wanted to stop later in the week for a drink I said NEVER AGAIN for any reason. I would not Wang 7 people to walk out and also being platinum and diamond total reward members.....I have been telling everyone and writing lots about my trip isn't there a saying about telling two people who tell two people and so on.......all I can say is don't waste your time or money.
Nice,  food was good but not amazing.  Atmosphere was great and service was average.  Yelp map was wrong on location.

ordered the corn beef sandwich. it was more like a grilled cheese sandwich.  took my group forever to get my food and it was dead.  overpriced and overrated. Gordon you need to do something about this mis managed shot out spot.  woulda rather went to mc donalds. your doing real bad gordon real bad.
Food is very good. Atmosphere is well planned. But our waiter was snotty and not friendly at all. Barely spoke as he took our orders, just nodded.

My husband and I are big Ramsay fans and while visiting Vegas decided to eat at all 3 of his restaurants. This one was our favorite by far.  The service was phenomenal and the food was great too! Our waiter and who ever the other server was were outstanding.  They took time to talk and joke with us.   Definitely a place we will come back too! Bottom line: great food and great customer service.

Surprisingly mediocre. We met a bunch of friends at the restaurant for lunch the day Bon Appetit's Uncork'd festival was going on at the hotel. The restaurant wasn't too busy and we got in with no wait. 

Service was really slow. Appetizers came out reasonably quick but entrees took forever.

Tried the pub pretzels which were quite good. They're served with a cheddar sauce and mustard. Fair warning: the mustard is quite hot, like Chinese mustard hot. Good but if you're not expecting it you'll be surprised.

I started with the English ale and onion soup. Very good.

A friend and I split the lamb burger with feta cheese. The burger was quite bland. Really could have used salt and even the feta was on the bland side. On the plus side it was cooked perfectly.

We really expected a bit more, especially since Chef Ramsey was in town for the event that evening. We much prefer Public House or Todd English's P.U.B.

Stopped by here when we noticed they were having Happy Hour. The nice thing is they honor happy hour pricing through out the restaurant, and not just at the bar. We ordered the half order of wings, mini burger, short rib nachos, and the sticky toffee pudding.

$30 for a happy hour meal was pretty awesome. The food was super tasty. I think my favorite was the short rib nachos, because they were made using kettle chips cooked from in house. The sticky toffee pudding was a nice ending touch. I'm obsessed with this dessert now. I'd definitely come back for happy hour next time we are in Vegas.

The only reason I am giving this place 1 star is because we never got to eat.  We put our name down at 6pm and was told it would be a 20 minutes wait. After 30 I asked and was told 10 minutes. At this point everyone behind us had already been seated. We ended up leaving so we could get to our show. At 7 pm an hour after giving our name I received a text that our table was ready. Wish we could have tried the food. This is why living in Vegas we stay away from the Strip. Sorry Gordan Ramsey you really are one of my favorites.

Definitely not worth a detour. 
What bothered us is the extreme noise level (loud rock music), the slow service, the prices are high because of the name on the door. It is also adjacent to the casino and therefore a lot of smoke comes into the place. 
The food was tasty but not a great deal.
Will not come back.
Stopped in for a quick drink with friends and we all ordered the same thing - the goodbye blue sky. It was a really delicious cocktail and I could of had at least 2 more!

Gordan Ramsay should consider featuring this restaurant on his show Kitchen Nightmares. At some moments, I thought there must be secret cameras filming my exasperating experience for the sake of entertainment and reality TV. But alas, it was just an unintentionally underwhelming dining experience.

I ordered the beef burger, and it was delicious. Juicy, huge, well seasoned and cooked as I requested, medium. Served with ketchup and garlic aioli on a soft bun, it was decadent, rich and meaty, everything one would need after a night out in Vegas. However delicious, I found it to be extremely plain. No options for toppings or anything could have offered some freshness. Just a meat patty, bun and bacon. I can't say it was worth the over $20 price tag for a burger alone. The accompanying fries were nothing special. The fish and chips were good, but extremely oily. I loved that they were huge, thick chunks of fish, and the batter was crispy and flavorful. But just a little too greasy for my taste.

Service is undeniably what put a damper on our experience. Our food took an eternity to come out. The two tables next to us were seated, ate their meals, and even paid their bill all in the time it took for our party of six to receive our food. When we asked for the check, it took an eternity for our credit cards to be processed. Most of our meal was spent anxiously waiting, either for the food, drink refills, and finally, the bill. There was no sense of urgency, and the restaurant was less than half full.  For a restaurant of Gordon Ramsay repute, the service was baffling. I wish he were there to scream at the chef and waitstaff to hurry the f**k up.

Located in Cesar's Palace, this restaurant doesn't seem to get too crowded so it's a good choice for a decent meal if you want to eat somewhere other than the food court or the lines for more popular establishments are too long.

We came here for lunch after walking around the forum shops.  They sat us immediately and the server was really friendly. Great truffle fries.  The menu has an americanized British spin.  Lots of tvs everywhere to catch the latest game.  Service and food was prompt.  Good place for lunch if you are Caesars. Lots of bat seating as well as dining room seating.

My brother and I really wanted to eat here because we used to watch a lot of Gordon Ramsay food shows. We had high expectations for this restaurant and we were definitely not disappointed. The food was amazing and the service was also really good! 

I ordered the lobster Mac and cheese, which was really delicious! There was a lot of lobster inside the Mac and cheese, which made the price worth it. For dessert, I ordered the sticky toffee pudding, which was also really yummy!

I went here last night for dinner. It was mediocre from start to finish. We were seated at a high top table and the stools were comfortable but had no back support, so you want to eat and not linger. 

Their wine selection is abysmal and the server was so excited "about our many beers". Really? Maybe because I'm from Michigan and we have usually have at least 10-20 craft beers on tap. The beer selection was rather boring at the Pub and Grill and topped out at maybe 12 beers. 

I got the Braised Short Rib and while it was fall off the bone tender, there was nothing spectacular about it. It was simply atop some plain old mashed potatoes with a few undercooked carrots and parnsips on the periphery. Certainly not worth near the $40. I don't think I would ever eat here again. Not that it was a horrible experience but because there was nothing special about anything.

Wow do I have to give it a 1? That seems high.  Daisy was our waitress who we did not see all night after she introduced herself.  I had the 2 lamb chops which were fatty and small ($38).  The glass of Pino was fine ($13)  but served in a tiny glass probably purchased at wal-mart.  The special fries were almost raw.  The lady at the table next to us had spoiled sea food and I think they were going to charge her for it.

Oh Gordon....where to begin. I've looked forward for so long to try this place out and the best way I can explain it is to think about the Price is Right song when people lose on the show......yeah exactly.

We were in Vegas for opening weekend of the tournament and originally had reservations for Gordon's steak house but after conversing with our bartender a couple days prior he mentioned that pub would be better suited for a larger group. We arrived for our reservation after seeing Seinfeld and were seated promptly, after that its ALL DOWNHILL. It took over 20 minutes just to get water! When the server finally came over he looked confused and to be honest a little pretentious.  I would have expected this from his steakhouse but not the pub. Anyway we put in our appetizer order, calamari and shrimp cocktail, which came out in piece meal again not seeing our waiter this entire time. I will say the shrimp cocktail was the best part of the meal (that's why they received a star) but the calamari left something to be desired. Two people in our party ordered the prime rib and after specifically asking the server how it was given the time (it was 10pm) he noted that it was perfectly cooked and good to go, however what they received was a tough gray log. I ordered the tenderloin medium rare and it came out medium....at best, it was definitely more gray then pink. My one friend might have had it right just ordering a chicken sandwich!

All in all, I was very disappointed by this place and can say that I will not be going back. The things that Gordon prides himself on, service and perfectly cooked food, were surely lacking.

Let me just start by saying that I do not understand the 1 and 2 star ratings. Perhaps there are some disillusioned expectations due to his status as a celebrity chef. Or maybe people are just pickier on the Strip ;)

We went with one of the fixed menu options.

Soup - Cream of Cauliflower. This was excellent. And I say that as some one who normally abhors cauliflower.  The curry oil was a wonderful, warm touch.

Fish and Chips - The batter was delicious and the portion of fish was generous. More then enough food on the plate, I was pleasantly surprised. The chips were some of the best I have ever had. Fresh potatoes and the shaved cheese was super flavorful

Shepherd's Pie - My husband ordered this but of course I had to sneak a bite. Smooth, creamy potatoes. The meat was tender and the vegetables still had a nice flavor to them that was not covered up by the broth from the meat. I am not normally a fan of lamb but this was pretty dang good!

Dessert - Sticky Toffee Pudding. This was my first time trying sticky toffee pudding but I am now a converted fan. I wanted to take a bath in the sauce that was poured all over the cake and the sweet cream ice cream was fantastic.

Peanut Butter & Jelly Cobbler - My husband picked this based on our server's recommendation (the sticky toffee pudding was her first recommendation but she said this was her second choice since we wanted to order different things). This was way different then any cobbler I have ever had. But it wasn't a bad thing! The crumble part tasted kind of like a crumbled up peanut butter cookie and the filling was reminiscent of black berry jam. The jam was not overly sweet so it wasn't overwhelming at all. We actually really liked it.

The service was attentive and informative. Our drinks never got below half before someone came by to refill. I was nervous after seeing so many complaining reviews but again. After going to the restaurant I really have no idea what those reviews are talking about. I would certainly recommend this place to anyone who was visiting or simply wanted to try Gordon Ramsey's food without paying the steak house prices. 

We will be trying his Burgr restaurant next!
I went there for lunch and it was horrible. Overpriced, mediocre food and servers in the goofiest uniforms I have seen in some time. Save your money and aggravation.

I was invited back to try a meal and am so happy that we went!  From the moment we entered the restaurant, we were treated well.  We ordered mac and cheese, a burger and bangers and mash.  For dessert we had a warm chocolate cake & mousse. Every dish was amazing!!!  I cannot say enough good things about the staff, service and food!  I know I will be back and ensure all my friends and family visit this restaurant while in Vegas.  Thank you to all of the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill staff for a delicious and memorable experience!
The service, food, and atmosphere was outstanding. I made a reservation the day before. We were seated promptly upon check in. I will definitely be back.

I've actually been to this restaurant twice; once for lunch and once for dinner.  Both experiences were exceptional.  The first time I tried Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill I was looking for something affordable yet indicative of the reputation of Gordon Ramsay.  

I looked the eatery up on the website and decided that a great way to test the waters would be to stop in for lunch.  We had a reservation, but we arrived early.  They sat us right away.  The atmosphere was interesting and industrial.  Large beer kegs lined the walls and pictures of Ramsay scattered the hallway.  There was a punk feel and a deliberately English design with emphasis on reds.  

My husband had a burger and I had bangers and mash.  For appetizers we had the soft pretzels and I had the onion soup.  When I tried the English ale onion soup I was furious.  I am a 41 year old woman.  I have been cooking for over 20 years and I managed a commercial cookware store.  I'd like to think I know a thing or two about cooking.  That soup... it was so light.  The cheese on the croutons was so creamy.  My heavy, rich onion soup made with red wine pales in comparison.  The onions were sweet and perfectly caramelized just so slightly.  What a difference.  It occurred to me that that everything I thought I knew about cooking was absolutely 2nd rate.  It also was a portent or the next to come.  Sausages so flavorful and delicate... I was expecting heavy, filling pub food.  I received a delightful surprise.  The wait staff was expedient and attentive.  I was happy with the portions.  I didn't need a take home box at all.    

Because of this experience my husband and I went right on Facebook and told everyone what an amazing time we had.  Of course when my cousin was in town for a sales meeting from Boston recently, it gave us the perfect excuse to return.  I spoke of that onion soup all the way there.  I've been searching for that recipe to no avail!

Again we arrived early and again we were seated immediately.  Boy was it busy!  We still had an attentive waitstaff though and my glass was never empty.  Music like Joy Division played and our waiter brought a round of ale.  He asked if we were in a hurry.  We said no and proceeded to work our way through roasted vegetables, smelt, scallops, onion soup, shepherd's pie and sticky toffee pudding.     

EVERYTHING was amazing.  It was an experience to savor and although the restaurant was quite busy, we never felt rushed even though we were there for about 2 hours.  The next day I asked my cousin if I could bring some sushi up to her hotel.  She said she was in meetings all day then would fly back to Boston.  I said maybe next time then.  She said next time she comes to Las Vegas we're eating at Gordon Ramsay's again.  Forget sushi!

This is the worst place I have ever eaten in Vegas. The fish and chips are mediocre and the pulled pork sandwich was disgusting. I even got food poisoning from here. You may not believe me but that day I only ate there and at night Gordon Ramsey Steak. This was the only food I had my boyfriend didn't try and he didn't get sick. I love all the other gordan ramsey restaurants so go to one of those and avoid this one.

Going to a Gordon Ramsay Restaurant we were expecting the best. Especially when Gordon Ramsay is on his restaurant show telling other people that their food is shit. Well, this shit wasn't far from it!  We came in for happy hour and it was less than impressed. Service was slow, yet they were not even close to being busy. Our sever took at least 10 minutes before she greeted us. We did notice she enjoyed visiting the staff more than serving guests.  When she did come to see us we ordered asap since we did not know when she was going to come back. We each ordered the the $5 pulled pork sandwich. It was tiny for $5 and the flavor was not there. We also ordered onion rings and those were served with some kind of port demi sauce.  What the heck was that?  It said on the menu and aioli.  We asked the sever if the demi sauce was right and she said no. So she replaced it later when we only had two onions rings left.  Oh goodie.  We also ordered the wedge salad which is $16.  Now, when you order a wedge salad, it comes with a blue cheese dressing. Why in the world would it come out soaked in a vinaigrette on top of blue cheese dressing?  Is that a British thing?  The combination of the two was not good.  I can't say we plan on returning due to poor service and so-so food.  We were both really surprised that the food and service wasn't up to par since Gordon Ramsay was at Caesar's Palace the following day for the 50th anniversary of the casino.
Scallops were amazing!!  Thank you for the free desert for my two sons for their birthdays, which was this past Sunday.  Evey was awesome!!

So incredibly disappointed. We've had better truffle fries at our local Cinépolis movie theater, better tomato soup at Panera, and a spicier, more flavorful  burger at Friday's. And then the pain of a $75 dollar bill to top it off.

If you're looking for horrible, you can find it here. I suspect that chef Ramsay sold the rights to his name. The food was hideous, the fries were reheated and probably came in large plastic bags from an industrial operation. The chopped salad was wilted and contained bits of disgusting salami and something that was supposed to be shrimp (???). Everything was greasy. On top of it, the high price didn't match the service or the quality. The waiter spilled a drink over an iPhone. Just a horrible experience overall.

I got pretty lucky when I came her being a diamond card holder for Caesars entertainment group, I missed the 45 minute wait and got seated immediately  

The thing I enjoyed here was the service. Not sure if it was preferential because of my status or if it's a standard offering. Waiter was personable and had nice, short conversations with us. Order the clam appetizer and it was ok. Not much to brag about, tasty but I've had better. 

Wife ordered the chicken plate and she couldn't stop raving about it. Paired nicely with some pesto and gnocchi (I totally stole her gnocchi) and that was pretty good. Pesto was super rich and creamy, loved the flavor and the smoothness of it. 

I order the chop salad but those are boring to review. Kinda disappointed with the flavor. Felt pretty bland to me but again, who the hell cares about a review of a salad. Don't make the same mistake as me

I recommend checking it out but don't go out of your way to eat at this place. Vegas offers a lot of great restaurants, happy eating.

They don't have ranch dressing and you better bloody well not ask for it! 

I guess this is the restaurant people go to when the line for the buffet is too long. 

It is over priced. ($9.00 for 7 green olives!) Kinda pretentious and mean. 

Thet mac and cheese wasn't bad.
We split a lamb burger and a Caesar salad. Black Butte porter and a red beer went down easy. Nicole steered us towards a delicious, light, and satisfying meal for two.
Food was amazing, price was reasonable, and great, friendly service from Kerry & Scott. Would definitely visit again!

Terrible service, food was over priced and bland. Manager was an A hole. Will not go back nor will I recommend this place to anyone. The worst restaurant experience I have ever had. If I was Ramsay I would be ashamed to have my name on this place.

On May 1, 2015, my wife and I had dinner at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. We had had dinner there previously and truly enjoyed the food and service. However, on this occasion, the dinner started out on a bad foot. We ordered wine, which the servicer promptly delivered to us. My wife's glass wasn't clean. So, we told the servicer, who quietly took the glass away and bought my wife another glass. Again, the glass had a sticky film inside. So, we told the servicer and that's when the attitude started. He took the glass without any apology and disappeared for well over 10 minutes. So, we started to leave, when the host called the manager, Randell Goldich, who saved our evening by one apologizing, and two, by providing a server (Stacy B.), who gave us exceptional service thorough the dinner service. The food was excellent. I'll will definitely return to one of my favorite TV celebrity's (Gordon Ramsay) restaurant. This is a clear case of not allowing one bad apple to spoil the bunch.

All I know is that the Fish & Chips mostly the Fish was the best we have ever had hands down. I eat fish & chips all the time and never has it been that good. I'm not gonna lie this place is not cheap but worth every penny. Our family tried 3 different dishes. My son had the Salmon which he loved and myself and my other son had the steak and chips. All were delicious but the fish was amazing. The service was great and they were playing all 80's which my wife loves. Oh Oh I can't forget the sticky pudding, I'm drooling just thinking about it. My only complaint was the limited menu and the prices but I expect nothing less then paying for good food and good it was.
Great place to have dinner and drinks great atmosphere food is definitely awesome and u get ur monies worth

There are 15 of us here from California and Alaska to see the Elton John Million Dollar Piano concert at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, Nevada. The concert was nothing shot of incredible by the way, strongly recommend it. We all went to Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill in Caesars Palace for dinner before the concert. They put us in our own private dining room. Now I watch Gordon Ramsay's TV Kitchen Nightmares and he is always screaming at restaurant owners to keep the menu short and sweet and the importance of outstanding food and customer service. It was reassuring to see that his words are not wasted in his own restaurant. The menu, short and sweet. The staff were exceedingly kind, polite, and accommodating. Even the manager popped in to check on us. The food was very good. I wished I could remember the name of our waiter, but in all the hubbub I forgot, but he was excellent. I too, like Mr. Ramsay, expect good service and good food, I was not disappointed. I highly recommend this restaurant, and the concert if you have interest!

Pretty pricey for pub food (we spent over $200 for 3 people) but everything was seasoned superbly!!! Had the calamari and salmon with crispy skin. Great with the exception of being a little oily. The sticky toffee pudding is to die! Get that dessert if anything! The cocktails are also very good! I would definitely go back!

I stayed in Caesar's Palace in January 2015 and knew we had to give this place a whirl. We stopped by for a late lunch, and right from the start I knew the food was going to be delicious. Our waitress knew everything you could possibly know about the dishes offered there. The atmosphere was nice, but nothing fancy -- space was limited since it's inside Caesar's Palace, and the entry to the restaurant is open and wide, so you can do all the people-watching you want as tourists and gamblers trot by. It was quiet when we ate there, with a couple of other people scattered here and there. I enjoyed the *#@& out of my chicken pesto sandwich on mint bread. I would definitely go back to this restaurant to try something else if I could, because there were lots of interestingly-titled dishes screaming at me on the menu. Yay for Gordon Ramsay.

Had Dinner there on Wednesday night this week and really enjoyed it. The truffle fries and aioli were my favorite and the beef tenderloin was cooked perfectly! Goodnight Blue Sky was a very refreshing, and tasty drink after walking the strip the whole afternoon. Would absolutely dine here again!

WOW!

Amazing and attentive service. Very cool and chill atmosphere. Our server gave us a free drink because (although we didn't ask) her recommended app was not mafist-friendly (people who don't eat mammals... its a real thing, look it up!). My friend's beef main was incredible, I really enjoyed the fish and chips, this was a dining highlight in Las Vegas which should not be missed!

Came here last night with some friends. Took us an HOUR to get our food. We kept asking when our food was coming and the server kept saying "it's on it's way" (it wasn't). It wasn't even busy and the server kept attending to the other tables ignored us for a very long time. Our server gave us some pretzels to hold us over, but we were still hungry. After our meal was finished, we felt still bothered by the fact our waiter was incredibly discourteous to us, so we asked to speak to a manager. The manager kept saying "oh if you told me earlier, I might have been about to do something" to which we replied "we kept asking where our food was." The manager comped 2 drinks for our friends, but this entire place is a poor excuse for an incredible name like Gordon Ramsey.

We actually thought it was pretty hilarious.. the soup we ordered was served first (butternut for me.. french onion for him) and it was fine..not fabulous but good and we were hopeful. Then came the pork .. considering the way Mr. Ramsay goes on and on, screaming and yelling at people about their ineptness in the kitchen it was downright funny. This meat was hard as a rock and completely inedible.  In the waiter's defense I did see him show this meat to the manager..stabbing at it as if to say ...see? and  no they didn't attempt to charge us for it.. they offered to make more but we were leery so alas we left  with our appetites only whetted. Kind of fun atmosphere, and nice waiter.. but oh Gordon how can you justify being so rude when your own cooks don't have it together?

This place is very nicely decorated inside. Food is very good and flavorful. The only reason I'm giving them a 2 star is because the food takes a really long time. If you request sauce on the side or any substitutions they don't do it. All they say is I'm sorry. I didn't send it back because I didn't want to wait the same time. Server never followed up with us for more drinks. Which is was disappointing. With all the competition around I would come here again. Lacks service. The only happy guy around was the hostess and Busser.

We were a party of 9. Our large group was easily accommodated - we didn't have reservations. Our waitress was very good. We had the burgers (lamb & beef), blt, wedge salad and pretzel sticks. Everything was delicious! Prices were what you should expect for an upscale pub! I recommend it!

One of my favorite places in vegas to eat. We have been here twice for lunch. First time was Christmas 2012. For appetizer we had the fantastic Duck Confit Poutine. it was so good all the way to bottom where there is more confit.. My daughter had the mac and cheese and son in law the fish and chips which the catsup was awesome homemade. I had the irish beef cheek stew which  I could eat 5 times a week and still crave it. it is so wonderful.  Service is good

Get the lamb burger!  It's so juicy and flavorful and yummmm.  I wish every burger place in the world has something like it.
