The fries were decent and the gourmet ketchup served along with it was pretty tasty.  They also had $1 mimosa refills when I came here.  Great service.  I would definitely come again.

Came with a large group since we were staying in the hotel. For an appetizer we ordered a lobster roll that was well seasoned but very small. Their signature salad was not seasoned well and the ingredients didn't compliment each other. I had the beef tenderloin that was not seasoned at all and I was very disappointed. My cousin had the ribeye and it was more seasoned and had a better flavor. The service was slow and it took us 2 hours from the time we sat down until they brought us our checks Also we had a specialty cake and we were charged $3 per slice but they didn't cut or help serve the cake, for them to hold the cake which was a bit ridiculous since we spend over $60 per person here and we had 15 people I our party. If you have a choice for the price I would say skip the restaurant unless you really want a $15 burger. But hey it's Vegas!

We walked in starving and left full. That is the only reason for the second star. The waitress was friendly and attentive but the food was far from delicious. My BF and I got the overpriced hardly 2 portion lobster roll app then split the fish and chips and the burger for lunch. Burger was way overcooked and all you could taste was the char from the grill. Fish was alright, pretty standard, nothing to remember. Being locals we love to experience different places but we will never return. Wish we would have read the reviews before we decided..

I went with a group of 8 people. Everyone was disappointed. The food was bland and very expensive. I order the $45 ribeye and it was just average. Because there are no sides with the steak (or any meal) the waiter suggested I ordered one. I paid $11 for slimy mushrooms. My husband ordered the Shepherds Pie for $25. It was very small and lacked flavor. 

I'm so disappointed that we spent $129 for a dinner that was only average. Each person at our table had the same feeling. I won't return.

Fancy, clean, great service, good tasting food. The expectations for this place were high. And was I right. Everything tasted very good . Service was fast. I got the chicken wings with truffle fries with the special spicy sauce they prepare thenselves and wow was it good. A must try. Also the bacon burger was delicious.

well taking the rents out to dinner however there was a few things that went wrong. 



The beet salad -- I ended up biting down on something hard that almost chipped my tooth see picture -- it was either a hard pine nut or something however not roasted nor edible I thought I was eating something other then a salad. Also the ridicule salad part ( mix with arugula ) was very sandy or harder then normal. However the beet part and the goat cheese part along with the dressing was nice. 


The order was beer battered fish -- cough 29.00$ I shure Gordon you don't offer that price in your England restaurants. was good 

My dad got a medium temp burger that was done on the rarer side - witch put him off . however ingredients mixed nicely. 

Mine well -- ( ale pie ) the filling was amazing however I was thinking it would be more like the shepherds pie with piped mashed potatoes like Gordon Ramsey always to have tips on his other then his hair lol. But the filling aspect was great however the mashed made it feel more like a meat chicken pot pie taste .. ( dont get me wrong it was good I am not shure the topping is wright. ) 

Spotted dc ( yes I abbreviated it ) lol . was great -- I know they stress on that. 

Overall 3 meals a little confusion with seating etc. -- Also we where set back in the part with tvs for the game -- Witch was blaring -- I am 30 not old - couldn't even hear our server 

I would be willing to give it another review at a latter date - due to fact I love hells kitchen. but will be back since I am a local know well obiv with over 80 something reviews in las vegas.

Walked in and thought it was bloody boujie.    But boy was I wrong. They sat us in right away and I didnt even have to slip them a 20 to be first in line. There service was impeccable. We changed tables as many times as the color wheel from twister. The waitress gave us her recommendations and the lamb burger was to die for. The first bite I took was filled with creamy savory feta and carmalized onions that just make u think of being on vacation and remembering the first step u took out of the plane watching the sun set in the horizon. Yes it was like an oasis in my mouth accompanied by a savory but lean and juicy lamb patty that was perfectly spiced. The lamb was so delicious I had to buy the chef a shot of patron. Kudos chef ramsey. I was so stuffed that I couldn't make room for dessert. So I excused myself from the table and threw up in the restroom so i could have some of their world famous bread pudding.  I cant even begin to describe the bread pudding. Its consistency was more like a cake that crumbled as it touch my lips. The ice cream was light and whipped with crunchy peanut brittle that made me pause from reading shades of gray. Yes it was that good.  Chef ramsey left my loins on fire. Kudos!!!!
Amazing!!! Met the chef for my birthday which was amazing. Food was delicious and drinks were tasty. The waitress did a great job of providing recommendations for items.

Great service and yummy food. I have never known a bar to mess up on a Black and Tan beer TWICE so that was a little disappointing. Good wine selection and are great at pairing with your meal. The rosemary buns make the burgers and sandwiches and the Sticky Toffee Pudding is top notch! One of the few places on the strip that didn't make me feel like shit after eating here. I'll definitely be adding this to the list of places I have to go every time I'm in Vegas.
Food was very good, first time trying fish n chips and it was very good (and I hate fish). Atmosphere was nice, food was beautifully seasoned and tasted great. Overall a must try if your in Vegas.

Came here with a friend for lunch during a layover. Adam, our server was charming and attractive. In addition to the hip ambiance, he was the best part of my visit.

I ordered a soda water with lime and the Pistachio Pesto Chicken Sandwich. Having watched Gordon Ramsey's reality TV shows and how he verbally berates others for their lackluster cooking abilities I had high expectations of his kitchen creations. Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed. The chicken was dry and there wasn't enough flavor in the seemingly flavorful myriad of ingredients. 

Upon receiving my bill and after scoffing at the $5 charge for my H2CO3, including the tip I was out $30 for a boring chicken sandwich, fries, and carbonated water.

Clearly, I won't be returning.

Still sitting here waiting for our waiter like we have been all afternoon. He's a ghost. 
The food was nothing special. You are paying for the name. My sandwich didn't say anything about having mayo on it on the menu but when I received it, it had mayo.
We waited forever for everything. My boyfriend actually had to get up and walk up to the waiter twice to get his attention.

I was at their venue last night, but just didn't had a chance to write out a review. 
So, I'll just cut to the chase. I intend to rate it 4.5 stars, but kind of hard to swallow the .5, so, I'll leave it at 4 stars, due to couple reasons. 
If I'm bringing a group of six adults for dinner after the CES convention week, I just assumed this will be a great place to experience the actual GR food. No to mention, two of my guests are GR fans, so, why not give it a try, right? 
The overall food experience was good, I wish I could've said great! I first ordered the calamari as to share appetizer, and the truffle fries, which I thought is a great way to start a meal. Especially if GR had been showing how crispy he likes to make them calamari. Well...I didn't expect it to have seen the calamari to have so much tendons, AND not being somewhat crispy as I'd had hoped for. As few of us tried it, it really turned out to be a bit soft and chewy. So, we had to send it back, and ordered something else instead. 
Anyways, aside to the bad calamari, the food we ordered were delicious, we had the burgers, and few of the folks ordered the steak. It was a lot of food, but we managed to finish. 
Our server was friendly and super courteous, but perhaps they need to pay more attention to the cleanliness of their sections! Not a Ramsay standard, I'd say! ;)
The booth we got sat in, the seats weren't wiped clean, the floor were dirty and not swept properly. I understand the concept is to be a pub and setting is to be as if we are to eat inside a London pub...But, if we're to spend $45 on a Ribeyes, I'd consider that being a steak house, right? 
So, aside to the chewy calamari and cleanliness, I do enjoy the rest of the food served after, as well the rest of the folks in my table. 
#foodporn #cleanmuch #GordonRamsay #Standard #VegasRestaurant

The restaurant was too dark. The waiter was a snob and kept walking away when we were trying to order. Also, my husband and I both had stomach issues after eating here. I would not recommend this place.

This place exceeded every expectation I ever imagined.  The Scottish egg appetizer was perfectly prepared with a runny yolk.The pub lamb burger was heavenly. The beef cheek sandwich was really well cooked with a nice horseradish sauce. The Bass on draft was smooth.   Coming back for dessert for tomorrow night.

Staying at the Caesar's for the week and went to have a quick bite at Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill. We sat at the lounge part of the restaurant. Was attended by Julio! what an amazing and hilarious guy! Very few servers like him! He was polite and very helpful! He suggested the fried chicken sandwich for me and since my girlfriend likes meat! She has the corn beef sandwich which was delicious! He took his time to conversate and have a good time! He didn't rush us or was money hungry! We will be coming back very soon!
Well the food was great I had a burger with truffle gets OMG amazing . The service was superb the waiter was so nice gave us all the specials looking forward to coming here again !!!

Although the employees are kind, this place is a mess. Poor location and ridiculously expensive. They didn't even have fish and chips on their menu. I think the man himself needs to clean this place up.

Not worth the time. We went on a Friday night and were thoroughly underwhelmed. Took 20 minutes to get drinks. The appetizers actually came before our drinks did I have never seen that before. The onion soup was pretty good every one else's appetizers were roughly OK not bad but not exactly up to the expected quality that the name attached to the restaurant would suggest. Main courses were nothing special the flat iron steak was disappointing basically a fancy way of saying fried -undercooked on the inside burnt black on the outside I'd say that was quite an accomplishment if it wasn't my food. Wife had the fingerling potatoes that the waiter suggested we're the best potatoes he's ever had. My guess is that he hasn't had many potatoes then. They were very bland. One of our number had the fish and chips and seemed moderately happy with it though so perhaps only 5/6 people leave disappointed. Mr Ramsey should be embarrassed to have his name attached to this place. We Will never return here.

My son and I happened upon this place hunting dinner last night.  I truly enjoyed my curry.  My son ordered the short ribs.  I noticed he didn't eat much of the meat...very strange for a 17 year old!!  I could tell something wasn't quiet right....

We returned to our hotel and within three hours he became so violently Ill that he ended up in the ER on IV fluids and medications.  The doctor mentioned it was most likely something he ate, And asked when his last meal was.  Apparently the timing is perfect.  No way to prove it, but I fully believe it was this meal.

I hate that we will never go back because the place was cool and our server was wonderful.

Great place!! We initially went for happy hour but decided against it because the regular menu looked wonderful. Our waiter was an absolute delight. Very attentive & informative. Our salads (chicken, shrimp, avocado, etc.) were so filling and delicious. Our waiter convinced us to get their famous dessert. The toffee cake was one of the best desserts I've ever had (and I don't normally like toffee).

Having stayed at The London in NYC and dined both at Gordon Ramsay--which was excellent and at Maize--which was also very good, I was very disappointed with the Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill. From the start, the girl acting as Maitre D could not find the reservation that I had made with her personally the day before. There were a group of female employees--hostesses--I think who spent more time chatting g with each other than assisting guests. Very tasteless.  

The food was mediocre at best. The Caesar salad was atrocious. My colleague had the flat iron steak which was tough, fatty and "the worst steak he's ever had". I had the shepards pie, which Mr Ramsay has featured on many a special. It was good, but the presentation was mediocre...a crock of Shepard's pie that looks like someone took a crap in a bowel and served it. I had a side salad of weeds, with a tasteless vinaigrette and a few slices of apple. Hardly appealing. I would rate this dining experience 1.5 out of 5 at best. Chef, I am truly disappointed. Perhaps your Hell's Kitchen winner will liven up a rather lousy dining experience.

The staff was very nice.  Asked for sweet tea and offered to make it for us.  Had the calamari  app and fish and chips. Both were good.   Decent portions of fish and seafood.  They came out timely and hot  asked for some extras and came out without a fuss. good side sauces.

Quality food, mediocre menu. Wasn't at all impressed with the selection of "pub" food. Burgers, fish and chips... That's pretty much all they had that fit the bill. My chicken pesto Sammy was less than impressive. The overall constancy of the sandwich was soggy by the time it got to the table.

My friends and I came by last Wednesday and immediately loved the atmosphere and feel. My friends sipped on delicious Bloody Mary's while I enjoyed a Black Velvet. The tomato soup was delicious as was the fish and chips. We sensed a special vibe throughout the restaurant. Randy, the restaurant manager came by our table to see how we were doing. this surprised us, as one doesn't often get a visit by restaurant management. He told us that he hoped we would enjoy our time here and that they had a "little surprise for us". Well of course we wondered what that could be as we became intrigued.....so we stayed on.

 The restaurant had a surprise visitor, none other than Mr. Gordon Ramsay himself!!! He was there for the restaurants 3rd anniversary and surprised all his guests with free dessert. Spotted Dick, Sticky Toffee and Creme Brulé shake, all of the above were orgasmic, especially the Spotted Dick.

 It was a complete joy meeting this brilliant chef and not to mention a handsome one too! Thank you Mr. Ramsay for the surprise visit. My friends and I were impressed as to how friendly and polite you were with everyone. You were not hurried in the least and took your time with the guests. And by the way, we want to know what cologne were you wearing?? it was divine We look forward to another visit.

It was not as good as I had hoped. The fish and chips were very good with 2 large pieces of cod with a thin crispy batter.  They could have used a touch more salt, but that is my taste.  
The split pea soup was nice and creamy. 
The disappointment was the Shepard pie.  The potato top was good with a crispy top but the amount of peas and root vegetables was small.  The major fault was that the lamb had been seasoned with spices that hid the lamb flavor. I thought it had an Indian spice overtone which was uncharacteristic to someone who was born in England. 
I enjoyed the Innis and Gun ale.  Not too bitter.
We skipped dessert as we had already tried the Sticky Toffee at the Steakhouse which was very good there.

A big let down for me.  I ordered the burger with bacon.  The only thing good on that was the bacon.  Very little fat and crispy.  The burger was tasteless.  No spices at all.  Just meat flavoring.  Like buying some ground beef at the store.  Form it into a patty and cook it.  BLAH

I thought the drinks might be better but also a disappointment.  I ordered a COKE and got a flat Pepsi.

Where is the Gordon Ramsay standard?  Really wanted to slam my plate on the floor and say F&$# it!  At least the food wasn't RAW!

The fries that came with the burger are giants size and thick.  But why do I only get 3 sticks?

As huge Chef Ramsay fans, my family and I had to stop here for lunch during our trip Vegas! I had the Fish & Chips while my family had the rack of lamb, scallops, and we shared a side of basmati rice. Everything, as expected, was AMAZING. The Gordon Ramsay name obviously comes with a price tag, but the food completely lived up to the hype and was well worth the money!

Great environment (def captures the English Pub vibe, but with a modern twist), VERY friendly and helpful staff, and to top off the experience, Chef Ramsay ended up following me on Twitter. (Humble Brag -- Sorry, not sorry.)

I have three words for you: sticky. toffee. pudding.

Each of Gordon Ramsay's Las Vegas restaurants has a different take on this classic English dessert, but Pub & Grill has the BEST take on it.

Each sticky toffee pudding here comes out perfectly warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and sticky toffee syrup on the side. Drizzle the syrup over the pudding to let it soak in. Take a spoonful of pudding and ice cream. Admire its glory. Devour. Repeat. Cry when there's no more.

I seriously dream about this stuff. It's that good. If you're into beer, pair this dessert with an Innis & Gunn (also Gordon's favorite!) and you'll be set for the night.

Wow! I'm so glad I came here, everything I tried was wonderful. The filet mignon was melt in your mouth heaven, my ceasar salad was dressed perfectly and was more on the vinegary side which I liked. The sticky toffee pudding and apple crumble aren't to be missed no matter how full you are. 
Gordon Ramsay is pretty amazing!

I visited Gordon Ramsays Pub and Grill for the second time on  a recent trip to Vegas. I must say my experience was amazing. We were greeted by Randi  who seated my husband and myself  at  what was  an intimate booth which surprised us, as the restaurant was extremely  packed. As soon as we sat down I noticed Randi replacing our utensils with another set of clean utensils. He caught me looking at him when he did this and responded to me by saying "Sorry, those weren't shiny enough  ...Talk about someone being on top of their game. 
Randi then introduced us to our waiter/server, Taylor. We chitchatted for a few seconds on how our day was and then proceeded to ask him his recommendations. We started with the lobster rolls. I personally LOVE LOVE LOVE lobster, but I have reservations in regards to ordering it in cities that are far from the ocean, however the meat on these rolls were absolutely delicious. One order between my husband and I definitely was not enough. 
For our main course I got the Fish and Chips and while my husband ordered the BANGERS & MASH for himself. My meal was extremely tasty. The fish was extremely tender and did not have that oily after taste many other Fish and Chips meals come with. My assume husband enjoyed his meal as well as he did not even offer me a bite of his dinner. 
We definitely stuffed our faces during dinner and as embarrassing as this sounds, we did also end up ordering dessert, which was definitely unnecessary but extremely worth it. Their pudding cake is to die for. It is a must when visiting this restaurant.
All in all I can honestly say I had a really great experience dining here. The service was way above average. Randi and Taylor are absolute gems and made our experience wonderful. 
Taylor made sure our glasses were never empty, our food was hot when it arrived  and continuously asked us if we needed anything else throughout our dining experience. 
We are planning another trip with our entire family in the next few weeks to Vegas and we cannot wait to bring everyone back here to experience the awesome food. 
5 STARS !!!!!!!

Not very impressive overall. 

I'm a local and had high expectations for dinner. Made a 5:15 reservation to give me ample time to make a 7:30 Jerry Seinfeld show. 

Was promptly seated and had our drunk order taken, but we didn't see the waiter for 15 or so minutes. 

We each ordered salad and an entree. It's a good thing I enjoy taking with my girlfriend, because by the time the salad came, I had completely forgotten we ordered them. 

Dinner came about 6:30 and was ok. We both ordered the same thing, a small fillet, piece of pork belly, and a couple shrimp. The fillet was cooked perfectly, but the other two items were over cooked at dry. 

The manager came over to offer a free dessert for the long wait, which was appreciated. The bill came and the $11 charge was there. The show read starting and I didn't push the issue.

I can go to Flemings, spend 2/3rds the money, and get a perfectly cooked meal. I realize we're paying for his name, but I don't think our meals would have make it out of the kitchen on Hell's Kitchen....

They're plenty busy with the constant traffic in the hotel, but.....
Amazing food, service, quality and ambiance.  Lamb burger outrageously good. If you visit Vegas you have to try Gordon Ramsey Pub and Grille at Ceasars Palace, you won't be disappointed!

First visit - just a beer and a free appetizer because the kitchen or bar staff messed up an order.  Bar service was average, but the free appetizer was very good (pretzels w/ dips - not good just because it was free.)

Second visit - dinner with my lady. Great service and average food. I had the shepherds pie. Good, but expected great for the price. Pint of Lagunitas IPA was $11..... 

Third visit - just about midnight and the hostess asked if I just wanted drinks. As my answer was yes, I followed the group of 4 that were just ahead of me into the bar area. The main bar was full, so I took a seat at the end of the adjacent bar, a mere 5 feet from the main bar.  With a slight lean, I could have touched the shoulder of the gentlemen at the end.  After waiting for about 5 minutes and repeated eye contact with the main bar bartenders, a lady came up to let me know they were closed.  So I asked why the hostess showed me in... I was told they may be open at the main bar... 5ft away... But as far as she knew, they were closed.

My disappointment comes from 2 directions:

- big name with a reputation, I had high expectations.  Didn't come close.

- outspoken critic of poor restaurants is failing at this location. Might want to pay a visit to the establishment with your name on it...

On the other hand - Ramsay's Burgr at Planet Hollywood is FABULOUS.  We have been there 3 times and received impeccable service and food every time!

What a disaster. We came with a large party. They knew we were coming. 2.5 hours later and we just got the salad. We were here for 4 hours before dinner was complete. Manager is clueless. They scheduled 2 servers for a party of 40.

Given the restaurant was Gordon Ramsey's, our party was extremely disappointed and shocked at the terrible service. The waiter must have been scared to do his job because he kept glancing at our table and not stopping by. I watched him pass about 4 times before asking if we wanted water (uhm yes, it's Vegas and we need to stay hydrated), another 4 times before asking if we wanted drinks, and another 6 times before finally bringing them. He literally forgot to bring the beer and then quickly left again when we were clearly ready to order. It wasn't a busy night, so his flightiness was unexplainable. 

This continued throughout the night. We needed salt/pepper, and the waiter continued to walk by hesitantly and not stop by asking how we are doing and if we needed anything. This might not seem like a huge deal, but no paying customer wants to feel avoided or neglected. 

Also, he'll need to brush up on his adjectives and food reviews. When we asked about how their pea soup tasted, his only response was "it has texture." WOW you sold us on that one. 

For Gordon Ramsay's name.. The staff needs better game. Very surprising..

The steak was pretty fatty. I was starving at that point (since the waiter took a lifetime to commit to his job) and would've ate anything.

I was very disappointed by this place. If you watch any of Gordon Ramsey's shows he always talks about quality. This was very poor quality food. Frozen fries, weird watery meat in Shepard Pie, and a rather bland in eventful burger. It is also expensive. 

Just blahhhh.

The whole Gordon Ramsey thing is just an act to sell overpriced food. 

The winner of his Chef show that was supposed to be the Chef of the restaurant failed her drug test so she is not there either. So they are just a ship at sea with no sail. 

I have spent time in England and this is very much on par with British food. It is pretty bad.

We specifically went to get dessert at GR, because we wanted to try his signature Sticky Toffee. 

The place is large and had no trouble getting a table on Wednesday night during dinner service. 

We liked the look of the restaurant, the kegs mounted on the walls, the wood placemats and unique flatware. Even the crazy costumes the staff wear. 

The waiter was obliviously disappointed when we only wanted to order dessert. In fact, he didnt even bring it out, another person did. The server never checked back with us, except to deliver and pick up the check. 

The sticky toffee was delicious, it was better than we had at Hells Kitchen, but I still think I prefer it at a pub local to us. 

Prices are kinda high, but with a Caesars Rewards card there is a discount.
I liked the hell's kitchen burger, but so spicy. The portion was good. Service was so slow and ignorance

I really enjoyed the food.  I ordered the lamb burger, medium rare.  It comes with goat cheese, grilled onions, and lettuce on it, and fries with garlic butter and ketchup on the side. The goat cheese perfectly complimented the lamb. The fries and garlic butter were great too. My meal was absolutely delicious but it was really rich.  In the end, the portion size was too much for me and it felt like a waste. I could have probably split it with another person.
Service was fine. We came in a party of three and were seated right away at arund 9:30 on a Saturday night.

Stopped in here for dinner before a show. This place is decorated in English pub style. A wall of beer barrels is kind of a cool look. Now onto the food......
Ordered their wedge style salad and a BLT.
The salad was awful and I sent it back. You could tell right away that this salad was pre-made and had been sitting around way past it's sell-by date.
Lettuce was wilted and rubbery. Ugh. Told the waitress that it was not acceptable and she took it away. Here comes the manager to apologize and to ensure that it will not happen on my next visit and he would remove it from the bill. Fine.
Now onto the BLT. This sandwich had a maple flavored bacon that just overpowered the sandwich. It was not good at all. The only thing I enjoyed was the cold pint of Heineken that I had with my meal.

Here comes the bill and guess what. The salad was still there. I flagged down the waitress who was surprised that it was on it. How about checking it before you hand it to me?

I have seen Kitchen Nightmares where Gordon Ramsay shreds every dish he tastes as awful. Hey Gordon, why don't you check out your namesake restaurant and see what you think of it.

Will not return. Vegas has much better places than this money grab.

Cheers to all

Very un-impressive meal. The look and feel inside the restaurant is nice but the quality of the food is low. We ordered soup as an appetizer which was good but our main meals were subpar. My wife ordered the salmon which looked good on the plate but was less than flavorful AND cold - not heated properly. I had the bangers and mash...the bangers were less tasty than the sausages you can buy at Costco and grill yourself. My iced tea was also $5! Sure, this is Las Vegas, but that's the most expensive iced tea I've had in my life. $120 later we felt ripped off.

Had a late night reservation, was seated immediately.  Unfortunately they sat us next to the service station and at one point one of the bus people tried to carry too much away and dropped glasses by us.  Would have been ok had the woman not stand there and start stomping her feet like a 5 year old.

Drinks were delicious.  I had the fish & chips, they were good.  Friend had the pie sampler (realllllly small samples) and had a very wet Caesar Salad.  Drinks were wonderful though.

I have watched chef Ramsey quite a bit, and have gotten the impression that all his red-faced histrionics are just his way of "taking the piss" as a brit might say. Certainly he has become quite the star by informing chefs and restauranteurs in no uncertain terms why their food or dining establishment falls short of his professed high standards. So naturally on a recent visit to caesers I felt drawn to his namesake pub, to see how it was living up to those standards. 
I must sadly report that it fell way short. We were there for a happy hour so got to sample a variety of items, and not one of them was in any way noteworthy. I recall a dry as bones slider, a pastry wrapped "toad in the hole" sausage that can be best described as insipid, some very ordinary "chips," or fries as we deem them west of the pond, and a few items than even now, just a few days later, have already faded from my gastro memory. 
Perhaps an earlier yelper was correct in stating that Ramsay himself should get in here and start yelling at people, but until he does I suggest you limit your patronage here to a couple of pints.

I agree with the other reviews about the staff and what they are wearing. They look very uncomfortable walking around in their outfits.  The staff seated us write away and we got a nice little area in the back so we can watch the crowd.  The waiter made some recommendations for beers and he was right on.  We ordered just a small quick lunch and I had the mussels and clams and the wife had the salad.  They were both outstanding.  Then the staff came by and asked we wanted dessert and made yet another recommendation and this time was even better than the beer.  The dessert was a toffee cake and it was splendid and I will eat it every time I am in Las Vegas.  I hope they do not change anything about this place, well maybe the girls outfits.

OMG the napkins... They are so awesome. They look like they were cut from a burlap sack, but they feel like silky heaven. Quite possibly the perfect napkin.

Unfortunately, that was the best part.

I went to grab a burger and a beer, something I thought that the "Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill" was perfect for, right? I imagined the chef screaming and belittling his staff until the perfect burger was created. So did the guy next to me.

Both my burger and my new bar neighbor's patties were grossly overcooked. We both asked for mid-rare and received a grey patty that made my heart sink when I saw it.

Here's the rub, and I don't mean delicious BBQ seasoning... it took 30 minutes to arrive and it was $20.  Ok, ok, so it's The Vegas Strip, that can explain the exorbitant price, but 30 minutes for an overcooked, boring, bland and disappointing burger doesn't fly in my world no matter the location. 

Save yourself the $20, seriously, Wendy's burgers are better than these.

What isn't to love about a restaurant where the beer and wine menu is twice as long as the food menu?

My aunt decided to visit me in sin city this past weekend and this was the first restaurant on her list that she wanted to try.  We arrived at about 3 on a Saturday afternoon and there was only about a 10 minutes wait.  We were seated by the very sweet host.   We were seated on the side near the walkway

Truffle Chips - They are huge!!  They are about 1in x 1in x 3in.  I heard they are boiled, baked, and deep fried to give it that wonderful consistency.  The Truffle Chips are special because they drizzle it with wonderful scrumptious truffle oil and top it off with truffle shavings.  There are also two dipping sauces one tomato based and the other has a creamier consistency

Pub Lamb Burger - This burger comes with a good sized lamb patty that is cooked to order.  Topped with goat cheese and sun dried tomatoes.  It was wonderful!  You also get a side of their giant chips.  If you are a beer drinker I recommend pairing it with a bottle of Delirium :)

I took off one star because of the tight seating situation.  My aunt and I were seated near the edge of the restaurant and we could barely get in and out of seats.  I'm not sure if all parts of the restaurant are like this, but it was pretty uncomfortable.

I really enjoyed my experience (minus the seating issue).  I can see myself coming back in the future if I have more visitors, but I will be sure to try and sit in a different section. 

TIP: 
I recommend parking at the self parking near the Forum.  Once you come off the elevators turn right and you will run right into the Pub & Grill

Bust out your Total Rewards Card (the players club card for the Harrah's Casinos) and save a buck or two on every item.

Hate to go with 3 on this one but the pub needs improved!  Have been there a number of times and the food is super, but the service and atmosphere are questionable given its look and location. 

The steak and ale pie, sticky toffee pudding, and lobster rolls are and have been totally tasty and delicious. The selection of comfort food is well rounded and slightly different than the average pub/ sports bar.  

So, we get to the service part.  We waited for drinks, our table, and the food for well over 3 hours. Granted we had a large party but the simple fact that half of the table only had a sandwich is absurd.  I have had more efficient luncheons at Buffalo Wild Wings (although the food was lame).  And the scene felt dead with soft music barely to be heard. This place need re-energized.  With a big name like Ramsey attached, it needs to be better!

Scotch egg, sticky toffee pudding, with a Boddington in a modern pub inspired atmosphere. If I were in Vegas at the moment with someone... or if I knew someone there at the moment, I would definitely recommend a late night stop at Gordon's for this. It's so freaking good.

Last night I ate here with some new friends that I was meeting for the first time. 
Hostess wasn't mean but not really friendly, doesn't seem to take much pleasure in her job.

We were a group of four seated at a very tight booth. We waited a good 10 minutes before anyone came. We were served water (tasted like tap) & told that our waitress would be right with us. "Right with us" really meant another 15 minutes before our waitress arrived. Our waitress Daisy apologized so we let it go but we were not enthusiastic about this experience anymore & we could tell our friends were getting annoyed but trying to keep it together since this was our first meet up.

My mother & I ordered the U.K. beer flight, fish & chips, & the British Ale Onion soup. Our friends ordered the fish & chips & beer flight as well. Food took about 20 minutes to arrive. The wait we could deal with but the actual food was a MAJOR disappointment. My soup was completely cold. It's winter... I wanted something that would warm me up... that obviously didn't happen. The fish & chips were cold too plus the chips were completely STALE. I have never been to a restaurant that has gotten fried potatoes wrong before... especially at the price of $30 per plate. It was a most unpleasant meal. My guess is that 
someone made it, they forgot about us, & the food was sitting there forever before the waitress was able to deliver it to us. I may have complained if we ever got a server to stop by. At the same time we were so over this experience that we just didn't even bother. 
Either way I don't feel like I should have to complain. 

I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay. I've seen him rip people a new a**hole over stuff like this on T.V. on many shows so I definitely expected much more from his restaurant. I still would like to give his other restaurants a chance & hope for a better experience but I won't be coming here ever again. Very sad.

We started at the bar and ordered the ginger beer drink with Juniper and it was amazing.  Then we ordered the Roasred Carrots and Cauliflower so good.  Then the calamari and the Hells Kitchen Burger which were good. Quick service.  Would deff come back. Our server Scott gave us exemplary service. 10/10

My husband and I came to Las Vegas for our anniversary and stayed at Cesar's Palace which houses this pub. We had only stopped in during Happy Hour for a couple beers and appetizers, but we now have plans to come back for dinner as well. The food was incredible...I recommend the Toad in a Hole...and the service even better. If David is working you should sit in his section, he is so awesome.

Gordon, I'm surprised. Was really looking forward to the experience, but overall, kind of disappointed. Good is a bit overpriced, but expected for Vegas.

I had the Bangers and Mash, wife had Prime Rib. Quite frankly, both wee under seasoned. My Banger quite small. :) and the mash was too creamy. Wife's prime rib really needed a bit more seasoning. Horseradish tasted really watered down.

Service was good, though it did take a little longer than expected for the entrees, especially since our appetizer came out super fast. We also had the "DIC" desert. Keep in mind, there's Bourbon in the caramel, so be aware. It was delicious, by far the best part of the Menu.

Overall, for the price we paid two, the Baccanal Buffet would of been a much better value and experience.
Wow!!! Lobster roll, calamari, chicken Loli pops, truffle fries. Need I say more? Great atmosphere. Awesome drinks. Superb service. Love this place. A must in Vegas!

Gordon Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares? Try "You Don't Know From a Nightmare Until You've Sat at Your Own Bar, Gordon Ramsay."

We went to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill this evening to watch the NBA Playoffs. Things started off well enough--we though the fish and chips were a bit greasy and way overpriced, and the french fries tasted burnt, but this was our first time at this restaurant, so we just thought that they were prepared strangely. When someone next to us was served the same dish, we realized that our french fries HAD been burned beyond all recognition.

We were having a fun time with the bartenders--lots of laughing and jokes. However, one of the bar backs, Antoine, followed my girlfriend when she went to the bathroom. Antoine, is a large, menacing character, and she was not comfortable with his aggressive behavior. When she came back from the bathroom, he came out from the back and handed her his phone number. Later, he said, "You better not have thrown that number away. You better call me or you can't ever come in here again."

At the end of the evening, one of the bartenders, Keith, put two drinks in front of us that we did not order, and said, "Try this." We assumed that he wanted us to try a new drink he was working out--we are very familiar with bars, and it wouldn't be the first time that a bartender had asked us to try his drink. I did not care for mine, so I wasn't drinking it. When Antoine came out again, he said, "What's wrong?" I said that I did not like it. Antoine then proceed to PICK UP MY DRINK, DRINK OUT OF THE STRAW, AND PUT THE DRINK BACK IN FRONT OF ME. I sat, mouth agape with incredulity astounded by his presumptuousness, and all I could manage to utter was, "I don't want that." He then took the drink and said, "I can't drink this out here, but I will take it in the back. Thanks for the drink!" I have never seen anything like this. As I type this, I still cannot fathom that a server (or any other human being) would drink out of a stranger's drink. IN WHAT WORLD IS THIS ACCEPTABLE?!?!? Especially in the context of a server and a customer. My head almost exploded. I supposed that it is fortuitous that I was intimidated by Antoine because that spared everyone from me causing a scene.

I called immediately after leaving the restaurant/bar. When I asked to speak to the manager, the hostess who answered the phone said, "Sure! What's your name, Hun?" I am a doctor and a college professor. "Hun?" What year is this?

When I spoke the the manager, there was no greeting on the phone, he just said, "Zeus." It took a few seconds for me to understand that he was actually stating his name, and I wasn't transferred to the wrong number. When I told Zeus the story, his response was, "So, I don't understand--are you saying that Antoine threatened you?" Hopeless--these people are all so hopeless. Zeus assured me that he would take our last two drinks off of the bill and tell the regional manager about Antoine's behavior. I am not really sure how that is an appropriate response to this horrific situation. 

So, I guess we won't be returning to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill, because my friend has no interest in calling Antoine--she couldn't afford to pay for all of his drinks all night anyway.

Great experience. We were celebrating a birthday. Our waiter went above and beyond when we told him we were fans if Hells Kitchen we got to meet the head chef. The food was amazing!!!  A must have is the Sticky Pudding dessert!!  

Service was slow but we weren't in a hurry. We loved the miss matched decor.   Little pricey but the quality of the is why.

This is the second time my girlfriend and I go here. What a huge disappointment. We got the onion soup and a salad. The onion soup was bland and the salad was soaked in dressing. Very disappointed, because the same salad and soup were so good the last time we were here six months ago. 

The waiter seemed like he was more interested in the game on the tv's than waiting tables. The other two times we ate here were amazing. From seeing other reviews, it seems this place is going downhill. What a shame. This was such a great place.

The two stars are because the place was very clean.

Way over priced but attentive service. Inventive menu items, but not so spectacular that it would justify the price point. I mean $11 for a pint of Miller lite is crazy even for the casinos. That said it is worth checking out. They have interesting and varied seating arrangements. We sat on a couch and had dinner. That was great! The steaks are too big at around 14 ounces, but it is high quality cuts of meat. That said, they dropped from 4 to 3 stars because my wife's burger came with a slice of tomorrow that had a stem on it. Gordon would have lost it for that alone I think.

Innis & Dunn. 
Fish & chips
Cleanliness issues. Table reeked of mildue tabled wiped and napkin put down in dirty table then into my water glass then she tried to dry table with napkin from next table. Thoroughly disgusting. Smell on my hands  they moved me to the dining room. 
Fake news paper disintegrated from the grease and vinegar on plate.  Disgusting. 
Staffing issues
Nice cutlery bad napkins
Watery Ono flavor malt vinegar
Watered beer
Tartar not refrigerated 
Good added lays up
Minted peas good and not overly salted
Batter had a huge salt lick on one side. Unfortunately my last two bites
Chips soggy tasted like Denny s or made the day or two before
Waiter offered fries. Whoa. Terrible soggy. Strange for sure. Waiter was very helpful offered to help. $30! Way outta line for what should be a perfect lunch experience.

I have been here twice now! Once at lunch with my husband and kids and another time for dinner for my husband's birthday with our friends! They were very accommodating and were able to seat all 9 of us together. Our reservations kept changing because we were coming from a tournament, but the staff was very understanding and helpful! The food was so good and you really can't go wrong! The drink menu had a lot of variety. I'm usually a beer drinker, but I wanted to try something different this time. The Salted Caramel Apple Martini was my favorite!
Excellent staff, superb food, and wonderful dining environment!!! Highly recommended!! Will be back for sure. Thank you Peter.

Absolutely amazing food, best fish and chips ive ever had. We also got the chicken pesto sandwich, it comes with fresh made chips and was excellent. The Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert was so delicious as well. Our waitress was so nice and friendly and gave great service.

Should have checked yelp before going! Horrible service. We waited a good 20 minutes before anyone came to greed us. 30 more seconds and I was ready to walk out - wish I kinda wish I had. Again took the server forever to bring our drinks. Didn't even bring the basket of bread until AFTER our main entree already came (although the bread tasted good, unfortunately it was too late for it). I had a salad which was ok. My fiancé had the burger which he said "sucked". His entree plate had a little container that was supposed to have ketchup in it but it was empty. Took them another 5 mins to bring that out... Just not what you are looking for sitting at a restaurant. You want to relax and have a good time. Not spend the entire night waiting on your service. I could tell the people sitting at table next to us were having the same issues - their eyes were wondering around looking for the waiters. When the check came, we didn't bother paying by card, just left some cash and got out! Disappointed.

My wife and I are big fans of Gordon Ramsay, so when we go to Las Vegas we try to eat at the pub at least once. My wife was lucky enough to eat here twice last week and had a great experience both times. She had server Carrie both times and she  was awesome enough to remember her and introduced her to chef Kristen. We watch Hells kitchen so that was very cool.The food is great, along with the staff and decor. We will eat here again!!

I'm in Las Vegas every few months for business, and this is the third or fourth time I've come to the pub-and honestly, the food keeps getting better and better every visit! I am looking forward to coming in next and seeing what they have! 

I ventured away from sandwiches this time around and tried something new-the pork belly. I've never seen such a unique and beautiful preparation! I couldn't believe how light it was, I didn't find it fatty at all. I would recommend this dish to EVERYONE! I may be back just for this...

We made a last minute reservation and we are so glad we did. The food was amazing. Best Rack of Lamb and Prime Rib. Truffle fries were delicious and the Sticky Toffee Pudding is to die for.  Good atmosphere and Tayler F took wonderful care of us. He even talked chef Scott into visiting our table. Best meal and experience we've had in Vegas. This should be on every 'not to be missed ' restaurant in Vegas.

I went to Vegas for my birthday last week and it was a great experience. My party of 3 had really great service and the food was fantastic. From the wonderful white wine that the waiter suggested to the warm bread sticks with cheese sauce to the braised beef cheek. The atmosphere was wonderful and comfortable. And the price was reasonable. When I go back to Vegas again I will be dining there for sure.

The food here was absolutely spot on. I met up with my sister and her friend for our last lunch in Vegas and it was the best meal I had during the trip. 

I started with the Maine Lobster Rolls Minis which had a generous portion of lobster and a light seasoning of lemon. I loved that the brioche they were served on also had a faint lemon taste. 

For my lunch I selected to the Pub Chopped Salad which I loved. Everything in the salad was finely diced so I did not need to use my knife, and the dressing was light and evenly distributed. 

The only downside to the pub was the seating. I was on a low chair by a large coffee table and it was incredibly uncomfortable to eat from that angle (and thank goodness I wasn't wearing a skirt!)

Overall this place was ok. Nothing special.
Ordered a $22 beef burger with bacon that was ok tasting unfortunately the bottom of my bun was burnt. My girlfriend got a cesars salad, she said it was good. Overall this was not the best burger I've eaten especially paying $22 for a burger with bacon. Would have expected way better food especially since is has chef's Ramsey's name on it.

Summary:. GO HERE ANYTIME IN VEGAS - Best staff I've encountered, got to meet a celebrity chef, coolest most fun/down to earth vibe in Vegas, and killer food!

I checked out Pub on Thursday for my first Gordon Ramsey dining experience.  We sat down and had Heather as our waitress (and she was amazing!) I asked about Hells Kitchen and Heather told me that one of the former contestants worked there and was there working that night.  Heather went above and beyond and arranged for us to meet Kristin (how cool!!) Kristin comes out to the table and talks to us for a bit and then takes pictures with us!  Everyone was so amazing and helpful all night. 

I didn't even mention the food and drinks yet! So there were four of us there and we weren't super hungry so we decided to go for a few different shared plates.  We started out with the nachos - I was thinking "how good can nachos be, and what kind of special twist can you put on nachos..." But at Pub they were amazing - the chips were a different twist and really brought it all together!  Then we had the pigs and a blanket which were hands down the best pigs and a blanket I've ever had!  I want to talk about all of the food I had but it was all just to amazing!  We split a birthday shake at the end which was a great end to a great trip.

Awsome place great food and fun employees great time
Banger and mash is to die for.thank you guys for a great time

Mediocre and overpriced, even for Vegas. I don't know why Gordan Ramsay is so willing to attach his name to this level of quality.

My friend's steak was ordered medium rare but was delivered looking like a microwaved hamburger. Zero pink and no juices flowing from the steak. It took 10 minutes to track down the waitress who didn't seem surprised and said it looked more like a medium well vs medium rare. If she thinks dark grey is medium well, she probably should look into a different career path. It took 25 minutes to receive a replacement steak, which is ridiculous. They should have taken the next steak off the grill. The manager acted like he was doing us a favor by removing the steak from the bill, despite the fact that it was delivered after every other dish had been cleared from our table. 

This was an embarrassing effort from a restaurant with a celebrity name and $100 per head prices for food and a couple drinks. Pass.

The food ranges from decent to bad.  Do NOT get the lobster roll or the lobster mac n cheese. My friend nearly cracked her tooth on a piece of shell from the roll. I kept encountering small bits of shells in the lobster mac n cheese. The mac n cheese was meh. It was overly salty, watery, and not cheesy. The lobster in it was dry and tasted fishy. I had made a much better Costco take home mac n cheese for $10 that fed 15 people a week prior.  I tried the shepherd pie and it was ok....watery but not bad. I told our waiter about the shells and he seemed offended that I was complaining about my friend almost CRACKING/SPLITTING her tooth from eating a small roll. I had only finished half my mac n cheese so I wanted to take it home to add my own cheese and recreate the entire dish. No point in wasting food when there are starving kids in the world. The server ended up throwing out my food. I assumed he was going to box it up since he asked us if we wanted to box up our food and we said yes, turns out he was only directly addressing two people and unfortunately in our group of 6, I was not one of them. He did offer to remake my food (of course begrudgingly and offended that we were inconveniencing him with the shell-bit food that he accidentally threw out). However we were rushing to make a flight home so I didn't have time for them to remake it. For $22, I could have bought 2 Costco mac n cheeses that tastes insanely better and can feed 24 people.  Just sayin...I should have went to Mesa Grill  :*(

First Gordon Ramsay restaurant stop while in Las Vegas. It was OK. Calamari as an appetizer was good. Wedge Salad, Fish & Chips, and Grilled Burger were all good. The Lamb Burger wasn't all that good. Perhaps the goat cheese was it's undoing. 
Overall, it was not as good as I expected. We'll try another one of Ramsay's restaurants before we decide to give up on the hype.

Another outstanding visit to Gordon Ramsay Pub! We were seated immediately despite arriving a few minutes before our reservation time. Our server, Chris, was friendly and professional. My wife is a big, long-time fan of Chef Ramsay and especially Hell's Kitchen, and was excited to catch a glimpse of Chef Christina Wilson, the season 10 winner. A few minutes after being seated, we were treated to a visit by Randy Goldich, who introduced himself and seemed very interested in us and our Las Vegas trip. Randy brought Chef Wilson to the table to meet my wife, which obviously went over great!  I'm in the music business, and we had a great conversation. All of our food and drinks - beginning with the Scotch Egg - were amazing. The fish and chips are truly a masterpiece. Mr. Goldich invited us to return later after our Billy Idol show, and we had a great extended visit. Thumbs up to Chef Ramsay, Randy, Christina, and the whole staff!

We made a reservation for our party of 6 at Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill, as we were looking for some simple food prior to attending Absinthe, just outside Caesar's. 

The server was nice enough, although somewhat awkward and not detail-oriented. 

I should have looked at the menu more closely before choosing this restaurant, as there was not much on the menu that interested me. I ended up ordering the mini-pub burgers as my meal. They were OK. One of the girls had the scallops and really enjoyed those as well. But that was about it for the positives.

One member of our party asked about the curry chicken, which the server said was very good. She probed as to how hot or spicy it was, and the server said it really wasn't at all. 

It took FOREVER for our meals to come, without any real update from our server. Finally, 5 of 6 meals came and the server didn't address the missing 6th meal. Finally, we caught his attention and asked what was going on. Apparently the kitchen missed the 6th order, which happened to be a steak so it was taking even longer to come out. After one bite of the curry chicken, our friend knew it was verrrryyy hot. The server mentioned it also came with a jelly to "cool the spices" and that was nowhere to be seen. She actually looked to be in pain trying to eat her meal.

My husband had the grilled beef burger, and he said it was just OK. 

To top it off, our waiter put everything on one bill. We had a party of 6, very clearly 3 couples. He couldn't take the time to separate it onto 3 separate bills?

I'm going to assume Gordon Ramsay doesn't spend much time checking in on the performance of this restaurant. We eat out a lot, and have rarely had an experience this poor. I honestly wish we would have just gone to the Cheesecake Factory!

I usually make a trip out to Vegas every quarter and each time Gordon Ramsay is on my list everytime. The food at Pub and Grill is nothing short of excellent. Great appetizers, salads, sandwiches and burgers. The potato chip nachos with beef is just incredible. The vibe and aroma is always great and entertaining. Now let's get to the best part of all, the service. From management to waiters, they are always kind, friendly and superior. The core purpose Gordon is always on my list is due to the most amazing, kind, friendly, sincere, and  professional waiter named Yaneisy (aka Jenny). She is nothing short of excellent, and that's even an understatement. What an asset to the Gordon family! Yaneisy, you are amazing! Thank you for your warm hospitality each and everytime. Ask for Jenny next time you are here, it is worth every wait.

I love his show so I was very excited to try his restaurant. What a huge let down. The service was horrid, the music so loud it was hard to carry on a conversation and the food bland at best. If you are looking for boring and flavorless food that the English are known for this is the place for you.

I don't write too many reviews but figured I should take the time for this one. Burgers were ordered medium and medium rare and both burgers came out very well done. One of the 4 fries that came with it was frozen in the middle. We told the server about the burgers and fries and said he would take the burgers back but by this time we were so hungry we just ate them. After having to ask if something could be done because of the poor food preparation we received $10 off the bill. Save you money and skip this place if you're in Vegas and looking for a good meal.
Excellent service from Rodney for our party of 8!  The nachos, meat/cheese tray, and wedge salad were awesome!

Happy Hour allowed us to try a few different items without having to shell too much money out of our already emptying pockets (the flashing lights of Vegas really get ya). All the food on the happy hour menu is from $5 - $7, which is pretty decently priced for the richness of the selection. You do have to sit at the bar, which was super crowded on this cold November Tuesday, but if you can manage to find a spot it'll be worth your while. 

Each dish was delicious! We were blown away. They were all classic happy hour appetizer type foods (nachos, wings, etc) but made with better quality and a slight twist of the fancy. The type of food you can eat until you're full and not feel like you're going to pass out after, you just feel good. 

Here's the dishes: 
Truffle Chips: Basically, fries with truffle aioli. The fries are super good, those thick but not too thick ones that are just crispy enough. The truffle, and the other dipping sauce, was flavorful too. 

Toad-in-the-Hole: A sausage wrapped in a pastry with dipping sauce in swirls around the plate. Fluffy, pastry with perfect balance of sausage. This dish only comes with one tiny sausage for a $5 price tag, so just be warned if you're sharing you'd need to order a few more if you want your own. 

Crab Deviled Egg (w/ cucumber, tomato, relish): This was good, the flavors were balanced. I'm a hug fan of regular deviled eggs, so the twist was definitely interesting. Not my favorite, but good and definitely worth the try! (They come with three egg halves). 

Kettle Chip Nachos (w/ corned short ribs & cheddar sauce): SO GOOD, probably my favorite dish. It's everything good about nachos but with better made parts. The chips by themselves are the real potato kind, the meat is flavorful enough to eat on it's own, and the cheddar sauce is rich. It all balances super well, especially with the sweet baked peppers on the top (I think that's what they are). It was so good we were literally scrapping every last tiny bite off the plate even though it was our last dish of the meal. 

Lollipop Wings (w/ Blue Cheese Dip): SO MUCH YES. Comes with 6 wings.

Came here a year ago and was not impressed at all. My wife and I felt let down as we had expected it to be much better. Anyways I wasn't going to write a review until my wife went there with some friends that were in town yesterday. Just like most people that try the place, we all expect it to be great since the guys name on the sign is such a jerk if the food isn't perfect on his tv show. When a restaurant can't even cook a hamburger correctly, there's got to be much bigger issues. My wife's raw hamburger seems like every episode of that tv show that I have ever seen. The cooks can't even cook a hamburger? Service has been subpar there and the price is not worth the food quality. I was hoping our first experience was just an off night but a year later it proved to be another let down. Oh and while my wife and her friends were waiting for a table they sat down in the bar area to have a drink and not a single server/employee helped them. So another loss of revenue for this place, but I am sure the guys name on the sign will get his royalty check or else someone will be in trouble!

Excellent service and awesome food!!!
This is a MUST place to visit!! Gordon Ramsey inspires me and so does his whole staff! I go to this establishment everytime I'm in Vegas...
The desserts are heavenly...love ALL of them.
The Shepherd's pie is my favorite dish, my daughters is the Fish  n' Chips!!
IF there is a line....WAIT!! Its WORTH the wait!!!
Enjoy~

An excellent Xmas day dinner!  This was upscale British pub food done really, really well.  I am already looking forward to the next visit. 

We chose to eat at the bar since a couple of basketball games were on.  That way we could also ask the bartender about their beer selection.  Our bartender let us sample a few and we ended up going with a pints of Innis & Gunn and Moa.  Those were $8.75 each but so was Pacifico and Corona so no point in going for stuff you can get anywhere else.   

The first entree was the "Dublin Brisket" which was set in a pumpernickel bread bowl.  The bowl was filled with hearty tender chunks of beef, cheese and sauerkraut that went well with the side of thousand island.  3 standard steak fries=1 fry here so you only get 4 of them which was enough.  

My wife wanted the "Shepard's Pie" and just hearing those two words gave me flashbacks of terrible school cafeteria mush, a poor man's English lasagna if you will.  But this was galaxies away from what I had in the past.  Savory was the word from the first bite.  Each spoonful filled with buttery mashed potatoes, carrots, peas and slow cooked beef and lamb.  A truly awesome dish that I would gladly have any cold weather day.  

We skipped all the good looking appetizers and small plates just to make it to dessert.  Everyone recommended the "Sticky Toffee Pudding" so that's what we had and it did not disappoint.  The perfect ending indeed.

Cruising through Caesar's Palace and came across the Gordon Ramsay Pub.  The place has a great look and very cool Hipster vibe.  At first we popped in for a beer and appetizers.  They had a great selection of micro brews on tap, a good enough reason in itself to stop by.  The deviled eggs and warm pretzel were awesome.

Unfortunately, our meal left a little to be desired.  The fish and chips were average, but plentiful.  They overcooked the first burger and felt it necessary to make a second one. The problem was, they forgot to tell us about the delay.  It was close to 40 minutes before we got our food.  By then, we were a little pissed.  Not a good idea to deliver food late to a Yelper.  Sorry Gordon, I really had high hopes.  But you'll get a chance to redeem yourself.  I'll be back.....

Steak and Ale Pie - The rich slow roasted deliciousness that you would expect from traditional British comfort food did not disappoint.  The steak in the pie melted in your mouth which was a nice contrast to the tender veggies and the rich deeply flavored gravy.  The top crust however was lack luster at best.  In my head I could hear Gordon Ramsay berating his expediter for putting up a dish that was undercooked. The crust left a gritty texture in your mouth that detracted from the overall yumminess of the filling.  I was sad. 

The Sticky toffee putting quickly put an end to my sadness.  It was everything and beyond.  The sweet cream ice cream was to die for.  The pudding itself, I had to admit was better than mine.

Like all other Gordon Ramsay restaurants this place is sure to impress. Every detail is carefully engineered down to the outfits that the bus boys wear. The food is amazing and all of the staff is well educated about it and the amazing wine/beer list. The vibe is upscale/energetic and fun with a british twist. Loved it!

First Ramsay restaurant and it was great! I had a great table by the edge of the casino allowing for great people watching. I ordered the Shepard pie. This was the first time I ever had a Shepard pie! I fell in love! I was also served a some unique bread sticks with a variety of butters as a light app before the meal. Quick service was great allowing me to get in and out. Will be back for sure!

It is a shame how truly disappointing this restaurant was. We purposely made a 5 p.m. reservation because we had our baby with us and were celebrating Father's Day. On two separate occasions I called the restaurant to confirm that we could bring the baby. Upon our arrival at 4:50 p.m., the hostess snarkily told us to come back at 5 p.m., the time of the reservation, and we would be seated. Ouch! Mind you, there were tables everywhere but we did as we were told. Once seated, our baby was sleeping and would have remained asleep had our waiter not taken it upon himself to move her stroller from where the hostess told us we could park it. From the get go, our server was visibly irritated that we would have the audacity to bring a baby to this restaurant. From there it went from bad to worse. Here are some highlights... the food (corn soup, English peas) was not even warm; anytime we asked for anything (a straw, a glass of cranberry juice, an oyster fork) we never got it; HORRIBLE service combined with lackluster food does not justify a $256 price tag. When the manager asked how our experience was we were honest and told him and he responded by offering free dessert which we took to go. The one menu item I'd recommend is the sticky toffee pudding.

Great burger in toasted bun, full of flavor. Tons of fries come with a nice truffle. Also recommend the nachos. They taste fresh and are loaded with cheese and beef. There are other Gordon Ramsey restaurants on the strip but I don't know if they all have equivalent burgers.

I loved the idea of this place, I was stationed in England for a few years and love fish and chips. The three of us were greater by 5-6 hostesses that was a little awkward. All bored and chatting it up. We asked for a place next to the bar TVs however they seated us towards the back of the bar next to one TV. That was mildly frustrating as the place was dead for a labor day weekend at lunch rush. I'm guessing people are intimidated by the prices but we had cash to blow. 
When the waitress addressed us she apologized for the wait as it was 10 minutes into being seated, she said she was the only server and someone called in. This was sad Bc there was 5-6 hostesses and a manager in a suit watching this whole ordeal and not doing anything about it. I wanted him to approach us and ask about the experience but he skipped our table. 

Long story summed up, the craft cocktail (Mr Tokyo or something) was like a pink lemonade with egg white froth, not good but the waitress didn't explain what it entailed.. My friend loved the blt. Other friend loved the lamb burger. The fish and chips was the biggest let down. $30 bucks for HUGE chunks of cod.. They state how awesome the batter KS but with peices so large you miss out. 

Long story short, I'd rather fly to England for $1,000 bucks, take a 40 pound cab ride to Mildenhall Village and eat at the dog track than to recommend anyone eating here. 

I'm a Vegas local and I only write reviews if I love or hate a place. The two stars is Bc I like the mushy peas

I have been there two times. First time I had the Sheppard's Pie, not a big fan. Taste was just a bit off for me, but the sliders were great. Second time I had the Salmon, cooked as expected, crispy skin , tender and flavorful. The sides was very nice with a puree and veggies. My guest had the chicken also very good and tasty, but the hamburger was just Ok. Quality of the food is good and fallows Ramsay standards, but a bit pricy for the quantity. I feel the sides were not enough and the portion on the small side.  Staff was very nice but the place is a bit noisy.

My husband and I were in Las Vegas for a work-cation in the beginning of June. and we went to all three Ramsay's restaurants.  I'd say we are both "amateur" foodies, but we will go out of our way for good food, never fast food.  

The food was great, and a vey ample selection of beer, wine and drinks to choose from- that thankfully they condensed by using an iPad- making it much easier to navigate than a bulky menu.

We shared the duck confit, my husband ordered the beef short rib and cheek sandwich, and I had the fish and chips.  The duck was so tender and sweet, no gamey after taste at all.  My husbands sandwich looked beautiful and the small piece he shared with me tasted wonderful, my fish was amazing.  It was so light and wasn't greasy.  (A silly side note... the ketchup is AMAZING- and I normally hate ketchup)

I've seen other reviews saying it's expensive or that they had long wait times or that portion sizes aren't huge....  my husband is a decent sized guy, 6'5" and a good 250 lbs and his meal was enough to satisfy.  I am much smaller and almost never can finish my plate, but I could finished this one and we both had room for the BEST dessert ever.... the Sticky Toffee Pudding is definitely a recommendation.  

I, personally, appreciated that it wasn't an over sized portion.  Mainly because I hate not finishing my plate and not having any place to store leftovers (our room didn't have a fridge).  

The price was on par with all things Vegas in my opinion (at least on the strip).  For the food, the experience and the atmosphere are worth it.

This tells me everything I need to know about this restaurant.  I asked the waitress for a recommendation, and she said:

"Oh I don't eat here!  I can't afford it!"

The staff at the restaurant doesn't even get to sample the food so they know what to recommend to the customers?  I've heard TV Gordon fly off the handle about much less.  At the very least they could give a reasonable staff discount so that customers looking for an opinion about the specialty of the house could get one from the "presumed" expert who is standing at their table.

My burger was fine.  Everything with Gordon is a "stunning" hamburger.  Mine was good....  Not great....  I wasn't stunned.

Fries were good.

Ketchup was probably the best part of the meal.... honestly.  In fairness it was pretty special ketchup though.

For the price and the ego, I was hoping for stunning.  I got mediocre.

Not bad but mediocre. Meat served in my burger was tasty but lukewarm and stuck to the bun. Chips (potatoes) were good and I liked the ketchup but this place didn't live up to all the hype. I appreciated my place setting and napkin more than I did my meal. Gordon Ramsey should spend more time working on his own menu instead of making an ass of himself on T.V. degrading other people.

My boyfriend and I visited on a Saturday night. Even though the place looked packed, we were seated within 5 minutes of walking in without a reservation. We didn't want to spend too much money since we had mistakenly come to Caesar's looking for Ramsey's BURGR and decided to eat here since we were starving.

We were seated behind the wall of beer kegs which was awkward since the table was raised and we were technically sharing the table with another group on the other side. The table was also weirdly wide and the place was noisy so we couldn't have much conversation. My boyfriend had the fish and chips and I had the lobster mac n' cheese, which is a side dish. The fish and chips was surprisingly big. The fish was well seasoned and still moist. With the tartar sauce they tasted really good. The fries were also nice and crisp and well seasoned. The house made ketchup was really good. The lobster Mac n' cheese was a bit underwhelming. The noodles were a nice al dente and the bechamel sauce was rich and creamy but I was expecting more lobster for the price (ridiculously $21). And it was still side dish size. I had maybe 1 small piece of  lobster for every 7 bites which is too small a ratio to call it lobster Mac n' cheese if you ask me! Also could have used more cheese, but I guess that's personal preference. 

For the pub atmosphere and the pub quality grub, Ramsey should definitely consider lowering the prices.

Almost everything at this restraint was perfect.  First the ambiance was casual and unique.  The food was cooked to perfection. I had the short rib cheese steak, this is the first time I had short ribs prepared like a cheese steak.  It was original and delicious.  The short rib was perfectly seasoned and had a horseradish sauce while delicious, it made the sandwich a little spicy.  The caramelized onions and red peppers complemented the dish.  The fries were prepared as small wedges and baked, topped with parmesan cheese, this was such a simple but delicious concept!  Be warned before you eat here you are going to pay. While the prices are high the food quality is defiantly worth it.  If you stay away from alcohol your average price per person will run between $15-30 for lunch.  The only thing stopping me from a 5 star rating was the stow service.

You can't sport the name Gordon Ramsay and serve us our entrees an hour after being seated..... Don't even bother speaking to the manager because all he'll do is tell you they can do better and invite  you to come back next time for a "better experience" (no discount btw).....Seriously? There are plenty of great restaurants with better service in Vegas, why should I come back? Ridiculous! Don't waste your time here.

I wanted to come here because I am a fan of Hell's Kitchen. This is the place where the current season winner will be cooking. Of course we don't know the winner yet. I tried to ask the bartenders and they don't know either. 

Came here on a Friday night. It seemed pretty busy. Not a huge wait though. We walked up to the bar and got a seat. I preferred the bar because there were TVs and I like to socialize with the bartenders. However these bartenders were not very friendly. They seemed cold and was all business. We asked to change a channel on a TV to watch one of the March Madness games since there were at least 2 other TVs that were showing the same game. Not sure if they heard us or not, but no response. Finally after asking several times, one of the bartenders said that they had to ask the manager if they can change the channel. However, no urgency to go ask the manager. He just stood there doing something with the register. O-Kay... 

As the night progressed, the bartenders got a little bit more socialable. They recommended the poutine with duck. It was A-Mazing! We had few Magic Hat beers which was a perfect match the to poutine. 

Overall, the service needs a bit more help. The restaurant is great for any sports enthusiast. Lots of TV and some tables had their own TVs! I only had the duck poutine but was ridiculous good!

We were seated right away.  The hostess was friendly and our server was very attentive.  The decor was cool.  The kids and I liked the dog photos on the back of some of the chairs.  It reminded us of our own dog and we were missing her.  The food was good, but I wasn't anything to rave about.  The variety of food, to me, was like what you can order at BJ's Brewery.  Same type of food, but more expensive.  I don't think we would return to this restaurant if we were in this hotel.  There was a quick food court right next door that had a variety of good looking food and less expensive.

Fan of Gordon's other establishments so tried the Pub and Grill. Expectations not as high as this is pub food. I'd really give it 3.5 Stars if I could.

 The service needs a lot of work as it is dreadfully slow. The time it took just to take our order, receive our drinks and get our bread was pushing 35+ minutes - underscored by the fact that the Pub was at about 70% capacity.

 The food was very good. My app and entree was very good as were my buddies'. 

 I read some comments on here, which are really short sighted. Of course it is expensive - you are in Vegas and at Caesers Palace. I paid $5.90 for a large coffee at the damn food court nearby. Everything is over priced there. Room service for 2 burgers at Caesars was about $75 so compared to room service this is a bargain.

The staff seemed disoriented and somewhat aloof. Not sure what the culture is there, but it is different from the other GR places I've been.

Anyway the place is pretty cool and tv's are everywhere. 

It isn't worth making an extra effort to go if you are staying far away but if you are staying at an adjacent property it is worth going to.

By far, the most pathetic interpretation of. British pub I have ever encountered. I cannot believe a British person prostituted their name on this place. 

The food embodies the caricature  ofBritish food being bland and tasteless, their steak an ale pie would make McDonalds seem tasty by comparison 

A wall of beer kegs greets you as you approach, but the actual selection is a couple of session beers you can get in many other places, zero real ales,  they have old speckled hen in cans if you are desperate for flavor.

Well, let me start that I really was looking forward to go the this place, i have always admire Gordon Ramsay as a chef, very serious chef about all that he does in the kitchen and take care of how to prepare food.
First: Irish Pub? their choice of beer there really sucks! I asked about IPA beers and the had only 3! what ALL LAS VEGAS HAS.. Sculpin, Dog Fish and Laguintas. really? thats all? Irish pub? Brown Ales only 2, red ales NONE... the place its decorated with all this beer barrels all around the restaurant.. its just marketing, I can get better beer in a safeway in Fresno CA or at a shitty bar in Oregon..... its a shame that he puts his name but he has gone comercial all the way, money matters, thats it....
The food was "OK" I oredered the ribeye and my co-league the NY strip.. I ordered medium and he ordered medium rare... the sent us the food the other way around, mine raw and hes almost all cooked, KUDOS for the service and the waiter on our table, very very polite and wanted to change us the food, we decided not to change it, we were hungry... my ribeye was bland, flat, and no flavor..... the mac and cheese with lobster nothing to talk about, just mac and cheese..... GR you are a star now... making lots of money and I congratulate you for that, thats whats all about, but I feel you sold your self to big corporations.... sad.

Gean the bartender is hands down the best server/bartender ever!!!! Not only is he kind and courteous but funny as hell!!! Food is great and if you have a chance stop by and have Gean serve you it's worth sitting at the bar... Trust me

Had high expectations for this place because it has Gordon Ramsey's name.  The food overall was good but not great.  Salmon had good flavor but was a little overcooked, the butter chicken was pretty good and the pesto chicken sandwiches were very good.  The service was fair.  It took about 45 minutes to get our food & our waitress didn't come refill our drinks & kept avoiding us after she dropped off our appetizers.  Would have given it 4 stars if service had been better.
