Then food is pretty good, but our waiter,Bryan, was not vegetarian friendly. I ordered the Caesar salad without anchovies and he informed me that is the way the salad came. I asked him to not add the anchovies and asked for a different salad dressing. He acted like it was a big deal to change the salad, we won't be going there again on Vegas visits.

Pros: Shepard's Pie is out of this world! (would you expect any less here though?)
-my burger was delicious
-mushrooms were out of this world
-décor was cool
-waitress was friendly and knowledgeable

Cons:
-Expensive...duh (not as bad as I was expecting though)
-the bar stools were a little too squishy (really not that big of a deal..)
-the cocktails we had actually weren't very good...especially for $14 or whatever they were

All in all, we were impressed!

My last stop on my Gordon Ramsey restaurant adventure, and I'm ending it at the Pub. It has a great look. Very laid back just like an English pub. More of a relaxed atmosphere where you just kick back and relax with a drink and unwind. 

I came for lunch and was seated right away. Again great service. Very attentive server. Explains to me everything about the pub, and drinks they have as well as the food. Now I'm a big Chef Ramsey fan and I've seen his dishes at the pub on his shows that he did in Europe and I was extremely excited to finally get to try it. 

I had his signature Shepard's pie. OMG! Amazing! The beef and lamb stew with the creamy potato layer on top was fantastic. The meet was very very tender and had so much flavor. I also tried his signature fish and chips. By far the best fish and chips I've had! Big tender flaky fish fried to perfection with a light crispy batter. The crunch on the outside was great. The batter was thin and lots of fish on the inside! Amazing! The fries were just as good. Any time you get fresh cut fries it's always good! For dessert again I got his signature sticky toffee pudding. This one is similar to his steak restaurant. Served hot but with out the brown butter ice cream like the the steakhouse restaurant. Came with a vanilla ice cream. 

I had an amazing time at all 3 of his restaurants in Vegas. The food is amazing, he really knows his food and it shows. I'm definitely a bigger fan now!

My visit to GRPG exceeded any and all expectations I had. Randall keeps a tight ship out there. This is most definitely one of my new stops when I come to Las Vegas!

The calamari were super fresh. I had the burger and my best half had the pastrami, I think. That could have used a little more meat. Don't get me wrong, It was a great tasting sandwich. It wouldn't be a proper visit without a dose of the Sticky toffee pudding. We had a great time. Thank you to Randall and his staff for exceeding my expectations.
Been here a couple times now and love it!  Server Sara was awesome! Order the pesto chicken sandwich each time and it is amazing!!! Great food, service and atmosphere!!!!!!!!

Since there are no half ratings, I went with a 3 because a 4 seems like a stretch for here. Nice stop for a decent meal if you're walking the Forum Shops or need a break from gambling. If you get a table near the casino floor it's also fun for people watching.

My wife and I both enjoyed our meal. I had the corned beef sandwich and my wife ordered the fish and chips. Nice drink selection. The service was solid as well. 

Pretty soon Gordon Ramsey will have a restaurant in every hotel, but we're fans so we were happy to give him a few bucks.

although it was a little pricey, this was the best meal I have had in a long time.  I got a simple shepherd's pie and it was perfect, my fiancé got the steak and I kept teasing him about having a foodgasm.  They had an amazing variety of beer & wine and the staff was friendly, really loved it and would totally go there again.

Food was not good, we tried the white bait- fried and bland. Mussels and clams were bad, the broth taste like chorizo fluid- no flavor at all. This restaurant is busy b/c it's own my a celebrity chef not for the food.
Just okay and pricey for bar food.  A cheeseburger, coffee, beer and fish and chips were $80 with tip.
The bartender Ray Ray is amazing and knows how to build a drink!! His personality and drink knowledge is outstanding! Great job Ray Ray!! Thanks!

What a backwards experience this time.  I gave them a bit of leeway the first couple of visits I was there since they just opened and all, but they have had plenty of time to get the kinks out.  Unacceptable at this point.

Service starts out slow as we wait quite some time for anyone to acknowledge us.  We put in a drink order for 2 beers and wait another 10 minutes to see our server again.  We order food now and still do not have any drinks.  They come by to put breadsticks plates out with no breadsticks so now we have plates and nothing else and it's been over 20 minutes.  We get our main dishes before drinks or breadsticks and my shepard's pie is cold.  Can we at least get some water please?  Finally get our first beer when we are almost done with our meals.  How hard is it to pour a beer?  After we finish our food and our beers and water are completely gone, along comes some breadsticks.  I don't need these anymore and I wanted a bunch of beers since it is a pub.  No one ever asked us if we wanted another beer so we just got a check and grumpily moved on.  This was even early on a weekday and it wasn't too crowded.

This is not the premium experience that should come along with the premium prices they charge.  With all the sh*t talking Gordon Ramsey does, he sure doesn't back it up.

Sometimes the greatest triumphs are born from disasters, and our visit to Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill at Caesars Palace was no exception. This review's a bit long, but trust me, it really hits its stride around paragraph eight.

My girlfriend and I wandered into the restaurant on Saturday, March 7th, lured in by a sign at the entrance advertising some pretty appealing happy hour deals. The deals were so enticing that we failed to notice the not-so-fine print indicating happy hour only occurred M-F. Oh well. 

We approached the host stand and were immediately greeted warmly by Randy Goldich, who we came to find out later is Bar Manager for GRP&G. Randy was a great host and was incredibly accommodating upon learning that my girlfriend was not only vegetarian, but also allergic to wheat. He brought us a gluten-free menu and even gave us happy hour pricing on our Angry Orchard cider/Fireball shot combos (also known as Angry Balls...you gotta try). And that's where things started to fall apart...

I ordered the fish and chips, and the GF ordered the vegetarian blah blah whatever sandwich with gluten free bread. The food didn't arrive until the Angry Balls had already done a number on us, so we were ravenous. As I stuffed my face with fish I couldn't help but notice that my GF's gluten-free bread looked remarkably like...bread. We called our waitress Nini over, and she was incredibly apologetic and immediately took the sandwich back to the kitchen.

As we waited for the sandwich to be fixed, two more ciders were mistakenly delivered to our table (not a complaint), and suddenly it felt like we were in a rotating restaurant. But boy did we make friends with all the staff! We met waiter Marvin, who recently won Caesars employee of the year, and yukked it up with Tom Tom (or was it Ray Ray?), their award winning mixologist. We were practically falling off our stools by the time the replacement sandwich came, but it finally did: a beautiful vegetarian, gluten-free sandwich wrapped in lettuce and filled with...chicken.

By this time I was forced to relinquish my own hand-cut fries (apparently they call them "chips" in Vegas) due to the girlfriend's voracious state, and the potatoes did a good enough job of soaking up the fermented apple juice that we were ready to call it an afternoon. Randy was apparently tied up in the kitchen, so manager Michelle came by the table and let us know that our meal was free. She also sent us off with the correct order in a to-go container, 2 1/2 hours after we had initially arrived for a light lunch.

Less than an hour after leaving the restaurant, I received a call on my cell phone from Randy, who apologized profusely and invited us back for dinner the following night as his guests. I was initially shocked as to how Randy had gotten my number, but then the GF reminded me of my tendency to hand out business cards to everyone I talk to after imbibing a few cocktails.

To say we were shocked at his offer would be an understatement. We're not high-rollers; we're not even the lint in Dean Martin's belly button. But if there was anything that we learned after chatting with our boy Randy, it's that the man takes a genuine vested interest in his customers' happiness. It's not about Yelp reviews or who can tip the most; it's about making every guest feel like they had a remarkable experience. It's an old-school approach to service and building customer relationships that seems to be lost on so many that work in hospitality nowadays. So obviously, we took him up on his offer for dinner.

We returned at 9:30 the following evening and came to figure out that even though Randy's scheduled shift had ended several hours earlier, he made it a point to stay until we were seated and served the meals we ordered. He put us under the tender loving care of waiter Roger, and introduced us to season 12 winner of Hell's Kitchen Scott Commings, who can whip up a meatless wedge salad like you wouldn't believe. Even after we declined dessert, Roger still brought us every single gluten-free dessert option on the menu! It turns out that vanilla ice cream was really the only option that fit the criteria, but we were impressed nonetheless.

After two experiences in two days with GRP&G, I was left with two very distinct lasting impressions: 1) Randy Goldich is a pretty incredible guy, and he and his staff will apparently do whatever it takes to make their guests happy, and 2) this is definitely the most awesome thing that has ever come from dating a gluten-free vegetarian. Because of our experience, we actively look forward to visiting Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill next time we visit Las Vegas.

Went here with my husband because Mesa Grill had a 3 hour waiting time if you don't have reservations on a Saturday night. Me and my husband are not fans of pubs but we were pleasantly surprised. We got seated without waiting.  The chairs were comfortable.  

The food was really good! The cheese plate was unforgettable. But they don't give you enough bread. We had to order extra bread. The fish and chips were good too! The batter was very crisp and the fish was still moist. My husband had the lamb chops and he liked it a lot! 

Service was good. And met the manager, Randy, and he was very friendly! 

Music was too loud, but, it's a pub...

Will definitely come back.

We stoped in for a late lunch and we had the best service. Our waiter was amazing and Manny the manager came over and chatted with us making us feel like family. The food was amazing and the overall experience was the best. Thanks! We are coming back for sure!

While waiting for the Celine show we were lucky to grab a spot at the bar. Our bartender, Keith, was very friendly, telling us the pub had only been open for 3 months. I guess the uniforms were supposed to be disco 80's, but I felt sorry for the girls. Our food service was prompt. I expect pub food to be fattening and it was delicious as well. I had the sliders and my husband had a ham and cheese sandwich.  I hope Ramsey keeps his eye on this place to keep it up to par. I've read several poor reviews that I think would get his ire up! Maybe better training of the staff? Our experience was great.

With so many great eateries on Vegas Strip, this place just taint Gordon Ramsey's name.  A hip pub joint that serves food which my mom can make better at home.  We were seated around 1PM on a Friday, and our server did not come over until 20 minutes or so after.  Then after he took our order, he came back and "confirm" our order.  Basically, he forgot our second entree order.  Anyhow, after waiting close to half an hour, I was about to blow a gasket.  I asked the waiter to check on our food, he said it is coming.  He served our entrees first before our mussels and clams appetizer.

The mussels tasted like mud, not fresh and tender.  It was just very musky.  The bacon burger was just ok, nothing real special about it.  It was under favored.  For $19, I expected a bit more.  Then the Steak and ale pie also lacked in favor.  Marie callendar's chicken pot pie tasted better than this.  I still can't believe I tipped the server.

The restaurant decor was nice, but the food and service really stinks.

ATTENTION: This restaurant is a Caesars Palace property. It is NOT owned by Gordon Ramsay. Do not expect better quality than you would from the food court or handful of other Caesar owned food spots within Caesars Palace. Gordon Ramsay's influence ended at accepting a check to put his name above the door. 

My friend and I didn't believe the restaurant  could be as bad as the reviews claimed. It was worse.

The fish and chips were revolting. I said to my friend, at least the bad reviews usually say the mushy peas are good. FALSE. I managed 2-3 bites of each, as did my friend, before sending it back. The waitress acted like she was doing me a favor by comping it, which was also contingent upon her taking the plates right then. Pretty insulting.

The staff was incompetent and rude. They wandered around clueless of what they should be doing. They would form large packs then break apart and begin wandering again, only to reform the pack in another area.

The sound from the sub woofer which was conveniently located 5 FEET behind my friends chair was an added bonus. We asked that it be turned down. The manager had the waitress tell us "No". For the record my friend and I are guys, we were there to eat, drink and watch the games. When I say the sound was to loud, I'm saying we had to lean in and almost yell to converse. 

To add insult to injury my St. Bernadus 12 was served with a plastic cup.

This was par for my overall experience with Caesars. Pathetic.

I like this place. Surprised it only has 3 stars.
All the food comes out well-executed and tasty, and the drink selection is good.
The only reason I can think of why it doesn't have a better Yelp rating is because it is slightly pricey for what it is?

A group of 6 of us came in for 1 hour and spent about $170 on three apps and two rounds of drinks.

Delicious Mac & Cheese, French fries and Slider-thingys.
Would come back on an expense account, or with out-of-town friends on a Strip pub crawl!
If your going here to get a burger save your money u can get a better burger from Red Robbin  hands down

Ambience was trendy, Food was good, overpriced, but the service was AWFUL.  (Dear Bryan, we didn't stiff you.  10% was overtipping for the attitude that you brought.)  From the second we sat down till the moment we had to ask for our check, we were a bother. There were FIVE long legged girls working the hostess counter but only saw THREE waiters in the entire restaurant.  And it wasn't lack of experience.  He brought the Gordon Ramsay "you're an idiot" attitude to all of his tables.  So if you want to be treated like a moron for asking if the toffee pudding is good and being told that it's like "EVERY OTHER toffee pudding in normal restaurants, "scoff" then go somewhere else.  After 5 years of waiting tables, I don't complain.  This experience was the exception.

We ate at Gordon Ramsey's Burgr earlier in the day and had the BEST service and BEST meal so our party decided to try the grill and pub for dinner... Service was HORRIBLE the waiter took one of our drinks to refill and never came back with it, I had to ask 2 diff servers for ketchup and by the time they brought it my fries were cold. The food was decent but not really what you would expect for Gordon's name attached to it. Oh and both my water glass and my friends were empty thru the dinner and never refilled or asked to be refilled. The waiter was no where to be found and it wasn't even that crowded. We dined there today, on a Sunday evening around 6-7pm. Oh and forgot to mention, they added a 18% gratuity for our group of 7, which we wouldn't have minded paying had we got 18% service! Overall we were all very disappointed and would not recommend this place however I would recommend his Burgr restaurant if your looking for a good burger and great service.

We were all looking forward to our reservation at the pub.  Cocktail menu is very limited.  I asked about some of the drinks I saw on their website.  The waiter said he didn't know anything about them, but they change their I pad list often."  Not impressed.  We ordered a bottle of wine.  Not once did the waiter come over to refill our glasses.  We had to ask him every time, as he did not leave it at, or near the table for us.  My hubby was looking forward to a nice burger...There is not a burger on the menu.  He goes to London twice a year, and said, there is no pub in London that doesn't have a burger on its menu.  When our meals arrived, we were very very surprised with the small portions.  The shephards pie portion looked like a small appetizer.  The guy that had it, said he had never been to a place where he had to fill up on bread.  The food was tasty, but very over priced for what you get.  The desserts were delicious.  About the only positive thing, all 4 of us had to say about the pub, was the dessert was good.  Service was very poor, and our waiter pretty much ignored us.  The next day, all 4 of us said, we would never go back again.  Very over rated.   I should also mention, we have been to Ramsays burger place in Planet Hollywood, and loved it.  Also to his fine dining steak house in the Paris, and loved it.  But never again to the pub

My wife and I decided to go on a little stay-cation for our anniversary, as we live in Las Vegas! Obsessed with Gordon Ramsay's Hell's Kitchen, we wanted to dine in one of his restaurants for the special occasion and the Pub & Grill did not disappoint. We were greeted with a smile and seated promptly. The manager came over to say hello and the waiter was to us in a timely manner. John, our server was quick and never left the plates on the tables or drinks needing to be filled. We were torn as to what to select as the menu was amazing. John helped with some suggestions. We started with the calamari, which was tender and had great flavor. I had the Ribeye and it was cooked to perfection. My wife's entree of the double lamb chops had her cleaning off the bone! We shared with our entree what will be the item that makes us crave to return, the Lobster Mac and Cheese! Spectacular with its large chunks of lobster! We ended the night not being to tell John no to some toffee sticky pudding and we will not regret it! Worth every last bite. I would suggest anyone in the Las Vegas area check out Ramsay's Pub in Caesars.

I always keep an open mind when trying a new place. Especially having tried Gordon Ramsay Steak and loving it. With that said we were greeted by a cute chatty hostess to show us to our table. I liked the staffs outfits, dark wood decor and barrels stacked to create a wall between the bar and restaurant but I hated our table. The location was fine, but it was a high top with backless stools, I felt like a little kid and never felt comfortable. Request a booth, they look so comfy. We got food menus right away but had to wait for the drink menu, they brought us some water ( which wasn't the tastiest tap water) while we passed the one drink menu iPad around deciding what to drink. Doug was the only one getting a specialty cocktail, the Pub Crawl. It was light and tasty, I'd recommend it, he ended up getting a second one later. 
I had my heart set on a Scotch Egg but I noticed it wasn't on the menu, once we finally made our minds up on food I asked our waiter about the Scotch Egg, he said it's on the pub menu and offered to get us one. We waited and waited, when he finally came back, he asked if we were ready to order,  again I asked about the pub menu, he apologized and got us one within a minute. He seemed to discourage us from most things on the pub menu, not sure why? But I ended up getting the Scotch Egg which was very disappointing, it wasn't greasy, had a nice crunch but the sausage was dry and very spicy which overwhelmed the egg and I didn't care for dipping it in the hp sauce. I had one at another gastropub in town and it was tremendously better than Gordon's. 
We had also received their free bread service which included 3 different pretzel bites and a rye roll with pots of butter and cheese. Having 4 people at our table I think we should've gotten 2 but we all shared so we could have a bit of everything. They were all very good, I would order it if it wasn't complimentary. One thing we thought was strange was we didn't get bread plates to eat our bread or share the apps. Very messy.
When ordering our entrees, Doug was unsure on what to get and tried to get some help from the waiter, but it was one of those scenarios where they say everything is good but push the most expensive choice, not very helpful.
Our entrees came not too long after our apps and bread. Crowding our already small table, they never removed the Scotch Egg dish. There was a Pork Belly Roll, the Lamb T-Bone, and 2 of us got the Fish and Chips. We sampled each dish. The Pork belly was very moist and tender but it didn't have much else going on. The lamb was okay but nothing special, I didn't taste any of the mint jus that was suppose to be present, the mustard on the side was strong with horseradish but it was good. The Fish was tender and not greasy with a decent crunch but it wasn't anything special either, I've had better fish and chips at an English pub in town. The "chips" were way too big, not crispy at all, I didn't like them. The mushy peas were really nice and fresh tasting though. I couldn't finish one of fish pieces so asked for it to packed up, I think in higher end places the waiter should box it for you, but maybe that's just me. I had to box it myself.  
We couldn't leave with out getting the Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert. It was really good. Sweet, moist, gooey, some crispy spots all with a side of sweet cream ice cream. Yum.
Thus far my impression was poor service, don't waste your time on an entree here (IMO go to his steakhouse instead), seems like a good spot for drinks, small bites/apps, and dessert. I have to say they were nice enough to allow us to hang out for awhile after dinner, they warned us they were closing for a private event so the place cleared out fast around us but let us stay til the last minute before they had to have everything ready. We were also well supplied with water, even though we had already paid and tipped. 

For the prices and name on the door, I was disappointed. Gordon, say it ain't so!

Good as far as pub food goes and very knowledgeable barkeeps.

You might be waiting a while for a table, but I can see why.

Best girls night amazing dinner Rod Schaffer took the best care of us. Ask for Rod when you make your reservation that way you are guaranteed great food and Amazing dining experience!! Thanks Rod for making Nancy's Bday and Tari's engagement night best time!!!!

**Have a Spiced Cider cocktail and ask for Joshua!**

I had the most enjoyable dining experience at GR's Pub & Grill. Being warmly greeted and seated quickly established my positive impression and the staff maintained the momentum. Our server, Joshua, arrived promptly and took exceptional care of us. 

We started off with Spiced Cider and Sloe Bramble cocktails. The sweet cinnamon flavor of the cider hit the spot. I cannot recommend it enough! The Sloe Bramble was "berry" nice but lacking in the wow factor. I enjoyed rifling through the online bar menu on Joshua's tablet. 

The Rib & Cheek Sandwich is beyond tender. It was flavorful and rich. The potatoes were huge and nicely seasoned on the outside with Parmesan cheese. 

The Mac N Cheese is divine. I adore the truffle and tiny duck fat crouton topping. Just a luscious dish. 

For dessert a must is the Sticky Toffee Pudding! Forgo the Chocolate Trifle and order two of the puddings! Don't worry about the servings being too big. They are just right. 

Thank you Joshua for being so knowledgeable, quick to gauge customer tastes and just charming in general. The staff was sweet and pleasant all around. I am happy to endorse this establishment and will certainly stop by again.

I love this place and love Gordon (please hire me):))) just kidding ok. The food we ordered was amazing. I ordered a lot of items just because I wanted to taste as much Gordon's food as possible. All I can say he didn't disappoint me at all. The food and service were great!!! Thank you for the beautiful dinner!!!!

I always wanted to try one of Gordon's restaurants, so stopped by to have a lunch here.
I had the pulled pork and chips,  my wife ordered a burger.   my pulled pork was just OK,  I found the flavor just a little bland.  I mean it was OK, but I've had better at small restaurants at home.  The chips were great, very tasty.  My wife's burger looked great visually.  it was a perfect round bun.   However,  it was not very tasty to me,  to be honest I thought it was a very average burger.  The fries were not that good at all. Sort of like fast food.   over all I was surprised at the food,  I could have had a better lunch at 5 guys.   Perhaps it was just an off day,  but I think it was just a mediocre lunch at a premium price.

Husband is a fan of Gordon Ramsay's Hell's Kitchen and I'm a fan of food so we decided to give it a try...the servers were really nice and food was good. 3 stars cuz I think food was over priced...we shared the clams...broth was tasty n clams were tender n portion was decent to share but it was almost $30...i think it was pricey...i got the fish n chips...they used cod fish...crunchy outside flaky fish inside...a bit oily but it is deep fried so what do I expect hehe...without the malt vinegar and the tartar sauce, there is nothing special about it esp since it was $30...that being said...the tartar sauce was really tasty...i was dipping the chips/potato in it it was that good...we also tried the chopped salad with chicken n shrimp...it's supposed to have avocado...so I was looking for it because I love avocado...the server said it has a "alittle" bit smashed at the bottom of the plate...I'm must have been very little cuz I didn't see any...and I couldn't taste any...i just wanted the avocado. It has an upscale pub vibe

Went there on a Saturday night and was able to find seating at the bar for a few drinks before dinner with relative ease.  Had dinner there after a long day of gambling and split a bunch of plates with friends.  Everything was great and I wish I would have went back again for a more focused experience.  

Definitely way better than Bobby Flay's place in CP.

Since I love his shows and became a fan, you got to try the food to see what all the hype is about! I already had his burgers, so next was some pub food. 

The prices are high.. first thing you notice. I got a Shepherd's pie just because it was the least expensive on the menu. ($23)

I had spent a lot of money throughout the night, I didn't want to over spend here too. The servers outfits were soo cool. I loved the chains and pants. They had a rock star look to them. 

My server was attentive. I was just finishing up my water, when she stood by waiting until I put it down on the table and right away filled it up! lol. She was not leaving my glass empty. My food was fast and hot. It looks small but once you start digging in, you notice it's more than it looks. It was really good. The meat was juicy and the potatoes had just the right amount of flavor. I was pleased with my dinner. 

So for my Pie and tip came to $29 bucks.

This pub is Awesome!!! Had the salmon for lunch and it literally melted in my mouth!!! Sooo deelish and healthy for pub food! Oh and don't forget to try the Mini Lobster roll (ate it the day before lol) it made me feel like I was on the East coast! ;) amazing cocktails and awesome food!! SIT at the BAR with the #1 Bartenders at Caesars!! They'll definitely make you a cocktail you will NEVER forget!!! CHEERS!!!!!!

The interior deco was a tribute to the motherland, England. Made to look like an English pub. You won't believe how casual and laid back this place is, in comparison to its neighbors at Caesar's Place. Peter was our host and he reminded us of Mario Lopez! 

I really like the pork rillettes (despite mistaking it for fish initially). It had none of the porky taste and looked as white as fish meat. Topped with strings of sweet caramelized onions. It was the perfect finger food to wash down with a pint of beer. We had a good pint! I can't recall its name but if a non-beer fan can love it, I am sure most people will too! It had a dark oaky color, wasn't very strong but had slightly bitter aftertaste. 

The Deviled egg was a miss for me though my friend seemed to liked it. To each his own. 

It's definitely one of Ramsay's biggest restaurant in Vegas and Hell Kitchen was shot there too. Interest ambiance but nothing beats the real deal English pub for sure!

This was a nice night out!!! The company and atmosphere of the restaurant were great! 
The service was top notch with a great and attentive waiter, use of the iPad to tell descriptions and pictures helped. 
The good however was average. I wanted a burger, any kind really and all they had were sliders at dinner. These sliders were tiny, bread over buttered and average taste. The fries side was excellent!! Way more fries than any one person can eat! His fish and chips were average. We were going to share fries but he didn't get more than a handful. The fish was ok but too much butter in the batter. The other couple agreed!
The dessert I got the toffee cake and it was too rich, everyone took a bite and we still couldn't finish it. The other couple got the berry parfait, I believe strawberry and said it was wonderful. It was finished before I looked up. 
Fun night, we sat there talking for awhile and felt kind of rushed to leave.... But we stayed till we all decided to walk around anyway! Off to shopping when in Caesars!!!

I would give this place zero stars, but that's not an option. The hostess was rude and short. After waiting about 10 minutes, on a non-busy Monday, we finally got water! We ordered cocktails and 20+ minutes later they arrived. Mine tasted like cough syrup. The appetizers arrived quickly, the meal did not. So far we are 35 minutes into this ordeal without our entrees. The food arrived and was "okay". Definitely not amazing and required salt. Do yourself a favor-- STAY AWAY from this place!

Update: I complained and the waitress said "Good news, I was able to comp 5 of your drinks". So, there were 7 of us drinking, so 5 wasn't even a round. Additionally, I was seeking compensation. I wanted to speak to the manager about how awful the whole experience was. The manager didn't even bother to come over!!!!! At this point, I thanked the waitress and asked to speak to the manager. He came over and acted dumbfounded that I didn't care about getting stuff for free, I truly believe a manager should come apologize and get feedback to improve the experience. 

This whole place was a disaster.

Service was great at lunch. Had the lamb burger with fries. They give you a ton of fries couldn't eat them all. Food came out quick. The lamb burger was delicious. The place is like being in an English pub without the plane ride. Did have a few items of note featuring scotch eggs, bangers and mash, and a few types of meat pies i.e. Shepherds etc. The prices are quite high, but less than Gordon Ramsey steak. If you are a fan of Gordon's and are by Cesar's Palace I would definitely recommend it.

My girlfriend and I went to Chef Ramsey's Pub last week. I have great respect for this man and his accomplishments. His food was excellent. My problem was with the service. The place was only half full and we were seated immediately. We had to wait too long for our order to be taken. Then when the meal was over, we waited at least 15 minutes to get the check after asking for it. Then the pen she left did not work. I waited another 15 minutes and still no waitress so I raised my hand with the dead pen in hand before the manager came over and gave me a working pen. Sadly when we speak of this experience in the future, it will be the poor service we remember and not the great meal...

So here we go - 
#1 - The Service and Hostess greeting were very, very good.
Really the ONLY reason I am giving it 3 Stars.
#2 - If The Hell's Kitchen Chef was in this house last night, he would have lost his S#&T over the Food Quality and presentation.
#3 - Appetizer! i ordered the Chef's Concept of PIG'S in a Blanket. This was the best of the food items I ordered. The Mustard and HR Sauce to Dip was very good.
#4 - I thought I would try his take on fish and chips!
OMG this was a greasy, semi warm plate of YUCK.
The fish fillets were stacked on top of one another and it turn them into a gloppie ( is that a word ) soggy mess.
The Chips were just awful!!! Under cooked greasy and I just watched a show earlier in the month Master Chef where they tried to replicate Perfect French Fries / .
The Chef wouldn't have served this to his dog!!.
Really Fish & Chips at a premiere english pub, owned by the man and it just sucked!!
#5 - At least the Ice Tea wasn't F#&Ked up LOL!!
$62 with 20 % gratuity added in total, because like I said at least the service was great.

I live in the Las Vegas Marketplace in Henderson, The other Ramsay Group restaurant s I have visited have been exceptional _ Burgr/ Steakhouse / so this was a total downer.

Never again at the PUB!!

We visited Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill (inside Caesars Palace) on the first night of a business trip in Vegas.

I was prepared to be unimpressed, but the celebrity stamp on a fairly affordable restaurant specializing in the chef's country of origin was interesting enough to give it a shot. Also, the people I was with wanted to eat there. 

I had an Innis & Gunn stout with the black truffle macaroni and cheese, which was EXCELLENT, and I've had macaroni and cheese in a billion places. The Scotch egg and salt and vinegar crisps (calling them that doesn't make them feel any more English than regular potato chips do, but I get it) appetizers were pretty spot-on... not amazing, but good drinking food. 

Drink, meal, and tip landed just over $40. Good on you, Gordon Ramsay, for not charging the hell out of people for food that doesn't really justify its price tag. It's sort of a foreign dining experience--I won't call it authentic, but dark, pub-like, with living room-style chairs that were awkwardly low versus the height of the table. Fun and easily satisfying for groups and drinkers.

The service was mediocre that night; our waiter disappeared for long stretches, I had to ask for a water refill; it wasn't the worst service I've had, but it didn't warrant a hefty tip.

A couple days later, we stopped in again (The connected Forum Shoppes made us all tired... from all the shopping) for drinks. The bartender recommended cocktails from the menu, discussed each at length, and was super charming and attentive, even discussing other local restaurant recommendations and letting me sample a bit of a drink I asked about.

If you love English food (and I'm not sure anyone does), this place is doing it right enough to give it a shot.

I had family come into town so we wanted to go somewhere different.  We were not disapponted. The atmosphere was cool, server was really nice, and since we had made reservations, we didn't have to wait. 

We got the Shepherd's Pie and the chicken, kale and bacon pot pie and they were surprisingly great portion sizes. Very filling and actually tasted amazing. 

I'm not much of a dessert person, but the snickerdoodle that we got was like nothing  I've ever had before.

Overall, great experience. Alittle expensive but would you expect with a name like that and on the Strip?

I attempted to go here twice for dinner but both times was turned down from my friends opinions of it already. I guess they had a couple bad experiences there before but I really wanted to go because I was wanting a good beer n some simple unpretentious food.  I'm glad I went. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. I started with the mushroom salad on a bed of frisée. I really love mushrooms, so when I say four or five different kinds, I gasped, and dived in. I didn't come up for air until It was finished. Oh what fun that was. And the pretzels were a nice touch, I liked the mustard far better than the cheese, surprisingly. I ordered the chorizo mussels for dinner because I'm a big mussel fan and the waiter recommended it.  Very good even tho I hardly ate the chorizo bc that was the only part I wasn't interested in somehow. The broth was salty but savory and it was gigantic.  My friend got the pork belly which had wonderful flavor and the fat was super crispy, I liked it more than him I think. The other guest ordered the shepards pie and said it was great.

This place is disappointing. They needed up our order three times and was not willing to substitute items in our entree when they clearly told is they ran out of. For example we had a burger and it was supposed to come with a dill pickle and pepperchini garnish. All they said was they ran out and that's it. I thought most restaurants would substitute something for that. It's a $20 burger that's worth $9 after this experience. Also the wait took an hour wait. Will not come back. Gordon better come back and fix this.

Pros:
1. Ice cold Newcastle at the bar
2. Scotch Egg was very tasty
3. Fries were super salty and hot
4. Friendly bartender with a heavy hand on the alcohol :)
5. Meat pie sampler was top notch per my gal


Cons:
1. Dusty front of the restaurant (the black steel window frames) right next to diners eating at the "patio"
2. Had a rare burger but the meat had zero seasoning and the bun was meh...wilted lettuce leaf, bland experience
3. Prices were through the roof (we spent the same for lunch here as we did for  dinner at Gordon Ramsay's Paris restaurant)
4. Seating was designed with high back chairs that were way too low for the table - felt like we were eating at the kid's table
5. Manager type guys in suits that looked like they were in the Mafia - never smiled or spoke to the diners.
This is our first time here.  Our waiter Scott gave good recommendations and was super friendly!  Pub bites and the drinks here are great for a break after a long day lf walking and shopping!
Pricey... Dunno about the food..but I'll rather pay that much for something better...guess I'm paying for the name.

Great British Fare! A bit pricey for pub food, but its probably on par with all the other restaurants in the strip.  The pretzel appetizer was pretty good but for 7$ it would be nice to get more than 3.  The english cheddar sauce that is served with the pretzels is amazing though.  

The Beer Braised Short Rib entree is fantastic however a little steep at almost 40$.  The portion size was generous.  The Sticky Toffee Pudding is a must have.

Gordon needs to be fired from the kitchen.  We ate here last Friday (party of 6) and felt like we were rushed through the entire evening.  All food items we tasted epwere very mediocre and prices were off the chart.  $30 for the fish and chips and $22 for the burger which was unimaginative and small in size.  Even the beer and wine were overpriced for a pub.  We ate here out of convenience because we were staying in Caesar's but will not return as there are far better places in the Linq area and other hotels across the street.  Gordon must be making a high profit margin on this restaurant.

Truly disappointed!!! Got the Scotch Egg. Very plain. Ale Onion Soup, plain. We waited with each item coming out. Over an hour after we sat we finally got our meal. I got the lamb rack -asked for medium, came out rare - no seasons. I had to add salt and pepper. The baby carrots were good and seasoned well and the mac'n cheese was good.. I told them 3 times it was my husbands birthday. The waiter came over after we ate and delivery of the check with all kinds of small talk....I plan to never eat here again...

I'm happy to give GRPG a solid four stars. Our meals were piping hot, and the portions were quite large. Also, beer lovers will find their line up of beers to be quite good. I went for something a bit different, and got myself a pint of pear cider. It went very well with their braised pork which I think was cooked to perfection.

The good: service was excellent. Prompt, courteous, and friendly. I had the lamb burger and it was really really good. 

The not so good: fries were very mediocre. My husband got the truffle fries for an up charge. They were ok but not worth the up charge. His beef burger was good but nothing special. The warm pretzel appetizer we got was cold. I also don't think this meal was a "good value." Way overpriced for what you get. I understand this is Vegas but $22 for a bacon cheeseburger is excessive to me. 

I feel bad for making these criticisms because overall the dining experience was good.

Stopped in for dinner last night.

Bottom line: the food is good, but the service is poor.

I tried the onion ale soup - B+. I also had the bacon cheeseburger - B. The burger would've been an A, but I ordered it medium and it was delivered nearly well done. The truffle fries were just ok. My wife ordered the steak and ale pie - A.

The service - F. Our waitress was inattentive and rude. She rarely checked on us, and when we tried to get our bill to leave, she was MIA. When we finally flagged her down and asked for the bill, she took 15 minutes to have another server bring it to us.

Probably won't return unless the service is addressed, or if we do, will just sit at the bar.

Ok I must say my burger was omg D Lish!!! The beer was good, they had a nice variety. We were both happy with our meals here. But overall it was ridiculous the prices they charge here for a burger & a beer. Wow, I could have sushi for a little more.. lol

went here late on a friday night. we were immediately seated and the staff was very kind and attentive. the decor is very eclectic, hip environment, and great people watching. we ordered caeser salad and fried oysters for appetizers, different beers off their very cool ipad drink list with pictures of each drink, and ate hands down the best shephard's pie I have ever tasted. the beef stew is delicious and there were soft mashed potatoes layered over the stew. great place for a date, for friends, everyone!

Gordon Ramseys chain of restaurants is growing but the quality is slipping. Had the Sheppard's Pie and it was tasteless. Too much potato and not enough vegetables or meat. Used lots of salt and pepper to give it taste. 

Tasted my friends shorts ribs and Risotto which was undercooked. This is something Ramsey rails against yet his restaurant violated it. 

The atmosphere was good with an airy feeling and the service was average. For the price in Vegas on the strip it is a good deal.

No no no. This goes on the skip it list. 
This is the second GR place I have been and had bad food and experience. And I'm a fan!
Maybe I was hoping for too much???
The food, just burgers and salad took forever to come out. The staff was confused and seemed disoriented.
Plenty of other places to eat at...move on...nothing to see here.

Very disappointed. Sand in the scallops. Fish and chips - fish over-cooked. When told waiter, he said he would let know chef know. Came back and said no one else complained. I asked if he thought I was lying. Said no, but no one did anything. Not what I expected from a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. My family is English and I have had MUCH better fish and chips from our local take out in San Diego and a LOT cheaper!
The food was less than mediocre, the burgers were dry, the lobster roll was bland.. The only good thing was the staff
The food and service were a-mazing. Well done Chef, well done! Had the sticky toffee pudding. Was the best thing with sauce to die for.

We had SO much fun here! We met friends who live nearby for dinner while we were in town for a getaway. We were staying in Nobu, so we had time to kill before they arrived. We sat at the bar for a few coctails. Jose was our bartender. Such a nice guy, as well as very professional and knowledgeable. We wound up going back on our 2nd night to watch the Rangers playoff game (the cigarette smoke in sportsbook is too overwhelming for us non-smokers).

On night 2, we met Gene the bartender, who's just as nice as Jose, and also extremely funny. We had great service and entertainment with Jose and Gene, plus the Rangers managed a win. 

Food is very good. Between us both, we tried the shepherd's pie, toad in the hole, lamb burger, and tri-tip sandwich. All delicious! Another fun spot we'll definitely return to when we return to Vegas.

Stopped in for a bite to eat whilst making bets at the sports book area. Found a seat at the bar and was quickly greeted with a menu.

The bartender behind the bar was an extremely friendly gentleman who, as I would learn, checked in frequently with all of the patrons and myself. He did a great job during the lunch hour under much duress. 

I was much in the mood for a burger and fries despite the fact that the two gentleman on either side of me ordered the fish and chips, which looked very appealing. 

This British-themed bar had Champions League soccer on the tele, and you could tell the bartender knew his soccer.

The burger I ordered was very good, and it came with standard fries. I noticed that the fish and chips came with steak fries. Kind of wished my order came with those instead of the shoe-string style.

I ordered a couple of German ales, and the beer was perfectly chilled.

Good visit! A little bit more expensive and the lunch-time clientele was dressed up a little more, but well worth the visit. When on vacation, there is no harm in splurging a little more, particularly when you double or triple your money at the sport book. Ha :-)

Gordon Ramsay est moins connu en France que dans le monde anglo-saxon mais il est en gros le Cyril Lignac des Britanniques (en plus méchant). Il est sans doute aussi un businessman plus averti, car il possède une quarantaine de restaurants à travers le monde, dont deux à Vegas (ne vous trompez pas d'endroit quand vous faites votre réservation !).
Le Pub & Grill, donnant directement sur le casino à l'intérieur du Caesars, propose une cuisine d'inspiration "pub anglais", en version assez américanisée tout de même. Disons-le clairement, la bouffe est excellente ! Mythe ou réalité, en tous cas le serveur jure la main sur le cœur que Ramsay surveille de près la cuisine et passe tous les mois en personne pour une visite de contrôle surprise.
Les portions sont très copieuses, une bonne solution est donc de prendre plusieurs entrées (les mini-burgers sont à tomber par terre) et plusieurs accompagnements (les frites à la mayonnaise aux truffes !) pour varier les plaisirs, au lieu d'un plat principal unique qui va vous bourrer.
Prix pas excessifs pour la qualité. Il est recommandé de réserver, mais on peut aussi se pointer à l'improviste et s'inscrire sur la liste d'attente et aller se promener dans le casino en attendant son tour, ou, avec un peu de chance, manger au bar.

Though there were some really great things about Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill in Caesar's Palace, I left feeling like something was missing.  This is the second Gordon Ramsay restaurant I've been to, the other one was in London and wasn't the best experience.  The atmosphere at this pub was nice... lots of TVs and the room was huge.  We sat in the bar area and had to wait quite awhile for service and our food.  I also found what the waitresses were wearing to be a bit much... but to each their own.

As far as the food goes, I tried the pretzels, pub nachos, sliders, and sticky toffee pudding.  The pretzels were amazing, especially the cheese sauce they were served with.  I only wish this has been a bigger portion.  The nachos were good... loved the kettle chips and sauce, but there were WAY too many jalapenos - jeez does anyone like them that much?  The sliders were standard... way over cooked.  As others have said the sticky toffee pudding is delicious... this is a MUST have at this restaurant.

All in all, I would go back and try some different things.  They do have some happy hour specials, which is nice... especially in Vegas.
Best place. Friendliest people I have met this trip. LOVED IT. Go see Ray Ray. A mixologist that can put many to shame.

Loved it at first glance. First time coming in with high expectations. Not disappointed. Had a nice beer (Innis &Gunn Scottish ale) which I don't normally have but it's a pub right. Ordered the bangers and mash and my wife had the fish and chips. Both were awesome. Glad we decided to come. We will come back and probably bring the kids.

What a huge disappointment.  If you want a good Ramsay experience try one of his other places because this probably won't be it.

The Truffle Chips were really pretty good but when it came to Fish & Chips, that's another story.  The fish was a pretty thick piece with a very light batter that made it seem out of proportion and not cooked properly.  The taste was okay, but when you pay these prices at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant you expect a lot more than okay.

We had two waiters that took turns waiting on us so you would expect good service but again, it was okay at best.  

Wow, what a bummer.

Disappointing considering this guy yells at people for sub par food!  We honestly just stopped for drinks and figured this was a safe bet-place looked cool and there were empty spots in front, perfect for people watching.  I ordered a grey hound and my friend ordered a mojito.  While waiting we realized we could have taken advantage of the happy hour menu which was never mentioned by our server.  (Would have been nice to know.)  After waiting much too long our drinks arrived but we were certain the mojito was wrong-it was in a clear glass, no fresh mint to speak of.  My friend had a sip and she said it tasted like the pre-mixed drinks you can buy in the grocery store in a can.  That is where I suspected my greyhound came from as well judging by the taste-it was horrible.  But if you are going to charge $14 (?) for a mojito at least fake it by throwing in a spring of fresh mint...but mAybe that was too much work.  So, we ordered from the happy hour menu next thinking this was clearly not a mixed drink place-we should have paid attention to the keg-decor and impressive beer offering.  I happen to love IPAs and was excited to see Dog Fish Head on tap...but no...it was out.  It was only 4:00 or so!!  Okay, so I ordered  Stone IPA, also. Rey nice.  Strike two... "Sorry-we are also out of that."  So the only other IPA was Lagunitas which I like.  At $5 (happy hour) it was a deal including the $5 nachos-over the top fattening but good.  I can't believe a restaurant of this caliber had the audacity to serve those so called cocktails we started with-they should be ashamed of themselves!

I've been here a while ago. Lovely decor and interesting cocktails. I had some seared scallops, oysters, and truffle fries etc. Delicious but not very memorable and a tad pricy for me. It's a pub so it was very loud. Suitable for casual dinner with friends and families though.

Best meal we had in Vegas (and way better than Chef Ramsay's steak, for about 20% the price). The service was excellent, and although I didn't particularly enjoy the ambiance of sitting at the edge of the casino, I'm sure you could sit more 'in' the restaurant to enjoy it more. 

That being said, the scallop dish with potato and bacon moat under it was heavenly. Each bite on its own was wonderful, but combined wax a little symphony in your mouth with each bite. The shepherds pie is good (if you like lamb), but the Caesar salad was just average. 

This is a great option to try some of Chef Ramsay's food influence and ideas without using hearing protection & dropping a mortgage payment over at Steak.

Stopped there about a month ago as we toured Caesar's.  My wife ordered the fish and chips.  This was perhaps the worst food I have seen in a restaurant.  Nothing is worse than fish where the breading is thicker than the fish.  Biting through 1/4" of soggy breading to get to 1/8" of fish is disgusting.  I would not feed this to the people in Guantanamo Bay...this would be torture!!!!  On top of that I had to pay $30.00 for this!  Perhaps someone should yell at Gordon Ramsey and call his food s**t like he does on television.  Stay away from this place.

You know when it takes 60 minutes to get your order and it is wrong at a Gordon Ramsey resturant something is definitely F'd.  3 pm on a Sunday. I order a lamb burger medium rare and truffle fries to go. 60 minutes later my order comes out. Burger and regular fries and not to go. The guy next to me at the bar ordered a rueben 5 minutes after I ordered and FINISHED it before I recieved my order. And it was wrong. I really wanted to go Gordon Ramsey on them, but I didn't. flavors were there but for 25 bucks it was not a good experience.... or as I think Gordon would say, "Absolutely F'ing unacceptable!!"

I have been a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay and have watched every reality show he has produced in the U. S. so when we were planning our recent trip to Vegas, all I could hear in my head is Gordon yelling at me, "You better eat at one of my restaurants, you f***ing donkey!"   

With those inspiring words resonating in my head, I booked our first dinner at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-pub-and-grill-las-vegas?select=P8fDK-wHe80_9pnT_mIrig ) for Thanksgiving dinner.  This also continued a recent tradition I like to call the "Untraditional Thanksgiving."   It started a few years ago with a trip to Big Bear with a Chinese Thanksgiving and since then we have done Hawaiian and now British cuisine.

One of the things I like right away was the vibe of the place ... I really felt comfortable and at home.  The attention to detail was extensive including a wall mural ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-pub-and-grill-las-vegas?select=0jogkV5ZH0-crkb0wzAzeQ ) , the table settings ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-pub-and-grill-las-vegas?select=7PjeahRWVg8XaSlaEYzKMQ ) and menus.  Even the mix matched furniture just felt right in this restaurant.  And if the staff needs a reminder of who they work for ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-pub-and-grill-las-vegas?select=mN8dmXYi9mLK3T9tu9vCzg ), you have Chef Ramsay staring at you every time you leave or enter the kitchen!

Once we were seated at a half booth table, our server came over, took our drink order and introduced us to the menu.  The menu consists of Table Starters, Soups & Salads, Sandwiches & Burgers, Seasonal Choices, Pies, Oak-Fired Grill Entrees, Classic Entrees, Sides and Desserts.

For my wife, her entrée was preordained weeks before the reservation and she chose the Classic Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-pub-and-grill-las-vegas?select=pLeX7KKtxHjHAVxFxtkWIg ) Substituting Mashed Potatoes with Chive Oil for the Chips, I decided to go with the Steak & Ale Pie ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-pub-and-grill-las-vegas?select=cxztqT6sQKUcvxwKCUb-dw ) and we split the Kettle Chip Nachos ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-pub-and-grill-las-vegas?select=3iew4HO_VJPYKtAeK9t_OA ) Starter item.

The Kettle Chip Nachos came to the table surprising hot and I think these were the first homemade chips that really impressed Laina.  Usually we would have some major complaints about the lack of short rib (very little) and corned beef (even less ... think nada), but the HP sauce (Tamarind based sauce with tomatoes, molasses and malt vinegar) really elevated the chips and there was a good amount of the other items.  Needless to say and to paraphrase Dr. Suess:  the one speck of food that we left on the plate was a crumb too small for a mouse to have ate!

Our entrees came out shortly after we had wolfed down the nachos.  Laina liked the fish and said she could taste the ale in the batter, but was more impressed with the dill tarter sauce and sides.  Opting out of the chips for mashed potatoes was an excellent choice as the potatoes were perfectly whipped and the chive oil was a great compliment.  Usually Laina will ask for extra butter with her mashed potatoes, but no butter was requested on this occasion.  Her only regret was there could have been more chive oil with the potatoes.  She was also a fan of the mushy peas and thought the vest of lemon was a great addition without being too acidic.

My steak and ale pie was a well balanced dish, just a bit on the small side.  The pastry was a perfect golden brown and flaky.  This is a very hearty entree and there was a good amount of tender steak, 'shrooms and root veggies.  I am just not sure the quality makes up for the lack of quantity when you consider the price tag ($24.00).  

For dessert, we selected the Potted Chocolate Triffle ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-pub-and-grill-las-vegas?select=4KSMWCaEumIG2DXwpsqF9A ) which came with two mini chocolate chocolate chip cookies.

Rohlinism:  It isn't Thanksgiving dinner without a fattening dessert!

Laina was basically full, but always manages to find extra room for chocolaty delicious desserts.  The triffle was topped with white chocolate shavings and round dark chocolate crisps.  The mixture of dark and milk chocolate was fantastic and the Chantilly cream put this dessert on another level!  Fantastic way to end the meal!

Service was really good for the most part.  We arrived a few minutes before our reservation and were sat promptly at 7:00 pm (love that British punctuality).  Our server was efficient and answered all our questions (or asked someone who knew), but he could have benefited from a personality transplant.

It is a bit on the expensive side, but that is to be expected and you can get $1.00 off most items by joining Total Rewards.  Overall, I was impressed enough with the food to return in the future.

Probably the best British pub food around (and I've been to the UK before) but service is horrific and it's stupidly expensive. Had sliders, French onion soup, chicken pot pie, and fish and chips. Service was slow, entrees came out right after apps, ordered a beer during dinner which came out with the check, etc.

Loud, crowded & full of energy- not unlike Chef Ramsay! 
My visit was at the bar to check out the drink menu for a future visit here. Lots of specialty cocktails & I'm impressed that one, Ramsay Tonic, is gin based.  Bartenders were easy going & happy to answer questions. 
Forsake the touristy vibe here & would be a great hangout pre whatever show or event you're heading to.

Thankfully I do not have to be able to hear to write a review because this place is LOUD! So loud in fact that sitting at a table I had to literally yell for people at the same table to hear me. The fact this place sits in a casino makes it bad, but then if you add the tv's playing sports at maximum volume it makes it even worse. 

The food is just okay. I have been to other Ramsay restaurants and they were by far better than this. Although it is not horrible it should be noted. I would suggest that anyone that comes here to eat some of the more British style food like shepherds pie or fish and chips. After all it is a British chefs menu and would you go to a Mexican restaurant and have spaghetti?

I love Gordon Ramsey but 21 bucks for two small pieces of fish and some fries that were cold come on!! On top if that, I had to listen to some manager yelling at a server for something like moving a chair so I could sit down was just crazy. Not impressed of the two out of three of his restaurants I've Been to, its strike two. Maybe steak will knock it out of the park.

My husband and I came to Las Vegas on our honeymoon. Being from Sonoma County, we are surrounded by delicious food. My husband and I both love watching all of Gordon Ramsay's shows so when we stumbled across his Pub and Grill at Caesar's Palace, we knew we had to give it a try. The hostess sat us in a lovely cozy booth and the ambiance was on point. Our server was David S. Gordon Ramsay is very lucky to have such an amazing and talented server such as David, working for him. My husband and I come from the restaurant industry and so we know the importance of good service and David is what all servers should strive to be. He was welcoming and professional and extremely knowledgeable. He showed us his picture of him with Gordon because my husband and I were very curious about the "real" Ramsay compared to what you see on television on HK. David had nothing but raving reviews about Gordon. Next we looked over the menu and couldn't decide what to order since it all looked so good. We decided to try the happy hour menu so that we could taste multiple items. Excellent prices as well! We ordered the kettle chip nachos, wings, truffle fries, and burger.  Everything we ordered was exactly what you'd expect to get from Gordon Ramsay. The nachos were to die for. Kettle chips and tender meats with the most velvety cheese sauce was like an explosion of flavors and textures in your mouth. The truffle fries come with the most addicting dipping sauce. Garlic fries don't stand a chance to these fries! My husband loves wings but I do not, that was until I tried these. WOW!!!! Just goes to prove that quality of food is truly key to successful dishes. We wanted happy hour cocktails but didn't know what to order so David recommend the Goodbye Blue Sky and The Pub Crawl. Perfectly pairs with our dishes. To make this experience even more fabulous and memorable, David presented us with it only one, but two, amazing desserts to help us celebrate our honeymoon. This was the first and only time during our stay in Vegas that we truly felt special regarding our honeymoon! We asked David about other spectacular activities to do while in Vegas and he had many suggestions. Everything we asked him about the food we ate and the restaurant, David had a very insightful response/answer. Mr. Ramsay, your server David is a delight and treasure to your restaurant. We will be back yearly and although David may not still be there, we will eat there every time! Thank you!

LAS VEGAS, NV: This restaurant is significantly underrated at 3 stars.  Haters gonna hate.  The food was excellent.  Service needed work, otherwise I would give 5 stars.  Eat here.

Tried a bunch of awesome menu items:

Fish n Chips (4.5 stars): Delicious English fish n chips, soft, tender fish with a flavorful crisp exterior.  

Steak Tenderloin (5 stars): Tender, delicious, perfectly cooked.  It was a wonderful dish!

Lobster Roll (4 stars): Delicious, flavorful, pretty good size for a starter.

Meeeh .... Went there last night for dinner, the hostess seemed uninterested. When we finally got sat, even though there were plenty of seats, it took the waitress at least 5-8minutes to acknowledge us. We ordered calamari which was great! We also got a rack of lamb, first it was over cooked so we sent it back - then it was basically raw. We ate a few bites and paid the bill. very disappointing from such a well known place.

Went last night for our daughters 23rd Bday, for her 21st we went to Steak at the Paris...she loves to go to his restaurants because they share the Birthday!
Food was amazing; seasoning was perfect & very "tasty".  We all agreed we were just as satisfied in the Pub as we couldn't get into Steak.
We will definitely be back!
Had Lobster Roll, Ceasar salad, Calamari, Short Ribs, Shepards Pie & Steak...OMG
Then they surprised her with a candle dessert...on them!

Such a delicious place to eat if you are in Vegas and craving a delicious burger. I never order burgers at restaurants but this was definitely the place I wanted to eat one. I got a medium well burger and the taste was amazing! It had a warm pink center that melted and got tastier and tastier with every bite. The garlic aioli truffle fries were to die for! Mannn writing this review makes me want to have this meal all over again right now! The service was on point. Very quick and very fresh! Definitely recommend :)

There was a large group of us and we were given our own private room with our own server. The server went over and beyond to make sure we were happy with everything and recommeneded a few dishes for us to try. We had just landed in Vegas after a long flight and we were pleasantly surprised at how quick the service was. The food I would consider to be pub food, but it was great and just what we needed being so jet lagged. 

Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

AWESOME food! We had a burger,it was big and very delicious! I was lucky enough to meet the winner of Hell's Kitchen and take a picture! Will definitely return! The drinks were pricey,but what do u expect,but they tasted great! Highly recommend when in town! You won't de hungry when you leave!

We dined here this past Saturday. Our server was Taylor, who was great. We were unsure of what to eat and he took time to recommend what he thought was excellent choices for us. He was very attentive. Great service makes a meal for me. The food was excellent too. I will be back for sure. Highly recommended. Good drink selections too.

Disappointing. We've been wanting to go here for a while now (we are locals). Mostly because we are Masterchef fans but also because we've been craving beef Wellington. So we gave it a shot today. We got right in on a busy Saturday but our food took quite a while to come out, our appetizer (pretzels) came after our meal, our side of fries didn't come until we reminded our server, our drinks were never refilled, and the food was just ok (except the lamb burger which was awesome). I had the fish and chips. It was good, but not $30 good. Anyway, they were super-slammed and the waiter was apologetic, but we won't be back.

I use to love gordon Ramsey but not anymore. I doubt he would have eaten the pork belly that was a dish comprised of more than 50% fat. My DH had the hanger steak and fries. Hanger steak was tough and fries undercooked. Really undercooked fries To add insult I'm pretty sure we got food poisoning from the hanger steak. 
Highlights of the meal were the pear cider and sticky toffee pudding. Service was ok. 
Save yourself the grief and eat somewhere else.

Over 1300+ reviews with an average 3 stars? =/ I really enjoyed Gordon Ramsay's burger place at Planet Hollywood. I've learned not to always judge a book by its cover so I still decided to give this place a try. 

We went to dinner on a Sunday evening. Made reservations around 7:45p and this place was pretty busy.  My boyfriend ordered the Pistachio Pesto Chicken Sandwich-it's a cold sandwich by the way. Also ordered truffle fries. He enjoyed it. I had a bite and it was pretty good. 

However.....I ordered an 8 oz burger, the waiter asked if I wanted cheese...I declined. But when the burger arrived....the burger was just a plain bun and the meat. I was thinking...okay...that's odd. Maybe these fancy-smancy restaurants make their burgers like that. It was plain and boring. Yes...I get it. I ordered a "boring dish." But sometimes, a good restaurant can turn the most simple dish into something that will tickle your tastebuds and leave you wanting more. 
We decide to ask the waiter what happened to the condiments. Where's the lettuce...tomatoes...onions...etc? He told us we were supposed to order that if we wanted it. -__- ugh. Thanks for your help, waiter. You were such a helpful guy. *insert sarcastic tone here.* So remember..FYI...IF you ever order the burger here, make sure to ask for veggies!!!!! What kind of restaurant don't automatically give you the lettuce to your burger? It's like ordering a chicken pot pie without the chicken. 

Also, the price for what we paid was NOT worth the quality of the food. $17 for the pesto chicken sandwich and $18 for a plain ol tasteless hamburger. Disappointing. I'm never coming back here.

Awesome restraunt. The atmosphere and decore are great. Even had to take a pic of the silverware :-) our waitress Brianna was GREAT!! She was very informative of food, beer and desert. I had the bangers and mash and my husband had fish and chips. The flavors of both were amazing. Would highly recommend this place. Great pick of Beers and the waitress even recommended one in which we are now fans of.. We will be back

Not only was the food was delicious, but the service was spectacular. Our server Chris really helped me out with my order and recommended the filet mignon with shrimp instead of just getting the New York steak. I must say I'm glad I listened to him. He also recommended a really good dessert. I forgot what it was called but it was some sort of bread with a scoop of ice cream on top. Overall it was a great experience. We even got greeted the GM. Thumbs up for sure!

My boss took me here for a really belated birthday lunch. I wasn't really sure if I wanted to eat here due to being overpriced and mediocre reviews, but I figured we should at least give it a chance.

For appetizer we got deviled eggs which were really good.

I got the Shepard's Pie. It was so bland. I was rather disappointed with that.

My boss got a sandwich that was essentially two giant pieces of bruschetta. She didn't enjoy that.

My coworkers got fish and chips and the beef burger. You would think the burger would be just as good as the burgers at Burgr, but it wasn't. 

The service was ridiculously bad. We asked for ketchup and salt, waited forever, finally was able to flag down the waiter again and he said yeah, I'm working on it. Who says that and why would it take so long to get ketchup and salt?? Everyone was trying to eat slow, waiting for the condiments...

The desert was amazing though. I got the Potted Triple Chocolate Trifle. If I were to go back here, I would just order that desert. And maybe the deviled eggs.

Last week me and my wife had dinner.  Sat for 10 minutes to get a server.  We ordered the filet each, mashed potato, asparagus and salad to share.  The filet was terrible, poor grade, at the price should cut with a butter knife.  Asparagus was woody, mashed was good as well as the salad.  No rolls, they serve no rolls.  The toffee dessert was excellent, should have just had that.  Mostly upset with the filet, fine quality you should be able to cut with a butter knife and not chewy.  Wonder if the steakhouse has the same quality.

We came to this restaurant hoping to try a celebrity chef's wonderful dishes. Instead, we were very disappointed.  Let me start with the steak and pork chop. They were very dry and salty. The fish and chips were just as bad, three thick strips of fried fish with not much taste to it.  The waiter asked how'd we like our food and we told him the condition. He offered to give us another order of steak and pork chop but we turned it down. Who has room for another piece of bad steak?  The manager came to apologize. I thought that gesture was very nice. In conclusion, we came for the big name and realized the food was just mediocre.

Terrible, terrible service.  And the waitress' uniforms made me uncomfortable, their dress is fine but the lock on their choker necklace, very tacky. And did I mention about their service? Horrible! We waited an hour and a half, and still didn't get our food. Maybe cause  it's the way we were dressed, but I had better service at Lawry's wearing sweatpants and a t-shirt. We walked out, thanks for the free bread and butter though.

Sitting for half an hour and still no food. While the workers in the back are screaming and joking around half the restaurant is sending its food back. Finally got burgers that were average at best. Definitely not worth $20 a burger. Staff is rude and service is nonexistent. Don't waste your time or money here. Feel sick already.

I have to say I was reluctant to eat here since I've spent a lot of time in London and the food never won me over.  I can't say the food here is stellar, especially since I don't eat fish.  What we had wasn't too bad, the pretzels were the best, and my kids loved the mini burgers.  It would be nice for them to have more items that are kid friendly, maybe some chicken fingers..  

Scott was our server and he was very, very knowledgeable about the menu as well as his customer service was top notch.  I'm pretty sure he was on point with ordering our meal, but I guess there was a bit of a disconnect with the computer and the kitchen.  I've worked in the service industry and I can say that Scott was a great waiter.  I forgot to post about Scott's excellent service, I had to find the receipt so I could post his name and make sure everyone knew it wasn't his error on the food but the kitchens...

What really won me over was the manager Michelle.  She was awesome!  My meal came out all wrong, twice, and she went above and beyond to make things right.  One of the things that I thought was awesome was that she never threw anyone under the bus.  She just made it right, and even got some cherries from the bar for my daughter to make sure she was smiling.  I'm huge on customer service and she made our experience well worth it.  I'm not sure if I'll be back for the food, but Michelle is for sure a keeper in the restaurant management game...

Ray Ray literally made my Vegas experience the best trip I've ever had. He makes the best drinks and has the best attitude. He made our whole group feel extremely special! We had a birthday girl with us and he went out of his way to make her experience the best! Ray Ray was funny, thoughtful, and went out of his way to take a picture of our group with Hell's Kitchen finalist And head chef Kristen. Greatest experience ever. Thank you Ray Ray for making this trip unforgettable.

I just had THE WORST MEAL I HAVE EVER HAD in Las Vegas. My wife and I have been here twice before and had good meals, though the last one was nothing to write home about. I brought my father in law here while our wives were dining elsewhere.

Except for the Calamari which were good, everything else was horrible. The chicken wings were meatless (a vegetarian could have eaten them for all the chicken they had). The prime rib was so tough that my father in law sent his back. I nibbled at enough of mine that I didn't send it back, but you could tell it was old, tough, dog food grade meat.

Gordon Ramsay should be ashamed of himself! His next Kitchen Nightmares should be filmed in his own bloody restaurant!  Not only will we not be back at this establishment, but we are far less likely to go to his other restaurants - just in case they've gone downhill in a similar manner to this one.

I've been getting spoiled rotten with delicious food in Vegas on our current trip and sadly I must say my lunch at Gordon Ramsay's pub was my least favorite meal. 

The chopped salad was off.. there was a ton of shrimp, chicken, ham, and other ingredients in there but it just wasn't good...  :(

The pistachio pesto chicken sandwich was... blah. Bread was hard... too hard on the outside and soaked in olive oil on the inside... I mean I don't know maybe it's supposed to be like that.. and if other people like it that's fine but my husband and I didn't enjoy it. There wasn't much flavor in general in the chicken, provolone, and roasted tomatoes. The tomatoes had the most flavor but not enough of it in the sandwich. 

The appetizers however, saved the day. We ordered the truffle fries and the mini lobster rolls. The truffle fries were delicious... and the lobster rolls were good. Not the best but definitely good! 

We were very impressed with Gordon Ramsay's steakhouse so I had high hopes for this one but it just wasn't as good as I hoped it would be. Maybe we'll give it another try next time if we have a chance.

This place sucks! The food is horrible and the prices are ridiculous! Tourist trap! This place has a central spot in the casino and if you see it pass it up to play some slots!

Slow service and crappy food for high prices. So not worth it!

Food was not very good. Ordered the wings and the sauce was pretty bad, not good wings overall. Truffle fries were 2 out of 10, mini pub burger tasted like old dirty oily bread, and the nachos are really thick homemade potato chips that tasted like oil. Hostess made us wait 30 minutes to be seated even though there was over 20 tables available in sight. Cups and utensils were very dirty, the second set they brought was even dirtier. After waiting at the table for over 15 minutes to get service, I had to twirl my napkin over my head like a lasso to get noticed. Also, the napkin was very weird and looked like it was made from a dirty old hotel curtain. I had high expectations of Gordon Ramsey but after eating here I lost all respect for him and the show. Would not recommend his place to anyone.

We called ahead to make reservations around 8 on a Friday night. The soonest available table for 6 people was 9:15 pm.

It was a bit too late for the two little ones so we showed up early in hopes there might be a table.

They offered to seat us in the bar area up front but later on when I passed by the main dining room on the way to the restroom, I saw tons of empty tables. :/
The bar seating is fine for grown ups but tough for little ones due to the height & no backs.

Service was great here. Food was okay.
It is pub food & not meant to be high end frou frou. I tried Ramsay's high end restaurant in Hollywood thanks to DineLA. I LOVED the food there.

I got the Hangar steak with fries here at the pub but thought the steak was under seasoned (for my taste). But it had great beef flavor & was tender.
Fries were ok.

I tried a bite of our friend's fish of his fish & chips (the fries that came with the burger at our table & my steak were all the same.) While the fish was not super moist, the batter was amazing. I'd get the fish & chips were I ever to return. They give you a lot of food with this plate!

Overall, the food is simple but for the price, lacked a little something....extra. I guess you're just paying for the name Gordon Ramsay.

One other thing to note....this is more a Harrah's thing than Ramsay's thing but photographers go around & take pictures of your table & then mildly try to pressure you to purchase the pictures after they print them. What's funny is they photoshop a picture of a pixie sized Ramsay standing on your table. A bit odd!

I just came in to grab an appetizer, have a drink, wait for a friend to get off work. This place gets pretty packed, but it's well worth it to sit at the bar if you can. The bartenders were nothing short of friendly and entertaining. Gene fixed me up a Goodbye Blue Sky (after I gave him the 'I don' t know what I want to drink' look) and managed to charm and be attentive to each person on the back end of the bar. 

I started off with the bacon crumble calamari and I was blown away. I love seafood and I think I've had calamari in every restaurant I've ever been in, but this stuff topped it all.
