My friend and I were in there at around 2:00 on a Sunday.  The place was hoppin', but we found a couple of seats at the bar and were promptly greeted by a really friendly bartender.  I asked him a few questions about the beer selection, describing the flavor profiles that I like.  He brought me several samples and was able to speak knowledgeably about the vast array of beers on offer.  I know it's kind of lame, but in the end I decided to stick with Peroni.  Hey, it was 109 degrees out, I had just walked all over creation, and I wanted something on the lighter but flavorful side.  

My friend had a couple of mojitos, prepared by the same bartender.  She said they were amazing.

We both ordered the burger.  My friend ordered hers medium and I ordered mine medium well.  Both were cooked to perfection.  We both opted for the cheese and bacon toppings (because you just kind of have to, right?).  We both had gruyere.  It was melted, nutty, aromatic, and delicious.  The bacon, while thick, was still very crispy, and richly maple flavored.  It was a delicious meal with layer upon layer of fantastic flavors.  

My friend ordered dessert (some rhubarb tart) and she said it was delicious.  

My meal (burger, fries, two imperial pints) put me back $40.  Not bad at all.

I highly recommend this place.  Give Wolfgang a miss and come straight to Gordon!!

Was expecting really good food and service, but all I got was your typical bar food.  We were a group of 4 and I tried everyone's food and can't say I was impressed with any of it.  The service was so so, had to keep reminding the waiter for stuff.  Overpriced for the quality.

I was optimistic yet cautious after reading other reviews. I had had wonderful experiences at his other restaurants.  IT WAS DELICIOUS.  Our waiter John was great. Started with Scotch egg and Lobster mac n cheese. Hubby got Banger n Mash and I got Lamb burger. I was so sad I could only eat half of the burger cuz I was so full. Sooooo tender and juicy. We ordered the Sticky toffee even though we could only each take a bite.  Recommend the Ramsay tonic cocktail. Delicious and fresh.

I grew up in England and felt a twinge of nostalgia when I saw this restaurant.

Accepting that there would be a Caesar's Palace surcharge on top of already over-priced Vegas food, I assumed that Mr. "f***ing make this dish right" Ramsay could provide a decent simulacram of English food.

However, the food was about as English as Excalibur hotel.

If you've actually tasted any English food, please don't go. I miss very little about England, but genuinely good fish & chips + mushy peas is one my favorite things from my childhood. 

If you've never tasted mushy peas, this review probably doesn't make sense, but if you have  enjoyed them . . . start planning on that trip to England rather than Vegas, because Ramsay's dish was not even made with the correct peas.

[insert other details about how this place offers weak adaptations of British dishes]

I emailed customer relations, because I am genuinely interested in how Mr. Ramsay could sign his name to those peas: I will update if I hear any sort of authentic response.

PS Service was good: helpful and friendly servers + food seemed made to order, so the individual workers seemed to be doing their best. My criticism solely applies to whomever approved the dishes.

A lot of pomp and circumstance when you walk in.  The staff wear ridiculous outfits and the restaurant has been overdone.  I would have preferred that the time and energy be spent more on the food.  I ordered the a bloody Mary and the pub burger.  The bloody Mary was very good, I will say.  Had a unique flavor and was worth the $10.  For lunch I had the Pub Burger, I ordered it rare and it came well done and was extremely dry and salty.  And if you are a bigger person, the burger is small.  (Worked out for me, but smaller than one would expect for $20).  The fries that came with it were very good, had shavings of cheese on them, I mostly ate the fries and the burger was not so good.  This place was not horrible, but for Vegas, you expect exceptional food, this was not exceptional.  I will say the staff was very nice.

I think Gordon needs to spend some time yelling at himself for putting his name on this place.  I will not go back...maybe for the bloody Mary, but not for the food.

Let me tell you why this place doesn't have more stars...the service!  Plain and simple.  Our server was fairly rude and just going through the motions.  I almost got up and left even before ordering.
My whole family (kids included) are HUGE Gordon Ramsay fans.  We couldn't wait to try the food.  Let me say I really wanted the Shepherds pie, but it is only served after 4pm.  My hubby loves a good authentic bangers and mash, so he was set to order.  My son and I decide to share an order of bangers and mash because let's be honest, it was $25!  WOW WOW, OH WOW!  One of the best dishes I have ever had anywhere!  Really!  Oh, let me say, I don't even like sausages of any kind.  But this dish was fabulously delicious.  There were 3 sausages (1 chicken, 1 pork and 1 beef) served over mashed potatoes with an onion gravy.  The onion gravy is the star here.  Ramsay's food did not disappoint!
Seated immediately for lunch. Service is good. Fish & Chips had three great pieces of fish $25. Chips average.

Came here because Mesa Grill didn't have availability and we love BurGR. They only had room for us at the cocktail tables, and the stools were very squishy and sinking down, but had hard edges, so my legs kept falling asleep. 

Our server was very friendly, but our food was somewhat slow to come out. With the location right on the casino floor, there was a man smoking a large cigar in line to get a rewards card, and the smoke cloud was almost intolerable, of course our food finally came out while the smoke cloud was hanging over us.

The food was very good. We ordered a NY strip that was surprisingly tender for a NY and cooked perfectly, but had a chunk of gristle. It was very good value compared to Mesa Grill, maybe not quite as good, but also much cheaper. Asparagus cooked well. Peppercorn sauce had an overwhelming rosemary flavor, but was good.

The pub chopped salad was also good. I think for a similar price, Cheesecake Factory has a better salad, and their portions are three times as big. The menu indicated the salad had apples, which I do not remember on the salad. The ham was more like strips of salami perhaps? It was very good, though.

The mashed potatoes were good, but the STAR of the show was the mushroom side with poached egg. This is brilliant! The egg, and I think chanterelle mushrooms, had similar texture and it was a wonderful and unexpected combination. Loved that.

The server wasn't able to adequately describe the toffee pudding. She described it as a cake. Maybe it was; her description was vague enough that I didn't want to try it.

If I were to return, I'd make sure I had a reservation and ask to be seated farther into the restaurant. I think I'd try the fish and chips next time. They looked fantastic.

Very disappointing! Went with the fam for dinner. We ordered the crispy calamari and chicken wing pops for starters. The calamari was far from crispy but rather soggy the batter didn't even stick it mushed up. The chicken wings were bland and cold, i had one that was undercooked.
For main course we tried the shepherds pie, sliders and fish and chips.
It didn't get better, the pie was drenched in oil and the sliders were dry.
Fish and chips were good great fries.
The services wasn't the best either, took our server 15 mins to take our order and we had to hunt her down for 20 mins to get our bill.. 
Expected way better from a chef like Ramsey.

WOW! I was truly impressed. Far exceeded my expectations. Derek, one of the managers greeted me and made some suggestions of what to eat and great beers that paired with it. I was not expecting to order 'nachos' but I did and I am TOTALLY glad that I did. The nachos were absolutely the best that I have ever had. The happy hour menu has items almost half off. The kettle chips, the meat and the sharpness of the cheese was perfect. I also had the pastrami sandwich. The bread on the sandwich was sort sort of zucchini that takes a whole day to make and to me tasted like pumpernickel, which was the PERFECT combo, and it was worth the wait. Derek had me try three beers and they were all different than I am used to and tasty. I can't wait to go back and try some desserts.

We were trying to find a place for dinner but knew Serendipity was our choice for dessert. Since we were at Caesar's Palace, we decided to try Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill. I'm obsessed with the food network channel so of course I automatically assume Gordon Ramsey's restaurants will be good. 

SERVICE - Our waitress was very nice but incredibly slow. We wanted extra dipping sauce for our wings but by the time she came around, we had about 4 left so it wasn't worth it. 

FOOD 
Mini Lobster Rolls - These came filled with lobster. So much flavor. The buns were toasty and delicious. They definitely didn't short us on meat. 

Wings - Spicy and sweet. My fiancé thought they were really spicy but I thought they had the perfect amount of kick. I usually don't like blue cheese but the blue cheese dipping sauce it came with were a perfect match for the wings! 

Brussel Sprouts - Nicely caramelized.  Tender with a crunch. Had pieces of meat and apricot throughout as well. Very enjoyable!

Overall, a great meal. We would come back! Main complaint is that the items were pretty pricey.

This place was fantastic.   During my trip, I visited different buffets and restaurants throughout the strip.  In my wanderings,  I happened upon Ramsey's pub and grill.  We were seated immediately, no wait time.  Our waitress was an energetic lovely Filipina gal that was extremely good with service.  She made sure we were checked on regularly for top offs on the drinks, questions for the menus, and making sure our experience was nothing but stellar.  

The food was great!  I had the lamb burger, extremely well priced.  The waitress suggested medium rare, and it couldn't have been done better.  Food was out in 10 or under,  and we have absolutely no comlaints.  The bill was extremely well priced in comparison to the prices of the surrounding areas.  And the location was perfect since my hunger appeared just as I was passing through the casino.  I'd definitely return during my next dalliance in Sin City.

Sat 8/6 This Place just gets better and better!

I was meeting friends from San Diego, They wanted a really good place to eat so I recommended Gordon Ramseys!

We've always ate at the bar, but now we had to get a table. I normally opt for a bar spot, since I am a good tipper and bartenders normally take care of my drinks. I was a little nervous because of the a few reviews on poor service, but we had the opposite experience here.
( This is why I don't add much into Negative reviews)

The night before we just had a party that Gordon Ramsey attended, so we were excited for another trip to GRPG!

The place was pretty busy, so I was hoping the service would be good. We were sat down right away in the back and our wait was named Adam. Actually we had two waiters and both their names was Adam.

We got our drinks and started off with the Short rib nachos. These nachos were actually better than the last time I was here and those were off the hook!

I had the Bacon Burger and my wife had the pulled Pork sandwich. My friend had the fish and chips - recommended by Adam.

My bacon Burger came and was well done like I asked. It came with a cone of fries, and to my surprise there was a lot more fries than I expected.

Fish and chips- My friends plate was huge and the fish was very fresh tasting. He is a big seafood eater and was happy with both the taste and the size. He stated the batter was perfect. Not a little fish overwhelmed by 10 pounds of fried batter. These were giant fish pieces.

My wives pulled pork sandwich was actually a little larger than she was expecting. She could only eat half. This plate comes with homemade chips as well. She has tried pulled pork sandwiches at some of the best places in Vegas and rate this the best. She likes it more than the Guy Fieri pulled pork sandwich, which I think is one of the best in Vegas.

Bangers and Mash: which consisted of chicken, beef & pork english sausages w/ mash potatoes, sauerkraut & onion gravy. My friends wife cleared this plate in no time. She ordered it without Sauerkraut (Which is a crime in most states) She stated that this was a very good dish as well and wasn't greasy like some sausages are.

We had a lot of drinks, between the Belgium Margs, Good Bye Blue Sky, Pub Crawl- wow were were feeling good after our meal. Drinks were 15 dollars a pop which is about right for a strip restaurant. 

Both Waiters names Adam were great and met our every needs. They let us have a good time and knew the meaning of the service industry! We will be back in Nov for sure!!

Silly Tip that might only interest me: If your getting a to-go box, they are awesome and are like little Tupperware boxes. Can be easily reused :)

Rodney, our server is amazing! I will probably go back here not because of good food but also because we had the best customer service at that night. He is very knowledgeable of the menu items that was written down on the menu. This is our first time and it is not gonna be the last. Amazing food, amazing server, and amazing venue. What a great night to splurge on good things in life. We really had a good time. Also I would like to add that Rodney is a good photographer. I'm giving the restaurant and Rodney a five star review.
Truffle Mac & Cheese was delicious! Little Sliders were tasty - I preferred the ones with chedder verses not. Fries were also good. I'm just have the pan of mac n' cheese if I were to come again.
The best British food I've had with tons of flavour and exciting dishes. Seriously the pate board was to die for, along with the spilt pea soup.

Beer was excellent, our server was phenomenal. The only reason I feel I had to give it 3 stars was my first impression. The hostess just stared at me when I walked up. It was only a little after 1pm on a Saturday and they were busy but not to the point of having a waiting list. I just expected more after visiting Burgr in the Bellagio. I expected the hostess to speak. Say "hello" or in some way welcome us. Disappointed in the hostess but not the overall experience.

Went to Gordon Ramsey Pub about 6 months ago. I was not overly impressed, but thought I would try it again. I am in Vegas often and was looking for a decent casual place. Mini burgers were dry and cold. Lobster Mac and Cheese was good, but not great. I told the waitress of my burger complaint and she did not seem interested. 

Apparently the standard that Chef Ramsey has on his television shows are not the same in his restaurants. It seems to me if you put your name to something and profess excellence, it should be excellent; not just alright.

We made reservations at 7:30 pm and sat us down at our reservation time. The staff and server is very polite.  The menu is very English pub food- great selection of appetizers and entrees. Next time I'll have to try an appetizer. 

I ended up ordering Ruben sandwich with rye bread and it had sauerkraut gruyere cheese, with truffle fries on the side. My mom had the fish and chips which was pretty pricy for fish and chips $30, yet the fish was flaky and not as greasy. 

The server kindly asked if we were a total rewards member (casino rewards card) cause they have special pricing which you can save $1 on each entree you order. I will be definitely be coming back!

Stopped in this past Saturday for a family dinner while in Vegas. I was skeptical after reading some bad reviews and I should have followed their advice. Overall, there are many better choices in Vegas to dine at and would not even give it a second chance.

Reservation/Atmosphere - We had a reservation but were seated at a bad location and bad table. They put to tables in a walk way area and then put short chairs around it. They were mix & matching the dining tables and chairs to squeeze in more people. The low bar chairs made us feel like we were at the kids table during Thanksgiving. Before we started I asked to be re-seated but they came up with excuses (30 minutes and no guarantee) and a little attitude. The waitress acknowledged the table/seats wasn't good but not much they would due. Given the time and not delaying the dinner we took it, but it was annoying and uncomfortable. 

The music was way too loud when we arrived and after about 30 minutes it was turned down, probably someone complained. Hard to believe that management couldn't tell that it was too loud even for Vegas.

Service - Pretty good, attentive enough given that they were busy.

Food - Here is the second reason I wouldn't go back. The food we had was average, and I expected a lot more. Bangers & Mash was only ok. Fish & Chips were also only ok, same you can get at any sports bar. The Braised Short Ribs was a huge disappointment, the meat had a lack of any flavor, the sauce was boring and the risotto was flavorless & held too long. I really expected the quality to be better on this dish. The highlight of the night was the Chicken Pot Pie, it had a flakey crust and some great flavor for the filing, good chucks of chicken and veggies. Deserts were ok, the Sticky Toffee Pudding was the highlight.

They were very busy as expected on a Saturday night, but it showed in their arrogance over the table & waits. They we stay busy with first time diners but don't believe they will get many as repeat. They are pricey, which I am ok with, but they need to deliver on the food and they failed there.

This review is only base on the service at the bar.

Since we didn't have any reservation, we just walked in and found two available seating at the bar; we were immediately greeted by the bar tenders and they were all very friendly and cool.

We had two glass of beers and an appetizer (we already had lunch before we came here); since I was already full so the husband finished the Deviled Eggs by himself, he said it was quite interesting, in a good way. 

I also enjoyed their decorations, Ramsay's photos were everywhere and my husband took a photo next to the big one outside their kitchen; the next time we come though, we'll need try more of their food.

Had to experience a Gordon Ramsey restaurant at least once. And the bar did not disappoint. Appetizers were fabulous. Highly recommend the Lobster Roll and the Calamari was outstanding! They have a great spin on a Mule cocktail that is a must try for sure. Ambience with great service made this a fun place to experience.

Busy, happening place in Ceasars Palace. I had the pastrami sandwich which was very good. My guest had a burger and they said it was also good. Prices seemed a little high for the quality of the food served, but then again, its Vegas and everything costs a lot. I would eat there again, but would also consider checking out other options too. Its a good place....perhaps not a great place.

Tried it today. Even though it was Christmas day we didn't have to wait.
 Ordered the nachos was ok
Burger i expected to have a juicy burger. It was dry nothing special about it . I liked the garlic sauce which comes with it. 
We ordered the pigs in blanket the worst pigs 
Didnt try the other restaurants on the strip and wont think about trying them after this experience.
The waitress was nice .
Fish and chips for lunch.  'Nuf said.
Had the Hells Kitchen burger tonight and it was awesome! Just right amount of heat and flavor. A must try as it may have been one of the tastiest burgers we have had.

This is one of those place that you had to try at least once in your lifetime...

Riding on the coat tails of Ramsay's popularity, I came here for dinner one night with my mother.  After a day of high-rolling gambling (nickel slots), I was interested in trying this place out.  We were not in the mood for burgers (that's why we passed on Ramsay's Burgr) and didn't feel like taking out a loan to dine at Ramsay's Steak at the Paris casino.  So being the penny-pincher that I am, I opted for Pub & Grille since a) it was somewhat affordable, b) it was close-by (walking distance from where we were staying), and c) had food items on the menu that we were interested in trying.

Since it was on a weekday, the hostess said that reservations were not necessary but it would be a good idea.  So I made a reservation for 7:00 p.m. and continued with my high-rolling ways until then.  We got there a few minutes before 7:00 p.m. and was a bit surprised that the place was nearly empty.  There were a few patrons sitting in the front for drinks but not many for food.

The dining area was pretty nice; it was fairly dim but not too dark that we couldn't read the menu.  The entire restaurant was spotless and well decorated.  There was this huge poster of Ramsay on the wall just staring at the patrons, which was intimidating yet sort of funny.

Since my mother and I are relatively small eaters, we shared the fish n' chips and a side of braised vegetables.  The fish n' chips were nearly $30 so it better be good!

And it was!  I was probably one of the best fish n' chips I ever had.  The fish was perfectly cooked and flaky and the batter was not heavy/oily at all.  The fish was not overwhelmed by the batter.  The braised vegetables was perfectly cooked; it wasn't mushy and the flavor of each individual vegetable was preserved.  There was a light covering of butter but not too much; it complemented the dish perfectly.

Our server was very nice and attentive; checked on us every so often to make sure our meal was pleasant.

Overall my experience at Pub & Grille was positive.  Both my mother and I agreed that the quality of food was outstanding (agreement between us is very rare!).  

Great place to eat if you're tired of buffets!

Well, I have learned a few things from watching Gordon's reality TV shows... When food comes out within 5 minutes, that should be a red flag. Also, serving frozen, not fresh or per cooked food is also a no-no. I paid $ 70 for shepherd's, fish and chips, and one drink. And I hate to say it came out within 5 minutes. The food beat the drink to the table. The drink was delicious and very freshly made. The service was impeccable. My girlfriend's fish had bones in it and it tasted frozen. The fries also tasted frozen. My Shepherd's pie was OK but could of been better. My expectations were very high and I am quite disappointed.

We were at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill on opening night. Nice atmosphere. Food was great. We saw a few celebrity chefs. I forgot to submit my original review after returning home and we have eaten at his restaurant again since. My original review was 5 star amazing but I have to say that our visit a few months later was not as great. Just 3 star ok. We were a little disappointed with the food. My husband and I both ordered the same items Fish and Chips and the Cauliflower soup both times and I felt the quality and attention to detail was not as good compared to or original visit. Probably because the chef himself was not there the second time... who knows... That being said, I would probably eat her again for a late night meal but not when looking for a nice dinner date night.

All the food here is delicious! So much that I even went back to the same restaurant a year later to have dinner. 

I highly recommend the beer braised short rib (seasonal item). The dish is really flavorful, the meat separates when you use a fork to cut the meat into smaller pieces. 

The truffle fries are great too, a bit oily but so flavorful! The fries don't taste like cheap truffle oil either.

Me and wife went to Vegas on our honeymoon. After finding Gordon Ramsay's last year and liking the food we decided to make this our first stop for happy hour on the day we got there. We decided to sit in the bar area and were immediately greeted by our bartender Ray Ray. Ray Ray asked us if we were right or left handed as to make it easier to pick up our drinks. After talking to Ray Ray he congratulated us on our wedding. We went back two days later on a Friday and Ray Ray was once again behind the bar and not only remembered us but also remembered we were newlyweds which I found amazing as Gordon Ramsay's is right on the gaming floor in the middle of Cesar's Palace. Ray Ray was once again very hospitable and even gave us a free Sticky Toffee Pudding which was amazing as were the pretzels, deviled eggs, and sliders we ordered. If you are ever in Vegas and want to go to a celebrity chefs restautant make sure to check out Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill.
My fish & chips were BLAND although the fish quality was high there just wasn't any flavor. I expected better Ramsey!

The place was a disappointment. The restaurant was very busy and the tables were crammed in too close. I kept getting my chair bumped by customers and waiters. 

I started with the English onion soup. It needed salt. Badly!

On the waiters suggestion I got the butter chicken. It was ok, but lacked flavor. The chunks of chicken thighs in it were kind of big and stringy. 

My companions had burgers, which were average. You can't really screw those up too bad. 

The best thing that we ate were the fries. I'm a French fry snob and am very picky. These fries were great!

WEIRD menu, and I love food!! Everything that sounded good at first glance has horseradish, onions, or bacon (all of which I do not eat) in or on it.  I had the tomato soup, which was so salty I couldn't eat half of it, but the 3 guys said their burgers were good once they scraped off the gross sauce.  We were consistently ignored my the server, after he said he would get drinks, a dessert menu, and a couple other things.  There are many more fabulous places to go in Vegas- skip this one!

Opening night!!

BTW, the previous reviewer only posted to be #1 on yelp for this restaurant, lame. A+ ambiance, good food. I had the fish and chips and the fish was delicious and with a really neat presentation. A touch on the salty side... keeping it in mind that it's opening night. Nice selection of draft beers and really friendly waiters and waitresses.

My neighbor had the duck poutine and that looked AMAZING. He also had the deviled eggs and said that was the best he had that night.

Will definitely be going back when they work out the kinks.

I just don't see the big deal. Maybe because it's in a fancy resort, and has the Gordon Ramsay name, but I just don't find it that great.

Prices are super expensive for what you are getting, which is basically a nice craft burger and craft beer.

I got the fish and chips, and while they were good, they were definitely not the "best" fish and chips I had ever gotten.

Bottom line, the food is average. You are not going to be blown away by the food. You will be blown away by the price though. 4 of us spent $100+ after food and drink. Then again, it is Vegas, so I guess it should be expected.

Sadly, no local beers, but the bartenders are local and they rock:  personable, attentive and engaging.  What also rocks here is the music selection: Smiths, REM, Ramones. I sat at the bar and had the chicken breast. It was simple, tasty, and exactly what I was looking for: something that emphasized the protein over superflurous carbs. I'll be back.

Service was excellent. We were seated right away.   I had the shepherds pie which was excellent. Someone else had the braised ribs. The meat was falling off the bone didn't need a knife. Good atmosphere. Fun. Good selection of beer. Head chef was going around the restaurant checking on everyone. She stopped by our table several times and was very friendly.
Excellent restaurant! The staff is awesome and makes you feel really welcomed. The happy hour apps are great. I recommend the nachos and corn dogs. I enjoyed my experience and the food was delish!

1.5hr wait for entree's... and even then, they were small portions and the burger was overcooked (well done, when medium was requested). The shepherd's pie was good but a small bowl and still left us hungry.

If you can AVOID this place. The staff were disgusting. I could smell the dirty rag they were using to wipe the tables with. I wondered why and it was because they were so lazy to rinse the rag under running water. They had a bucket stored under a table and were using the same water over again.
And their cups were so dirty also. It makes you wonder how clean can their kitchen be.

My wife would say.. Awesome, delicious... go.

We had the truffle chips "Fries" and the Lollipop Chicken wings for apps, both were great and cooked to perfection.

The wife had the scallops with clams. Said it was very tasty, i don't eat shell fish so I took her word. They looked very good, seared nicely on both sides.

I had the Burger with bacon. It was outstanding, the beef was perfect and the chef knows what Medium means.

Service was great, very attentive and we were seated within a minute of showing up at our reserved time... It was packed on the Friday night.

We gave it 4 stars based only on the price... If you go, you will love it.

we went to Las Vegas for Thanksgiving. It is the true Mecca for foodies. Having been a fan of his many cooking reality shows we decided to eat at the grill at Cesars Palace.Things quickly went down hill after being seated in a tiny table stuck next to a row of 4 cramped tables with barely breathing room. Our waiter was the worst I have ever encountered after eating out for 30 years at some of the better to best restaurants in the US and Europe. He repeatedly ignored us and after sitting for 30 minutes without a drink I complained to the management who got us started with our cocktails. This caused our waiter to futher act out in a blatant passive aggressive way. He did not smile, gave us no eye contact but plenty of attitude as he sarcastically announced with each entree "is this good enough for you". I literally wanted to put the food up his U KNOW WHAT but we were hungry and would have been late for our show so we had to put up wth this clown. While ordering, they had 'RUN OUT " of 3 of the 4 items????. Sounded odd. Anyway the shepards pie was ok, the lobster mac and cheese very salty and my memory is a wash with the rest of the meal. Thus I conclude that it must not have been memorable. I was so irritated with this snarky, pompous jack ass of a waiter it was all I could do to contain myself.
The one plus was dessert some kind of bread pudding that was super sweet but definitely the best among the items ordered . Just when I thought things were bad enough I went into the rest room. Had I done that first thing, I would NEVER have eaten at this establishment. It was FILTHY. Yes! you may find it hard to believe, I DID but the smell and look of the toilet was as if they had not cleaned it. Rather disgusting what was on the toilet seat thus I will NOT describe it in case you are as visual as I am. I still can't get the imagery out of my mind a month later. When it came to soap supplies, they had 1 little bottle of soap for 4 sinks and plenty of patrons waiting like kindergardeners to get a squirt of the stuff. A 50 plus year old to my left erupted and questioned the staff and was seen on my way out complaining to upper management. Tell you what, for such a fussy chef with his noteriety of perfectionistic standards, he should visit the place he sold his name to on the sly and see for himself. A real let down and all around dive with absolutely lazy staff that needs a major attitude over haul. I would never recommend this place.

My boyfriend and I love this place! We LOVED the  Randy!!! He was so personable and accomodating. The place was packed but Randy spent time with each table, he made sure we were satisfied and came by more than once. It's always nice when someone besides the waiter cares. We will definitely be back to see him and have dinner! Thanks Randy for such an enjoyable night!
Everything we ordered was amazing...bangers and bash, onion soup, pretzel appetizer, the beef pot pie (forgot the name ) and the bartender was so friendly and let us sample everything

I had high expectations for this place. This was suppose to be my one big nice dinner in Vegas. I expected perfection due to the stigma attached with Gordan Ramsey himself. To my disappointment we sat down and immediately had poor service. 

It took 10 minutes to be properly greeted. When we were greeted it was quick short and in a rush and not personable. Another 10 minutes to receive water and my iced tea took even longer. 

We ordered an appetizer which took atleast 30 minutes. I would guess our order was not even put in because our server ran by our table to tell us our dinner was on the way and we were already at 40 minutes from out initial order. 

I spoke with the manager and the only thing he was able to do was provide us with a free B-day dessert which we would have not ordered in the first place, and decided to take off my iced tea from the bill. All together our food took about 1 1/2 hours to receive, and the overall time took 2+ hours. 

I felt the management did not care about our experience, and no one admitted to any wrong doing with our ticket times. I paid the bill and left no tip.

After all the issues we had the food did not make up for it alone.

3 stars, huh.  Could a Ramsay place be only 3 stars?  The Yelp rating says so, are the people right?  

$30 for Fish & Chips?  Ridiculous, right?  After all, it's nearly 2x what I've ever paid even though it was super beautiful white fish; 2 smallish pieces with a generous amount of fries, and a very little ramekin filled with fresh peas (and a bit of mint).  The flavor of everything was great even though I didn't have one bite with both fish & coating -- it broke when cutting it.  (3.0 stars due to price)

$18 for Sandwich?   It was terrific, though.  Chicken pesto with roasted peppers, arugula, tomato, caramelized onions.  Cold chicken, but the toasted bread was so good, it made up for it.  British?  (4.5 stars)

$11 dessert?  Sticky Toffee Pudding (available at all Ramsay eateries) is to die for.  Served with sweet cream ice cream and warm caramel poured over before your very eyes.  Mmmmm.  (4.5 stars)

Service was slow to begin with, but when Daisy finally made it over, she was all over my dining partner and I.  Very responsive, fun, and efficient.  (4.5 stars)

It's a really excellent pub, with drafts (Boddington's, $11) but expensive/costly/pricey.  Beautifully constructed, painted (like a pool table), and many different rooms offering a little different feel depending on your desire.  But, it's really expensive.  For that, I came and conquered but may not return.

My dad and I went. We ordered the Deviled eggs, fish n'chips, and the lamb burger.  Deviled eggs were great. I've never had yoke filling be so light and delicious. Solid snack starter. The fish n' chips were cooked perfectly!! The fish flakey and tender inside and batter crispy on the outside. The execution was so good it seemed as if they were independently cooked. Only qualm is that it was under seasoned. 
The lamb burger was pleasant. You can taste the slight distinctiveness of the lamb without it being overwhelming. The burger was also flawlessly cooked to a MedRare. Although the burger was cooked perfectly, the portion of condiments inside (goat cheese and slaw) could have been been bigger because the burger was also slightly dry due to an over toasted bun. Good food all around with the exception of a couple of misses.
Not great, not horrible. Happy Hour wasn't very happy as the drinks were only a dollar or 2 cheaper when advertised at $5 when they are like $13. Service is good tho.

I so looked forward to eating an expertly prepared meal even if it was one of his pubs vs one of Gordon's more $$$$ restaurants. I was very disappointed. We ordered their "speciality" dishes, fish and chips.  The fries obviously came off a warmer not freshly cooked and the fish coating was tough from being on a warmer. 

I still enjoy his reality shows but this restaurant not so much.
Just finished lunch here.  Ate in restaurant side with tables.  Great service by Joe and outstanding fish and chips with the best mushy peas I have ever had.

My fiance and I are fans of Hells Kitchen. So when we walked past this place and saw a sign for "Hells Kitchen Happy Hour," we had to stop and try it out. We ordered a bunch of awesome happy hour small plates including chicken wings, nachos and a toad-in-the-hole plus two incredible cocktails. The nachos were INSANE: fresh, homemmade potato chips slathered in the most flavorful beer-based cheese sauce I've ever nommed. When I die, I don't want to be embalmed. I just want to be covered in that cheese and put in the ground. Also: in Vegas, you cannot beat the value of this happy hour with a stick.

Shout out to our waiter, Dave. Dave provided the best, most attentive and polite service ever. He had excellent recommendations on food and drink AND he was kind enough to offer some tourist-y suggestions to me and my man. Not only did he stand at our table and tell us about a bunch of cool things to see downtown, but he even grabbed a piece of paper from the bar and wrote down a ton of stuff for us. 

Attention, management: Dave is awesome. Give that guy a raise. Or a high five. Or something. Cause he's awesome.

Omg!! Food was DELICIOUS!! And mind you we had Burgers ... they were the BEST.  Of course I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger and it was awesome, I normally don't like sliced jalapeños but I ate them in the burger and they were great!! The Ghost Pepper Jack Cheese was good!  The burger had a good balance of Heat!  Also, tried my husband's Wedge Salad and it was amazing!! Tasted the Bacon Burger the Bacon was delicious!!

Overall great experience at Caesars Palace in general but really enjoyed dinner here at the Pub & Grill on August 10, 2013.  Taylor was our waiter and he was knowledgeable and friendly.  We appreciated his recommendation help.  I had the most delicious salmon I've ever had.  Tender, well seasoned and cooked to perfection.  The accompanying vegetables were a bit sparse but everything was delicious. For dessert the sticky pudding was AMAZING.  Perfect.  Nice atmosphere and great people watching.  Hope to return someday!

Ok where do i start...when we arrived we were told 25 min wait w/ several tables open. Once we were about to leave mysteriously one or 10 opened up. Th
e food took 45 min to come and all we had was mac n cheese and a burger after we asked our waiter. The drink took 10 min to come and didn't look like the photo shown. The cauliflower soup was nothing more than the flavor out of a campbells can...the water was not refilled and when asking the waiter of the black things on my mac that tasted like black olives he said they were truffles and i told him they did not look like the truffles that i had the night before at Gordon Ramsay's steak- phenomenal by the way and all he said was there are different ones but knew nothing about them then asked if i wanted something different....NOT WORTH the MONEY...go to Ramsay's steak much better. Oh the menu outside the resturaunt had mac n cheese and burgers where the one inside didn't so we had to ask for them separately.

A friend and I came here just to try one of Gordon's restaurants. I ordered the salmon and she ordered a burger off the menu. Nothing special about the food but it wasn't mediocre either. Would I come back to this specific location? No, but we are definitely going to try one of his other locations :) I want to find his famous risotto!

Service was excellent! I ordered the duck confit as an app.  Received about 1 tablespoon of duck and a bucket of fries.  VERY disappointing for the price. 

I ordered the  shepherd's pie.  Flavorful, but so dry.  It needed some kind of sauce. My wife ordered the lamb burger.  It was so dry, she dipped it in her ketsup. Side of fries were so hard, had to use knife to cut them. We made this a destination restaurant, and it was bitterly disappointing. Will not try again. Gordon you're building an empire, but it's all in about the quality, and our recent experience at your Pub questions how much you are involved.

Family trip to Vegas, quite a few Ramsey fans amongst us.  Total of 8 diners off of the grill menu.  We made a reservation and our table was ready for us.

Service - Solid.  Our waiter was friendly and knowledgable.  The staff was attentive to our needs with regard to keeping water full and table clear.  My only complaint would be the drink menu.  I can dig conserving paper and flashy electronics, but passing a couple iPads around to place drink orders was a bit of a hassle.

Ambiance - I liked it.  I wouldn't call it a traditional pub, but the feel is there.  The noise level is moderate, with an eclectic mix of British rock/pop on the playlist.  The uniforms fit with the theme.  I work with beer for a living and I am without a doubt overly anal retentive with regards to it.  So, a wall made of kegs in a British themed pub didn't sit right with me.  Casks would have been much more appropriate.  Speaking of casks . . .

Beverages - Admittedly, we were all looking at beer, it's a pub after all.  For everyday beer selection, I'd give it a big thumbs up.  Lots of imported and expected domestic draft options, and a more craft friendly bottle selection.  I got a Union Jack, brother got a Sculpin, mom got a SNPA.  Their's was fresh, mine wasn't.  Que Sera, at least the options were there.  I would say this is more disappointing after visiting BURGR this afternoon and being offered a much more impressive beer list.  Lastly, it is a Pub, how is there nothing on cask?  If you are an avid beer advocate temper your expectations.

Food - Not one of the 8 off us left disappointed or hungry.  Between the 8 of us we tried the Pork and Lamb Rillettes appetizer, Lamb T-bone, Shepard's Pie, Brick Pressed Cornish Hen, Clams and Mussels, Pork Belly and sides of Brusselspouts and Fingerling Potatoes.

Bread and starters: The bread, holy geez the bread.  A selection of pretzel breads and a beer roll served with Devonshire butter and a Welsh cheddar spread with horseradish.  I can't believe they don't charge for this, it is easily one of the best things that was put on our table.  The Rillettes were excellent as well.  I favored the pork over the duck, which admittedly was a bit bland for duck.  It comes with a fabulous horseradish infused mustard, crispy acidic house made pickles of carrot and radish.

Mains - I am going to jump right to it.  Everything was at least good, but the Shepard's Pie is absolutely astounding and I would say the best thing we had on the table.  The pork belly, which I ordered was very good, crispy and fatty just as it should be.  It has a pea purée with it that is hardly noticeable and tiny chippolini(sp?) onions for sweetness.  All together great dish I wouldn't hesitate to order again.  I did not try a clam, but the mussels were great.  They were massive and came swimming in a delicious broth and a few heels of bread to drag through it.  The hen we a little dry but, my goodness, was the skin crispy.  The lamb was well prepared, perfectly cooked.  It is topped with Stilton, which I find to be a relatively medium flavored blue cheese, but in this situation it surprisingly dominated the lamb.  It was good to be sure, but could be better.

Sides:  The brusselsprouts were outstanding, simply prepared with bacon and apples.  Cooked perfectly, flavorful and a great compliment to the fatty pork.  The potatoes were potatoes.  They are tough to screw up and were not here.

Overall - For the 8 of us it came to just under $50/person, but I'd say that is a comfortable number for the experience we had. I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

This is the second time I've come.  I ordered pretzel appetizer and the salad with chicken shrimp and salami. The service was horrible.   The waiter should write the order down. The beer never came. Appetizer came after the meal.  Salad was fair. Drenched in dressing.     Pretzels were best part.   :/

I love all the little details that Gordon Ramsay restaurants have. Every piece of furniture and the outfits of the employees make the experience what it is. The food was better than decent and service was great. I know this place only has 3 stars but it's honestly at least 3.5 stars. I would recommend coming here if you're in the area but I wouldn't say this is a place you need to go out of your way for.

Disappointing! My wife and I are big Ramsey fans and we religiously watch Kitchen Nightmares. We've both been to London and love Pub food, so we were very excited to go to the new Ramsey Pub.  

First, the hostesses quoted an hour and a half wait even though it was off peak Sunday after 8, there were six to eight open tables and what appeared to be very few people waiting. They took my contact info and less than 30 minutes later the text came through that our table was ready. The early table was a pleasant surprise but it was obvious they weren't really keen at estimating accurate wait times.

Our server was friendly but not attentive. There were a number of times we had to wait a while before he returned to our table.

The Shepard's pie was bland and not very tasty at all.  The portion was very small, which wouldn't be a big deal if they weren't charging nearly $30. It was an entree price with a tapas/small plate portion size. Everything was way overpriced, the side of mushy peas was $11. $11 for a few ounces of mashed peas? And they weren't very good either. 

Overall it wasn't a very positive experience and with Ramsey's name on it you certainly expect more.

Gordon Ramsay's pub at Caesar's Palace is okay. We had tickets to see Jerry Seinfeld on a Saturday so we decided to eat here beforehand. My husband and I share the fried calamari appetizer, which was nice when you got a bite of calamari with the sliced chili, but was way too salty on its own. My husband enjoyed his lamb burger but thought there was way too much feta spread on it. I had the sliders, which were a bit dry, and chips with truffle aioli, which were excellent: crispy, lightly salted, and the mayo wasn't overpowering. Dessert was the best part. His famous sticky toffee pudding definitely lives up to the hype.

Before going to Pure Nightclub on Valentines night I came here for dinner. I never have been to a Gordon Ramsay eating establishment before. I watched him on TV however I didn't know what my expectations were. After eating here, this eatery met my expectations. Since this is an English pub it made sense to order the Shepherd's Pie. I'm not a big fan of meat pies as they tend to be heavy. This meat pie was hearty. I love the mashed potato covering on the pie as it had that outer crust. In addition the mashed potato was creamy and not heavy. Regarding the meat there is a contrasting texture with the minced beef and lamb that makes the dish very appetizing. Everyone mentions about the Sticky Toffee Dessert but for dessert I ordered the Spotted "Dic". I liked how the warm bread pudding meshed with the cold ice cream. I would have given a higher rating had it not been for the Truffle Chips. I expected the chips to be a thick cut chip. Instead the chips were the typical skinny cut. Overall I had a good dinner Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.

I am a fan of Gordon Ramsay! I love his shows and I love his other restaurant, Gordon BurGR, but I was not too impressed with this place. We got there pretty late so there was no wait. The waitress led us to a table that was ridiculously too small and you had to sit on stools, so there was no place to put your jacket or purse. I immediately asked her if we could be seated at a bigger table but she said that they had a limited waitstaff because they were closing in 45 minutes. OK, fine, I figured I could make it work. But no, the table was just way too small. I wish I had taken a picture of it because it was half the size of the other tables around us.

Our waiter, Chris, came by and introduced himself to us. I asked him right away if there's anything he could do about our table situation. He said he would have to ask the hostess. He came back right away and said we could move to a bigger table. THANK YOU, CHRIS!!!  BTW, the area where we were seated was kinda dark but I was happy for a bigger table.

My boyfriend and I both ordered the Shepard's Pie. He really enjoyed his but I thought it was kinda bland. It did not have much taste to it at all. I've only had Shepard's Pie once before years ago and I remembered it being flavorful. Usually we don't order the same things but for some reason on this night we did. I should have ordered the fish and chips.

We received super excellent service. On a scale of 1-10, my girlfriend and I rank probably an 8.5 on the beer knowledge / tasting scale. We sat at the bar, and the bartender could sense our experience based on a couple basic questions he asked about the kind of beer we like.

He was a super star. He provided 3-4 (free) tastings, recommended an excellent Saison, and even opened a British IPA, poured us some, the people beside us some, and himself some, free of charge.

Very friendly upscale experience, and I highly recommend giving this place a try.

With my specific food allergy, I spoke with a friendly manager about the options I have there. He was so gracious that he took me to speak directly with the chef and I was able to get the perfect meal. They accommodated the 10 of us and the waiter and secondary were also great. I have a hard time finding places I can eat and usually it becomes a drag but they made it seamless. I would give more stars if I could. Kudos to the staff and manager that Saturday night.

Absolutely fantastic! Me and the wife had the bacon burger (I added avocado) medium it was the best I have ever had in my life. The hype is real. Anybody giving bad reviews about this place dont know what they are talking about. I absolutely recommend it.

Let me start off by saying the food was fantastic! I ordered the lamb chops and they were cooked to perfection. My only complaint was that the veggies it came with had zero seasoning. No salt/pepper or anything, which I found odd considering the lamb was seasoned very well. My family ordered the Shepherds pie, Hell's Kitchen burger, and chopped salad. Everyone was very pleased with their meals.

My only complain is that it was extremely dark. It was hard to see the menu. 

Just like every other restaurant on the strip there was nothing on the menu under $20. You get what you pay for and we were not disappointed!

Updated to a 3-star for the prompt response from the restaurant manager who promised to look into the service we received that night, extended his apologies, as well as an invitation to try them out again... I look forward to taking up on his offer when I'm in LV next.

We had a great lunch here. Stopped by right before 11am and there were lots of people already waiting for the restaurant to open (good sign!) I had a corned beef sandwich that came with chips (homemade potato chips). Corn beef was excellent, very moist and tender. The rye bread was delicious and perfectly grilled. There were pickled onions and swiss cheese on the sandwich as well. Chips were okay but not my favorite. My husband had fish and chips (french fries) and he enjoyed everything very much. The service was excellent. They have a great beer selection that we will try when we return!

The food here is delicious, this is a newly opened pub located inside Cesar's palace. Priced a bit above average for a normal pub. So they loose a star for that. They were pretty busy the day i ate there, and I felt almost ignored at times by my waiter. I dont need many things, but refills come on. I dont have any thing else bad to say tho, def give it a try if you are around the area. Atmosphere is amazing, decorations are great looking and cutlery was amazing looking and well combined together with plates and glasses. 
Try the shepherd's pie its delicious!!

the service and food were great. it was disappointing to find out that the hells kitchen winner was NOT working there, apparently she had actually declined the job offer.

either way, i'm a huge gordon ramsay fan and i enjoyed the food!

I ate here before and the food I ordered was spot-on. This time, however upon ordering the shepherd's pie (which I also ate last time) I found it to be pretty bland. I will likely think twice before eating here again and if I do I will definitely order a different dish.

Disappointing menu, boring, tasteless food, pretentious, snobby atmosphere.
We have the feeling this place is going out of business.

We asked for well done meat and it came rare / raw.
Then then condiments were thrown on the table like the place is a gag diner with comic attitude,, but it isn't.

No salt and pepper on any tables or bar and the food crys out for it. You'll get attitude if you ask for it, and you just may not get it. Only Pub in the world without Brown Sauce.

Expensive, not worth it.

Surly, hostile bartender obviously flying on tweek or other powder.
Nothing here folks. Just tourist-trap attitude, sorry menu, high prices, mediocre quality and shot glass size portions. Well cocktail: $16.
Look to spend at least $60 to $70 per person plus drinks and walk out hungry.

5 star reviews are from employees.

Go elsewhere.

The food was excellent, but I honestly expected Amazing and did not get it. We love Ramsay so we wanted to try this place since we were here...the appetizers were very good. calamari was excellent. The drinks were okay, nothing great. The mini Shepard  sampler was really good, but super tiny. The french onion soup was okay. 

The service wasnt very good. I had to raise my hand three times to wave someone down for more water. I really didnt like the couch/coffee table set up because I had to lean over to eat. Then, interestingly, I give the waiter a $50 bill when I hand him the black folder (that contains my credit card ) with the check and he takes the cash and puts it in his pocket, and brings me the the bill with the full amount on the card. I reminded him I gave him a fifty with the bill (to apply cash first, rest on the card), he thought that was his tip? He did go back and fix it.

Go here for the Toffee Pudding dessert. Enough said. You won't regret it. It's our 2nd fav dessert here in LV (Fav would be the Caramel Budino at DOCG). Identical to GR's Steak version, but cheaper here.

A friend and I looked forward to checking out and eating at GR Pub & Grill, so we hightailed it there. The decor def fit with the theme of the restaurant. Comfy seating, and kind waitstaff. Now here is where it gets tricky...I asked what their signature dish was and our waitress swore by the fish & chips. My friend ordered that, with the mini pot pies. I ordered chicken Marsala (Brits are known for their Indian food right?), and some lemon shrimp cocktail.  Sorry, the Jasmine rice had hair in it, was obviously old, dried out...the chicken was ok. The only thing lemony about the shrimp was the cut up lemons on the side, nothing special, rather blah. The fish and chips weren't anything to rave about either. His mini pies were supposed to be lamb, chicken, and beef. No chicken came, but he stated it was pretty good. Will I go back? No. Would I recommend a friend? No

After paying for the meal, the waitress kind of left us hanging, as we had to ask another person to get us more drinks. I don't think Gordon Ramsey would be too pleased, not judging by his television shows. Maybe he better come to Vegas and manage his own businesses!

A family wedding brought us to Vegas. We follow Gordon Ramsay and wanted to try his casual dining atmosphere.  The hostess sat us promptly and our beverage order was taken. Afro was our server and he made the experience a terrific one. We had various questions about the beverages, menu items, and even Gordon himself.  The grandkids had fun interacting with Afro as well.  The pesto chicken sandwich was moist and tasty.  Wings, sliders, and lobster roll were top notch as well. Scott the winning chef was in the kitchen that day and he was gracious with photos.  We tried various alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages suggested by Afro and were not disappointed.  Overall one of the best memories we take home from Vegas.

As a big fan of Mr. Ramsay I have rather high expectations which honestly I learned from him.

My wife and I ordered Sheppard's pie, the mixed skillet with two beers and two cocktails coming to $150 including the tip.

Sheppard's pie:  You had to do some deep core mining to get past the
                           mashed potatoes and get to the goodies.

Shrimp Cocktail:  The shrimp were really high quality but the were put
                            into some sort of bland white sauce which reminded 
                            me of mayonnaise.

Mixed Skillet:       The beef had a real good flavor, the pork was a bland
                            piece of meat occupying valuable space on the plate, 
                            the prawns were good.

Service:               Ordinary.

The experience overall was lackluster so on the following night we 
returned to "Steak" for our third time and had Mr. Ramsay's five course
signature dinner which was expensive but the food was amazing along
with the service.

I am sure Mr. Ramsay will have the short comings at the Pub and Grill
sorted out in short order.

Really good food.  Great service from the waiter, Scott.  Knowledgable, helpful, real.  We went twice during our trip this week, once with my wife, once more with all the kids.  Learned a lot from Scott about Beer, and thoroughly enjoyed both visits.

One sour note- the female greeters are unattractive, dressed in ridiculous outfits, all seem to have a really bad attitude and are uniformly unhelpful on both visits.  Don't let them scare you away- it's great once you work your way past them.
Piercingly loud! Smokey. $128.00 fish n chips x 2 n two beers! We took server away from his post watching gamblers. Next night Voodoos! 180 degrees!

In true Las Vegas fashion, my family did Christmas on the Strip starting with dinner at one of the most recent additions to Ramsay's restaurant empire. The good impressions started even before we entered the place. In the first moments of walking up to the restaurant, I fell in love with their uniforms! The hostess' are outfitted in the most adorably sexy newspaper dress accessorized with fingerless leather gloves and matching booties. Someone remind me to ask our loving David S. to steal one for me ;) The uniforms only got better as the rest of the FOH people were dressed in this awesome British punk street wear. Designer Allison Leach of Mad Men and Glee did one heck of a job of creating that awesome first impression.
 
Our server was a little too high energy for me. You know when you have that fake salesperson vibe when they're trying to sell you something? Yeah, it was a little much. But other then that our server and serving assistants were working like a well-oiled machine. My mother is a lightweight and needed a girly beer. Our server smartly suggested the strawberry Fruli... It is now her favorite beer ever. And bread service was amazing. It shows up warm and delicious with a cheddar cheese spread and whipped butter cream. Andthey don't have a problem with serving you seconds. Hands down the best bread basket in town. 
 
The food. Oh man, the food is British pub action on point. I was itching to try some Sheperd's Pie. And although it is one of the cheapest entrée items it was one of the most delicious non-Asian foods I've eaten in forever. Tender chunks of lamb, beef, and vegetables blanketed in mouth-watering mashed potatoes. *heaven* In the fish & chips, they used cod which was a little heavier on the breading but fried to perfection. And the chips (fries) were thick blocks of fried potato served piping hot. Instead of a salad, we ordered a side of Brussels sprouts sautéed with bacon and apples. The slices of apple were real treats! They absorbed all the delicious flavors from the seasoning  and the sugar cooked off in the little bit of bacon fat. Amazing! I wish there were more than just 2! 

The only downside to our meal was the lamb riblettes appetizer. Tiny bits of lamb were served with a creamy cumin-based yogurt sauce. It was tasty but for the price, portion size was absolutely abysmal. GR insider David S. says the lamb entrée is the way to go and 1000x better.
 
I'm loving GR's new diggs. It's cool but still upscale with the food & service to match. I shall return.
 
Cheers!

Mehh, I've definitely experienced better.

This place was a disappointment. However, my friends disagree. 
I ordered Beer-Braised Short Rib $38 this lacks flavor. I mean, they added vegetables to add flavor to the short rib but the vegetables didn't have any flavors either. It was missing basic ingredients, like salt and or pepper. Such a disappointment. I expected it to be better.
My friends ordered steak, well done. They loved it but then again, they don't dine as much as I do so when I tried their steak... my god, it was not good. When they said well done, it was literally well done that it was tough, dry, and flavorless. I don't understand why they said it was good when it was literally hard to chew. That steak was a fail.

2 good thing about my experience: The skinny fries and the dessert which I forgot the name of it. 

Service was mehhh also. We ordered for drinks and it took a while for it to come to our table. Our server was so occupied with the table next to us because maybe they had more demands and there were at least 5 people in their table while there was only 3 of us... 

This place was such a disappointment that I will never come again. I love Gordon Ramsay so I will check out other places or restaurants that he owns.

Ordered beef cheek and pork belly. Amazing! Beef cheek was super tender you don't even need a knife. The mashed potato was a tasty side to the meat. Pork belly was well cooked, crispy on the outside, tender inside. Sat at the bar, Keith was fun to converse with. So much fun eating there. Would definitely go back. They need to work on their 'text message' system though, not organized or efficient at all.

Tried a few more dishes here this time around and all were excellent!!! The corn beef brisket sandwich made me love corn beef just that much more. On appearance, the bread seemed over powering but it was perfectly buttered adding more flavor to the corn beef and sauerkraut. Every aspect of the pot pie was awesome from the meat to the crust. The crust was flakey, occasionally giving you a hint of salt that blended well.

I'll end this with saying Ramsay knows his stuff when it comes to good food.

Dinner 6/5/2015

My friend and I had an excellent experience here. We came for a pit stop before hitting the strip on a Saturday night. There was a long wait for table, but we were able to walk right up to the bar and sit. 
I have to say, this was the way to go. The bartenders were our favorite company for the night! Antwone was hands down our favorite. Ladies, I am telling you, if you want a great view for the night, go no further. Antwone is the best view in Vegas.
We ordered the chicken chop salad and scotch egg to split and I thought the food was amazing. 
The people at the bar were social and fun. The whole vibe was great.
But like I said above, the bartenders were really our selling point for this place. I would go back to Ceasars just to visit this Pub again.....

Let's start off that in Caesar's Palace, there is no shortage of food options. Fine dining is as commonplace as a tourist with a spiked neon slushie in a foot-long container. That said... When we chose to eat at Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill, it was calculated. We were all enthusiastic to eat at this scary, yet reputable chef's restaurant.

But all went awry when 45 minutes after placing our order, our party was awaiting the APPETIZER.  And the most puzzling part was that the restaurant was damn near EMPTY at the time we ate. Where the dag nabbit was Ramsay with his inappropriate and oft mal-placed British curses and wrinkled forehead to scare the bejesus out of these chefs for a hustle on our order? 45 minutes on a meal in Vegas? You know what I missed? I missed the taxi cab that was going to take me to MGM to see Calvin Harris. Or... I might have missed the end results of the poker tournament at Rio. Or... At least 2 drinks with my cousins from out of  town.  In other words, time is money and in Vegas, time and money is currency. 

Ramsay, you have a 3-star pub and grill. And your name brought us despite the mediocre reviews. I still have a homoerotic man-crush on you, but the service  needs a firm kick in the pants.

My wife and I dined at this Ramsay restaurant on June 3rd for lunch.  The hostess and wait staff were excellent.  However, if the food was on a scale from 1 to 10 it was a 5 or 6 at best.  I understand that Gordon Ramsay is not back in the kitchen personally and I understand none of his top Chefs are back there as well.  But I was shocked that he would put his name on the mediocre food that is served there. 

I ordered the Onion Soup and my wife ordered the Duck Confit Poutine for our lunch starters.  The Onion soup was good, it had a different after taste but it was a good soup.  My wife was not fond of the flavor of the soup.  Her Duck Confit Poutine was tasteless and was a slightly warm glob of a mess and again it was really tasteless.  

For our main dish I had the Traditional Sheppard's Pie and she had the Pub "Spots" (3 mini-house blend pub burgers.)  My Sheppard's pie was ok, not great but not horrible, I was shocked that it came out of a Gordon Ramsay kitchen.  It was bland and a bit greasy, it tasted like pot roast  that was served in my elementary school which I was not a fan of.   I have had much better Sheppard's Pie at Walt Disney World's EPCOT.   My wife's the Pub "Spots" (3 mini-house blend pub burgers.) were ordered Med Rare and came out over well done.  The overcooked burgers were taken off the bill, not by our request but by the server who agreed that they were not cooked properly and were way over cooked.   The wait staff again was excellent and I tipped her approx 30 percent because she and the rest of the staff were excellent.   

I am a big Gordon Ramsay fan and really enjoy reading his cookbooks and his television shows.  However, after the let down at Gordon Ramsay Steak and now at the Pub. 

 I just don't think I can spend our money on a product that is supposed to be top quality in all aspects and falls short, but you never know what the future brings..  I may go back..
Such an expensive disappointment! Calamari appetizer was very good. Had the waiter recommended short rib entree. No amount of salt and pepper could help. Would not go back!

Having been a patron to Gordon Ramsay's Burgr, I figured his pub and grille could be a good choice since I absolutely loved my food at Burgr. 

I was so wrong. 

I wasn't terribly hungry so hubby and I decided to do appetizers only. We were staying at the hotel so we reviewed the menu in the room (note: the listing says casual dining but the prices are equivalent to or more than the upscale restaurants) and headed down. 

The hostess told us it was a 15 minute wait so we added our name and stood around. After half an hour, I realized the hostess forgot us as she kept seating other 2 top parties right away. I told her the dilemma and she insisted she didn't forget us and that we were next. Sooo we finally got seated after 30 minutes of wasted time. Not too good of a start for dinner. 

Our waitress took our drink order of a soda each ($5 sodas. Yeah. That's not casual dining prices) and didn't return with our drinks for 20+minutes. So here we are thinking we were forgotten by the hostess and now by our server. 

We ordered the lobster mini rolls (it comes with only 2.....not really an appetizer and more of a small bite) and the jumbo shrimp cocktail (7 shrimp if even...with large croutons stuffed between them.)

The food was actually delicious but was overshadowed by the ridiculous expense of it all. We spent equivalent to a full fledged meal for two on two drinks and two appetizers. The service was abhorrent and absolutely TERRIBLE for a high end establishment. 

Save yourself the time and money by not eating here. This restaurant is a flop.

I got the Caesar salad and hubby got the fish and chips.   The salad had a little too much dressing and the chicken was dry but all in all it was good.  Hubby liked the fish and chips but said that the Nine Fine Irlishmen in New York, New York was better.

Fun, fun, fun place.  Love the vibe, the decor, hip-Brit fashions of the staff, and the modern pub food.  We enjoyed the Deviled Eggs and Gordon's secret nachos with kettle chips, corned beef and English cheddar.  Paired with a Boddingtons and I was happy happy happy.

A total disappointment across the board. Service was terrible for a Monday night. The calamari was decent but our entree was cold and the lettuce in our salads not fresh. Maybe just a bad night but bad enough that we won't be back.

What a place! 

First off I like to start off with the staff they, are freaking awesome. Not only are they very tentative, but they are super friendly, and they provide the necessary accommodations  to make one feel welcome. The decor was pretty cool as well. 

The most important thing  that I can generate from this review is the food. 

It tastes so fresh and delicious I could just eat a plethora and not get tired of eating here.

 I had the braised pork belly. It was so soft, tender and juicy that I wanted more. The seasoning used on this was really delicious.

The pretzel was decent nothing out of this world. (and that all I have to say about that)


For dessert I had the sticky toffee pudding, this was actually my favorite part. It closed my meal all the way around. 

I would highly recommend this place prices are a little steep, but still congenial.

Effin amazing! The scotch eggs were amazing! The pigs in blankets were truly bangers (pork). The lamb burger.........yep, amazing!!!! The fish an chips......meh. If you're English, you know fish and chips and the yanks can't match it but damn these were good. The sticky toffee pudding was YUMMY!!! Great atmosphere and a wonderful food experience! Irish coffee was made just like home....:no tinned whip cream crap! A wonderful night and the food was......well....:amazing!!!

Our first meal on our last trip to Vegas.  It is exactly what Ramsey wanted - pub food taken to the next level.  Great staff and good atmosphere but it does lose a point for being a bit pricy.  Over $50 per person including a drink each is a bit expensive for what it is.

I'm giving it 4 stars but I can see how people gave it a 3 star rating.  Let's call it 3.5 stars.

I loved this restaurant the first time I went in 2013 and was excited to return. The last two visits have been such a huge disappointment that I will not be coming back.

The first time I visited the menu was much more expansive, they had iPads with endless craft beer and wine selections and the food was delicious. When I came back a year later the iPads were gone, the menu items were different and there were less of them.

The food was greasy, bland, and spectacularly over priced for the quality. On my latest visit in July 2015 I ordered the short ribs, which turned out to be only one piece and boneless. Not what I expected, but at least it will taste good, right? Well actually, it didn't taste like anything at all. The meat was tender but had no flavor or sauce to help support it. The barley risotto had zero salt and was reminiscent of plain oatmeal. For a $40 plate I expected much more.

I gave my review two stars because the pretzels and cheese sauce were good enough, my glass of wine came in a small carafe so it felt like a generous amount for the price and the service was ok. Not enough positives to come back again, too bad.

Ask to sit in Adam's section! Super nice and will gove you great recommendations.

We had the nachos ($7) and deviled eggs (5). I had a glass of cab ($7) and hubby had a stella ($9). 

It was so awesome! Great food and experience at Caesar's Palace. Stop by for happy hour!

I was very dissapointed with my visit to Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill. The food was just not that great and very over priced. We shared the fish and chips - which was $30... and got three small/thin pieces of fish and just a few chips. Nothing special about these at all. Especially for $30. We also tried to order the pub pretzels and told we couldn't order them until 12:30 (place opened at 11/this was about 11:45) because they make them fresh every day. ?!?! So they don't make food to serve when the place opens? Then.. not ten minutes later (not noon yet)saw an order arrive at another table. We did get the "deviled eggs" which were pretty good and had a drink, which was good as well. Overall, not what I expected. Won't return.

Had the nachos which were yummy and indulgent. Not what I would expect from a Gordon Ramsey restaurant but tasty. The 2 cocktails I had were fabulous. The bartender did an amazing job. I had the goodbye blue Sky and the Pub Crawl. Two totally different drinks but very delicious!  Nice stop for a drink and a bite!

A yummy dining experience, thanks Gordon!

Hubby and I are not big turkey fans, so in recent years, we have taken to searching out non-traditional Thanksgiving locales.  Being a fan of Gordon Ramsay (a bit of a crush?!), his shows on t.v. and last visit loving Gordon Ramsay Burgr, hubby made dinner reservations with Open Table and we showed up at the appointed time.  Our half booth/chair table was ready and we were sat almost immediately.

The decor and general vibe is a bit loud, a bit fun, large open area looking out into casino, with a mix of slightly different appointed areas of lighting, seating and various artwork.  The table settings were unique, including the flatware.  Service was efficient and friendly and our waiter would come back with answers to our questions without being prompted to.  

Appetizer:  4 stars for English style Nachos, delicious hot freshly cooked kettle chips with a terrific sharp English cheddar, a delicious English TP sauce and corned beef bits and tender short rib.  This could have been a 5 star contender but the chef was stingy on the meats.

Main Courses:  4 stars for Fish & Chips and 4 stars for Steak & Ale Pie. High end ingredients in both, tasty, tasty tasty. I opted out on the chips for chive truffle oil mashed potatoes and that was delicious.  The reason the 2 main courses didnt receive 5 stars are due to the fish batter could have been crispier and the steak & ale pie was a tad on the small size for a main course.

Did you save up room in your tummy?  I hope so because below was the only true worthy five stars!

Dessert:  5 stars for Potted Chocolate Trifle, perfection and a must for chocoholics!  Stealing hubbys pic:   http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gordon-ramsay-pub-and-grill-las-vegas?select=4KSMWCaEumIG2DXwpsqF9A

I highly recommend Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill and even if you just want to chill, have a beer and watch some sports, this is a solid spot.

I had a late lunch today at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill today.  Gord and I are fans of Hell's Kitchen and MasterChef so I thought I'd check it out.

It was fairly packed so I sat at the bar rather than wait for a table (a 15+ minute wait).

It's in Caesar's Palace so it's not cheap.  I ordered a burger and fries (without lettuce, onion and cheddar and added bacon).  It took about a half hour ... Charlie, the bartender, said the kitchen was backed up.  It was good but could have been hotter (I guess it was sitting around for a while).  It was rarer than I like it but tender and juicy.

The experience was okay, not outstanding.

We came for dinner. We ate the filet and lobster tail. It was the most delicious food we have tasted in a very long time and we like to think we're aficionados on food. Our server Aris was very knowledgeable about the menu and a joy to have. Pricey but we knew that. We will return.
Grilled beef burger was honesty the best damn burger I have ever had. Can't even describe it!
Had to walk out.  Sat waiting for drinks (even water).  The table we were sitting at wasn't big enough for kids, much less adults.  GR should be embarrassed.

Had a great time here for my 2nd Birthday Dinner. 

I ordered the Deviled Eggs and the Bacon Cheeseburger. I also tried the spicy Chicken Wings and The French Onion Soup. 

The food was tasty, and I didn't really have any complaints. 

Nice environment for large groups, plenty of options that will please everyone's food tastes. 

They gave me a free bread pudding at the end, OMG it was to die for. LOVED IT. 

I would definitely come back.

I wish I could write a Awesome review but the experience was Terrible. 1/2/13 We had 6:15pm reservations, arrived early and seated at 6:09, from that point it was all down hill off a cliff!

At 6:18 I had to ask one of the 5 waiters/waitresses that had walked by without even looking at us, I had to ask if one of them could help us, and/or who was the server at our table.  We found out that 'Jennifer' was over our table and never did show up and at 6:25pm when 'Kimberly' was assigned to us she comes over apologizes to us, turns to the table beside us to take their order who was just seated, the couple points out that we had been waiting forever and the waitress Kimberly says to her 'it"s ok, I will get them in a minute!'

My wife bless her heart is not one to make a scene stands up with me and I tell the waitress we are leaving for good. Out the door we went, we will not be back, period.

I am a Hugh Gordon Ramsay fan, books, cookware, knives, we have been to dinner at Gordon Ramsay Steak in Vegas, which was excellent. Just for the Gordonites in the crowd.

We left went over to Bobby Flays 'Mesa Grill', was seated in less than 2 minutes, waitress acknowledgement and glass of water on the table in less than 1 minute! Hugh difference, not even close!

Amazing Food and Amazing Service from Mesa Grill!! Saved our evening.

I realize that no may care of even read this review but, it was extremely upsetting to see such a bad performance by the staff of a World Class Chef who I highly admire. The menu is extremely pricy for a pub so save your dollars up and forget the pennies it is not enough!

Having eaten here a few times in the past two years I can say the food is very consistent. The shepherds pie is fantastic as is the fish and chips. Bartenders are great at coming up with just about anything you can ask for. Service was very prompt and quick to refill drinks and provide answers to any questions we had. Just remember this is a pub environment, if you want quiet peaceful dinner go somewhere else. This place can get loud when busy.

Around 30 or so craft beers on tap, fun bartenders, terrific looking place, and some ok fish & chips. Still, Jones Wood Foundry on the UES New York does them better! Sorry Gordon.

Was here last week for a bite to eat and to catch the college hoops championship game. The bar area itself is huge with many stools to take a seat and watch the game on one of the large flatscreens hanging above.
