We ordered chicken kale and bacon pot pie and the kettle nachos. The nachos were delicious. Thick, crispy potato chips with an English cheddar cheese sauce, braised beef and sweet peppers. They're were surprisingly filling, but there were only peppers and meat on the top, not layered it's the chips. Since we got them during happy hour, the price was reasonable for what we received, but we would have felt robbed if we'd paid full price. The pot pie was under seasoned, and there was no salt or pepper at the table. The waitress came to ask if we wanted any halfway through the meal. The bacon pieces in it were fatty and limp, the crust was soggy, and there were maybe 5 pieces of kale in the whole thing. Portion was small by American standards, which was what I expected and would have been fine except that it didn't come with any sides. Odd for a dinner entree, and really ridiculous for the $24 price. To cap it off, I informed the waitress that we were celebrating my husbands birthday at the start of the meal, and other than a "oh happy birthday!" nothing was done. Maybe it's just the restaurant policy, but really, would it break the bank to bring out a scoop of ice cream or something? Overall the meal and experience were a huge let down.

oh, my goodness...Love yelp!! I read the reviews before going to this restaurant, and I am so glad I was prepared because everyone was right on.  Let me start by saying that the quality of the food was very good, and truly that should be the important part right? The service however...ugh.
Husband and I came in Xmas Eve, dressed to the nines as we were going to a show that night...the hostess put us on a tiny crappy table stuck by a beverage cart and then she walked away without asking if it was ok...I don't like to make waves on a busy service night, so I didn't complain, but we had a reservation made over 10 days previous and it would have been nice to have a decent table when we were obviously dressed for a nice dinner.  Our server was then clueless to anything.  He was slow, did not have a good knowledge of the menu, and was not genuine in his approach to our questions.  When he asked us for our drink order  we were very specific in what we wanted.  I specifically asked him if he had a particular liquor,& I overhead him ask his co-worker about it,  and we could tell they had no idea. He then placed the order..?  Out of concern I then walked the 10 paces to the bar and found out myself that indeed they did NOT have what I wanted.  Low and behold, my drink arrives. The server tried to pawn off a drink as the one that I wanted....Furious. If someone is going to take initiative and ask me to try a drink in place of one that I want, I'm ok with that....However, to pretend to give me what I want, and pretend knowing otherwise angers me. These drinks are $20 bucks a piece, so I am pissed at this point and so is my husband.
Bartender to the rescue...I walk up there a second time and he looks sheepish. He knows already that the drink he made came to me after knowing full well that I did not want what was obviously given to me. He offered to look in the backroom for a replacement and ended up getting me exactly what I wanted from somewhere else.

Food: we had the mini trio of pot pies for appetizer, delicious, came out quick, but a little pricey for what you get. Prime rib entrée also very good, nice cut, well cooked. Caesar salad, simply delicious, homemade dressing with anchovies, yum! Grilled lamb burger on the brioche bun, soooo good, I loved it!  
Its so sad that an experience like we had could overshadow really good food. The food is served well, its creative, eye appealing and tastes great. The service is poor, the hostess stand awful,  stacked with 2-3 girls who don't use any common sense,  and are phony to greet but yet don't even notice as you leave after spending $250.  It all left a bad taste in our mouths.  This is vegas, and there are so many restaurants to choose from...We will not be back.  Well, maybe we will sit at the bar :)

This was completely unexpected in its greatness.  We had planned an expensive dinner at Gordon Ramsay's Steak to celebrate our anniversary.  We were staying at Caesar's Palace, and were looking for someplace to eat lunch.  We decided to stop in, with the plan to get a drink and an overpriced lunch.  We were fortunate that the restaurant week menu was still active, with a $30 three course price fixe menu.  It was a great deal.  We both had the chopped salad, which was a step above most.  Crisp, fresh items, tossed with a tasty dressing.  Generous portion as well.  The salmon entree was amazing.  Perfectly prepared, with amazing sides.  Then there is the sticky toffee pudding.  Served warm with home made ice cream and with hot caramel poured over it table side.  Arguably the best dessert I have ever eaten.  Nice selection of beers and wines.  Worth it if you can get the price fixe menu.
great cocktails and bartenders, we sat at the bar and had the pork rillete!! amazing-ness!!!

We stopped in for a beer and were welcomed by the bartender. Lots of beer on tap, good variety, something for everyone. I am not even a beer expert but I found a beer I liked.  

We tried the calamari and it was very fresh and came with tartar and cocktail sauce. 

Service was attentive and the couple next to us wanted a sit down dinner. The bartender walked all the way to the front and got the hostess, walked back with her and introduced them to the hostess. Can't get better than that kind of service!

Food itself is pretty on point. I had a perfectly cooked steak and nice sliders here. BurGR gets all the attention and unfortunately i can't compare between the two but dinner was good. The truffle fries were delicious! Service was a little lacking. The table next to us was seated after us but given their order much faster. We mentioned this to our waiter who was friendly, apologized and promised he would check up on our order... then disappeared again. It was hard to find him at any given moment. Thought the restaurant was rather small. Didn't realize how large it was until after our meal. We were sat by the bar and the bar stools were pretty uncomfortable. I'm not the tallest person and felt like a little kid eating on the high tabletops haha!
Had an absolutely wonderful experience here. From the host to the server to the food - it was all great! Would highly recommend this place.

DON'T waste your money and time. After having a great experience at Gordon Ramsey's BurGR, we had hoped an English pub by an EmUK chef would be amazing. Sorely disappointed. Hubby had fish and chips. The fish was not seasoned at all. The batter was crunchy but amateur chefs can get crunchy. Here is a tip: try salt.
I had the lobster macn cheese. Solely based on this I'd have given it 3 stars. Better than fish n chips. Lots of lobster but mac n cheese was blander than it could have been. I had much better lobster mac at House of Blues. The staff seemed to be working hard but we had to wait forever for drinks and for the server in general. The bus boy was awesome though. Kept our waters filled and table taken care of.
Fish n chips: 2
Mac n cheese: 3
Service: 2.5

Hugely disappointed that a restaurant with GR's name would be so lacking!

As much as I like watching Gordon Ramsay Hell's Kitchen, Kitchen Nightmare, Master Chef and Master Chef Jr. shows. This place is just as awesome. Though services are slightly not on top. We were a table of 3, two of the appetizer came out while my cousin was still waiting for her French Onion Soup. Apparently, the waiter forgot to take notes so therefore she never got hers. Then after our dinner meal, we ordered desserts. It took another 50 minutes before we get our sticky toffee bun between sipping down our coffee. It was a real long wait. Where's Gordon when you need him to yell at his staff? Totally bad timing. But the waiter was smart and did us a favor by taking out the desserts on the tap on them. 

Not so bad, despite the food was super delicious! They probably need to really work on their time management with the kitchen to floor excursion. Otherwise, I definitely wouldn't mind to go back again to try out other dishes! Yippee!!

This was probably our overall favorite restaurant on our trip because we both had a good experience. I got to go off menu when I requested a vegetarian dish. They waitress offered me the risotto, but then she came back and said the chef wanted to something different and fun. I ended up with a delicious pasta with veggies that had a sour flavor, but was really good. The artichokes and olives complimented the flavor well, and it only ended up being $14! My girlfriend got the shepherd's pie, which she really enjoyed. For dessert, we went with the famous toffee pudding, which did not disappoint. This place didn't blow our minds, but it was definitely the most solid restaurant we ate at on our trip.
We've been here twice in 24 hours now. The salads were very tasty and the pasta was absolutely delicious. You can't go wrong with this place it seems. Definitely recommend this place.
Food is excellent!!! Awesome service, I will definitely go back again next time I go visit vegas!!!keep it up and maintain  your excellent service!!! Happy camper here!!!!

I had the lobster rolls which was technically an appetizer. Very good! Bread was drenched in butter. My only complaint was it was 2 rolls the size of your index finger for $18. When you haven't ate at all that day and it is 4pm that was kind of a rude awakening. Had to get a slice of pizza from another joint a few hours later. But, the food was very good.

High expectations, sadly disappointing. After an hour of waiting for our meal, we flagged down our waiter and inquired as to how much longer until service. He had no immediate answer and appeared to be indifferent.  When our meal was finally delivered, mine was cold and dry. A second attempt did not fair much better. My money and time would have been better spent at the food court. Gordon Ramsey has a brand, and that brand was not represented well. We got our table at 9 pm and did not finish until 1 am. It is a waist of money and time,

Waited 35 minutes for my order and the food was subpar. To make things worse, getting water was a mission because our waiter was nowhere to be seen. Ordered medium well... my burger was basically rare. At least the fries were good. Wouldnt recommend.

They get a half start for their beer selection.  Ordered the onion soup and it was a flavorless broth with untrusted bread and an enormous flop of cheese that was like bubble gum   The truffle Mac & Chee had overcooked pasta and the small amount of actual truffles were overpowered by the chemical truffle oil.

WOW What a big mistake... Had the fried Cali almost ok and Pig rapped devil eggs nasty. Bacon was cold and under cooked. Yoke tasted like vinegar.  The drinks are fine. Service was strange.. The bartender took my place setting and beer before I was finished... Must be a Ray Ray thing I guess that's his nickname... Strange uniforms.... We will not be back. To many super KOOL place other than GR Pub & Grill...

I have dined here twice and love it. I had the steak and ale pie the first visit and nearly licked the dish clean. My companion had the chicken and she loved it. I had a sample of hers and thought it was quite good.

Second visit I had the short rib. Wow wow wow as Gordon would say. So delicious. We also split the calamari app. Was done in a unique way but was excellent. My husband had the bangers and mash. It was very good.

The only thing that I have a gripe about is the prices of the beers. But whatever. If I like my meal, I don't care what it costs. If you are on a budget, perhaps this is not the place for you. Also, if you come here why on earth would you order a burger? You can get a burger anywhere. I read lots of complaints about the burger and the price of it. Duh... No burger should cost $20 and if you come here, why not get something that is not so common?

One downside is the service was on the slower side each time I've been here, but I make reservations and allot 2 hours just so I don't feel rushed. I like to take my time to eat. 

Give it a try, look at the menu before you come to make sure it is in your budget and you don't go on yelp later and complain. Also, make reservations, plan accordingly. Order something a bit out of your normal realm too. Complaining about burgers and fish and chips....you people....smh.

Tried it out this past weekend with a few friends. The feel is sorta between a bar and a restaurant(duh hence the name), little dark, open air. Located inside Caesars Palace where Bradley Ogden used to be. As expected for such a spot, prices are a bit on the higher side, and like all other Caesar properties, slightly discounted(read as $1-2) prices for their Total Rewards cardholders. Had the shepherds pie. Very good. Our server seemed a bit slow. Took him awhile to greet us, refill waters etc. He brought out the complementary bread when we were in the middle of the meal. He did apologize about that. I heard good things about their desserts but didn't try any this visit, maybe next time. Woulda gave it 4 stars but the service wasn't grade A. If the prices don't give you sticker shock and youre in Caesars Palace, it wouldnt be a bad place to try.

Went there week of New Years.  We knew it would be very busy but decided to try it out anyway.  Started off by ordering the Ramsay Tonic.  Was very refreshing and had to get a second one.  I ordered the beef pot pie and my fiancee' ordered the chicken pot pie.  My mother and sister ordered scallops.  All of the food tasted very well and it did take awhile to get our food but it was a holiday.  The staff was very friendly and we had to make room for dessert.  Ordered the cherry custard and it tasted very good.  Food and drinks were spot on, service was just  slightly slow due to holiday week.

Absolutely phenomenal food. We had a basic all American dish, burgers and pub sandwiches, and Gordon's crew was able to make them some of the best I've ever had!  The wait staff was extremely personable and friendly. The vibe and atmosphere of the restaurant was welcoming and modern.  If ever I am back in Las Vegas, there is not a doubt in my mind that I will eat here again!!

I expected to love this place. We loved  Burger across the street and Steak at Paris, Very disappointing had lunch with my husband at the bar. New waiter on his first day probably would have been better on his own. The guy training him was offensive.  When I said I did not like their take on the corned beef sandwich in a bowl he said I shouldn't worry about looking pretty while I eat it just dig in there.  high priced as it is and after presenting our Harrahs card still did not get the $4 off a $20 so called corned beef sandwich. Why bother putting the two prices on the menu if they don't understand what it means.  Will not be going back.

I have wanted to visit a Ramsey restaurant for a while now, as  a big fan of all of Gordon Ramsey's shows. The meal and service did not disappoint, I had the battered fish and chips, where the best I have ever had, great cocktails, very friendly staff, very clean restaurants, a great experience and a mist do in Vegas.

Myself and my son enjoyed a great dinner there on Monday, as well as getting to watch some Monday night football...Our server (forgot name) was informative and very attentive, also met the manager, Michelle, she checked on us and was so friendly, awesome attitude!!!!...Overall we had a great time and will definitely be back....

Ate at the bar here while at a conference at Caesars.  I ordered a NY strip steak because I was allowed to spend so much for my meals, LOL.  Dumb idea.  I should know better than to order a steak that is not prime grade.  But nonetheless, it was satisfying.  Nothing special by any means.  The menu is definitely tilted towards an English influence which should be no surprise.  I just wish I would have gotten a burger.  The staff was all very attentive, friendly, and full of interesting characters.  I would definitely go back to eat here.  I would just stick to what the name implies they are best at.  Pub and grill food!

This place was OK, nothing more. The service was fine and the pricing of the beers wasn't terrible in comparison to other places in Vegas but we paid $55 including tip for 2 bowls of soup and 2 pints of beer. My draft beer also tasted like cardboard. The soup was OK but totally not what I was expecting. My fault for not checking first but the description could use some editing. The free bread came out after we had finished our soups, which made no sense. Oh well, you live and you learn.
Overpriced, slow service and ok food. We went thinking it was happy hour but that is only Mon-Fri.

I have now been to the Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill twice; once on New Years Eve and then again yesterday. My party and I were satisfied on NYE. The waitress was friendly and attentive and the food was incredible. However, my visit yesterday was mediocre at best. We had to ask twice to get out free pretzel/bread basket and it wasn't delivered until well after we received our entrees. Also, the food was not all delivered at the same time. I ordered the fish and chips, which you would think was the fastest to make (compared to the lamb and sliders), but I had to wait three or four minutes for my dish after the others were delivered. There were no complaints about the food, but we felt neglected.

Tips:
- Make sure to make reservations on Open Table before hand
- If you have Total Rewards make sure to check the TR prices are charged on your bill. Both times I visited full price was charged. They also don't accept Ceasers TR F&B vouchers.
- I made the mistake of taking my parents here. The music was very loud, which I don't mind. However, it was difficult for my older parents to hear.
- As with most upscale restaurants, unless specified (eg Fish and Chips), the entrees don't include any sides. You have to order them separately.

Honestly wasn't too impressed by GR Pub & Grill.  I think when a celebrity chef puts their name on a restaurant, we assume that it should be spectacular but that isn't always the case.  We came by for dinner since the other half is a big fan of Chef Ramsay.  He watches Hell's Kitchen religiously, while I can barely tolerate all the yelling and drama.  I will say that I do like to watch his show Junior Master Chef though...but I digress.  As expected, the place was packed.  Especially since it is located across from the Colosseum, many people (myself included) wanted to eat dinner there before the Mariah Carey concert.  We arrived and were told it would be about a 20 min wait.  That worked out fine and we were seated inside for a table of two.  The ambiance is very pub-like with and I imagine there are actually some pubs like this in England.  Our waiter was just so-so.  We told him that we were in a hurry bc we were going to the concert after dinner.  He didn't really seem to care much and it took longer than expected to get our food.  25 minutes later, our salad and burger finally arrive.    

The two items we ordered were just average and we could have gotten the same level of food at any bar and grill:
-Pub Chopped Salad ($16):  I will admit that the salad was very fresh and they did give a lot of shrimp and grilled chicken.  The salad also contained ham, sliced apples, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, white cheddar and pretzel crisps (their version of croutons).  It was supposed to have avocado too but I only found 2 small chunks.  The pretzel crisps was a nice touch which I liked. 
-Grilled Beef Burger ($19):  Huge disappointment.  The beef patty was dry and unseasoned.  The only toppings on the burger were two slices of white cheddar.  There wasn't any lettuce or tomato so it made the burger completely lackluster.  A small side of fries accompanied the burger.  Presentation was nice as it came out on a chopping board but that's as far as it goes. 
Total tab was $43.  Overall, not worth the hype or anticipation.  You could get a better burger at so many other places and probably for half the price.  The other half said that even Habit Burger was better.

I knew going into a Gordon Ramsey restaurant as a vegetarian that my options would be limited but my Option (1 single entree option) was 4 piles of vegetables dumped on a bowl. There was no effort to make an appetizing option. Yard house offers a full vegan menu so to be charged 28$ for nothing less then a half assed attempt to say they have a "veg friendly" option was sad and disappointing. My husband said his food was fantastic as were our friends but I left hungry. Too bad, as locals it's a nice change of pace to go out on the strip and have dinner but this will not be an establishment we will be returning to.

We had dinner around 5 and we're able to catch the last of happy hour drinks. They were out of a couple tap beers but the food was excellent. The food did take awhile to come out but the woodburned chicken salad with shrimp was definitely work it. The avocado dressing was the shizzle. My boyfriend had the club and he wouldve liked it more if the toast was cooked a little less. It was so toasted that it was cutting the roof of his mouth.

We decided to eat here since my hubby is a big fan of this place.  He comes to Vegas once a year for a convention and this is a frequent stop of his.  My girlfriends and I literally got off a plane, dropped off our luggage and beelined to this place.  We showed up at 10:55 AM and they weren't open yet.  They open at 11, so don't show up early!!!

Once they opened, we were promptly seated and our waiter came to take our orders.  We started off with the pretzel appetizer which is delicious, BTW.  Then I ordered the bangers and mash.  The mash was delicious, but I was not a fan of the sausages.  My friend ordered the fish and chips...and man this was the biggest plate of fish and chips that I've ever seen.  She said it was great, but probably would be best to share.  She didn't even make a dent in it.  Lastly, my other girlfriend got the burger and really enjoyed it.

I think I'll just have to come back and try something different.

Waited over 30 minutes for our food... Fish and chips, lamb chops and lamb shank were ok. Scallops had no particular flavor. They were just salty. Accompaniments were less than desirable. Waiter was busy flirting with two ladies sitting at the next table. He stopped by once to check on us when we were nearly done eating. Don't come here if you want service. Trying to get someone to take our credit card so that we can pay and get out of here...

Liked the atmosphere but  that as about it. I am not a big portion guy but thought the size of my order didn't match the price that came with it.  Overall nobody at our table was impressed and luckily me and my bro were buying or the two old guys with us would still be complaining. Big fan of Mr. Ramsay but my experience at this place was less than what I was expecting.
This is the second time here and the bar service is impersonal, little eye contact and minimal effort. Unfortunately,we will not be returning.

This place is delicious. My better half and I were walking around at the Caesars Palace and as soon as we both saw the restaurant, we just had to try it! We both love Gordon Ramsay and his crazy bad temper, so why not try his restaurant?

We had the Devil eggs and they were out of this world!!! So tasty!! Very interesting way to serve them too. Serve the yolk as a spread rather than already inside of the hard boiled egg white is pretty brilliant.

I tried the lamb burger and it was really good. I asked for some mustard for the burger and the fries and I almost died. It is so spicy!!! Delicious!!

My bf had the fish and chips and the fish was cooked perfectly. Really flaky but crunchy on the outside. Exactly what I expected out of fish and chips.

The only bone I have to pick with this restaurant is the uniforms.....what on earth were those girls wearing?? There was some waitress well in her late 30s, early 40s wearing the trashiest little number ever! And trust me, it was definitely not age appropriate. I would change their uniforms to something a little more modest. Even hooters girls look more modest and out together. 

Hopefully we will be back, soon

I am sad to say that our experience here wasn't as pleasant as we had hoped. Our wait time from the time we ordered our food was 50 minutes. Yes, we actually timed it. Our waiter came to tell us that the food would be just a few more minutes at about 30 minutes into the waiting period. We never once heard back from him after that. Once he brought out our food, he just dropped it off and said, 'enjoy.' We clearly needed more water, which never got refilled as we dined. Our server never acknowledge or address the long wait. He also actively avoided us before and after bringing out our entrées. 

We ordered Shepard's Pie, Scottish Salmon, & Rack of Lamb. The lamb was mostly fat and gristle. The Shepard's Pie was good. The Scottish Salmon was good. The bread & cheddar cheese sauce was amazing. 

We would have loved to try the desserts, but we didn't feel like waiting or dealing with the bad service anymore.

Overall, the service was lacking but the food was okay. The best part was the bread and the Innis & Gunn beer. Unfortunately, I personally wouldn't recommend this restaurant based on our first experience.

First up i want to say that everyone that knows me knows that i am n love with Gordon Ramsay, with that said here we go. We go to Vegas every month been trying to decide between his steakhouse, burger or pub. We figured we would do the in between so went with the pub. Just went Dec. 23rd so it wasnt crowded at all. Got seated immediately. First up the tables r too low seats very  uncomfortable. Our waitress took forever just to come over and take our drink order which was just 2 sodas. Very small menu so that made our choices pretty easy. Now mind u its 7:30pm i havent eaten since breakfast bcuz i wanted to make sure i would b able to eat my meal and end it with a great dessert.

Me: Had to go with the fish & chips of course bcuz thats all Gordon talks about, with a very heavy heart i must say i was not I'm
pressed a matter of fact i was disappointed none of the dishes were flavorful. The only difference btween this fish & chips and HSalt fish & chips was it wasnt as greasy.Thank God they give u such big potatoe slices bcuz the fish pieces were small.

My daughter: shepards pie n this tiny bowl, which she had to salt and pepper, but she did love it.

My other daughter: braised lamb shank: shallow
 bowl/plate the lamb was very tender. 

Maybe if the meals came with a soup or salad or if they had some bread or something on the table u wouldnt realize how long it takes the food to come out. Once again we do splurge every few months on a fancy place and i dont mind if the total experience makes me say i cant wait to come back here, that didnt happen.This meal set us back $105.00 and just was very average. We went to the Chocolate Box and had some delicious dessert.

Now, i wont b back here to eat but i will at least try his other spots.

We gave it another chance after a disappointing first experience and we were disappointed again... We sat at the bar the bartender barely paid attention. The food arrived while we were just starting our appetizers... so now we are at the bar with an 3/4 full plate of nachos, two burgers and 2 beers. The bartender did not do anything about it to help us out, we had to send the nachos back... the food was not bad but not good either, especially for the price.
The entire experience was just a disappointment unfortunately, no major problems like last time, but this time was probably the last time we tried.

We were so extremely skeptical after last years disappointment at Gordon Ramsey's burger bar but everyone kept insisting that his restaurants are great. So.. For our last night in Vegas we decided to try here.

After a 15 minute wait we were seated and ordered from our lovely server Jennifer. We ordered the mini burgers (6/10) and lollipop chicken for starters. They both came out super quick (within a few minutes) and while the burgers were ok the bone on my chicken was a bit cold which was strange.. I should have taken that as a hint as I bit into my chicken and realised it had a bloody raw taste and when i spat it out.. I looked down to discover that it was indeed raw.. My poor partner had eaten 3 pieces and thought they tasted weird but did not want to spit them out and after looking over at my raw chicken leg, he really wished he had..

Another server brought our mains over in record time also and we showed him the raw chicken for which he was immediately apologetic and said he would speak to the chef and manager.

Our mains we had the New York Strip Steak (7/10) and the Lamb stew shepherds pie. (7/10) Both were good but it was quite difficult to truly enjoy our meals after being so worried eating raw chicken.. I could not wash that taste out of mouth no matter how many gulps of red wine I had! 

The server returned to inform us that the chicken would be removed from our bill (I think this is the least they could do because most likely.. We will both be sick on our 14 hour flight back to australia) and apologised once again.

Dessert was the sticky toffee pudding (8/10) and the salted caramel sundae (8/10). Both were delicious.

Unfortunately it was pretty difficult to recover from serving us raw chicken lollipops. The both of us including 2 pints of cider and a 250ml Pinot noir was $140 plus tips. 

So will we be coming back? No.. That's a 2/2 fail rate for Gordon Ramsay's restaurant... Such a shame.

We took my daughter here last month and over the nascar weekend. Decided to splurge on the rib eyes because I figured we could not go wrong with watching all his cooking shows, plus it was her birthday weekend. At 45 bucks a piece it was one of the worst rib eyes I have ever had. The outside rim of this thin steak was cooked decent, but the middle was inedible, not only because it was over cooked, but there was so much gristle i ended up spitting most of it out. My daughter got one of the burgers which was good and we discovered the best tasting root beer we have ever had. Very disappointed as we were very pleased with his other place burgr on the strip.

My boyfriend and I decided to go to the pub instead of the steak house as we are not big fans of steak.  Going in, of course we knew it was going to be expensive. Hence the 4 star rating.  The only reason it is expensive is because of the name and it is on the strip.

But the food is absolutely delicious!  I ordered the salmon and it was the best damn piece I have had since leaving Seattle!  The bf had an amazing looking burger and had his first Pim's cup.  The service was great and the overall presentation was worth the price.

We haven't been to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant before but we were expecting a good experience. Boy were we wrong. Some of the food were pretty good, I'd give that 3 stars, our server was awesome - I give her 5 stars, everybody and everything  else 0 stars... 

First of all, we went at 5:45 to get a table for 3 - with lots of empty tables in the restaurant they tell us, they can't accommodate us until 9:45 that night. We weren't that hungry so we decided to take the 9:45 reservation. When we got there again, we had to wait to be seated because it seemed like they didn't even know which tables were available. 

We finally got seated at approximately 10:15 and the hostess gave us ONE menu for a party of three. Okay, you might be busy and ran out of menus for the moment, but you should give us two additional menus ASAP. She never came back, and every other party around us had a menu for per person in their party. My friend saw a hostess with extra menus in her hands so she flagged her down to give us the menus. She had the nerve to say, "I'm sorry, we usually only give ONE MENU PER TABLE." - really?! That's a ridiculous excuse...if you can't think of something better, just say sorry and hide behind the counter or something. Oh yeah they ran out of water as they were filling our glasses so one of them was half full and they never came back to give us more...

We finally placed our order probably at 10:30. We ordered pub crisps (pretty good, might be a little too oily), mini sliders (I tried one that was overcooked, the meat was so dry), duck confit poutine (best dish of the night), a burger, and fish and chips (if I had read the review that all fish dishes were crap, I wouldn't have ordered this) and two drinks. During the 1+ hour that we were waiting for our food, we decided to order desserts ahead of time because we were afraid that would take another hour. We ordered the sticky toffee pudding and triple chocolate trifle - both were very good. We also got the peanut butter and jelly but that was too sweet for our taste buds. 

We ordered at the same time as this table of two girls that the bald manager guy snuck in after we were seated. But their food and drinks came way earlier than ours. 

We finally got our drinks at 10:45 and we didn't get any of our food until 11:44. That's over an hour after we placed our order, and people who were seated after us got their food, one table even paid and left already. Our food didn't even come in the order that the food should arrive, we got appetizers and entrees at the same time. At least they didn't bring us the dessert too. 

A different manager came with the people serving our food. My friend just started to complain about the poor service that we had all night. (Aside from our server - we didn't quite catch her name but she acknowledged us, she keeps coming back to tell us she had already asked the kitchen to hurry up and get us our food; she was very attentive and nice to us while we were waiting.) So the manager was apologizing, saying sorry that we had such a bad experience, yada yada ya. And they ended up giving us a free meal. 

If we had to pay, I would say the food is slightly overpriced. Portions are small but depending on what you order, the food was pretty good. (DON'T ORDER FISH!!) Unless they fix how they run the restaurant (kitchen and everybody else minus that one server), I wouldn't come back...even if I loved the duck confit poutine, sticky toffee pudding and the potted triple chocolate trifle -_- But they just opened recently, so I might give it one more try (after careful screening of fellow yelp reviewers comments) in the future or if it is still around...

They have pretty judgmental people working there, if you want better, quicker service, then dress up. There was this other table near us, they received the same kind of crap service when it came to food, drinks, and all. They had to wait just as long as we did, if not longer. And they messed up their order on food too.

Had a dinner date here & it was one of the highlights of our trip to Vegas last week--it helps that we already love both pub food and British fare in general.

Briefly: The shepherd's pie was excellent, and my wife devoured her lamb burger with much love. We think the real highlights were the starters and desserts, though; the "Pub Spots" (sliders) were phenomenal, and we think well worth the price. We ordered 3 desserts to share (though it turned out to be too much by that point in the meal, and we left a little at the table) and while all were bliss-worthy treats, the sticky toffee pudding was the standout favorite (and the only one entirely finished).

A bit pricey, but more affordable for us than, say, Gordon Ramsay Steak and (we think) worth it. The service we received (it was relatively early; we arrived around 5:30PM for dinner) was excellent, and we never felt we were waiting long for anything--and there was always someone to hand to take a plate or refill a drink or whatever was needed. 

After watching Ramsay on TV for a few years, it was nice to be able to see that he really does run (or at least put his name on) well-run restaurants with great food and service. We probably won't return, but it'll be because we've saved up for Steak, next time we want to do Ramsay in Vegas!

The food was amazing but not so much for the service. The server didn't know anything about the wine on the menu. She also forgot to bring the oysters before the entrees. When she brought them after we finished our meals, she brought 1/2 dozen instead of a dozen (which was the actual order)... However, she didn't ruin our evening since the food (we had a rack of lamb, trio of meats) was heavenly!

I had a great expierence here, given that my earlier expierence at another restaraunt was horrible. So I got on Yelp! to find an other place that was somewhat close to where I was and this place showed up. so i headed over, hoping I could get something to eat even with out a reservation. I walked up and was greeted by a lovely hostess. I explained that I didn't have a reservation and told her briefly about what happened at another restaraunt. Thankfully, she said don't worry and follow me. I sat down and glanced at the menu. My server came over and asked what I'd like to drink? I ordered a beer. He returned quickly and asked if i was ready to order. I said yes and I'll have the fish and chips. OMG! the fish was so yummy and the chips were divine. the mushy peas that came with it were better than I thought they would be. I will be back the next time I'm in Las Vegas.

I didn't know what to expect from the Pub & Grille. I knew Ramsey's name was attached and that might mean really awesome food or just a cash grab trying to lure dumb tourists into paying twice as much for their food...

The restaurant is really well designed and looks cool especially the wall of kegs. The waiters wear vests and have these little satchels. Pretty well themed.

As far as service, your water never drops below half way. The lady was on top of it!

Our waiter though was lazy, lingered, and only checked on us after we finished the vast majority of the meal. What if I wanted more than a thimble of ketchup? He seemed bored and pretentious. Plus he messed up our order. No bacon on one and the other was undercooked.

As far as food goes, what a straight rip off. 21$ for a burger with bacon and fries. I'm not sure if they ran out to Carl's Jr and grabbed up a bunch of 6$ burgers because that's all I tasted. Bland, small, and overpriced. The fries were tasty but really greasy and like I complained before all you get is a simple thimble of ketchup.

Our host had Prime Rib. His plate looked like he went to a Claim Jumper but was priced like a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse.

In the end I just I picture Mr. Ramsey rolling over in his... giant pile of money.

The food was awesome..one of the best burgers I have ever had..I gave the restaurant 3 stars because the service sucked...our waiter never once checked yup make sure our food was right or if everything was ok..There was another gentleman who did bring us our food and made sure everything was ok...but our waiter totally sucked..I will not say any names but we sat in the second seat behind the hostesses stand...I hope we get better service at Gorden Ramseys steak tomorrow night.

I've had a lot of burgers, and I mean a lot of burgers. But this by far provided the best burger i have ever had. The price is competitive with all of the main stay burger and pub places on the strip. If there is a mistake made, they promptly correct it with out asking

It's hard to believe this place is run by the same guy who screams bloody murder when his "TV chefs" don't get it right. We arrived for lunch and (even though the restaurant was only about 1/3 full) were told it would be a 30 min wait for a table. Huh? We decided to sit at the bar which was packed. We watched as arriving diners were told there was a wait for a table even though the tables near us never filled up. While we waited for our food we asked a waitress why we were told the wait was 30 min when there were so many empty tables that didn't fill up while we were there. 
She said they (not sure who that is) tries to "stagger" the diners so the kitchen doesn't get overwhelmed. She said she hates it because she doesn't make any money off empty tables. I told her I had a hard time believing a decision like that is left to two very young girls pretending to be hostesses and that a kitchen in Vegas run by a world famous chef can't handle a full dining room. CRAZY!
Gordon! Don't be a donkey! If you're going to put your name on a restaurant make sure it embodies your customer satisfaction philosophy. Judging by the reviews this place is not doing that. 
BTW The food was just "ok".

I wanted to give these guys a higher rating and if it was based on the server, they'd get 5 stars. The food was nothing better than basic bar food. The fries were cold (fish and chips) and chewy. The salmon was good but lacked the 'umph' to make it great. 
The desert ( toffee bread pudding) was the highlight of the meal. For the price I felt I could have done MUCH better.

We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary today !!!!! Our wonderful server Scott H was very pleasant and knowledgeable about the food. The best meal yet!!!!!  Great experience. Can't wait to go back.
The pub is a fun, relaxed environment.  Our waitress gave great service.  The lollipop chicken wings are so good.  Also tried the mussels and fish and chips, which are great too.

The Ramsey Pub and Grill almost lived up to our expectations... but as most know the more expensive the place the smaller the portions.  My friend and I thankfully made a reservation for the pretty crowded restaurant and were seated almost immediately.  We were seated in the bar section which was fine, but the seating was unusual - I felt like the seats weren't tall enough for the table.

Aside from that the fish and chips entree was stellar!  I think that possibly the best cooked fish and chips I've ever had.  The batter was light and tasty, perfectly salted and the cod that lay beneath was wonderful.  The tartar sauce was also lovely with the fish.  I couldn't have been happier with my dish.  My friend was a little less satisfied with his meal of the steak and ale pie.  His biggest complaint was that there wasn't enough of it.  I'll agree that the pie was pretty small for the price - but other than that he enjoyed the flavour of the dish.

Perhaps people might be surprised that I rated it a 4/5 but the food was in fact very good.  The service was nice and we enjoyed the experience.  It was a treat to go and I'm happy that we did.

One of the worst meals we've had in Las Vegas in 6 years living here. Onion soup was very bland. Fries tasted like they were from frozen. The shepherds pie was an extremely salty soup with potatoes on top that tasted and felt like instant. And all this was after waiting nearly 45 mins for the food to arrive (after watching two other tables seated after us be served). Would never recommend it to anyone - and am very disappointed with Mr. Ramsey for putting his name on the place.

Stopped by as I was walking through Caesar's for a quick snack, and sat at the bar. The server recommended the Scotch Egg and pub chips (fries). She was friendly and efficient, and correct on the recommendation. Both items, while simple, were done to perfection. The chips were about a third of a potato or more each, and you got eight, so quite a bit of potato. They were crispy on the outside and just right on the inside. The house made ketchup was good enough to eat without putting it on the chips. It was my first scotch egg, so I don't have much to compare, but I enjoyed the contrast of the spicy sausage, egg, and slightly molten yoke. yum!
Very good food, but this is Gourmet pub food and very expensive, burgers start at $20.00, average entree $30.00 plus, food was great as it should be for the prices.

In brief, it was very good, but I wasn't wowed by it.  My expectations were set too high because of Gordon Ramsay's name attached to it.  

The ambiance, the atmosphere and the decor were absolutely gorgeous.  The service was impeccable, although some of the staff were having a bit too much fun at the bar, which was a bit distracting.  If I was basing my review solely on these factors, I would give it 4 and a half stars.

The food was good, not great, but very good.  I had the English Ale Onion Soup, which I liked, but thought it lacked.  The onions were gorgeous, the cheddar crustinis were good, but the broth didn't have it.  My main was the filet platter.  The steak was nice, the pork belly was a bit boring and the shrimp were not hot enough.  My friends had similar complaints and compliments.

All in all, not a bad choice, just not as good as I would have expected!

Nachos, wings, salads, and beer were great. Service was great. Location was nice. A bit pricey for what it is, but it was expected. Didn't come for dinner, just a quick bite to eat in between gambling sessions..  Served our purpose great. The wait was only about 10 minutes and they sent us a text to let us know our table was ready. I'd like to go back and try the lamb burger and steak!

So lastnight my beautiful wife and I go to eat dinner ,expecting a non forgettable dining experience. After all that passion Mr.Ramesy demonstrates on TV about food with flavor, temperature, and presentation I guess my hopes were pretty high. But come on really, $100 for basically two hamburger combos,McDonald's like frozen fries! They need a Whataburger in this town to show them how a Texas burger outshines their crappy gourmet burger anyday! And the waiter,  not very engaged with the work and customer service aspect at all! I will never go back,and my curiosity for fine dining is ruined for good! Thanks alot Gordon!
Wasn't very impress with this place.  Service was ok and food was pricey and not worth it. Definitely not coming back.

Gordon Ramsay's Pub is a nice restaurant for a lunch or a quick meal. We ordered the shrimp cocktail (chopped up shrimp that was marinated in lemon mixed with cocktail sauce), warm salty pretzels with queso dip and horseradish dip and the BLT with Pulled Pork. The pulled pork is the consistency of chicken salad not pulled BBQ pork. Overall, the good was good but the process were a little more than they should have been.

Had a great time dining  at the bar before the concert. The bartender was super friendly and didn't push us out as we ate & drank at our leisure. Mini pub burgers. Truffle chips. Devil eggs and scotch egg were yummy. Fast service! We will Def be back.

My husband and I came here to celebrate our anniversary and loved it! We were at Caesars Palace for a show and appreciated the prompt service. The food was fantastic and our sever Rod provided excellent customer service! We had the braised short ribs, bangers and mash, and sticky toffee pudding (best dessert ever!).  As Las Vegas locals we will definitely return for date night.

My husband and I went to dinner here the other night. Fantastic. We made reservations because we had read about long waits. We arrived and we're seated in minutes. I read some reviews that said that they staggered seating. I didn't see this happen. The tables that were empty for a bit seemed to be for larger parties with reservations. We also didn't have a long wait for our food. Waiting time, all around, was average. 

My husband had the lamb shank and I had the lamb rack. Both were delicious. The lamb rack comes with a couscous that is to die for. The sides not listed with your dinner come at extra cost. We ordered the mac and cheese, which was the best mac and cheese I've ever eaten. To be fair, the sides probably come at an extra cost because you don't need rhem. We both would have been full and satisfied with just our meals. Our helpings were pretty large. We struggled to finish the extra side. 

As a side note, I ordered my lamb rack medium and it came almost well done. This didn't bother me at all, since the only reason I didn't order it well is that we'll usually translates to burnt at most places. So I was perfectly satisfied with what I was served. 

There is a photographer that will ask if you want your picture taken at dinner. She comes around about 20 minutes later to show you the picture. You get three and a frame for like $18. She also stated that she worked for ceasears and does this at all of the restaurants and attractions within the hotel. So, no matter where you go in ceasears it seems this will happen. You can always say no and she will leave. She in no way pressured us into getting or buying our pictures. 

We also ended with dessert, because we were waiting for our pictured. We ate the pear cobbler, which was warm and gooey. It came with a sweat cream which evened out the dish very well. 

The only complaint I have about the night was that the chairs (not the stools) are pretty low compared to the tablw. I felt like a toddler trying to reach everything, no matter how close I got to the table. 

Other than that, great and interesting place! Would definitely eat here again if I was given the choice!

I got food poisoning from the mini pub burgers. Not sure what's going on here. I tried to order a side of fries but the waitress recommended getting a full size burger with fries because it's be the same price and better meat... Also overheard the next table complain that their steak was undercooked.

Our waitress (Daisy) was phenomenal! She was no doubt, the best part of the meal. She was friendly, sweet, and adorable! I really honestly cannot rave enough about her. We even searched out the manager just to let him know how incredibly amazing this girl is. I hope you get appreciated there Daisy!

Now, the food... delicious! I ordered the Dublin sandwich with no sauerkraut. Daisy suggested I leave it on, said to trust her. So glad I did. The sandwich was amazing! The fries were just plain and basic, nothing exciting there.

I will definitely be back, and hope to have Daisy again!
Excellent service and food. Had the pub burger and toffee for dessert. Burger was juicy and very tasty. The dessert was the icing on the cake so to speak.
Popped in for a beer. Great atmosphere & the staff is awesome. Charlie the barman gave me good tips where to visit in Vegas & some hiking locations. Really liked the place

I give this place 5 stars for 2 main reasons: Service and their calamari  We dined here on one of the busiest day of the year...New Year's Eve. While all the restaurants at Cesars Palace were fully booked as expected (even the food court line was up the wall), we were seated within 10 minutes at this restaurant. They were also extremely busy yet they were able to accommodate a family of 6 at the peak of their dinner time which was 7:30 pm. We were never rushed, server was very knowledgable of the menu and specials, our water was refilled constantly, and when they made a mistake with the way one of the burgers were cooked, they replaced it within minutes. They even gave complimentary truffle fries. 

Now for the calamari, it is by far the best I have ever had! And I've had a ton in my lifetime.  It was so tender and fried to perfection! Great portions too. I would come back over and over just to have it. We could've had a lousy take out or room service for our New Year's Eve dinner but Gordon Ramsay staff turned it all around. Keep up the good work!!!

Went there for my birthday dinner. Had fish and chips, it was too greasy and after 3 hours it still is not sitting well in my stomach . Service wasn't good, had to call the waiter for drink refill. I had a higher expectation of this place. I wouldn't recommend that dish, maybe a different cook would be better. Also, it was $30 for the dish, which wasn't worth the money. A friend ordered lamb burger for $21 and it was much much better, but still it wasn't up to the standard of the name brand.

Holy Crow!!!!  
Just had dinner here tonight, and it was a completely awesome experience - I hardly know where to start!

THE DECOR/AMBIANCE. Loved, loved, loved the decor, different sections/seating areas and especially loved the bold,  colored stripes down the middle of the whole restaurant.  I'm a geek for great graphic design and this place kicked some major ass in that regard.

MENU. Not huge (2 large pages), which was totally fine by me because it tells me they are sticking with what they do best. Only 2 vegetarian options for my friend, but a few sides were vegetarian-friendly... just not called out on the menu as such.  As a carnivore, I had more than my share of choices. 

SERVICE. Everyone I spoke with (phone-for reservation) and met were very friendly and helpful. Adam Z. was our server, and he was awesome.  Adam was fun, engaging, had the menu details nailed (which greatly helped my friend pick her entree), and a real sweetheart of a guy who made our experience truly memorable.  When you go (when...  NOT if), be sure to ask for Adam Z!

Lastly, THE FOOD.  Ah the food.  Veggie Dish of the Day:  delish.  Bacon Cheeseburger:  excellent. Truffle Fries:  fantastic. (Didn't have the Fish and Chips, but the guy next to me did and they looked heavenly.)  STCKY TOFFEE PUDDING:  THE BEST FOOD (not just limited to desert) IVE EVER EATEN...  EVER!!!   No exaggeration, the sticky toffee pudding is hands down the best thing I've ever had - it's an absolute MUST-HAVE when you go.  I just finished eating and I'm stuffed, but I'm seriously already planning to go back tomorrow just for the Sticky Toffee Pudding, and the next night...

Such a cool place with fantastic food. p.s. Consider yourself extra lucky if you get one of the dog chairs like I did. #Bramble

The service was amazing here. Very attentive. If you like mixed drink the " goodbye blue sky" was really good. I got the lamb burger and it was cooked perfectly and tasted great. Would eat here again.

If you are a vegetarian don't ever plan this restaurant.. I didn't know that Gordan Ramsay never planned to cook for vegetarian. Above that had the worst service of my life. I think Gordon Ramsay should play hells kitchen with his own restaurants.
One good thing about the food n restaurant for which I gave one star is the desserts.

We came back at this restaurant because we had awesome burgers that we ordered a few months back.
We ordered Bacon Burger and Grilled Beef burgers again both cooked medium this past weekend and it was terrible.  The patties were dried and no flavor!!!! 
Do not order burgers here!!!!!

Epic! I've been here twice and it's one of my absolute favorite places to eat. I ADORE the corned beef brisket sandwich, the pretzels with home made mustard, the lobster rolls, and the steak and ale pie. The pub crawl cocktails is spectacular. Both times I've been here the service has been above and beyond what one could possibly expect, with Scott being an exceptionally cool server who was honest (no to the lobster mac n cheese and steering us to the shepherds pie) . I'm afraid to over-hype this place, but I really can't say anything really bad about it. It's not cheap, but they use real ingredients and you're not going to leave hungry. Sometimes quality food costs more, and let's be real here, Gordon Ramsay is a name brand so there has to be a mark up. I definitely recommend eating your heart out here!

We had high expectations when arriving to eat but were quickly disappointed. It was absolutely horrible service. We arrived at 6:30 and did not get our food until around 7:45. Our server was non existent for about 30 min and never checked in on us throughout our meal. Although it was quickly taken care of, the shepherds pie came out cold even after taking over 40 min to receive. I would not recommend this restaurant.

I will be straight forward with this review. Being that it was our wedding anniversary, my wife and i decided to try out the Pub and Grill. It was not up to par from what I expected it to be. I will start off with the server. First of all, he was not very friendly and I felt the attention was not there. Took 15 minutes to come back and ask us what we would like to order after he brought our drinks, considering there were only 2 other customers he was tending to. Once we received our meal I asked for a second beer, he replied he would get that for me..10 minutes later, I reminded him about my beer, his answer "yes I know, I need to go get it" Really? I am dropping at least $100 for our meal and you answer me like that? The burger was good but not excellent for being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. I was expecting a big juicy burger, but it was compared to maybe a Red Robin burger, and I am being generous. I will not come back here again only because the service was so bad.

The decor beautiful, the service was friendly and attentive. The food was very delicious and worth the price. The dessert was the best part in my opinion, the sticky toffe pudding is their signature dessert and it was amazing, like nothing I've ever tasted before. Every time I go to vegas now, this will be the restaurant I have to come to before I leave. I'm definitely recommending to everyone and will be back.

Yeesh, like another reviewer has mentioned I am also surprised by the average reviews. 

I came here in the off season (early December) for lunch and we were promptly seated at some high tops. Our server was very attentive and the menu offered typical British pub food that I'm familiar with. 

I ordered the onion soup which was wonderful, not overly salty or oily and full of flavor. A great soup for the cold weather. My husband had ordered a lamb burger with goat cheese and it was fantastic! Absolutely delicious! My other lunch guest ordered mussels but wasn't pleased with them since they were cooked in a type broth that I couldn't identify but he wasn't familiar with (I liked it). I would definitely return but probably avoid the dinner hour based on the lackluster reviews.

TERRIBLE SERVICE, I had the fish and chips, chips were soggy and luke warm, the mashed peas disgusting, I complained to the management and offered no apology, our waitress must have been assigned 20 tables and I was never able to get any service staff attention.  Avoid this restaurant, very over-hyped, just like the infamous TV chef

Eating at a Gordon Ramsey restaurant was on my bucket list... my overall impression was only meh!  Don't get me wrong... The food, service,  and decor were all excellent.  But... considering this particular restaurant was just standard pub fare it just wasn't worth the prices. If you're going to pay this much for the Gordon Ramsey experience you're better off going to one of his nicer steak houses.

That being said..  The food was really good!  We got the deviled eggs and the warm pretzel snacks. Then the mini pie starter. I had the fish and chips. And our table shared the sticky toffee pudding for dessert.  Everything we tried was delicious just expensive.  For a table of 3... With 3 beers, 2 snacks,  1 appetizer,  3 entrees and one dessert. .. total bill was $178. Could have been worse I guess

Gordon Ramsay has quite a few restaurants in Las Vegas. The Pub and Grill was the one we selected for dinner before a show on Saturday night. We made reservations and were seated right away when we got there. This spot looked just like an old pub, classy but still pretty casual.

The waitress offered us some specials and helped us decide on our dishes. She told us that when Gordon Ramsay is there he always gets the Bangers and Mash. I decided on the pistachio pesto chicken sandwich that came with fries. It was delicious! So tasty and the bread was a zucchini cheese bread - yum! The fries were tasty and the ketchup was even better! I don't know what was in it, but it had some type of kick to it. The braised short ribs were also amazing and the risotto with that was so delicious!

There is also a Steak and a Burger spot from Gordon - I will have to try one of those the next trip!

Embarrassing.  On Juy 16 2013 we've got a drink server and a bread server, but the main waiter Scott was barely showing up. We've waited forever for our food and had to ask another waiter for status. He then found out that our food was accidentally taken by someone else, or whatever else happened.  We then got out filet steak which was just mediocre for a $45 steak. I visited over 100 restaurants in this city and this one was one of my worst experiences.
Very slow and poor service! The nachos are very good! The fish and chips are overpriced fish and chips. The best thing was the beer!
Horrible. Greasy, flavorless and overpriced. Captain D's makes better fish than this place. Don't waste your money.

I gave Gordon Ramsey another chance and you failed again.
Please do not ask for a well done burger because you will not get what you ask for, I say this as a 2nd visit at a Ramsey restaurant. 
The service was BLAH nothing comforting about the service. It took a long time to get a greeting.
The drinks were good.
Atmosphere was nice, good for large groups.
The second star is for Randy for really picking up the broken pieces from the team we encountered during our visit. 
Overall my birthday dinner was distasteful and unpleasant from the service of the waiter to the improper food request from the kitchen.

Gordon Ramsay has a great stop in the Caesar's Palace for those seeking upscale bites and a few brews while watching the game. I love the ambiance of the place and the menu. There aren't five pages of options, which helps narrow the choices down. I highly suggest ordering appetizers to share. Not only will it cost the same amount as 3 regular entrees, but you get more variety and more food for your buck!

Came here for a quick bite to eat. We shared the Cesear salad, which was good, but drenched in dressing. We also got the sliders, which were good, but a little dry. 

They have  a decent beer selection, good service (even though the waitresses had some funky outfits), and a nice atmosphere. The food is average and a little on the heavy side, but not bad for a quick bite. 

If you have a TR card, you get a couple bucks off.

I went to Gordon Ramsay's Pub with a large group on a weekday night.  The restaurant was partially full but it took almost two hours from the time we ordered to when received our food!  The waiter that was in charge of our party of 18 could not keep up and they asked a waiter with a bad attitude to help with the order taking.  The food was good but not great and we had to endure a long wait and poor service!  My last time at this place!

Surprisingly good food for a place that calls itself a pub.  The scotch eggs were done with a touch of flair, the shrimp cocktail was better than expected and the organic chicken was great.  

I'm used to having bangers and mash for breakfast but what the heck I ordered it for dinner and it was good enough to be an entree.

I give this fantastic restaurant a five-star the reason why as soon as we walked in they were very nice and polite the waiter explain to us the menu and was very kind he never seem to eager or mad or in a rush to leave he took his time with us and was very polite and nice my husband ordered the lobster mini rolls and he said they were fantastic I took a bite and they were very good I ordered the grilled lamb burger it what very delightful better than any Lamberger I've tasted so far!! We ordered for our two-year-old the mac & cheese I also got a taste of that it was like heaven so creamy and cheesy really good I recommend it highly our experience here was verywonderful i'm definitely coming back to this location again I highly recommend it for everyone to try!! Thank you for such a wonderful experience Gordon Ramsay pub and grill

Ok, allow me to begin by saying that the food here is quite satisfying. Our server was willing to accommodate any special request and did so, with a smile. Our party enjoyed our time and our food. Upon leaving I realized that I could not find my sunglasses. I immediately called and let the restaurant know. Unfortunately the 3 females located at the host stand were not very helpful. I believe the exact words were "no one has turned anything in, you can check with security later. That's where we will turn everything in" um... Ok? I literally JUST left ... One of those girls can't walk 10steps and take a quick look around the table and possibly the women's restroom??? You have to be kidding me. I understand that the conversation of what they did their past weekend is fascinating but, you just had a guest call about a missing item. This missing item can be easily tracked since I left less than 15 minutes ago. Nonetheless, it seemed hopeless so I turned around and headed back to the restaurant. A very kind gentleman in a suit (probably the manager) offered to assist. He walked to the back of the room and came back in less than sixty seconds with my sunglasses in hand! Thank you kind sir for being the hero. I know hostesses usually don't have the best reputation... But these three had the opportunity to change that tonight. Sorry ladies... Epic fail. Thank goodness there was someone else willing to step in. It may not be important to you, but if it's important to your guest... It should be important to you. This place would have received 5 stars otherwise.

I came here with friends a while back.  I really loved it here.  
I'm mildly obsessed with Gordon.  I watch everything of his that I'm able to, having access to only what's on Netflix and Hulu, so when I saw that he opened a pub here, I jumped at the chance to go...especially since its a lot more affordable than the steak house. (still dying to try that one.)

For starters, we had the Warm Salty Pretzels, with the beer cheddar and mustard spreads.  These were absolutely delicious.  Good thing we split them between four people, because I could have filled up on those alone.  

We each got a sandwich/burger each:
Welsh Rarebit Ham Sandwich:  I hate ham.  I really do.  But I wanted to try a bite of this sandwich so that I could say that I was brave and ate ham JUST because it was at a GR restaurant.  It was reallly good.  Open faced sandwich with lots of flavor.  My only complaint is that my first bite fell into my beer. :(  that was totally my fault though. lol

Pub Lamb Burger:  The menu gives you the option of feta or goats cheese.  My friend opted for the goats cheese, and I think this is the perfect decision.  The lamb burger was just a touch on the dry side, so the feta might have taken away from the taste of the burger.  With the goats cheese, it was flavorful and pretty good.  I'd order it, but like it a little less well done.  

Pub Beef Burger:  This is the one I got.  Of course, I added the applewood smoked bacon. (duh.)  I loved it.  I thought it was the best tasting meal of the group.  Not only that, but the beer that I chose (Lucky Buddha) went with the burger perfectly.  It was a good size, very juicy, and perfectly cooked.  

I'm kind of ashamed to say right now that I might have gone too long in writing this review to remember the fourth sandwich.  I could have SWORN that my friend had a corned beef sandwich, but I'm not seeing it anywhere on the menu.  So it might have been the beef cheek one, but I'm not going to review because I don't recall.  Whatever it was, it was really flavorful. :D

I loved how the sandwiches were all served with REAL chips...they were perfect as well.  Not a single one was over cooked, and they were't super greasy either.

I will definitely be going back, and hope to save room to try the sticky toffee pudding next time.  

The staff was awesome, and I love the decor.  We were seated at a "coffee table" type setting with two love seats.  It was right in the middle of the restaurant, where I could watch the football matches in the other room (real football, not American.) :D  

I felt that the price was good for the quality of the food.  4 of us ate AND drank for about $100.  Not too shabby.  

Hm.  Maybe I'll go back this weekend... ;)  Now that I'm thinking about it, I'm getting hungry again. :D

The name alone is worth checking this place out because if any of you have seen any of his shows he strives to be the best and well this place is almost just that. I can honestly say I have never had such amazing service in my life. Not only do they refill your drinks the second they are low but they also know what you want before you even ask its pretty awesome. But besides the great service the food is also really great. I had there lamb burger which was recommended by the staff. I was here for lunch so its unfortunate i wasn't able to try there dinner menu. There prices are sort of high but then again it is Vegas so that is kind of expected. Overall its a great place and well worth checking out.

My husband and I love coming here for our last lunch/meal before we depart to the airport to go home. Waitstaff has always been great. I love the decor. Food has always been yummy and the peas are just so good. The chef makes them to my liking and I don't eat peas anywhere else. The menu is full of pub food that is well worth the money. 
Can't wait to come back and eat again.

Really great for lunch or dinner!!  Love the British menu, table set up, and silverware!  And, of course, the food!
Loved:  Lobster Mac and cheese, pot pie, Hell's Kitchen Burger, and trifle dessert
Liked: Beer choices
Hated:  No longer do they serve the pretzel bread basket as in so many Yelp photos!  Boo!  Our waiter said they stopped doing it, but it's available for purchase at happy hour.
The lobster mac  and cheese is a side, but it was perfect as a meal for me.  I do love my comfort food!!  My husband tried both the Hell's Kitchen Burger and beef pot pie on separate meals.  He said both were excellent.
The best part was the dessert...to die for!!!  A must!

We opted to go here for a family birthday dinner. The service was extraordinary -- from the time we made the reservations with the hotel concierge.  Kimberly and Lisa Marie took great care of us and accommodated all of our special requests.  We loved our meal.  Burgers were fabulous-- very special ketchup. And my salad with chicken was awesome. Great beer list, too!  We love Innis & Gunn.   From jaynefurman.com "It was beyond sensational." The drink menu is extensive and they bring it to you on an ipad. Three kinds of pretzel rolls accompanied by an amazing flavored butter and an extraordinary cheese sauce. The burger was flavorful and cooked as ordered, which is phenomenal for any restaurant.  Our group is finicky, so kudos to our superb server, Kimberly, who must have a photographic memory.  The server/runner Lisa Marie was incredibly helpful and sweet. When we left, we felt we had two new friends!  Gordon Ramsay's homemade ketchup (and we're not even ketchup fans) is not to be missed. Michael loves the sticky toffee pudding here. The mac and cheese was over the top fabulous -- duck fat croutons, truffles and three cheeses. Burger with applewood smoked bacon and cheese was awesome.   Photos to follow soon

Gordon Ramsey Grill and Pub is ordinary. They have pub style items at an astronomically higher price. We ordered Pub "spots" as an appetizers which is basically 3 two bite burgers. They were $18. They did not have much variety. You either had to have fish, pork, or chicken. It was very ordinary. Service was decent for a place like this. The only real redeeming quality was that the drinks were good!

Before I review this restaurant, let me first say I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay's. I've seen every Kitchen Nightmares and Hotel Hell episode. I've also eaten at Gordon Ramsay BurGR several times and at Gordon Ramsay Steak once.

Therefore I was excited as my brother and I went to Gordon Ramsay's pub and grill last month. We went for lunch at 2pm; we didn't have nor need a reservation, the hostess seated us immediately. Our waitress was very pleasant and friendly, she took our drink order right away and returned with our drinks promptly. We then ordered food, my brother got the burger and I ordered the chicken sandwich. 

The food came quickly (it was 2:30pm on Wednesday and not busy) but it wasn't very good. The fries were soggy and way over salted. My chicken sandwich was really greasy too. As I've stated before I've eaten at Gordon Ramsay's several times before, and this meal did not taste like Gordon Ramsay food, it tasted like Denny's. I'll definitely go back to Gordon Ramsay BurGR and Gordon Ramsay Steak, but not here.

First time here, and I was blown away. Happy hour M-F 2-5 in the bar only. My cousin and I ordered the frog in a hole (pigs in a blanket), nachos (short rib with an amazingly velvety cheddar cheese sauce, best nachos I have EVER had), and pretzels with that same cheese sauce (heaven). Ray Ray was the bartender. We chatted with him the duration of our meal. Very knowledgable and he made us want to come back for sure! Friendly staff and very interesting decor. I will most definitely be back!!! I will dream about those nachos...

Wife had the kettle chip nachos, WOW.  I had the braised beef short rib.  Both were very good.  Seating was quick, food was quick, service was very good.  Lots of other things I wish I had time to try on the menu.

Very Disappointing.  We are locals and spent $126 on bland tasteless food.  Don't order the short rib, the calamari or the Caesar salad.  Don't understand how a celebrity chef could dupe so many people.  Sadder because I was such a fan of his show.

So going into a restaurant with Gordon Ramswey's name on it, I wonder what he would do if this was a place on his famed Kitchen Nightmares. 

First off, let me say the food was good. the only problem I had with the food is that it's very overpriced. I should've gotten a much better meal for what I was shelling out. And the decor and service left something to be desired. I asked for my drink to be served with my meal, and my meal arrived ten minutes before my drink, and I couldn't catch anyone to help me out, to the point where I didn't bother asking for salt, because I didn't want to go through the hassle of trying to grab someone to bring me something that should've been on my table in the first place.

Which brings me to the table: I was seated in an oversized barstool, a ridiculous piece of furniture for even a pub/restaurant, making me wonder if Ramsey really did have anything whatsoever to do with setting up this restaurant.

If you're in Caesar's, don't bother with this place. Go to the Cheescake Factory instead. Better service and much more reasonably priced. And there's already salt on the table!

Ramsey, put this restaurant on your list for you own show!

First, we walked in and were seated fairly quickly. Our Waitress never came to our table so the waitress working the tables next to ours took our order. It still took at least 10 minutes to even be noticed. 
We ordered two orders of the sliders. One we ordered well done. The food took forever to come and when it did they didn't know whose was whose.
The food was mediocre to say the lease. I would not go back Ramsey should take a tip from Wolfgang because as a foodie I've never eaten a bad meal at any of Wolfgang's restaurant!

I've been a fan of Ramsay's UK restaurants for years, but many of his other ventures appear to be in name only. His BRGR at Planet Hollywood is overpriced burgers. This "authentic pub" (hardly) had good food, but not great, and certainly without the flair and twist of Mr. Ramsay's usual cuisine. The charcuterie was good and the burgers tasty, but nothing special. If you're going to eat here, try the scallops. That dish was truly sublime. Atmosphere-wise, the place is open to the highly trafficked casino near the entrance to the Forum Shops, so there's no feeling of being anywhere special either. Service was unattentive and spotty.

Honestly, if anything, Ramsay gets you over with the details and sauces, just like not so pretty woman hypnotizes you her outrageous accessories. Amazingly creative sauces, freshly baked bread, mouthwatering shrimp salad...  Who mixes beer, horseradish and mayo and sells it for $12? Only a genius!
He lures you in with the delicious teasers and then ...boom. Your trout is tasteless, fish and chips Denny's style, shepherd lacks zest... the beef cheek was really good and gentle but that is about it.
I was digging for water in the dessert, but honestly out of four dishes, three were not even worth it. My Armenian in-laws could not even finish their dishes nostalgically mentioning that there was much better food half of this price in Bellagio's buffet.
Of course, in another life I will totally come back and spend at least $500 on the rest of the menu just to check it out, in case of my punitive reincarnation into this very pretentious Saudi borehole owner.

My husband and I had a reservation for 7:30 through Open Table on a Friday night and were seated immediately. We both had a drink at $11 a piece for an Angry Orchard and some other craft beer. Ordered the Kettle Chip Nachos as an App and they were alright with cheese, shredded beef, sour cream, and some pickled sweet peppers on top. The chips were hot as if they came freshly fried and was pleasantly surprised. 

My dinner on the other hand was kind of a let down at $39.00. I ordered the Beer Braised Short Rib meal that came with mashed potatoes, grilled carrots, and a brown sauce. The beef was the same meat that came on the nachos and was completely tasteless and bland. It tasted like bland pot roast out of a crock pot. I couldn't pick up any beer accents and it definitely needed salt and some seasoning. 

My husband loved his meal as he got the special that night of Gordon's famous Beef Wellington for $55. He was extremely impressed and very satisfied with his dinner. My dinner made me sort of depressed instead.

Was a very disappointing dinner! First of all our server wasn't that great but what  made it a less than average dinner was the New York strip while it was cooked correctly it was way under seasoned and the potatoes where way overcooked. For those kind of prices and knowing that it is Gordon Ramsay I expect a lot more!

Food was outstanding! Service was great! The atmosphere is fun and inviting.  Food is a bit pricey but worth the price.  I was surprised about the 3 stars. My girlfriends and I ordered the NY strip steak and beef tenderloin (definitely worth the splurge) with sides of mashed potatoes (they were ok) and lobster Mac and cheese(super yummy).  The hostess came around to see how everything was.  The waiter was attentive and the manager Randall came around to introduce himself and to make us feel welcomed.  When he found out it was my birthday he offered dessert on the house. Definitely coming back when we are in Vegas again.
My first time eating here and it was amazing!!!! I ordered the Dublin corned beef sandwich and I was AMAZING!!!  Definitely a must when inside Caesars Palace. .

Was here in February. Interesting place. Staff was great. Beer list extensive and good. Food was good but I was put off by fish and chips at $28. Was not special but was good. Other pricing looked OK.
Would I return..probably.

The food was very disappointing.....i had the chicken sandwich with pesto and it was so so sweet and no other taste, couldn't feel the pesto, i was not salted or peppered either. The chips that came with were so hard i almost broke my teeth eating them. My boyfriend had the lamb burger, he said it was good but not the best he had....we shared some brussels sprouts which had a tone of oil on them....very greasy.
