And i ordered a  club soda and they changed me 5$....really....in most places they give it to you for free or charge you 1,2$. 
I wish I could do a big scene like Ramsey does on TV and spit the chicken all over the table and say" whats this shit!!!!!". I hope you read this!!!!!

Service was slow.   Food was bland.  Had the salmon and it was dry and bland.   The braised short ribs were also bland.  Needed salt and pepper at the table to fix and of course we didn't get any.  hugely disappointed
Chef Gordon Ramsey is amazing for this place. Everything is amazing with a great atmosphere

The decor for the restaurant is really nice. Really like the keg on the side. The place has scores of televisions. The restaurant is a but dark but nice. Mix match seating with living room chairs. Some of the seating sit low. We ordered the devil eggs for appetizer and fish and chips. The deviled eggs just was to much over the top for my liking. They had bacon and cheese in the filling. I do like the concept of putting the filling into your egg. The fish and chips, hubby like the chips as long as they were warm. I have mixed feeling about them. Love the ketchup!!!! The fish was really good along with the tartar sauce and mets vinegar. Oh the peas, ate all of those they were really good.
 
Service what service??? Yeah okay right maybe next time service will show up......

I was disappointed in this restaurant. I realize that it's pub food, but still. I think that, like everyone has said, Gordon Ramsay needs to come back and whip the ex Hell's Kitchen winner back into shape. 

We made a reservation for 1 pm and we wound up missing one of our people. We told our waiter that we were just going to order/eat without him, and it took so long for him to take our orders. 

My fiance liked the bangers and mash, the fish and chips were a little sour tasting (weird). If you go, you should order the duck poutine, that was the best thing!

I wanted to grab a bite to eat before my Rock 'n' Roll race, so my friend and I chose to go to the Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill in Caesar's Palace. 

A British upscale pub with fabulous décor and nice ambiance. The second I sat down, I sinkend into the comfy armchairs, and I started admiring the beer keglined the Pub's wall, and wondering what should I get for lunch.

I knew I was getting the sticky toffee pudding for dessert. Oh my goodness! I wish if I can have it as entree, if only my friend didn't ask me not to put on a show LOL. I'm telling you it is to die for and so addictive.

So for my entree, I got the classic steak & ale pie. When my pie arrived, it was small but after the first bite I realized how filling and flavorful my pie was. Very flaky and crispy perfectly golden brown crust made with  tender mouth-watering pieces of beer braised beef in delicious dark rich gravy. You cannot beat Ramsay!
Four Yelps!

So underwhelming. Completely mediocre. Service was good but it seems that Gordon needs to get some Hell's Kitchen action going to deliver a better tasting and more interesting menu. We had calamari starter, a lamb burger and a rueben sandwich. I can't recommend anyone go here.

SHUT IT DOWN!

I was incredibly disappointed when we went to grab dinner here last night. Chef Ramsey would have been so upset at the lack of customer respect. It was like they really didn't care. And I found this unacceptable. 

The hostess took us to our table which was a very cool table but it was not very comfortable for our group to have dinner at. It was so low, that there was no way we could even eat or cut our meat. If we were just drinking then we would have hung out here all night. I asked the hostess for a booth, which was right next to the original table. 

She told me that the 4 empty booths were reserved and we couldn't sit there. I asked the hostess how embarrassed would she be if we sat at the uncomfortable table and no one showed up for those 4 booths in the next hour.  She ignored me and didn't respond. 

She then told me that this was the only table we could have. The sad part is that 60% of the tables were empty and she refused to seat us anywhere else.  I told her I wanted to speak to the manager. She went back to the hostesses station told the other girl and the second hostess rolled her eyes. Honestly I'm the customer.  I don't need to see that. The hostess made a phone call to the manager, who never picked up his phone.  She then went in the back and when she came back she gave us one of the booths we had requested. Wow! What changed?

First, why did it take me 10 minutes to get a booth in a restaurant that was only 40% full. Secondly, I asked to speak to the manager and the manager never came out. Why? Completely unacceptable and disrespectful. Really where is the manager and why didn't he come over to talk to us. 

On a side note: At 10:22pm, we were seated and at 12:19am the booths were still empty.  In fact, nobody ever sat in any of those booths for almost 2 hours. It became apparent that the hostess completely lied to us by telling us they were reserved. Who is training the staff to act like this?

Plus we sat at our table with no service for about 10 minutes. I believe the hostesses probably thought it was funny to send no one over.  We all discussed leaving but decided to stay. 

At 11:52pm all of the lights went full blast, during our meal. It was so bright it hurt our eyes. I spoke to the guy cleaning the tables and he went to speak to the manager and the lights went back down after 5 minutes.  We were just trying to finish our dinner. He came back and said, "the manager had no idea who turned all the lights on!" I think the manager might need a visit from GR and he may have his lights turned on. The waitress told us the lights go full blast every night at that time. I think it must be on a timer, like last call for alcohol. But it should not blast all the lights in the dinning areas. It was not a fun feeling as we ate our dinners. 

My first drink didn't look like the picture in the iPad menu. And I was told by the waitress that the drinks never look like the photos in the iPad. Then why do we have photos of the drinks in the iPad? Again this is wrong and not right. GR would be screaming at someone. 

I went to order another drink at 12:00am but was informed that the bar was closed. I said really and why didn't someone tell us it was last call. There was no response. I told the waitress that I was just having a wheat beer and it shouldn't be a problem to pour a pint. All the bartenders were still there. She went to ask and came back with my pint but I noticed that the Orange slice was missing and about an inch of beer was also missing.  I asked where was the orange slice (this beer is suppose to come with it) and I was told that it was wrapped in Saran Wrap and put away. I asked her to grab me a slice and she said that it wouldn't be possible. Why is this dinner so painful?

I'm so mad that I haven't even got to reviewing the food yet.  The best thing we had here was the fingerling potatoes. It was a side dish but it was the star of the show. My buddy was not happy with his lamb. It was covered in a cheese and he felt it was over powering. I liked my PEI mussels and clams but didn't love them. They came with chorizo, carmelized fennel and lemon zest. I've had better mussel dishes elsewhere. I will say that the shellfish was fresh and only two clams had some sand in them. 

Would I come back here again? Probably never! So you're saying there's a chance? I would only probably ever eat here if Chef Ramsey was actually here running it. This place needs to be on one of those Restaurant Rescue Food shows and its only been open 4 months. I was also informed by the staff that GR had only been there 5 times in the last 4 months, since this location opened. If that is true then, he really needs to spend some time here fixing the many issues. I think the loser of Hell's Kitchen might be running this place?

I let my love of GR influence my choice to stay! Next time I will follow my brain and not my heart. We should have all walked.

I have had two dreams involving Gordon Ramsay's pork belly, and that was just in the last week since I have eaten here.

We went to the pub last week for a nice, relaxing dinner. The restaurant was packed for a good reason, so we weren't able to get a reservation until 10:30PM. The reason why I was willing to wait was because when I went to the hostess stand and asked if they had a gluten free menu, the hostess pulled it out and it was full of GF happines. A pub with a gluten free menu? I never thought this was possible! Oh, but it was, and oh was it amazing.

We ordered their house chardonnay in a carafe. Very reasonably priced and went perfectly with all three of our dishes. It was a strong chardonnay, and I didn't want to stop drinking it.

We started off with the cauliflower soup with curry oil. I am very sensitive about curry. Curry is powerful and if used incorrectly, it can devastate or illuminate a dish. Since we shared the soup they split it into two bowls, no extra fee. The first sip? MIND BLOWING. The soup wasn't soup; it was so light and airy that it was actually like a foam. The curry brought a subtle smokiness to the dish and with the little saltiness from the bacon and sweetness of the caramelized onion, this became one of our top 3 soups. EVER.

Then we ordered their salmon and pork belly as entrees, both which are naturally gluten free. The salmon skin was like a potato chip and the salmon was cooked to perfection. Not too raw in the center and perfectly soft and flaky all throughout. The cream sauce was subtle, not heavy and not overwhelming so that salmon was still the star of the dish. It went beautifully with the mushrooms and other garnishing vegetables. 

My husband got the pork belly, the star of the night. Neither of us have ever had pork belly before, and I am now spoiled on pork belly and have very little hope that any restaurant will beat Ramsay's because this pork belly, even with all the fat, melted in my mouth and did not make me ill with greasiness. It was pork butter, and I could have eaten the entire dish had my husband not devour it before me. This pork belly was perfectly cooked and the sauce underneath was not rich was I LOVED because there is only so much my palette I can take before going into to overload. There is too much for me to say about this pork belly, so to avoid the novel, just eat it. You cannot go wrong. Also, grab a side of chips with fried truffle. Best chips my husband has had in the U.S.

Service was phenomenal, manager stopped by to see how we liked dinner, the environment and rhythm of the restaurant was smooth, sexy and upbeat and there is truly nothing I did not like about our experience here. We will absolutely go back VERY, very soon.

Mmmm,...pork butter...

P.S. Throw down your Total Rewards card and save a few dollars!

So I was running around Caesars and I saw a huge line out front of this place so I decided to give it a try.  The line was really long and I was by myself so I decided to sit in the lounge.  Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves, so I figured I was in for a treat..  Well I couldn't have been more wrong.  I guess my server Brianna had a horrible New Years Eve because she was the worst server I've ever experienced in my life.  I asked a few questions about the menu and she didn't know the answers, as well as she seemed even more pissed that I was asking her questions.  I mean, shouldn't the server know the menu well enough to help me figure out what I'm going to like or not like?  Her attitude was similar to a person that just got hit by a bus and then ran over by a steam roller.  If you get this server, RUN away..  She made me so mad I just ended up leaving.  I have no idea why they have horrible people like this working and interacting with customers.  All she did was totally upset me and make it so I'll probably never come back.

Sooo, I was pretty excited about this place and total fail!!!  I paid 30 bucks for fish and chips that were very bland and not even worth 10 bucks.  I substituted the chips for a side salad and the salad was just dry lettuce with some carrots and snap peas. Not good, don't waste your money at the Pub.

I really wasn't too impressed. I didn't feel like the menu was very diverse, but even then - what we did order was just OK. I ordered the sliders with fries and the group I was with all tried other parts of the menu: salad, salmon, burger...

Would I give it another chance? Maybe if a friend really wanted to try it, or there wasn't much else open. A visiting friend asked if they should try it recently and I suggested other places with more flavor and a better menu.

Never eaten here till now, thought the mobile reservation system was awesome. Works great. Very nice ladies at the podium with a warm welcome.

But the food, I had fish and chips which were great, but my two buds that were with me didn't like their burgers one bit. In fact one didn't even finish his. That bad. 

Service was great, even had a few good drinks. It's a little over priced in my opinion. I'm wondering if Gordon is really involved with this restaurant based on the lack of quality. Seems he wouldn't tolerate this. Maybe we feel threw the cracks. Dunno just know we won't be back on this trip.

Always been a fan of Gordon Ramsey so was excited to visit his place at Caesar's.   Saturday night around 8 the wait was only 30 minutes but we ate at the bar which was perfect.

I'm not a Deviled Eggs type of person but my sister ordered those as an appetizer and I had one and couldn't believe how good they were.   They didn't taste like the kind you get at a picnic.   Very excellent.    Also the Salt and Pepper Calamari was really good.

I ordered the PEI Mussels & Clams with Chirozo and it was amazing.  The mussels & clams and chirozo tasted just like anywhere else but the broth it was in was delicious.  Sopping that up with the bread took the meal over the top.

Enjoyed the restaurant,  good, friendly service,  good food,  not a long wait for orders to arrive.   The food definitely tasted a step up from the average restaurant.

The food was quality, but overpriced... you are paying for the Gordon Ramsay name and the prime location right in the middle of Caesar's Palace (directly across from the Colosseum). $30 for fish and chips, ha! And as others have said, the service can be slow.

However, there were some positives. I made a reservation via Open Table directly from Yelp for 10 pm for after the Elton John show at the Colosseum. We arrived at 9:30 and were seated right away, even though there was currently an hour wait for the person in front of us. Definitely make a reservation if you plan on going.

As as others have said... OMG the sticky pudding! It is a must, one of the best desserts I have ever eaten. Definitely share with others to avoid sugar overload, just a few bites is enough lol.

If you want to experience a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, go to Burgr at Planet Hollywood. I haven't tried Steak at Paris yet, still trying to justify their prices for a single meal lol.

Extremely disappointing. I have wanted to go to this restaurant for 3 years. After finally being able to visit this establishment, I have never been so disappointed. The waiter was very disinterested. We had burgers, mine was lamb. The burger was way under cooked and the buns so small for the size of the burger it just fell apart. Impossible to eat. The fries were not fresh, and barely warm. We each had one drink and a burger and the bill was over $100. Totally outrageous. Never again.... Total waste of money!

None of us enjoyed our meals.  I got a BLT.  I didn't think it was possible to ruin a BLT. It was not edible.  I'm pretty sure if someone served that to Gordon he would spit it out.  The service was almost as bad.

Very matter of fact service, and pretty slow at that.  Bartender made the wrong drink, and they did not offer to replace it.  Drinks were strange tasting in general.  Ridiculously expensive, even for the strip.  Pot pie was just okay, but very small.  I ended up feeling sick for 4 hours  after eating this food. I would love to swear at Gordon Ramsey about his meal and restaurant, kind of like he loves to do to other people.

Chose this restaurant because Gordon Ramsey is so damn tough on his show looking for top quality tasty food, so of course I would expect a restaurant to bear his name to be awesome.  What a disappointment, hubs ordered a steak, very pricey, but very flavorless.  I ordered the tomato bisque, while it was tasty, it definitely wasn't worth over $13 for a bowl of soup. Waitress seemed uninterested in her job, only took our order, and gave us our bill.  She wasn't the one to bring our food, and never once checked on us during the meal to see how we were doing.  As my first trip here to vegas, I am going to say that all of these restaurants really are not great, but what do they care? 90% of their business is tourist! their money doesn't come from repeat business.
Food is ok. Service is lacking. Up to you if you go, but far better places to go for a far better meal for equal or more inexpensive prices.

Stopped in while visiting Caesars Palace with some friends. Ended up make a reservation online while shopping and walking around. The food and service were superb just like you would expect. Prices were surprisingly affordable even with a celebrity chef name attached. Would definitely be a go to spot when in Vegas if I don't care to get too adventurous.

I don't understand the hype to this place.. Food quality was below average but everything is ridiculously expensive.. I did not mind paying higher price for the food, but super disappointed with food quality.. Probably you can get a better quality food in any casino buffet. This is the place to go if you are full and just want to show off that you ate at Gordon Ramsey's!!

Chef Ramsay needs to be scolded as what he does on the TV show...
Worst food to eat...Good to Take a picture but definitely not to eat...
Yelp didn't allow me to choose 0 star..else I might have opted it..
My wife and I both had the bacon cheeseburgers.  They are as good as it gets!  Fresh delicious ingredients, and cooked to perfection.

Terrible representation of my chef hero, Gordon Ramsay. I was extremely looking forward to trying my first Ramsay restaurant and left disappointed. I've watched every season of MasterChef/MasterChef Junior and Hell's Kitchen, so I feel like Gordon has subconsciously trained me to know how a decent meal is cooked. Unfortunately, my 1st negative YELP review goes to the fish n chips entrée. I remember him on a MasterChef season yelling at a contestant for putting steamy, hot food over fries. Why? Because it makes a soggy mess on the bottom of the fish batter and soggy fries on top. Also, the batter was way too heavy that I scooped out the cod which ended up to be terribly seasoned and bland. Our waiter says that this entrée is the most requested..really?! I know he just opened up a fish n chips restaurant, and I hope it's a lot better than what I ordered. 

However, my mother ordered the Shepard's Pie which she thoroughly enjoyed. I did appreciate the kind hosts in the front and our waiter who was very friendly and engaging. 

Please make sure that soggy fish and chips doesn't get through the pass..you might disappoint more Ramsay fans other than me. Chef Kristin from Hell's Kitchen was my all time FAV, so it might have been just an off day. I'm just pretty bummed that I'm heading back to LA not raving about this place to my friends.

Great meal and great service!  My family wanted to eat at one or Gordon's restaurants.  We decided on this one.  The food was phenomenal! We had the nachos to start which have kettle chip and short ribs meat.  Delicious.  I had the Chicken and Kale Pot Pie, my wife had the Fish and Chips and my kids had the short ribs and a burger.  The short ribs were some of the best we've had.  Finished it off with the Sticky Pudding.   All of these dishes were great.  You won't be disappointed.

There was a huge line at Hash House A Go Go, so we wondered over and decided to try Ramsey's.  The fish and chips were a real let down, and my brothers pot pie was child sized. My uncle and dad weren't impressed either. We won't be back. Wolf Gang Pucks in the MGM is stellar (try there).

Wow, right off the bat, great looking bar. Waited for the cool sofa tables. Got great service, lets just leave it at that! Way to go, we'll be back when we're not so stuffed! Btw, great pub bloody mary!

OMG! Where to start!! I am a big fan of Gordon Ramsey and I was so excited to finally come here!We sat at patio for fast service! We had the best service from a big boobie server! Very sexy caliente!  We had the bomb ass nachos that were made with my favorite meat brisket and short ribs! Finger licking good!! We also had chicken wings with blue cheese! Better then BWW!!! Winner winner chicken dinner! This was all happy hour specials!! Last but not least we had The Goodbye Blue sky which had my big sister hasta las chanclas meaning tipsy lol. I in the other hand stayed with my blue moon! Had a great time the service was amazing cant wait to come back soon! Thanks to the server for making my cousins 21st birthday special by singing and giving us a sticky toffee pudding which was to die for!

Great experience, incredibly personable and attentive staff.  The food was very good.  Nacho appetizer was fantastic and addictive.  We enjoyed the burgers, corned beef sandwich and lobster Mac and cheese.  Drinks were unique and very tasty.  The atmosphere was fun and relaxing.  To cap off a very good experience, we received a thank you for dining with us email.  All in all, highly recommended.

We grabbed a last minute reservation at the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.  There weren't many places available on short notice, so this seemed like a good option.

I had pan seared salmon which had a nice sear and good flavor.  It wasn't bad, but nothing I would rush back for.  My three dining companions all ordered the beer braised short ribs.  Their feedback ranged from mediocre to 'awful'.  The risotto was consistently undercooked and the meet was quite fatty (even by short rib standards).  

Overall this restaurant might work in a pinch, but for the price (entrees ran around $30), there are numerous better options on the strip.

Wow!  I visited last week and was absolutely bowled over!  I wish I could afford to go here more often.

We started with delicious drinks--the Ramsay Tonic was the best gin and tonic I've ever had. How can a gin and tonic be better than another?! Next we had the calamari starter. Perfectly fried and seasoned, and the calamari were fresh and delicious. Coming from Boston, our seafood standards are high.  I had the fish and chips which were fantastic, My fiance had a ribeye steak which was cooked perfectly, and my niece had a steak and vegetable pie. The steak was reportedly not as good as home, but delicious. The steak and vegetable pie was reported to be tasty and flavorful. But oh my gosh, the sticky toffee pudding was a foodgasm!!!  

I don't know how others could have had a bad experience here in the same time frame I visited. We ended up going back the next day for cocktails and more calamari, and would have dined there, but couldn't afford it. 

The bartender confirmed that Chef Ramsay visits often and inspects to ensure the restaurant is up to his standards. It was fantastic!

Underwhelmed.  Gave four dishes a try and all of them were mediocre. I had high hopes for thier famous fish and chips, but to my disappontment, it was nothing special.  I've had better elsewhere at 1/3 the cost.  Food was bland, beer was warm and portions were small.  

I hate the feeling of spending good money and leaving the restaurnt hungry.  

One saving grace for this place was the excellent service of the staff.  Our server was fast, attentive and addressed everyone at our table by our first names.  Impressive. 

Too bad I can't say the same for their food.  As Golden Ramsay says... 'Shame'

I had the beef burger and it was delish. But at $18 (TR) it's pretty steep. 
I asked for med rare but it was more medium.
At medium it tasted pretty good.
My burger didnt have a bottom bun!
It was made with 2 top buns!! Yesss!! Everyone likes the top bun better. :)
Fries were horrible.

We were going to order the fish and chips but we saw the next table have it and it was pretty dinky for $30.
So we order a couple of app dishes instead since the only other seafood dish was Salmon.
We ordered the Calamari and the Clams.
The calamari which was delish!!
It was topped with some thinly sliced peppers that tasted pickled. Pretty good!! 
The clams were decent but be warned there are sausages in the dish!! For those who cant have meat.

I had a pint of sam adams which put me down $10. 
It was either that or a $4 coke...ugh haha

Also our server tried to pull a fast one and didnt give us the TR discount...I had a feeling he wasnt going to...so I told him to recheck it and he did and "fixed it".
Tsk tsk..I'm no stupid.

I wanted to love this restaurant as much as I do Gordon Ramsay, but alas, nope! The service was pretty pathetic and the food was just alright. Surprisingly, as a pea hater, the English pea cold side was good. The ale battered cod was good but not awesome, as expected. I prefer Cheesecake Factory if that tells you anything. The fries were gross.

Gordon might've put a bullet in his brain if he'd had the dining experience to which I'd been treated. The good:nut appetizer and deviled eggs. The mediocre: overdone salmon (c'mon, there's never an excuse for this and worse, no offer of a condition), steak that while cooked to the right temperature, was a little tough and overly doused in some kind of unknown sauce.  Wine glasses far too small for swirling and a server that didn't seem to know pouring etiquette.

A group of friends and I went out to eat here because it was right in our hotel. There was no wait and our waitress was nice and attentive. For a starter we split a bottle of wine and the meat and cheese plate. The various cheeses and meats were fresh. I ordered the beer braised short ribs, which was served over creamy barley risotto surrounded with pearl onions and root vegetables. The short ribs were cooked to perfection and was nicely complimented with the other parts of the dish. I tried one of the diver scallops off of my friends plate and it was also cooked to perfection. I also got to try a piece of lamb from the shepherd's pie and it was delicious. 
   My only complaint of this restaurant is that I left hungry. Normally, I take food home because I cannot eat all of it or I eat just enough to be almost full, however, not the case here as after eating at Gordon Ramsay's the group headed out to Serendipity 3 for ice cream as we still had plenty of room in our bellies.

Food is good but not great for the price. Excellent ambience and service.  the fish and chips were overpriced and tasted only so-so.  waitress said they were top seller and I guess it because people think it would be like eating in England, but not even close to the real thing!

Horrible service. The scallops were great along with the pear cider. He handed the check to my husband as he took our dinner plates. He didn't ask if we wanted coffee or dessert and didn't give us a chance to ask for it. Felt kicked out and would discurage anyone from going.

We had dinner here on 10/08/16 prior to seeing a show. Service from Scott was very good.  However, the meal rates only two stars.  We first ordered the crispy Calamari. It was quickly served but was greasy.  See posted photos. Edible?  Sure.  Best we've had?  No way. Cost: $18.  Next we ordered something different in theme with and saluting British food.  Bangers and Mash.  This meal consists of three different sausages plated within a double scoop of mashed potatoes. The potatoes were good. The sausages were essentially flavorless and they were a bit undercooked and tough.  We both agreed we would not order this again.  Cost: $25.  We could prepare the same meal at home for $4, and it would be a lot better.  My wife is a 5 star chef, so we routinely taste and rate meals which can be a challenge to prepare correctly. Yes, this is Vegas, but we are expecting superior quality food and great flavors, which are prepared correctly.  Here we didn't get it.

We had a very good experience, booked a reservation through our hotel for lunch last Sunday, good time to go.  Our server was excellent, the food was very good.  I had the seared scallops, delicious.  The pricing was extremely high, even for Vegas standards.  $16 for a cocktail (London calling)? I mean, it was good and all.  My family enjoyed their food and beverages.  I would say thumbs up overall-splurge a little!
Absolutely incredible lamb burguer!! Totally recommended for any burguer fun. A must go place to have some food in Las Vegas. Rodney, my server was fabulous!!

Ótimo atendimento !!!! Ambiente maravilhoso !!! Sanduíche espetacular é enorme !!!!fuca localizado dentro
Do hotel ceasars las vegas

Only went here for drinks and dessert...definitely get the toffee pudding!!!! It is really rich and sweet so be prepared..it's life changing...haha! Oh! Use your total rewards card to get a dollar off.

I had a really nice dinner here.  Everything was pretty good.  Not great, but just good..  I had the pretzel appetizer, followed by the pork belly entrée and the spotted dog dessert.  I did expect a lot more from a celebrity chef's pub and expected to pay more because of it, but I felt the reputation outweighed the food.
This place was amazing. I had Bangers &  mash. DH had steak pie.  Service was great. Absolutely want to return.

Ordered the fish and chips since there is a British theme to the place.  Likely one of the worst renditions of fish and chips I've eaten.  Both the fish and the chips were very soggy and had no flavor.  I peeled the breading off the fish and it was amazing how small the actual fish filet was.  I think Gordon needs to increase his food cost % and the quality.  Not worth the high prices they charge.

Nice atmosphere. Service was spot on. The server had good knowledge of the menu.  The food was delicious as is expected in a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Location was easy to find in Caesars palace.   Would eat there again.

Went here in March 2013 celebrating my husbands 30th. 
Food was decent however I had a tray of about 8 glasses of beer spilled on me, in my shoes, down my shirt, in my bag and wallet and neither the restaurant or hotel would assume responsibility for the accident. At the time, the waiter and manager apologized profusely but later lied and twisted the story to Caesars liability department, blaming me for knocking over the drink tray by reaching for the bill (the bill was set on the table by the waiter who leaned over me, tipping the tray of drinks and broken glass all over me while I was seated).
It's a casino restaurant, so no doubt there were cameras that caught the incident.
They refunded the meal but wouldn't pay for the laundry bill ($70 through the hotel!!). 
Really don't think it was a lot to ask. It goes without saying that the whole dining experience was spoiled. I walked back to my hotel (Aria) soaked and smelling like a drunk at 1:00 in the afternoon.
I ended up paying for the laundry bill myself so my hotel room and suitcase wouldn't stink like beer! 
To this day, I'm still super annoyed that the waiter would lie as he did and that the restaurant manager would allow it. When I returned home, I continued to discuss reimbursement with Caesars regarding the laundry bill which was eventually denied. Awful business practice.
Definitely will not be visiting the restaurant on our trip to Vegas this year even though our friends had thought about it. After telling them this story, they were as PO'd as I was.

I went with my family when we stayed at Caesar's and it was the worst meal of the trip. The service was sub-par, but the food was worse. I wish he had stuck to true pub food because he missed the mark on being something more. When you order pub fries, you expect fries. Instead we got potato blocks. The steak was just ok and that should be fairly easy to get right.

It's ironic that he has a tv show about bad restaurants, because his is not what I would call good. Even if the meal hadn't cost $500, it still wouldn't have been good. 

Don't waste your time, your money, or your calories.

Went here last and have to say it was below expectations I think Gordon Ramsey would have. They sat us we ordered an appetizer they brought it out and started giving it to the table next to us. Then we ordered food and again the guy tried to give it to another table. Fish and chips were 30.00.. There was nothing special about it. Won't be back

I visited this place during the Mayweather vs. Pacquiao fight.  It was super duper busy but despite that the servers did a great job handling business.  Whenever I wanted another cocktail they were right there for me.   The food was awesome especially the FISH AND CHIPS.  If you are ever in town and you like fish and chips I would highly recommend this place.  I normally would not go to a place like this but thought I would give it a chance.   You never know till you try!!!  Good job guys.  I will be back again this month.

Seriously overpriced. I had the veal chop which was good, but Capitol Grille charges less. My dinner partner had the Shepard's pie which had a muttony taste. I didn't care for it.

Our waiter was a bit of a retard. First he forgot to bring a Pepsi which we needed to fix the horrendous Long Island iced tea we made the mistake of ordering. Then he told us the fountain drinks were completely out. 

He spent more time gossiping in the back of the store, and not enough time watching the levels.

Really can't recommend this place.

Items Selected:

Warm Salty Pretzels with Cheese Sauce - Bacon and Parmesan, Green Garlic, and Plain
Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips - Cod with Tartar and Lemon
Red Wine Braised Short Rib - Horseradish Mashed Potatoes with Onions, Carrots, Parsnips, Red Wine Jus
Trio of Pies - Chicken Pot Pie with Bechamel, Vegetables, Bacon / Steak & Ale Pie with Root Vegetables and Mushrooms / Shepherd's Pie with Root Vegetables and Cheddar Mash Potatoes
Sauteed Forest Mushrooms - Poached Farm Egg
Spotted DIC - Steamed Bread Pudding with Raisins and Cream Sauce
Sticky Toffee Pudding - Sweet Cream Ice Cream

Having come away from a late-2013 visit to Chef Gordon Ramsay's Steakhouse at The Paris quite impressed by both the quality and the brand I knew a visit to casual sibling "Pub & Grill" was only a matter of time - friends and fans of chef's shows and celebrity frequent to visit Sin City.  Housed in Caesars in a sizable space renovated from Bradley Ogden featuring plenty of wood, kegs, television, and Brit-kitsch it was just after noon when I sat down with two old friends and greeted by friendly, though pushy, service orders were expedited to the tune of an appetizer, a side, three mains, and two desserts - high prices and small portions tempered by a Total Rewards card...at least slightly.  Focusing mostly on signatures and favorites present since the menu's inception dining began with three small but lovely seasoned pretzels paired with cheese and mustard for $8 and progressing to plates proper another trio arrived in the $21 trio of small ramekin-pies, all well prepared but only the lamb loaded Shepherd living up to the high standards set by the exemplary golden cod selected by my friend, soggy 'chips' notwithstanding.  Ignoring the shortrib and what I'm told were vastly overseasoned potatoes while wishing some form of seasoning had graced the flavorless mushrooms it was with sweet redemption that desserts both shined, the rustic Sticky Toffee Pudding every bit as good as the fancy version at Steak and the "DIC" a bowl of buttery custard hefty with raisins and aromatics that I'd gladly return for along with a cup of coffee - breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
Charlie gave us great service and great recommendations! First time here and we love it! Had the hellfire wings & a nice cold weihenstephaner beer. Wonderful! This place does Gordon Ramsay proud!

$55 without tip for a side of truffle fries, a side of Brussels sprouts, and two 4oz screwdrivers... We don't mind paying for good appetizers but of all the delicious ways to cook Brussels sprouts and pork belly, this restaurant chose a method that makes them taste like canned frozen goo-sprouts. Overpriced, unoriginal, disappointing... We walked 100 feet away after to smash burger and got double the amount of fries ( Rosemary Garlic) for $3.50... Stay away unless you want to waste money.

I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay but I do have to say the food was "OK."  What impressed me was much more than the food...the decor, the drink menu, the waiter/waitresses outfits.  

The service was extremely slow however we did not have to wait for a table on a Saturday during lunch time in February.  (I think the waiter had tables scattered all over the place and not in one vicinity).  The food was a little pricey but I loved the display of the food, originality, and atmosphere.  From my experience, almost everything in Vegas is pricey (even more than NYC) unless you grab a burger from McDonalds.   

The drink and dessert menu was on an Ipad and gave you descriptions of the drink cocktails.  I got a drink that I can't remember the name but it had Guinness Cream, Boddingtons Ale, Jack Daniels Honey and something else...but all I know it was fantastic and I never drink Jack Daniels anything!  The cocktails were $15 each.  My bf got corned beef in a bread bowl that actually looked good (I never eat corn beef). I got the hamburger which was $19, with bacon would have been $23. All the french fries are 4 huge pieces of potato with a garlic seasoning that come with the meals.  

I was told Ramsay had checked in the day before with the restaurant and I saw the head chef walking around.  PLENTY of seats, right in the middle of Caesar's.  It's definitely worth checking out and having a more casual meal than a fancy one in LV.

P.S. Huge Beer Menu as well!

The food is really good and the staff are pretty chill. There is a large selection of food and beer. The bartender helped explain some beers so they seem pretty knowledgeable. The decor is pretty cool and the seating arrangements are pretty nice. The take on pub food adds a new experience to this type of food. My favorite is the fish and chips, but the sticky toffee pudding was really really good. As expected, this place is expensive so be prepared to shell out some money. All around a good experience, and I would come back.
Came here with my entire family for my 50th. Rodney served us and I'm telling ya, what an amazing experience.  Food was insane and the nachos...  OMG.  Thanks Rodney.

Dry mini burgers, dry and tasteless fish and chips. Stinky bar. Eff this place. Hey Gordon Ramsay I want to yell at you like you yell at all the chefs on that one show. Your pub sucks. You are a fraud.At least the bartenders were good.

Really? This restaurant bears the name of Gordon Ramsey? Actually, more closely resembles Amy's Baking Kitchen. How can he have any credibility judging and criticizing the food of others when his establishment serves such horrible food?

Now I wanna say that the service was excellent and the staff very warm. Drinks were large as they should be for the price. Apps were okay. Onion soup was awesome and vegetable salad solid. But the entrees were absolutely horrible. I had the pork belly and could only get through a  bite. It was too fatty and oily, without flavor! 

I'm shocked that for the money and considering all the great good alternatives, how can this place stay in business? Should have just gone to Nobu and spent $50 more!
AMAZINGLY good!  Service was excellent.  Atmosphere was very relaxing and staff was very knowledgeable.  Look forward to going back again.

Like some of the other reviewers I agree with the three stars!  My husband and I ate there the other day and absolutely loved everything we ordered!  This is a place that is fun, great atmosphere, great authentic British food, and top notched staff!  Five star for both of us!!

After a series of meals designed to appeal to the lowest common denominator palette, I was glad to have some flavor-packed comfort food.

At the Pub, we were greeted with warm, soft pretzels acompanied by whipped butter and cheddar spreads. Beef cheeks were tender and tasty. I normally dislike cooked carrots, but these were prepared well and maintained their snappiness. Shepherd's pie was the standout with shredded, braised lamb rather than the usual ground preparation. 

After watching Gordon's "Nightmare" shows, it was good to hear he practices what he preaches - each staff member has tasted the dishes they serve, and could describe them well. Our server was also knowledgeable about the Belgian and UK beers. 

I was even glad to hear disagreement on favorites - it was good confirmation they were sharing their opinion rather than promoting a certain "chef signature item." To this end, we decided to complete our meal with a blueberry cobbler topped with peanut butter crumble and peanut butter creme fraiche instead of the more traditional sticky toffee pudding. 
We'll be back.

Disappointed!!  35 minute wait, which was what was quoted.  Uncomfortable seating everywhere.  Service was about as bad as it gets.  Looks like Ramsey allowed some kids take over the place.  From sit down time to food delivery was 50 minutes.  That was for a party of 2 on a Monday night @ 9pm.  Requested steak medium well...but it was bleeding upon arrival!  The food tasted good, but just not impressed.  Total bill about $100.  Never again...never.
It's okay. The pub fare is good the restaurant clean and the service good. Just a little pricing for what you get, I suppose we're paying for the name.

Stopped in after refusing to wait for Caesar's buffet. We were able to get seated immediately since there were plenty of open tables. I asked our server for some suggestions for dinner. She suggested Fish & Chips as well as Short Ribs. Each dinner was over $ 30 which I don't mind as long as the quality, taste & portion match the price. After waiting an unusually long time for our dinner, we received small portions of fish & short ribs. The majority of my tasteless short ribs was a huge helping of barley, also tasteless. The fish was prepared well & tasted good, however, the portion did not reflect the price. The chips were unremarkable French fries. Drinks are overpriced also since they are served in small glasses. Worst part was the service. No excuse for the lack of attention since there were many open tables, we did notice the staff enjoyed congregating & enjoying one another's company much to the customers detriment. I will not be returning.
Excellent service, quality, and style go into this place. Really enjoyed my experience.

Came here right before Mariah Carey's July 15th Concert, it's right across the casino!

Me and my friend made reservations MONTHS ago as we watch Hell's Kitchen faithfully, so as soon as we knew we were going to Vegas from Chicago, we knew we had to try out this place with hopes of meeting Executive Chef: Scott Commings, winner of Hell's Kitchen.

Our server Kimberly knew we were extremely excited and she was very knowledgeable of everything on the menu (even though we knew exactly what he wanted because we looked at the menu so many times before going). She was extremely nice and had ties to Chicago. She was the one of the few people in the entire city of Las Vegas who did not have an attitude! lol, but she was spectacular to have around. Also, two members management were extremely attentive throughout dinner service, did not get their names but they were in suits so I can assume it could've been the GM and Assistant GM. 

Sidenote: *We were in a rush because we did not want to be late for the concert, we did not tell our server this because we also did not want to rush the experience of being at Gordon Ramsay's restaurant. We ordered truffle fries as our appetizer and the 14 oz. Ribeye and the Salmon entree. The food arrived to our surprise so quickly! First the fries, then the entrees, at our table no less than 15-20 minutes cooked to PERFECTION! We both shared everything and was quite full!

Truffle Fries: truffle fries are huge in Chicago and we already knew that we loved them so we definitely wanted to give it a try, the fries were perfectly crispy and the truffle aioli was perfect! I don't usually care for the truffle aioli but this one was delicious!

14 oz Ribeye: Cooked to absolute perfection, our mouths melted, not the steak, our mouths did. That's how delicious this steak was. I've been to plenty of steakhouses before, but when I say that the quality of this beef gave it a flavor like no other paired with perfect seasoning, and seared to perfection. I wanted to cry, that's how good the steak was.

Salmon: With salmon, the trick is getting a crispy skin, a lot of times you get salmon from a restaurant that comes with an unnecessary slimy texture. Not here! I feel like I am repeating myself by saying everything was perfect, but it's been a week since I was here and I have not forgotten about it at all.

I had to tell the manager how amazing the entire experience was and he served us a English Toffee desert that was poured table side and was scrumptious!!!!! 

Chef Ramsay, OPEN A RESTAURANT IN CHICAGO! I BEG OF YOU! I personally thank you for this establishment and I 100000% recommend it to anyone traveling to Vegas and to anyone who is a fan of Chef Ramsay's monopoly of cooking shows. This was definitely one of the highlights out of Vegas' amazing options and I will never forgot coming here! I couldn't have had a better eating experience!

We even got to meet Scott and take a picture with him!!!

- Devin Torkelsen of DevinTorkelsen.com

It was good, really it was.  

I had the lamb burger which really was good.  The beers we're good, super overpriced, but good enough.  I think I was expecting a bigger selection....if it hit 15 draught selections I would be surprised.   I was expecting a lot more especially with all of the kegs being used for decor.  Nothing particularly earth shattering, again five uk beers would be pushing it here.

Other people had the fish and chips, sheapards pie etc.  everyone thought it was good.  But for these prices you would expect exceptional.  It's Caesars....otherwise no one would even consider this place.  Be prepared and accepting of that and you'll be alright.  

Outside of the strip it wouldn't get a second look, here it's pretty legit....weird huh?

Second visit here won me over... This place has some good pub fare. 

The first time I came was several years ago when they first opened... I thought the food and service really sucked and I wrote the place off.  Recently I had some friends in town and they wanted to try this place so I reluctantly agreed... So glad I did!

This is English Pub food done well... Nothing particularly adventurous, just very solid fare. The ambience is also a Vegas take on an English Pub... dark and casual... Very simple introverted space... Not much scenery or over the top design. 

Had the Kettle chip nachos and Hell's Kitchen burger... All were awesome.  Burger could have used more heat as it's billed as spicy, but the flavors and proportions were great. 

Sticky toffee pudding was phenomenal... It's the same signature dessert served at Gordon Ramsay Steak and a must try!

The staff is extremely attentive, the food of the highest quality, and the price quite affordable for what else we found on the Strip. For this place to sit at a 3 star rating is criminal. From the fulfilling entrees to the delicious desserts, it is one of my best wins in Vegas, and wish it could be a home town favorite. 

Recommendations include the Steak and Ale Pie, Lamb Burger, and Sticky Toffee Pudding.

As a huge fan of Kitchen Nightmares, we were really excited to try Mr Ramsay's Pub in Ceasar's. So in his honor I am going to give a brutally honest review. There was definitely some excellence, the fish in the fish and chips were amazing, not sure any fried cod is worth $30, but that's just me. The "chips" were meh, slightly soggy potato wedges. The Hellfire Lollipop wings were tasty but a little tough skinned, overcooked. Our appetizer fries were tasty. My husband, a huge fan of Gordon, was hoping to have his mind blown by the shepherds pie. He said it was solid, rich, good, not quite amazing. My daughter ordered the Ceasar salad, it was barely mediocre. Something about capers sitting on a romaine leaf is just kind of weird and looked a little like mouse poo. For dessert we shared the Sticky Toffee Pudding and is was absolutely perfect. Probably one of the best desserts I have ever had. Our service was also great, attentive and friendly. Not sure if we will go again, but if we do I would order the overpriced cod again and definitely the same dessert!

Lot's to say about this place...

First, the decor with all the kegs would lead you to believe that this place is a good place for beer. It is not. There's a fairly limited selection, and they are not exactly impressive beers to choose from.

We were seated at a table that I'm not sure was originally intended for dining. It was low to the ground with sofas on either side. It was incredibly uncomfortable to sit at and I had to adjust numerous times so that my legs would wake back up.

My burger wasn't bad, but had too much of a taste to it that I can't place. Maybe garlic? It kind of ruined it for me. I wished later I would have tried something else. The fries weren't exactly the greatest, either.

I'd give the restaurant three stars, but two things picked it back up for me.

First, the sticky toffee pudding was very good. I had not had it before, so I can't really give a comparison to any other sticky toffee puddings, but it was so good I was sad when it was gone.

Second, the service was very good. We didn't even know our dinner was delayed, and we got apologies from the waitress, the manager, and the person who brought out our food. Seems that there was an issue with getting it out from a ticket being closed when it shouldn't have, so they redid the entire meal. Our dessert was free as well, which was a nice touch. It was nice to see that the customer service that Gordon is always preaching on Kitchen Nightmares held true for his restaurant.

Holy cow what a total disappointment. I'm fairly certain the potatoes are instant, which I have seen this guy blow a gasket over. My risotto was way undercooked and we waited an hour for this disaster. Somebody call Kitchen Nightmares! Oh wait....

Had an amazing meal. Adam Rogers was our server and he made the night memorable for my family.  Superior service, delicious food and met executive chef Scott!  an expensive restaurant, but woth every penny.  

Absolute must haves are the fillet and the sticky toffee!
Nice place. Good atmosphere with excellent food.very tasty . Best fish and chips I ever had. Woa a British guy who knows how to cook.

OVERPRICED! Awful service and the food was so-so at best, in fact my daughter got sick on the ride back to the hotel from the Sheppard's pie. I ordered the BLT because I heard it was the only thing on the menu that was good. to be fair it was, but not good enough to justify the price. Gordon Ramsay should yell at himself for how bad this place is.

Loved it. The pub chips with onion dip was fantastic as was the cheese dip with pretzel bread. My wife and I split the fish and chips and it was still more food than we could finish. Oh and the fish was battered crispy and melt in your mouth inside. Our server, Ali, was pleasant and knowledgable. He checked often and the service was fantastic all around.

I'm sooooooo sorry to say but this place was a BIG disappointment. My family and I were so excited to eat here but it was all a big hype. The food was cold, service was terrible and the prices were high for the type and quality and food. Will never eat here agin.

We had the restaurant week lunch with the braised short rib.  The French onion soup was pretty good, but the risotto was extremely undercooked.  It was so chewy that we couldn't eat it.  The undercooked onions also were not peeled.  There was a layer of skin that we had to spit out.  The short rib was larger than I expected and very tender, but also very bland.  The best thing on the plate was the carrots because I actually like raw carrots.

This place is a shame to any chef's name.

3.5/5 on the speed and quality of the server. He saw two young adults sitting down and thought "oh they won't tip me anything since we're in happy hour." He rather hang out with the older couple with kids, fine better for us. We had the mini corn dogs, wings, and chips with pulled pork. Cocktails were really well made and savory. Would definitely come again. Make sure to go during happy hour otherwise it could rack up !

First time here. The food was amazing, especially the Lobster Mac&Cheese. Our server named Rodney was excellent. He was very friendly and helpful. 5 star service at its best. We'll definitely be back!

Food is tasty, but very small portion for the price. Entrees are appetizer sized. My husband and I each ordered a chicken, kale and bacon pot pie, but there was no kale or bacon in either pot pie. Our server was very rude, as well. He was rude when I had a question about the menu and actually mocked me when I asked for a spoon. If entrees were bigger and servers were more friendly, this place would have been given 4 stars.

Meh. The food was good enough but the service and drinks were lousy. We asked twice for our bill and still had to wait more than 2min for it to arrive. The best was busy, but not enough to justify the service, especially not for how much it costs.

Came here for lunch. No house bread during lunch but prices are the same as dinner.

Had the shepherds pie and fish and chips. The shepherds pie is like a beef stew under a bed of mashed potatoes. It tasted exactly how it sounds. I was underwhelmed.

Fish and chips were good but not the best I've had. The fish was light and crispy. The fries were plain and boring.

The sticky toffee pudding was good but the one at Gordon Ramsay Steak is way better. Even our server said so.

After a mind blowing meal from Gordon Ramsay Steak, this place really underwhelmed. Nothing tasted bad but everything was just average.

Make sure you have a Total Rewards card for better prices on most dishes.

I don't get the negative reviews at all. The service was great, my cocktail was amazing, and the food was delicious. Had the pork belly and it was spot on. Had to also get the English chips, seriously no complaints. We had a great experience.

I will review this place in the order in which we experienced it:

First we arrived at the establishment to be greeted by the unfriendly hostess who had a nasty little attitude. She asked us what our last name was, in which my fiance replied: "I will just tell you my first name, because my last name is very long, and hard to pronounce." So he told her his first name, and she preceded to still ask for his last name. My fiance repeated his reason for not giving it to her, to which she replied with a roll of the eyes and a "Well, it's a 45 minute wait." I think she misunderstood the favor that we were doing her by not having to go through the trouble of spelling, and pronouncing our last name; which she would have butchered if left to her. 

After that, we went to the bar. I am not a fan at sitting at the bar, but the bartenders were very animated and friendly. They served us our drinks and food quickly. The bartenders were also very helpful on helping us make selections. We ordered (I don't remember the exact names) the pub sliders, pretzel sticks, and the fish and chips. Me and my fiance share food a lot, and it is a wise idea to do that here,because the portions are large. 

I thought that the food was presented beautifully, and that it tasted good. The pub sliders were juicy and came with a side of garlic mayo, loved it. The pretzel sticks came with a side of spicy mustard (VERY SPICY AND AWESOME), and the fish and chips were tasty and not too greasy. 

While we were eating at the bar and enjoying ourselves, we noticed the beauty queen hostesses up front flipping their hair and snapping their gum. We also noticed a ton of empty tables in the establishment. Clearly, doing their job is so exasperating for them. Gosh, they should take a break. 

I would come here again, and I would recommend it to a friend. I took off a star because of the rude introduction we got from the hostesses. Ramsay above all people should know that first impressions mean a lot, and that those ladies up front gave us, and from what I'm reading most people, a bad taste in their mouth.

Had a great night!  Took my daughter out for a daddy daughter date and had a great time!

Shepherds pie and fish and chip.  Thank you Travis for fantastic service!

Worst service in Vegas in my entire life! And, I am a veteran Vegas connoisseur of restaurants so I know what I am taking about 
To begin with the hostess forgot about us and we had to wait longer than usual as she took other parties ahead of us as she lost our name and reservation 
Food was fantastic but the waiter was terrible. He (Travis) had a attitude and totally ignored is from the moment we sat down till we paid the bill. 
Travis didn't ask us if we wanted drinks, I had to order a drink for my gf from the bar. After our food arrived we were not asked if everything was ok. The guests next to us were asked if they're food was ok immediately a after their food arrived. We needed salt and pepper as well as more catchup. We were asked about our food when we were practically done with our entries, too late. 
Not a pleasant experience. Travis treated us like crap as he hovered over s group of girls dining next to us. 
I loved the food, bad service though.

Easily the best meal of our recent Vegas trip- and we dined at several other places that were much more expensive. 

Stumbled on Gordon Ramsays location here at Cesears one hungry afternoon. Seated right away and ordered two beers. Drinks served promptly by our server who was very professional the entire way through our meal. 

We shared the sliders, mac and cheese and mixed veges (brussel sprouts and carrots). Sliders were great- cooked medium with cheese and bacon. Very tasty. Mac and cheese was excellent with several cheeses and duck fat croutons. The veges, believe it or not were outstanding. Mini brussels and carrots sautéed and seasoned perfectly. 

Service was quick and professional. Prices were high but on par with what you got and Vegas in general. No complaints here! Will definitely return.

Wow. I hope whoever wins Hell's Kitchen hasn't taken over as executive chef of this place yet because that would mean that Ramsay made a bad choice. If what we experienced happened during dinner service on that show, someone would have been kicked out of the kitchen. 

My boyfriend tried to order a beer, but we were told they were out of it and the server couldn't really recommend a comparable choice. So he gave us what felt like 15 minutes to choose another beer and then came back for our order. 

I ordered the chopped salad, Leo got the Shepard's pie and we share the pub chips. Everything was just OK. The chopped salad mentioned wood-grilled chicken, but what I got resembled shredded rotisserie chicken - pretty bland. And then midway through our meal, we got bread service - which made absolutely no sense. 

Leo ordered another beer and after our meal, we asked for the dessert menu. And watched our server schmooze with a larger party for 10 minutes before we could flag him down and ask again. Once we got the menu and picked out a dessert (Sticky Toffee Pudding, which was actually very good), we had to wait until another server tapped ours on the back to let him know we were waiting. 

By the time we finished everything, nearly two hours had passed and the place was pretty much dead. It may have just been because we had a poor server that night, but we would never go back to this place.

This is a great place for friends and family! I wish I could afford to come here more often! Great stuff and food!
If you're there, pay attention, Gordon might be in the room and you might miss him!

What's the only thing I like more than Gordon Ramsay? Gordon Ramsay AND Fish & Chips!

This was disappointing. I'm a fan of some of his other restaurants and a huge fan of his shows. I have had waaaaay better fish & chips anywhere (and almost everywhere else). The fried calamari appetizer was okay - a little fishy smelling and the breading was falling off the calamari. The fish and chips were VERY overcooked and tough... they didn't taste that good either. I had to smother everything I ordered in the tartar sauce and malt vinegar. Even the fries were overcooked and tough.

Server was nice but inattentive. Won't be back and I wouldn't recommend you try this.
Great food and service for a awesome price on prime real estate.  My new go to in Vegas.  Curry was awesome!  Cocktails were well thought out!

I wanted to eat here for some time...but omg that a bad experience.
The food was cold, and the service was bad.
The NY steak was just cook bad without salt and my wife's fish was cold...never coming back
Horrible service,  bar backs serve drinks while others sit and shoot the breeze.  Weird atmosphere...staff that could care less...I guess just like its name sake.

Was deciding between this place and Bobby Flay's MESA, but decided to come here cause Bobby's menu didn't look very appetizing- probably tiny portions of mexican food, anyways...

So first off there wasn't any room to seat us, apparently most people make a reservation, but it was nice that the girl said she would text us so we could go play the slots while we wait, and I did get a text about 10 minutes later.

We ordered the lobster roll appetizer, it came as one thing, and we asked the waiter to split it and he didn't cut if very well, so it was really hard to share. None of the appetizers looked good for sharing, except the calamari, but i've had enough calamari this year.

So I ordered the lamb burger, kind of a long wait to get the food. We took pictures with the British background while we waited and posted on facebook. It was nice for social media purposes, I guess. We had the bad luck of ending up with a wobbly table and it ended up shaking and spilling water everywhere and the cloth napkins were water-resistant so it was hard to clean up. 

The burger itself was pretty good, although it was strange that I couldn't tell if it was beef or lamb- i'm not sure if that's a good or bad thing. The cheese on the burger was good and the fries were good. My boyfriend got the salmon, which was good as well.

Overall, the food is good, but the restaurant itself has some issues with tables and service.

With all of the restaurants on the strip it was unbelievably hard to choose one so we found a local and asked for their opinion. This restaurant was their number one pick and boy were they right. We had an incredible experience and the food was amazing! Can't wait to have the nachos again!!

Came into eat earlier tonight with my wife for her birthday and it was such a huge disappointment. We had such high expectations for a place like this and it was horrible. I come from restaurant business of 6 years and my wife was pointing out more things than i was.

First off took us about 10 mins + to wait for our server because he had a problem with another guest.

Second took about 10 mins for our drinks to arrive.

Third the environment and people who worked here looked so lost.

Fourth I'm almost 100% sure i was served ketchup with my calamari. Now this could of been a runner mistake but i doubt it. 
So all i had to eat was some fries.

Fifth after eating our food we wait 10+ mins for the bill

Last but not least i told the hostess to note a birthday for my wife and nothing was done.

I should of just gone to Applebee's or Chili's and spent the same amount of money for more food and more drinks and PROBABLY better service.

The food was delicious, we sat at the bar and ate because there was a 1.5 hour wait. The bartender Shaun was less than desirable. He was not very friendly and he played on his cellphone. The funny thing was that Gordon Ramsey was in Caesars doing an appearance, would have thought employees would be on their toes

The Good:

- Tenderloin was excellent.
- Sticky toffee pudding was great.

The bad:

- Bangers and Mash. Sausages were bland, rubbery, and the ends were too close together. Stingy portion of barely-warm mash. This is such a simple pub dish, it is a shame it is not done well. Lincolnshire sausages with hearty mash would be so much better. 
- No custard option on the sticky toffee pudding. Although good with the ice cream it just feels like the lazy option. Not very authentic for a pub. 

The ugly:

- Poor selection of draft beers, especially from the UK and Vegas area microbrews. Mostly standard beers you can get at many bars. The exception is Fullers, and to a lesser extent Boddingtons. 
- Everything is seriously overpriced, even for Vegas. Add 50% to what you think is reasonable, and you'll be in the ballpark of what you are going to pay. 
- The prices may be justified with fine dining food or service, but you don't get either. You get adequate food and service. 

3-3.5 stars seems about right.

Brianna saved your reputation.   Not only is she a phenomenal server, knowledgeable about beers, cocktails, food, she accepted some feedback on the short rib/cheek sandwich (first half tough and included gristle).   I didn't know how the sandwich was supposed to taste until the second half.   Then it was awesome.   She took the feedback graciously and took care of it.   Another great GR restaurant!

One of our favorite places to eat when at Ceasars. The steak and ale pie is my favorite- so delicious and flavorful! We've been here for several Cinemacon events and as guests- and service and food has been consistently great for both. 
The sticky toffee is awesome!

Came here with a group of 7, 
made reservations earlier in the day,
The service was on point,
Food arrived in a quick manor and was delicious!
Would definitely come back!

Definitely get the truffle fries. Or crisps, I think they're called... They are really good and you're given a large helping of truffles! Yum! I was really surprised when they came to our table because it looks like 6 large, fatty fries stacked on top of each other. When I picked up the first one I was so surprised by its weight that I almost dropped it... Apparently the fries are boiled, baked, then fried to give it a great consistency!

They're still working on smoothing out the service and everything since they just opened not too long ago. We were initially seated at a table with basically no lighting. Other than that, I had a great experience with the boyfriend.

I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay, but his newest head chef (Hell's Kitchen Winner - Ja'Nel Witt) has her work cut out for her. Three of us went during a NOT busy lunch. The service was friendly, but nothing special. The braised cheek sandwich was phenomenal and the clear winner at the table. The fish & chips were tasty, but the mushy peas were under seasoned. The bangers & mash were disappointing b/c the bangers lacked flavor and the mash were under seasoned. However, the biggest disappointment was that after ordering the appetizer (burger sliders w/ an unpopular spread) w/ the mains... THE APPETIZER CAME OUT AFTER THE ENTREES!!! Since we ordered everything at the same time, I can only assume the fault lies in the kitchen and not w/ the server. Even more disappointing is that they CHARGED US for the late appetizer! The server apologized for the inconvenience, but are you kidding me?! Chef Ramsay has higher standards than that. Best of luck & congratulations Ja'Nel!

Let me start by saying I am a huge Gordon Ramsay fan.  I have watched all his shows from BBC to Fox.  I have also dined at the London NYC and it was one of the best meals of my life.  Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill?  Not so much.

We waited at the bar for the text that our table was ready and the wait was the highlight of our experience.  Great drinks and friendly bar tender.  He made great recommendations of what to eat and seemed to know the menu well.  We were seated just after finishing our first drink which was perfect.

After that it was all downhill.  The table we sat at was directly behind the hostess both so it was a high traffic area but it was so close you could reach out and touch them.  Not only was it awkward placement but the table was far to short, both in height and depth, for the 2 chairs and booth that were pushed up to it.  Strange and uncomfortable, but I could get past it for great food and service.  Unfortunately we got very little of either.

The waiter was friendly enough and for some reason felt the need to share that he was a competitive eater (even called another staff member over to prove it).  Again, awkward, but whatever.

For an appetizer we ordered the Scottish Egg, as recommended by the bar tender, and it was good.  Not great, but good.  There were 3 of us, we had the Prime Rib, Diver Scallops, and Fish and Chips.  The scallops were cooked perfectly and were very good (best entree ordered), the batter on the Fish and Chips was flavorful but slid right off the fish, which was tasteless, and the french fries didn't have any salt at all.  The Prime Rib was extremely bland but the mash potatoes were pretty decent.  For desert we had the Sticky Toffee Pudding and it was definitely the star of our dining experience.  I have watched Gordon make it on TV for years and was very happy that I wasn't disappointed.  

For what I have reviewed so far I would have given 3 stars but the service is where it really fell flat.  Every single dish we used from our drinks, to the apps, to dinner, to desert were all still on the table when we left the restaurant.  We were out of drinks, even water, 45 min before we got our check, which I had to wave our waiter down to request and then it still took another 20 minutes before we got it.  Outside of taking our order and delivering food he only stopped at our table to check on us once the whole hour and 45 minutes that we were seated.

I saw the manager at the hostess both several times and tried to get his attention to inform him of our experience but he never would make eye contact.  Normally I would have got up and went to him but at this point I was annoyed and just wanted to leave.

Needless to say for a meal that cost over $170 (not including the $60 we spent at the bar) I was EXTREMELY disappointed.  This is a restaurant worthy of Gordon's show Kitchen Nightmares!  What a shame.  I hope, Scott Commings (Hell's Kitchen season 12 winner) will turn things around when he takes the head Chef position and hopefully that is soon!

This place has cool decor but as with all of Vegas, the waitresses are dressed very tacky. The food is mediocre at best and extremely overpriced.

Go here to say you did and pretend things are great.

Stop and stare was amazing for a laid-back afternoon with family and friends. Great food and the service was fast and friendly. I would say that Heather is one of the most friendly and menu knowledgeable servers I've had in awhile. I have worked in the industry my entire life and for me to leave a hundred and 110% happy does not happen very often. So thank you again for the delicious very much enjoyable service.

We had an amazing time here last night. We ordered the fish n chips, and it was incredible. I live by the ocean and can appreciate a fresh fish. Even the tartar sauce tasted ridiculously good, I learned they make just about everything there fresh. 

The service was incredible. A manager came to our table and really made us feel welcome.
We had the toffee pudding and it was the best dessert I've tasted in my life.
What can I say?  Just fantastic! This was our second time there this year. Food was excellent. Service was great. Ambience is cool. I would highly recommend this restaurant if your in Las Vegas.

Had the fish & chips. Yes. A winner !  Hard to find places that don't over cook them... Also had the muscles and clams. Also, good. The bread with the sauce to soak up, yumm.  All the hype and pom poms aside. This is a great place. I would go back for the overpriced fish and chips. I poured on the malt vinegar. mmmm so good. Will go back for the dessert next time.   Ignore the negative nellys, the palce is fun & festive ...

Incredible experience! Had absolutely amazing service from David, he was so nice and helpful, always kept our glasses half full, & had a wonderful attitude in the restaurant! food came out in such great timing, & made it perfect time for happy hour! Can't wait to come back again, my friend and I were very pleased with our experience!

We loved it! We are Vegas locals and went on a Friday afternoon because we wanted to see if we liked this as much as BurGR. I ordered the onion soup and the shepherds pie and my boyfriend ordered the burger and fries. Both of us kept eating way after we were full just because it was so good. The service was fast, really friendly, and helpful with recommendations. The decor is hip and comfortable, and there was no wait at all on the last weekend before Christmas, which was a plus.

The only cons in my opinion were 1) the price of beer, which is typical of restaurants in the casinos on the strip and 2) being seated right beside other patrons lacked privacy and was not seemingly necessary.

I think this restaurant is a great example of what sets an expert like Gordon Ramsay apart from the rest. Everything was clean, organized, friendly, simple to understand, food was made very well, and the experience left us wanting to come back with friends.

My wife originally wanted to go to the steak house at the Paris but once we realized it was going to be About $400 for lunch we opted for the Pub. First impressions nice atmosphere clean bright vibrant. We sat down with our daughter and waited about 20 minutes for a server to come. I was hungry and went straight away for the toad in the hole and the diver scallops I told the waiter I had not had toad in the hole in over 20 yrs. he explained it was not traditional at which I realized it was basically a pig in a blanket. I changed my order to scotch egg and chicken curry my wife had fish and chips. When the waiter eventually came with the food all at the same time I think a quail egg was used for the scotch egg I got scallops instead of the curry. My wife's food was okay at best for $16 F&E but they cost $30. Scallops overlooked. $180 for two and a half peeps with two drinks each. A lot of dosh for bad nosh, Done!!!!!!!

We tried the Pub and Grill on our latest adventure and loved it!  Not sure why all the bad reviews here.  We were greeted and given a table right away, 11 pm on a Friday night.  Our server came by, got a drink order while we looked over the menu.  I ordered the Beet Salad and my fiance got the Burger.  Both were absolutely delicious!  We also got the sticky toffee pudding for dessert and loved it.  We had a great experience here and would not hesitate to come back again.  Discounted pricing for Total Rewards members is nice also.  As were were seated near the bar, we were able to see ESPN and catch all the scores.  Check it out, you'll be glad you did.

Not a lot of hesitation in wanting to try some of Chef Ramsay's tasty treats; however, after bellying up to the bar for a couple drinks and a bite, I can say that I was more than pleasantly surprised by the drink & pub menu! 

Our drinks were fantastic! I had the Ramsay Tonic & my date had the Innis & Gunn draft. We ordered up the Truffle Chips & Deviled Eggs much to our delight, as everything was better than anticipated. So much so, that we downed our appetizers & declared a round trip after seeing Elton John perform. 

Upon our return for additional drinks, we had the opportunity to meet & thank Chef Ramsay for a great experience. 

Saving the best for last... I will say that our bartender, Brandon, was beyond friendly, insightful, attentive, and gracious. He truly made time to make us feel welcome despite how busy he was. He provided drink and food suggestions, & also pointed us in the right direction for a fun filled night of gambling.  

I'd give five stars; however, given our limited time to dine, I'll leave that for our next visit where we try more of the menu!!

Seriously disappointed.  First off, we went during lunch - 1:00pm- they seated us promptly and wait staff was pleasant and timely.  However, we went to order, they informed us they were out of beef.  Beef?  Seriously at 1:00?  They weren't  busy, I see why now.  Then we order beer, it is a pub after all, and they have not beer glasses?  What?  The dishwasher broke?  After a mediocre meal, with high strip prices, I must say, I don't think we will be dining here again....

There is only one thing you want here. Okay, there is only two things you want in here. Skip the food menu.

Come in for dessert (doesn't matter if it's before your meal, after your meal, or in-between your meal) and a drink. 

The only two things you want when you come here are the Sticky Toffee Pudding and the Innis and Gunn beer that pairs perfectly with it.

Imagine the sweet, liquefied caramel just running itself down the sides of a crispy toffee mounted inside ice cream, layered on top of one of the softest bread puddings you'll find. Every spoonful of this dessert is a touch of heaven's bliss.

1. Take a spoonful of that sticky toffee pudding
2. Then a good sip of the Innis and Gunn
3. Proceed to smile as your mouth spins in orgasms
4. Return to step 1 and repeat all steps again, until there is nothing left. 

Heavenly, truly.

-- Side note, I've had the food here and to be honest the stuff is good (as expected of Gordon and Ramsay), but all incredibly overpriced. I mean, $30 for regular fish & chips -- really, Gordon? Anyway. The sticky toffee pudding and Innis and Gunn..that is all you need here. Grab your meal elsewhere. :)

So on a recent trip to Vegas checked out Gordon Ramsay's @CaesarsPalace with a friend. Found out the hard way that the catsup has garlic in it but the truffle fries were good otherwise. Friend had the Lamb Burger and had no complaints about it. I had the 8 oz beef tenderloin. I always get my steak well done and always tell them no pink, butterfly is OK, had to send it back because it came out pink. Second time around it was perfect and very tender. As of this writing the online menu differs from the actual menu, in my case the steak only came with asparagus no potatoes or seasonal vegetables like the online menu states. My friend says three stars I say two based on the steak but I will go with his and give three.

Cheers to that manager that spotted us, on deck, waiting to grab a seat while the patrons ahead of us hassled and argued with the front hostess about every little thing -  Trying to score that free meal, treated like kings & queens.. c'mon, I'm hungry and willing to pay for food, the hell you doing here?  

Two thumbs down to our server whom, at times, made us feel like we weren't even there.
