He was so inattentive and disregarding - I'd like to say I forgot his name, but the dude didn't even introduce himself. He seemed focused on other people, giving the feeling of someone looking through you as if you ceased to exist. 

A mixed thumb up for their Beer Braised Short Ribs. Unreasonably priced and it wasn't as tender as one would expect - The flavor screamed & howled, 'Puuub'.. And rightfully so, 'cause we were in one. Nothing exciting here, it seemed to lack flavor all together. A tad chewy and bland would describe this dish best. What WAS good was the potato puree. It lasted all of 1 minute as did the vegetables which were just okay.  

Two thumbs down for the Crispy Calamari. It was more soggy and flimsy than crispy, which is disappointing when you want that snap and crunch. The fresh dill tartar sauce was actually tasty, just wish we had something other than the calamari to dip in it! 

Shared a wedge salad that was straightforward. They didn't overdose the thing with blue cheese nor vinaigrette and were rather generous w/ the bacon. Fresh bites of this wedge salad overpowered the emotional depressant disguised as the Beer Braised Short Ribs. Sad, a salad won us over and it wasn't all that!

Toss our table next to the outer railing, where drunks, kids and families stroll by and stare at you and your food.. we've now created an all around unpleasant experience. 

At least I went to a Gordon Ramsey eatery, though, we were highly disappointed.

My wife and I are big Gordon Ramsay fans, but this place was a giant disappointment. The food and service were both average at best. 

- I ordered a pint of Boddington's (draught) which should have been $8. When the bill came it was $11. I asked the server why it was $11 and he said because it was a 20 oz. I am still trying to figure out how they squeezed 20 oz's of Boddington's into a pint glass. Hmmm....

- My wife ordered a diet Pepsi and it was $4. Wow! 

- I ordered the Chicken Curry. It took about 25 minutes to come out and when it arrived the portion wasn't the biggest, the sauce was good, the rice was fine, but the chicken was undercooked (pink). Definitely not worth the $24 price tag.

Would I go back? No.

My wife and I watching every season of Hell's Kitchen religiously since the very first season.  So when we were in Vegas we had to come visit this restaurant since it is where the winner Jeanelle (sp?) will be working starting August 14th I believe.  We were quite excited to come here with our friends and my two children.  We had reservations and when we got there we noticed all of the tables that seat more than 2 people use only high backless stools for chairs.  My youngest is 4 years old and while she could sit up there fine it was not something I really wanted to chance.  There were two cocktail type tables in the middle of the restaurant that were open but they said at first that we cannot sit there because there is no server for those tables.  Really on a friday night you dont have servers for all your tables?  Seemed a bit fishy to me but in the end we were able to sit there although after waiting 15 minutes we had to go back to the hostesses and say the waiter they said would help us still has not shown up.  Once he did show up our waiter was good but not anything special in the least.  The drinks were ok, one of us had a blueberry smash and I had a grapefruit drink from the cocktail menu.  Both again were good but at $15 I thought were a bit overpriced.  I will only speak for my own meal and I got the flat iron steak which was $30+.  When I received it, it looked liked 5 sliced small pieces of steak.  I couldnt believe that for that price the portion was so small.  All in all I think we were all let down by this restaurant mostly for its lack of value, slow and not that friendly service and seating arrangements.

excellent service and the food is done fast. had the amazing tomato soup which I recommend, which tastes like home-made soup. 
we had the steak, medium done, and it was perfect, pink on the inside and just right on the outside. the place aired of a modern UK, loved.the utensils.

Was really looking forward to trying this place esp as I've been a fan of Hell's Kitchen for years. Wait was about 30 minutes on a Saturday which I suppose isn't too bad for a group. I had the steak pot pie and it was average at best. Brussels sprouts were good - had a nice tangy vinegar flavor. Service was attentive and friendly. So I also learned that Scott - the winner of Hell's Kitchen worked there for about a year but eventually left as he was burned out and overwhelmed - doing two jobs plus taking fan photos. Overall, it felt average but I'll give it 4 stars because it was a pleasant experience

I enjoyed my Gordon Ramsay experience here so much to have it twice New Year's weekend.  I've always walked by it and wanted to try it out.  Both times we sat at the bar without wait and watched the games on the tv's that they had.  Made it convenient to get away from the sportsbook to grab a bite to eat and drink and not miss the game.  The first time we went, we ordered the chicken wings, deviled eggs and sliders.  The chicken wings were pretty tasty and a nice portion.  The deviled eggs were not cut as beautifully as I'm used to, but it didn't sacrifice its' taste, they were still delicious, topped with bacon.  The sliders were pretty good as well.  Not a huge fan of the bun type but the patty, cheese and bacon were a good combination.  The second time we came I had the corned beef brisket sandwich and the butter chicken with rice.  The corned beef brisket was moist and delicious.  I wish it came with fries automatically instead of the kettle chips, but the chips were good as well.  The butter chicken was also a great dish even from a place that doesn't focus on Indian cuisine.  The pita bread was good but I probably would have preferred the butter chicken to have a little more of a punch and spice.  Service was great both times, everyone was very nice and attentive.  Overall, a place with solid food and service.  Would definitely come back in the future.

I went here with my girlfriend for lunch on my 21st birthday. After my wonderful experience at Gordan Ramsay Steak, I thought that this restaurant would be well worth it - I was wrong!

My girlfriend and I ordered from the classics menu - Yorkshire ale batter fish & chips and bangers & mash. The food was good! No flaws in quality, taste, and presentation. However, for the price we were paying, we were expecting GREAT (not just good). The food was nothing special and could have been bought elsewhere for half the price.

Conclusion/recommendations:
- Food was highly overpriced.
- You are essentially paying high prices for the unique dining experience and customer service.
- Go to bacchanal buffet. It's right next door and you'll be spending the same amount of money.

I love/hate this place. Been here several times, but the one thing I hate, the one thing I hate bothers me.  EVERY. TIME.

Things I love:
The service. Very pleasant service, with a longer memory than my own. 
The food.  Classic pub fare. Prepared good.  I like it.  One of the best Scotch egg I've had. Everything else is good.  Not great.
Atmosphere.  It's what I think of when I think "pub"

Thing I hate:
The beer menu.  A pint isn't 20 oz.  Don't call it a fucking pint if it's not a fucking pint.  Assholes.

So far not too impressed, I would expect one hell of a lot more from a Gordon Ramsay establishment.  The service was less than stellar.  We waited 15 min before anyone even came over to take our drink orders. We ordered and haven't seen any one for 30 min since we ordered.  I hope the hell the food is good or this review will go down.  I ordered the braised ribs and my wife did the steak pie.  Well let's see what happens.

well, the food was great.  the braised ribs melted in your mouth and the beef pie was a bomb of flavor.  But the service was horrible, our server Richard was slow, he couldn't remember the desert order.  he almost made us late for our show.  Gordon, you need to look into this.

Good food, good portions.  Granted it is slightly expensive, we'll worth it.  Our table had the red wine braised short rib (probably best dish of the four we ordered), diver scallops, fish and chips, and blt sandwhich.  The short rib was extremely tender and had very food flavor.  Service was excellent as well.
Not really very authentic if you are English. Fish and chips are ok but not great

We were incredibly disappointed by this installment from Chef Ramsay and we expected a lot more from a place with his name. It was very crowded, probably about 8 o'clock on a Tuesday night. They were out of at least half of the items on their menu, including basic staples like pies and drinks. Our server failed to tell us ANYTHING and overall was not very pleasant. The food runners were rude and sort of ignored us.
The food itself wasn't good- I had a warm chicken sandwich that might have been decent if it wasn't overwhelmed with Gruyere cheese to the point where the bread was soggy and the cheese was all we could taste. The rest of my party was only marginally satisfied with their food. The only good part of the experience was the nice interior. Maybe we came at a bad time, but
I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody. It doesn't live up to Ramsay's standards in the slightest.

Our server Kerry was so friendly and helpful and the food was amazing.  This place truly has innovative tastes and large portions to fill you up. I read some of the negative reviews that complain of the price.... get real people.  You are eating at a chef quality restaurant not Panda Express. Quality food and service costs and is worth it.  My party of three ate an appetizer, 3 entrees, 3 beverages and dessert for 120 bucks.  Great deal. Thanks again.
A big fat "meh". Do not get the fish and chips for thirty dollars. I asked the Bartender why it was the highest priced item on the menu and he said because of Vegas prices.

This place is very expensive at practicaly 30$ a plate. I ordered the scallops which had no flavor. The portions were small. I ordered a side salad with my meal which would have been alright if they wouldnt have drenched it in lemon juice which was pratically unedible. The service was horrible they left 2 dishes that my family had ordered in the kitchen until we told them they forgot our food. Im personally very dissapointed and personally would never return.

Excellent place for a casual lunch during our trip to Sin City!  

We ate at the bar and Ray Ray was fabulous!  Fun, helpful, and attentive.  He helped us find some local faire to enjoy during our week.  Visit him and chat him up!

For lunch I had the Lamb Burger which was excellent, just slightly over dressed with the feta topping and it had cabbage in it, which I don't love.  Still melt in your mouth delicious!  As always, Drew picked better and had the bangers and mash.  Three different sausages made of different meats with one of the best gravies I've ever had!  

Beer selection was great, including Boddingtons on nitro!  The beer gods smiled upon us that day.

The place is spendy so cheapskates don't even bother!  Worth every penny in my opinion, wish we would have eaten here a second time.

I stopped by here last night for an early dinner with my fiance.  We didn't have reservations and that did not seem to be a problem as we were sat immediately.  Our seats ended up being right near the edge of the casino and near the posted menu which was distracting for me.  Since it was a Sunday the tv's all had football games on them with the sound playing loudly over the restaurant speakers.  While i enjoyed that, i wish the volume would have been a bit softer.  The decor of the restaurant itself is quite cool with one room being divided from another with a wall of kegs and then there was some cool chandeliers and a lounge type area.  I also enjoyed the wooden chargers on the table as well as the silverware of which the bottoms reminded me of the St. George cross. What i didn't enjoy was the outfits of the staff as the hounds-tooth was hideous and i would have to agree with other users who said it made them look cheap and trashy.

For an appetizer my fiance and I started out with the duck confit poutine.  Whenever it first came out I was unable to see any of the duck but I eventually found it lurking in the goodness of the poutine.  My favorite parts of it were the duck and cheese although the fries were nice and crispy except for the ones that sat too long in the duck gravy which ended up being overly sweet for me.  Who would have thought that this Canadian dish would end up on a English pub menu.  For my main course I decided on the shepherds pie.  Whenever it came out I thought that it looked a bit small but I was stuffed by the time I had finished it all.  The base was a mixture of beef and lamb combined with some carrots and peas and then topped with some mashed potatoes.  In the end it was a decent dish as the meat was tender but it did not really wow me at all.

The bottom line for me is that I would probably not come back to the Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grille in the future.  While my meal was ok, there are too many other places nearby that are better and at the same price point or even cheaper.

Walked in for lunch on a whim while in Ceasars palace. Ordered a burger and scotch egg. The burger was of high quality but it wasn't anything that great. The scotch egg was just ok. They also have a very nice beer menu. Service was fast and friendly. Nice place to grab lunch and sit watching the people in the casino go by. I would drop in again to try something else sometime. Exact three star place.

Love many of the celebrity chef restaurants in Vegas and Gordon's Pub and Grill did not disappoint, especially the sticky bread pudding for dessert.  Had fish and chips and portions were perfect as well.  The service was quick and attentive. Definitely will return.

I've only watched Hell's Kitchen a few times, but I'm pretty sure Gordon Ramsay would lose his mind & fire all the employees if he ever visited this location.  But then again, he's probably kicking back somewhere in South London drinking a pint collecting the royalties off this mess.  The staff was terrible, it took 15 minutes to get water I had asked for 3 times.  The shrimp cocktail was good, but it's Las Vegas & a shrimp cocktail.  The whole town pretty much has this dish nailed.  I'd suggest trying one of the other 647480 restaurants within walking distance.

The food was delicious and the service was impeccable. Gordon is so judgmental on all of his shows, which is why I wanted to go and see for myself if he backs up what he preaches. He absolutely does. The decor was great, the staff was very friendly, the cocktail was amazing, and the food was cooked to perfection.

Don't bother unless you like rude hostesses, $25 hamburgers, and slow service. This is the perfect example of a celebrity chef cashing in. Food was sub-par and over priced. Run away! 

The seating arrangement is terrible. The table looked dirty and the chairs were to short. 

I should've gone to Panda Express.
Went their had a great time food was great bartenders where nice . Just don't sit by the taps kept getting sprayed by the glass rinser kind of a bummer

Hey Gordon, I found restaurant for you to fix!  Surprise you own it.  I had to send back my braised beef short ribs and risotto twice because the risotto was undercooked, somehow the risotto was worse on the second attempt.  Ended up eating nothing.  The manager never even came to the table to apologize.  My friends meals were also underwhelming.  Save your money and go to the food court next door.

This place was amazing! Really great service and amazing food. Fully impressed with the Bangers and Mash, if that's British cuisine I'm sold! My daughter ordered the bacon cheese burger minus the cheese and she said it was one of the best burgers she's ever had. My husband had the 14oz ribeye and had a chance to taste all three sauces. He said it was a pretty good steak, but Mesa was much better for him and he thought the service was slow. Next time I go I'll try the wedge salad and tomato soup!

We came here months ago while on vacation and both tried the Yorkshire Ale Batter Fish & Chips. The fish was crispy and not too greasy inside, chips were great as well. They were big portions, we could of shared one order. 

I like the other GR's Steak and BurGR better than this restaurant, but it didn't disappoint.

Not sure why this place gets bad reviews.  I've been here several times and the service and food are top quality.  The happy hour is great with great Irish nachos and the beer selection is pretty impressive too.  My favorite dish is the Curry Chicken and it goes great with an Innis and Gunn.  Will definitely come back when people come to town.

1. They sat me right away.
2. Service was excellent. 
3. Waiters made drinks on point.
4. Food came out on time.
5. Food was acctually hot. burned tounge on fries.
6. My drink never was empty. they refilled it consistantly.
7. price was decent.
8. energetic staff.
9. desert was awesome
10. lastly, fish n chip ladies and gentlemen. Fish n Chips
Loved the food. Our server was Heather and she was very polite and professional. It seems as the management has the staff on well order. Thank you for a great experience

I'm very sad! Not really for me, I've already had bad experience at restaurants, but for my son. He really wanted to eat in a restaurant of his Idol Chef Gordon Ramsey so I brought him here. The restaurant was not crowded.
My son ordered a Ribeye, should be an easy choice, a simple steak medium cooked.
We waited almost one hour to have served a piece of hard semi carbonized meat.
Nobody apologized for the long delay, no one from restaurant notice the bed quality of the Ribeye, we paid 40$ for it.
After paying I had to go to another fast food to feed my son.
Bad experience!

We needed to find a place to eat on Tuesday night and decided to stop by here. 

Wait was short. About 5 minutes. 

Our waitress wasn't that friendly or attentive. We got seated at the bar table and once a table opened up, we asked to switch (this was before we even ordered). Waitress said she needs to check with the front and took over 5 minutes. She comes back and starts moving our menu and silverware over without telling us we're moving. 

We ordered:
Lamb Shepard's pie
Fish and chips
Beer
Cider

Food took a while to come out. Waitress didn't give fiancé a spoon for Shepard's pie (or offer to). I had I ask for salt and pepper, which took a long time for her to return with it. 

I think if we are paying $25+ per dish, the wait staff needs to be more attentive. She was not only slow, but she never checked on us. Food was ok... I wouldn't pay $30 for fish and chips..... Sorry but, you've disappointed me and I will tell my friends.

Service is very good, but they really try too hard to have you order a beverage or dessert.  I would recommend you make reservations 2 days ahead of time.  It seems to be very popular especially starting Thur-Sat, when the crowds pour into LV for the weekend or when a big headliner is in town (Elton John was performing when we were there).  We tried:
1. Baby beet salad, $16, very good
2. Ale onion soup, $12.  OK, wouldn't order again.
3. London Calling (cocktail), $15, very good
4. Cornish Chicken, $26.  Hubby liked this dish, I didn't try it.
5 Fish & Chips  - large pieces of fishy-tasting cod, fried the way I remembered it in London. Tastes better if you pour malt vinegar on it, but the bottle had one of those spouts that will pour large amts if you're not careful.  The fries were wedge-type, meh.
$26.
I really wanted to try the sticky toffee, but we were too full.  If you want dessert, would recommend you skip any appetizer, salad or soup. The portions are very large in LV.

So my boyfriend and I are foodies, and we came to Las Vegas for the shows, and the food.  We had a list of "chef signature" places we wanted to visit.  Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill was actually an accident because one of our other places was a bust.

The Experience:
We came around 2pm for a late lunch and were seated right away.  The experience here started off a bit rocky since our waitress never came, but once we asked the manager what was going on, we were seated at a different table with a very friendly waitress (her name was Bridgette I believe).  The manager (his name was Derek) was extremely apologetic and checked on us often through the duration of our meal.  He even offered to comp our appetizer, which was a really nice touch, and alleviated any possible hostility that we might have had.  Derek was probably the highlight of our experience since he was so accommodating and warm.  He truly went above and beyond for us.  Thank you Derek!

The Food:
Both my boyfriend and I had the lobster rolls, shared a chicken caesar salad, and lastly the toffee pudding.

Lobster rolls:  Great portions, but lacked a little flavor.  I expected a bit more or maybe something different, but still delicious.

Chicken Cesar: Comes on large leaves of lettuce, but generous portions of chicken, and the dressing was phenom.  Very delicious.

Toffee Pudding: We bought it per recommendation from Derek...it was incredibly delicious.  Im not a super fan of caramel, and even I demolished this thing.  It was perfection.  The caramel is served warm and you pour it on top....YUM!!

All in all...wonderful..and we will be back! :)  Thank you Bridgette and Derek!

Less vegetarian option. In fact I would say no option.!!! Good that the service person helped us in getting some veg food. Finally we ended up in ordering mushroom risotto and nachos.

I would say that I had better risotto than this.  Overall It's pricy and at the end, it all comes to the restaurant name!!

First the Hostess are not very kind and are really rude. It was 10:15pm the hostess said it was last call in 15 minutes. Hmm ok. We still were seated in the Restaurant. However they were still serving for another hour. Get your facts together.....

 I believe our Server was Elise. She was amazing. 

We saw they had mac and cheese on the menu up front however it was not on the menu we were given. So we asked and were brought the pub menu as well. We both ordered beers they were great.  We then ordered out Mac and Cheese and were going to share the truffle chips (fries). Our Mac and Cheese came out before our appetizer.  We asked about it and then just told them never mind. The Mac and Cheese was Damn  good.  They ended up bringing the truffle fries. They were very good, however the dipping sauces were not very good. 

Back to the Service. OMG Elise she was great. She was joking with us and made our dinner out a wonderful experience. She made a real connection with us. Would recommend her to anyone...

However the main menu was a little over priced from what i saw the portions to be. 
Take a look at what you are serving and make some adjustments. 

Will go back again....

On the whole, this place is about 3 stars... the fish and chips however are 5 stars!   

I got the fish and chips which were AMAZING.  The batter was perfect and the fish was fried perfectly.   The fries were medium sized and also delicious.

We also got the scotch egg, bangers and mash, and sheperds pie at our table.  All of which were average (3 stars).

Their beer selection is actually pretty weak although they did have Innis and Gunn on tap which is an amazing beer.   This being Vegas,  there are much cheaper places to drink so I would suggest just getting the 1 beer to go with your meal.   

Prices were 9-13 dollars for largely mainstream and uninteresting beers.

OMG... Service was seriously unfriendly. The look we got for not ordering alcohol was pure disgust. The food was okay, but stupid expensive. The waiter insisted on taking our plates even though we hadn't finished yet.

Wow! Don't give many 5 stars, but couldn't find anything wrong with this place. My brother and I were walking by on a Saturday night @ 8pm and grabbed a table for two in the dining room. Our server presented the ipad with their brew selection. When he returned we ordered our food and asked him to pick the best beers for our entrees. He hit it perfectly. I had the fish and chips with the same beer that is used for the batter, my bro had beef cheeks with some other beer. We had the poutine for an app. Amazeballs!! 

Great service! Great food! Don't know how authentic of an english pub it is, but I don't care. I'll be back.

They take boring pub food and make it taste good.   The pork chop was the best.  Great service from all.  Had the chicken come out cold.  They took care of it right away and com the one meal.  Things go wrong how you How you it makes the difference   Very good

This is no exaggeration, the best restaurant I have been to in a long time.  The food is incredible, in fact I can never haver another shepherds pie again, because it is all downhill from here, I will never eat food this good again.  Anyone who argues with a Gordon Ramsey recipe should be shot and pissed on.  There is not a clunker on the menu.
And if you are lucky enough to have Taylor as your server you will not be disappointed.  Hands down the best service we've had in many many years.

The service was lackluster at best. I heard the hostess complaining to one of the servers about her shift, loudly. Our server never ONCE checked on us after he brought the food. It also took a very long time (over 30 minutes) to get the food. That seems like a long time to wait for lunch. I would expect 15 to 20 minutes, especially since it wasn't that busy. Also, while the food was tasty, it cost us 82 dollars after tip for: One can of beer, two beef hamburgers, and one BLT.   I know Vegas is expensive but the meal wasn't worth more than thirty five or forty bucks, tops - even in Vegas. 
My advice:  find somewhere less expensive with better service. You'll be happier.

Had zero plans to eat lunch here while out shopping inside Caesar's Palace.  But whatever it was that led me here - hunger, tired feet, FATE - I'm so glad it did.  This was hands-down my favorite lunch out of all the places we tried on vacation.

First of all, I loved the decor of the restuarant.  You really felt this is what a real English pub would look like.  It could be an Americanized version for all I know, but I still liked it.

Our service was great.  Very friendly wait staff.  There were water spots on my husband's fork, which isn't even that big of a deal, but our waiter noticed it (without us pointing it out first) and replaced it right away.  I thought that was a very nice, above-and-beyond touch.

I started off with a very delicious cocktail called Goodbye Blue Sky, which was blueberry vodka, Chambord, sparkling wine and fresh lemon and blueberries.  So refreshing.  I hardly ever finish my cocktail at any place I go, but this one could have easily begat a second one as much as I loved it.

We decided to pass on appetizers as we didn't really want to stuff ourselves for lunch (knowing we had a very large dinner ahead of us later).  I debated on what to order because so many things sounded delicious.  Shepherd's Pie, Chicken Pot Pie, even considered ordering several apps as my entree (Scotch Egg - yum!).  Finally decided to go classic English pub and ordered the Fish and Chips.  This was without a doubt the best fish and chips I've ever eaten.  Three lovely pieces of beautifully battered white fish - the texture was spot on (crispy and light), fish cooked to perfection.  Served with a side of mushy peas, which were also very tasty.  They were minty, although I didn't taste too much of it.  If I could complain about anything, I'd say the fries were nothing special.  The weren't horrible by any means, but for $30 you may expect something hand-cut at the very least.

Everytime we see a Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert, we have to try it.  For something not chocolately, this bread pudding is surprisingly good.  Warm, with a rich caramelly drizzle atop a delicious sweet cream ice cream.  It's like a comfort dessert - you leave feeling wrapped in a warm blanket, cozy and comfy.  Perfect ending to a fantastic meal.

The only thing I wasn't keen on was the price of the food.  Now, I can eat expensive food, and have no problem paying for it.  But let's be honest - this was not an upscale 5-star restaurant.  It's a pub with above average food.  It's not overly gourmet or made with luxury ingredients.  I'd say you're paying for the Gordon Ramsey name for the most part.  Don't get me wrong cuz the food was spectacular, but it could definitely handle being slightly cheaper.  Lunch food shouldn't cost over $100 for two people.

A group of friends and I were here on 7/28 and we were all disappointed with our experience. Service was on point but the majority of us thought the food was a joke.

Lobster rolls looked extremely appetizing.. but had little to no flavor.
Wings.. you can tell that these wings were definitely fried for way too long and have been sitting for a bit. Flavor? Waaaay overly salty. Everyone that ordered wings didn't end up finishing them.
Sliders.. I've had better from Dennys unfortunately.

This was a first at a Gordon Ramsay restauraunt and may honestly be a last.

We were thrilled to WIN a dinner at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. We watch his shows and thought dinner would be amazing. The first two items we ordered were "86ed". We said that was too bad since we really wanted to have them and the waiter replied that it was "good" since they were busy that night.  Good for him, bad for us,  but it didn't occur to him to think that way.  My husband ordered rack of lamb, and since the apps we wanted were not available he asked about the portion size and was told it was " three bones". When  the dish came with two, he asked the waiter about it and the waiter said he would check with the kitchen, then came back and told us he was misinformed  and the serving  went by weight. However, he agreed that it looked like a double cut chop, not a rack of lamb for $38. The meat was chewy,had no sauce, & needed seasoning. My  scallops, a dish Ramsay routinely dumps in the trash on his show, were nicely browned but served in a tasteless broth that made them a soggy mess. Although our waiter became more apologetic when the table next to us also complained about their lamb, and brought us a complimentary dessert, it was a really disappointing meal. Like the woman at the table next to us said, " This restaurant is a Kitchen Nightmare and needs fixing."

Awesome,

Try the Lamb! Great atmosphere, food and service! Ask for Mike the waiter. Personal service, great guy, on his game! Will sit and talk with you but never miss a beat.

Do it! And ask for Mike!

2 Thumbs up!

First, the beer on tap is amazing.  They tap only half-kegs, thus assuring freshness.  They also chill the lines and clean them every day.  Seriously, the beer taste like no other place.  The food is the perfect pub food, gourmet without being pretentious.

Food was 4 stars, service a paltry 1 star. I ate lightly, just a bowl of English Onion soup which was fantastic and a side of the mac & cheese which was above average, but not the best I've ever had. Main problem was the service. Even though we had 3 different servers waiting on us, they were all incompetent. Splitting a bill 3 ways shouldn't take 30 minutes which it took for them because they kept screwing it up. Improve the service and you might be looking at a 4 star restaurant.

I'm sorry but I don't know how you won Hell's Kitchen Ja'nel...  I have no issues with price (its Vegas so its priced right) but I have a huge issue with how the food was seasoned. Only thing seasoned properly was the duck confit poutine.  Everything else we got needed salt and acid... Or flavor! Only reason you got 2 stars was because of the good service and the duck. One star for each...

#GordonRamsayFail:  Christmas Day,  mid afternoon.  We ordered a medium well done lamb burger and a well done grilled beef burger.   The lamb was served very rare,  maybe barely cooked.  The burger was rare and quite pink.   WTF?  This is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant without anal retentive attention to detail.  Uneffing believable.  

And the waiter had a bad attitude.  He obviously didn't want to be there (understandable), however, professionalism is required in every sales industry.  High level customer service delivery is key to stay in business.

That's 2x #GordonRamsayFail in 1 visit.   A completely destroyed first impression. 

Positive points: the manager on duty took the poorly prepared food off our bill, offered to make our meal right and a free dessert.  We declined a second food prep and the dessert. 

The lobster Mac & Cheese is delicious. 

Will I go back?  No.  There is awesome mac and cheese everywhere these days.

I came here with low expectations because of all the negative reviews but was surprised. Service was not great. It was efficient enough. My two main complaints are the bar height stools are so uncomfortable! The seats sag too much! Second complaint is the quality of tv screen around the bar area. The screens were dark and just looks like they were old tvs. The food was above average! I think people expected more because of the name but they have to remember it's meant to be casual because it's a PUB!

Had an amazing experience at Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grille in Las Vegas.  The kettle chip nachos were the perfect temperature and an outstanding compliment to our beers and entrees.  Gordon Ramsay's supposed favorite beer, Innes and Gunn, is really good!  We had the Fish and Chips, which was very good (and I'm very, very particular about fish and chips as I have lived in England); kind of crunchy and flavorful.  The Bangers and Mash were definitely the highlight; amazing flavors and so, so authentic.  Service was perfection; Our server, Neira ("NiNi"), was gorgeous and very friendly with a nice smile, and took great care of us.  I figured this would be a simple lunch, but it has ended up being one of the highlights of our visit!

This place offers good English pub comforts (bangers and mash, Shepard pie, etc) but the real draw here is the casual atmosphere, good beer and fun waiters. Our waiter (my brother from another mother, Christopher) was awesome and took very good care of us. 

Sadly, they no longer offer complimentary bread anymore. 

IMHO, it's good food but a little pricey. But then again, you're on the strip and inside ceasars so I guess it's to be expected.

Service was terrible.  We had a party of 7 on Saturday night.  They had a prime rib special   It was around 10:30 pm so we checked to make sure they still had prime rib before ordering.  We even joked with the server about who would get the last piece if they ran out.  3 of us ordered it.  We also ordered an appetizer.  About 30 minutes later she comes back and tells us they are out of prime rib. No kidding. Somehow it took 30 minutes to let us know they were out.  I ordered the ribeye instead. I then realized we hadn't even gotten our appetizer. I asked her to include an extra app of wings since now everyone was starving.  

Much like our experience earlier that day at the Cafe Americano, our server then stopped coming back to our table. Food runners brought everything out.  My steak was pretty good. Another person in our party never got part of his order and had to cancel it.  

We asked her to split up the check and she brought out one bill with each party separated.  Of course a 20% was automatically added.  So I guess I now see why she had no interest in coming back to the table.  I know this is common but this is the result.  I will not return to this place.

Came here with the boyfriend just to try something different. Was pretty busy! Decor was fun and definitely made me want to travel to England haha.

Food-Nothing amazing but the truffle fries were yummy! Sometimes restaurants serve it with too much truffle and what not and makes me sick lol. I would definitely go back and try another dish... I don't remember what I got but it was ok.

Decor-loved! We had a huge booth too and a lot of room. 

Service- Amazing! Everyone here had recommendations (even though I didn't try any of it haha) and always made sure we had everything we needed.  Very friendly and fun staff working here. 

I would for sure go back and actually try something they recommend... I'll definitely give the food another chance!
Don't waist your time or money. The food is average at best and far too pricy for what you get.  I am very disappointed and will not be going back.

We should have got the shepard's pie, I think it would have been much better than the basic burger we split.  There was a legit gray hair in my ketchup too, so not cool!  I may have asked for a replacement, but as usual, my fiancé grabbed the hair out of my dip and threw it on the ground, then deemed the ketchup good to go (he did this once before when I found a huge black fly on my pizza).  The service was good and the burger was not bad, but it was nothing special!!  Next time, we will go straight to Burgr and skip this place entirely.

Excellent. 

I got the short ribs and if anything on the menu is better it'll be hard to believe. 

Service was great.    They have special pricing if you're a card member (it's a reward card.   You get about $1 off per meal).

We also got the calamari appetizer.   It was good,  but don't fill up because you need room for the Short Ribs.

I had the Scottish Salmon. The taste was good but half was cooked nicely and the other half was raw.  The waiter tried to explain that was the way it was suppose to be cook. Very sad experience. I had a hard time keeping my "inner Gordon" in check. I really wanted to slam my fist into the fish and yell "IT'S F-----G RAW!!!!!!"
I will try his steak house next time.

Only 4 stars because it took forever to get our food. Just like in Hell's Kitchen! Oh, and you don't get any dinner rolls or bread while you wait for your food. So don't come here if your starving. You'll be waiting forever!!! But the food is good.
I'm going to recommend this place to everyone I know. This place is amazing! I had the bangers and mash. It was delicious. Everything that my group had was amazing.

Love this restaurant, tried it for the first time in 2013.  Me and my boyfriend reminisced about our food for a year so we had to come back this year.  Mine was amazing, but a little different than the year before.  My boyfriend however was disappointed, the amazing chips from the year before were very different now.  They were soggy and thin cut and nothing like last years thick crispy chips that made us come back :(

Food was AMAZING! It was our first time and we took a friend visiting from outside of the U.S. and we were so happy for the great experience we had during dinner. 

Our server Ali was FANTASTIC, friendly and super knowledgeable! He really knows his stuff. Whatever he recommends is what you should get. 

We will for sure be back!

Came on a Tuesday for Dinner, Ordered the oysters for a starter, super sweet little oysters and cocktail sauce with horseradish in it,  they were the highlight of the meal unfortunately. 
I was dissapointed by the current menu, came here last year around the same time and was absolutely blown away by everything and the overall style of the food choices, this year not so much, really narrow options with seriously predictable stuff, it's almost as if I went back in time to when it was first opening and they hadn't quite had time to make up any original dishes so they threw out the ol' classic favorites.. 
I ordered the scallops, they were ok. Cooked to perfection but nothing else, surprisingly bland! Nothing stunning about them though the portion size was fair. The amazing Girlfriend had the Salmon and it was also bland, almost like they didn't season it, very odd. Friend had the fish and chips. fish was good, batter was excellent, but the "chips" were undercooked! 

Prices here were also a disappointment. I payed what?! for That!? 

At least the Oysters were good!

Must mention service was excellent, and beer selection was good, some tasty stuff on the drink menu. 

Maybe next time...

We've eaten here twice so far (both times selecting from the grill menu) and each experience has been different. Speaking to others that have dined here, it seems that your experience depends a lot on the server that you get. Both times the food was outstanding, but our first visit was somewhat dulled by the lackluster performance of our server.

Our first visit was a weekday afternoon. We arrived just before 5:00 and it wasn't that busy--plenty of empty seats. We were told it would be about 15 minutes--strange since there were plenty of tables available. The hostesses are dressed in some sort of strange/tacky newsprint style dress that really isn't flattering. It seemed like everyone except the hostesses were busy--they were mostly standing around at the front kiosk chatting with each other.

It only took about 5 minutes to find us a table. The waiter stopped by after a few minutes, dropped off an iPad, and told us to order our drinks through it. No problem, except that it's for alcoholic drinks only and Brenda wanted an iced tea. BTW, you don't order off the iPad, you just browse--what a waste of a perfectly good paperweight. Brenda ordered the Braised Pork Belly with Sauteed Asparagus and I had the Filet Mixed Grill with sides of Creamed Spinach and Smashed Fingerling Potatoes. No starters, but we did snack on the delicious pretzel bread with butter and a cheese sauce. The cheese sauce was nothing spectacular, but the bread was warm and soft and went great with the English butter they brought out. 

From the time we placed our order until the food arrived was about 20 minutes.  Brenda's iced tea finally arrived after the meal was served. The pork belly was delicious--just the right amount of crispiness without being overdone. The asparagus was done to perfection as well. The lemon zest and thyme went perfectly with the sweetness of the asparagus. I had pork belly with my meal, but it just wasn't the same as Brenda's. It was a smaller piece and it seemed it was cooked just a bit too long. Still had the good flavor, but it was just a bit dry. The filet was OK, nothing to rave about, but at least when I ordered it mid-rare, it came that way. The shrimp weren't bad, but I just don't think you can get really fresh, good shrimp in Las Vegas. For me, the stars of the meal were the two sides. The creamed spinach with stilton cheese was perfectly seasoned and really complimented the flavor of the pork belly. The fingerling potatoes had black truffle with small chunks of British double cream. I could have eaten two servings of these. 

We finally got to see our waiter again when he brought us the check. He didn't ask if we wanted dessert or an after dinner drink. Small tip for this bozo. 
All in all, it wasn't a bad experience. The food was as good as we expected, but the front of house staff turned what should have been an enjoyable dining experience into a mediocre one.

Our second visit was much better than the first. We made reservations for 6:30 on a Friday evening to take our friends out for dinner. We were greeted warmly and waited less than a minute for the next available hostess to take us to our table.. It was a nice table away from the bustle of the casino with deep, comfortable chairs. Our waiter was there almost immediately and we were given the menus along with the useless iPad.  We placed our drink orders and before they were there our waiter was ready to take our order.

This visit we had two orders of the Braised Beef Cheek, one Fish and Chips, and I ordered the Grilled Rack of Lamb, replacing the olive oil crushed potatoes the great fingerling potatoes I had last time. Since we passed on starters, we continued snacking on the bread while we waited for the food to arrive. Very busy this night, but the staff didn't seem to be as disorganized as during our first visit. 
Like the last trip, the food was amazing and as before, Brenda picked the better meal. The beef cheeks simple melted in your mouth and the sauce was so rich and tasty, I wanted to dip some of my lamb rack into it. The plate of fish and chips was huge. The batter was crispy without overcooking the fish and the tarragon tartar sauce complimented it well. My lamb rack was cooked perfectly to a medium rare with a nice sear on the outside. The rosemary lamb sauce was tasty without having that overpowering rosemary flavor or odor. All during the dinner, the staff was attentive, refilling our drinks and water glasses. We definitely didn't suffer through the poor service we had the last time around.

This trip we all had dessert and each picked something different to try. Steph had the Potted Triple Chocolate Trifle which she enjoyed, but couldn't finish because of her large portion of fish and chips. Joe had the Spotted Dog (a bread pudding) which was tasty and quickly devoured. Brenda, who loves rhubarb, had the Rhubarb Cobbler. I had the Sticky Toffee Pudding, which I first had at GR Steak, and it was just as good and a few bucks cheaper.
for this $18 burger no lettuce tomato onion pickles (!!) and bun not toasted --medium rare beef was rare -- hey Gordon your cooks here don't have a clue -- please email me a refund

Was staying in Caesar's for the week, so our group decided to try out one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. Overall, had a good experience here. 

Really enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant. Just dimly light enough so that it was intimate, and the servers were very nice and helpful. Our waiter was top-notch - and he even offered to connect us with a promoter for night clubs. The 3 stars is for the food, though. I sampled the pesto chicken sandwich and lamb shepherd's pie. Both were good, but nothing really wowed me. Some other friends tried the maple sage fried chicken sandwich, which they said was delicious (it looked delicious too). 

To summarize, I was slightly disappointed dining at my second Gordon Ramsay restaurant. However, the food is decent according to Vegas standards, as you'll end up paying around ~$30 after tax and tip.

Had dinner here with our friend. This place was DARK, like we could barely see each other dark. The service was whatever, nothing great.

BF just had an appetizer of Toad in a...something? I don't see it on the menu. It was a sausage wrapped in puff pastry, served with a super spicy mustard and onion gravy. The sausage was pretty good, the onion gravy was delish, the mustard was way, way, way hot.

I had Fish & Chips - very under seasoned. The fries were good, but obviously old, they were pretty mushy. The tarragon tarter sauce was tasty, as was the house made ketchup.

My friend had the Shepard's Pie and he thought it was great.

Overall, I thought it was just an okay meal. It wouldn't be on my list of places to try again, but in a pinch, it got the job done.
Yummmm The deviled eggs is been tested or hamburger was really good especially with the ghost pepper cheese

I'm honestly surprised that Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill only has three stars and Gordon Ramsay BurGR has four stars. In my mind it should really be reversed. Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill has nice English pub fare that I would be happy to eat any time. 

My friend and I split the steak and ale pie, fish and chips, lobster mac and cheese, and truffle fries. All were very pleasing! The steak and ale pie was my favorite - the pie filling was fantastic. I wish I could get my own personal stews to have the same bold yet delicate flavor of steak, mushroom, and ale. 

The fish and chips were also satisfying. I am definitely a harsh critic of the batter on the fish (after two years of living in Ireland and eating at my fair share of chippers and pubs) and this one was light and crispy, but still solid. I wish the fish was a bit more seasoned before it was battered, but nothing that couldn't be fixed with some malt vinegar.

The lobster mac and cheese was gorgeous. Exactly the ooey-gooey cheesy consistency I look for in mac and cheese - and filled with lots of lobster chunks and flavor. The truffle fries were also fantastic. The truffle aioli had so many chunks of truffle that I was alternating dipping my fries and fish.

My other two friends ordered the lamb burger and the bangers and mash. Both enjoyed their dishes as well. 

Again, we had a very good meal at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill. I would MUCH rather come back here rather than Gordon Ramsay BurGR any day!

We tried the Hell's kitchen burger. It was not that good. I was expecting more flavor. 
Fries were too garlicky. Service was fast and they made sure we always have full glass drink.

The wait staff was great but the food was just ok, I expected a bigger menu or something unique, but it had neither and what we did order was just average. Considering it was Vegas the price was better then expected.

Tables are a little worn, server poured water and touched all the glasses with the bottle he should learn how to pour some water. People know you never touch the bottle to the glasses in case someone was sick. Then he poured  the women last and the men first, kind of weird. We placed our lunch order at 1:00 and food arrived at 1:46 I think for the wait time the food was ok. Nachos were just ok nothing fancy. I guarantee if Gordon Ramsey wasn't on the cover no one would be here. I would not come back. $21.00 for a burger that is just ok not worth it.

My rating is based on the customer service I received from the Manager, Peter. We had to send our food back and Peter went over the top to make it all right. His customer service skills were Steller!!! And that is rare these days.

Sent back 2 burgers both overcooked and dry ,.really just a huge let down. WAS EXPECTING  more . Sad part is i haven't been eating red meat  for quite a few months and then when I want to cheat and get this crap. Sucks big time

Had a late dinner with the BF (who is a huge Chef Ramsay fan) after seeing Daniel Tosh at The Mirage this past Saturday. 
We shared the lobster rolls, I had the New York strip, and he had the fish & chips.
The lobster rolls were so fresh and tangy, I was tempted to order more!
My steak was cooked just right and was very moist and flavorful and the roasted asparagus that came with it was perfect. My BF's fish and chips were well seasoned and delicious.

Service was great as well. We were a bit intimidated by what seemed like a line as we approached, but everyone was seated promptly. Our server was attentive and our food came out quickly. The only thing that I didn't like was our table. It was right next to another couple, so close it felt like a double date. I think I was sitting closer to the woman next to me than to my BF. Also, it was very noisy which is expected since it is inside a casino, so we couldn't really talk without raising our voices. 

Overall, we had a lovely dinner. I wouldn't recommend coming here for a romantic dinner, but it's great for something more casual.

This place was terrible. We came in for lunch, wanting cheeseburger, and  decided to splurge on Gordon Ramsay. Gotta be good, right? NOT. The fries were so soggy I would venture to call them wet, and cold. and flavorless. The cheeseburger was dry, boring, and also flavorless. We actually did complain (which we never do) and the waiter made some very lame excuses. I wish I could upload a photo here. Go to any other place in Vegas if you are looking for a cheeseburger and fries. and do not spent 60 bucks on this crap.

Probably the biggest disappointment I have had in Vegas. I have been to other restaurants from Gordon Ramsey and have enjoyed them. This one was a fail on most levels.

I found the food to be pretty crappy. Not good flavor profiles at all. All my food was even bland at times. I tried nearly everything that our table of 6 got. Nothing really wowed me.

The service was slow. Not very attentive.

There were 2 positive notes. The sticky toffee pudding (which is one of my favs) was really excellent. I would go back only for desert just for that. I also like the sound track of British music playing.

Aside from that, I think Mr. Ramsey should take a page from some of his own TV shows and go in there and cuss people out for failing to run a good restaurant.  Whoever is in charge there needs a good yelling at.

I once had the pleasure of sitting next to Gordon Ramsay at STK and even snuck a picture.  I did not have the cojones to go chat it up with him (crying inside). 

Just a little claim to fame anecdote.  I hope you guys find it impressive because I tell this story at least 2-3 times a week.

My BF and I are both really big fans of Gordon Ramsay and our favorite show to watch together is Kitchen Nightmare.  This Pub & Grill seemed like a nightmare, to a small degree of course.  One thing Gordon Ramsay boasts on the show is a small fresh menu.  The menu was far from small and seemed to have everything under the sun. 

What I ordered was pretty impressive.  It combined everything I loved.  Scallops, clams, in a chowder broth with BACON.  BACON BACON BACON.  Love me some BACON.  Although the food was delicious the price left me wanting more.  I had the scallop dish and my BF had the fish and chips.  Our tab was nearly $75 with tip.  And, NO we did not order soda or alcohol.

Food here was good but not worth the price.  You are better off going to the food court a few feet away.

'If you don't spot by this place the next time you're in Vegas... consider yourself a f*ckin donkey'. Service was okay but the food was great (a little bit on the heavy side). This place is better then Ramsey's spot in The London Hotel in LA

So unless you want a free meal by having hot creamed spinach and beet greens spilled on you (or a friend) I suggest one of the other thousand restaurants in Vegas. 

Took forever to get served (even waters/drinks) after getting a late reservation. Food and drinks came out slow. took over 45 minutes to get our food after ordering. When the food finally came out the sides were not ready and my steak was already cooling down. We called the manager over to complain and while he was there apologizing, the creamed spinach side finally came and was accidentally dumped on one of our party. Needless to say dinner "was on them" after that. 
The food did not live up to my impression of Gordon Ramsy except in that the kitchen was from hell.

Our waitress tried to be as attentive as possible but this place is a train wreck and I think there are better options around for the money (assuming we had paid)

Beware:  Not as seen on TV.  No exacting standards for perfectly cooked food here.

Appetizers:  Calamari, Toad in a Hole, and Scotch Eggs.  They were all overcooked.

Entree:  Fish & Chips and Shepherd's Pie.  Fish was okay, but the chips were a soggy, greasy mess.  The flavor of the Pie was okay, but the mash potatoes were gummy.  And they had no HP sauce for the pie.  I thought this was supposed to be a British Pub.

Desserts:  Sticky Toffee Pudding and Spotted Dick.  First was not very moist and the latter too rummy.

Definitely not a do-over.  Not a good value and left disappointed.

Food was ok, came here after a show and stopped by to get a bite of something. We had the fish and chips and the steak potpie.
Small serving for the price.

Great food! Loved the ribs and Mac n cheese lobster, 
Our drinks were a bit to strong if a little lighter I might have had two drinks instead of one. 

Overall I had a great time

Service was poor. Waiter cleared table of food prior to finishing the meal. Waitress was non-existent and was somewhat rude. Waited over 10 mins for check and rarely saw her after she took my order. Took another 5 for her to pick up the check and return it for signature. 

Ordered the madras chicken which was good but very spicy. 

I'm guessing if Gordon was here tonight there would be a lot of profanity as the service wouldn't come close to meeting his high standards.
Never been to a real pub that didn't have budweiser.  Suck it Ramsay.
Gordon your staff is so professional, thank you to all staff for making the start of our night so special

Had to eat here because my daughter loves Gordon and his shows.  

I had the pastrami sandwich and the wife and daughter had burgers.  

My wife's burger was WAY under cooked and then when they recoiled it they left of toppings like bacon 

Not to mention the price you pay to eat here it was quite equal.  

Not a bad place but not a great place.  Add the cost in and it's pretty much just ehhhh ok

5 people burgers/sandwiches and a couple of beers over 100.00.
Nothing on menu sounded tasty. Burgers came out tasting overcooked and like it had been sitting out. Gordon Ramsey would have been pissed at what was sent out.

Sorry Gordon but English pub food is for wankers. You don't serve Breakfast and the music is too loud for a Sunday at noon. Get rid of those high top tables also in front or tell your hostess not to seat people there that early in the day.  The lamb burger is a big gooey mess with that goat cheese. Your fries could be a little more crispy too .

I love Gordon Ramsey on tv, but I am not impressed with his restaurants. Average food at best. When I order lobster/shrimp rolls I expect chunks of fresh tender lobster and visible pieces of shrimp. It seem to be shredded. Not very good. Also ordered the fish-n-chips. In a Gordon Ramsey PUB, it should have been the best ever - not so much. Again, very average.

We were recommended to try this place by a friend and it didn't disappoint! We had the awesome beer cheese dip with the pretzels for an appetizer... omg! To. Die. For. And even though the burger was the most expensive burger I've ever had... it was freaking amazing! So where the fries! The place looms awesome, the staff we helpful and super attentive too. Can't wait to go back and try their fish & chips... and I was told they have great drinks too!

this place is such a mood killer...the name is the best thing about this place...bad service...the burger was so ordinary...please go to ur tgif...u will get a better burger in half the price...these big chiefs sell their name...with no control or care about the taste of food or their customers...i guess having a big name...location in caesar palace...will run the place to tourists in vegas...who cares about taste...gord ramsey does not....not recommended...

Food was excellent, service was fast, and waiter was great! My husband and I walked into this restaurant after landing into Las Vegas. We were seated promptly. I thought we would have to wait a while for our food because the restaurant was packed, but the food came out right away! Big+ because I was tired and hungry. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, which was spicy and awesome. I ordered it well done bc I'm pregnant and I can't have it medium-well like I normally order burgers and steaks (my dr said no pink!). I was a bit worried because every time I have attempted to order something well done it comes back charred, which I absolutely hate. However, this burger was cooked to perfection! It is a bit on the expensive side (we paid $60+ for two burgers and two beverages). I expected it because of Gordon Ramsay's name being attached. It did not disappoint! Will revisit next time we are in Vegas!

So firstly we were excited to go here, but from start to finish this place has problems. We were seated and our first server came, took our drink orders and left. My wife opened her menu to find it torn and dirty. Our second server came and so did our drinks, my Guinness had the biggest head ever, I asked it to be topped off server 2 rolled his eyes but did it. My friend had ordered a glass of sparkling wine, but the one on the menu wasn't right, I mean come on update your menu. As to the menu it's not detailed enough 3 of us ordered "toad in the hole" but although the server questioned the order he didn't explain how much food it was, plus they were supposed to come with HP Sauce but didn't, when we asked for some they said they didn't have any (order hadn't come in). The food is ok, but the service is just so, so. One staff member was standing near us drinking Starbucks (bet Mr Ramsey would have something say about that on his TV Show if it was somebody else's restaurant). In the ladies toilets one was damaged and not in use, in both mens and ladies toilets they had huge wicker baskets to put your paper towels in, they looked stupid and tacky. All in all a bad experience.
Tonight we had one of the best servers we've ever encountered. For you foodies out there, Julio knows how to pair food/beverages. A must for a great experience in LV.

Food is average, service is slow, way overpriced. Waited 20 minutes to be seated, waited another 15 minutes for anyone to come for a drink order. People that were seated after us had already ordered food, before we even spoke to a waiter.  Burger was average, fries were cold. Fish and chips, fish was overcooked and dry. One piece was so salty, couldn't eat. I have had better food at a fast food joint, and paid ALOT less. It's obvious Ramsay cares only about the money he makes. If this restaurant had to rely on repeat business, it would be closed in a year. Only bright spot was sticky toffee desert.

Had the pleasure of enjoying happy hour with the best bartender known to man big Ray Ray. He chose the best beers for my friend and I, I was especially excited when he found a beer that I was able to drink to accommodate my gluten intolerance! The truffle fries are a must and the herb ceasar was perfect! Ray Ray is our new BFF!

Had dinner here pre-Elton John concert.  Started with the cheese plate and a bowl of split pea soup.  Cheese was good, paired well with the chutney and the olives.  The split pea soup was stellar.  Thick, big chunks of ham...but only a piece of bread (which was really good, though) to go with it.  Would have preferred saltines (it's a pub, right?). 
For entrees, wife had the fish and chips which was really good, crispy, hot, nice chunks of fish.  Only issue:  asked for "regular" ketchup,for the fries and the waitress said they don't have regular, they add horseradish to it.  Really?  Can't come up off a bottle of ketchup?
I had the shepherds pie, which was also really good.  But it was unbelievably hot (oven hot).  Came in a clay pot which maintained the heat.  A little over the top hot.

I have to say, it seems Gordon Ramsey caved to Vegas pressure and made everything overpriced (like almost everything else in Vegas) at least it sure wasn't the prices one would expect for pub food (especially if you've ever been to a pub in England, the difference is huge!)

No salt and pepper on the table.  That's just pretentious.

Bottom line:  good food, loud restaurant, good people watching, way more expensive than it should have been.
Happy Hour.  The Deviled eggs consisted of rubbery hard boiled egg whites served with a blank blob of yolk filling and another blob of tasteless crab.  Disappointing.  Beer was fine.  Service ok.
Did not reach my expection. Since this is a grill own by Gordon Ramsay.Kidna Disappionted.Especially the scotch egg, curry chicken.They are really.just o-Kay...Probaby won't go there anymore.

Wonderful meal at Gordon Ramsey Pub. Started off with the Onion Soup. One of the best that I have ever had. Next was the Chop Salad. The ingredients were interesting for sure but the avocado dressing brought it all together. The Salmon was my main course and was just as good as the starters. The sauce it was paired with made it very flavorful. The service was on point through out the meal. The restaurant was very clean and not loud, when the atmosphere could make you think different. I would recommend coming back and will for the soup and chopped salad.

My son and I laughed at the bad reviews (especially the one who said she ordered chips and got American fries) but we thought it would be a matter of taste. We love Gordon Ramsay and the Steak restaurant, but I have to say, when I got the bill for $70 at the pub, I did not feel like I just ate a $70 dinner. Son had shepherd's pie, I had fish and chips. It was not presented the way it is in the pictures, so they must have changed something. Nothing was bad. I don't know what I would change, though.

Slow is key word! Not a little bit Terribly slow! 30-45 min for appetizers and the same for the entree! Fish was fishy and small in portion! Appetizer little burger bites were good. Others in my party were not impressed. 

Service people are very nice and personable but the kitchen is a disaster and killer!! For $50 a head plus tip I won't go again! Server was embarrassed by the kitchen. The beer is good and the server was knowledgeable. Even on reflection weeks later - No stars for kitchen -wait time and food (fish) poor! Server 4.0. Overall 1 stars. December 26. Unfortunately the service cannot overcome the food since that's why I came.

I would caution accepting high reviews on face value. Appears they must have had a stellar opening and served drinks because the good reviews rarely focused on the Dinner food but liked the bar. Guess it depends on if you are there to eat or drink!

Overall, I left my short trip to Vegas feeling I had wasted one good meal opportunity given the price there are just too many other outstanding choices to waste a dollar or precious time here! Appears Mr. Ramsey is better that hyping his restaurant and TV shows than producing it in his restaurant. Save your time and money.

Arrived with mid-level expectations -- celebrity restaurant in a LV casino. We were very disappointed. Hostesses were blase at best. Server was friendly but seemed stressed/overworked. It felt as if they had to accommodate some huge party unexpectedly. Drinks took 15 mins. 

My $40 tenderloin was overcooked but I dare not complain given the spotty service.

That aside, all food was very tasty. Fries I would guess are NOT house made - a slight disappointment.  You set high expectations but clearly you overextended. Shame on you, Ramsey!!! Service atrocious.

Some woman (not our server) delivered our truffle fry starter without even looking at our table -- almost dropped the plate. Thus was pretty aggregious. 

Overall, food 4 stars, service (better yet, restaurant management, 1 star). I leave sad.

Grabbed a reservation early to eat before the Elton John show. While this was a great idea in theory, it still took 40 minutes to get our food and we ended up eating quickly and dashing out to make the show. It seems the food for other tables came out within 10 minutes of ordering before and after ours hit the table, so maybe ours got caught up in a rush...

Food was average. Had the chicken salad sandwich and fries. There wasn't a lot of chicken salad and it was just okay. The fries were better. The other thing we got was the pub sliders and a side Caesar salad. Each of those were solid but not mind-blowing.

Service was friendly. Seems like it could be a cool place, but just didn't hit all the marks for me.
Great service and food was real delicious and came out pretty quick. Loved the vibe in the restaurant. I had the beef sliders. They were a little small in portion, but very tasty.

My expectations were high going to a restaurant owned by Gordon Ramsey restaurant, this restaurant exceeded my expectations.

We had Michael who was a fantastic server, very professional, kind and seemed to check on us at the exact right intervals. The water is pretty delicious, and comes in a unique bottle.

The draft beer selection could be better, but you can't go wrong with a Dogfish head IPA.

I would suggest asking your server for food suggestions, they really know what they are talking about, and also if your into splitting your meal with your date it might be a good idea to taste different dishes. 

I had the lamb burger which was delicious and I highly recommend you try it.

This is a very unique dining experience and it is a must do if your in Vegas.

A big special thank you to Michael and Randall who made our dinning experience wonderful, you guys are fantastic.

Kitchen Nightmares...

For years we watched Gordon Ramsay sweep into a restaurant, point out the inadequacies of the food and staff, whip everyone into shape and leave the owners and patrons happy. Well Gordon needs to visit his own restaurant. We waited over an hour for our food and when it finally arrived it came to the table in bits and pieces, even though there were only four of us. Two salmon dishes came out first and by the time the other two dishes came out, the salmon was cold. Gone are the days when the server knows who ordered what, now it's like an auction. At this price point, with only 4 diners the food should arrive at the same time and the server should be able to figure out the orders. One member of our group ordered the shepherds pie, it was very hot around the edges but really cold in the middle. This is one of Ramsay's signature dishes and it should have come to the table properly cooked. We sat in a booth and the seats were too low for the table, which was uncomfortable. The white wine glasses were very small, not conducive to enjoying the wine...I felt like a child seated at the big table and given a kids glass of wine. Our server was distracted and appeared overworked. Almost everything at Cesare's Palace is overpriced, as is this restaurant, but we don't mind paying if the food & service is good and the seating comfortable...this restaurant doesn't meet the standard of it's owner. Big disappointment.
I had the Caesar Salad with grilled chicken. The salad was a little short on dressing, otherwise deliscious. The chicken was overlooked and very dry. Very dissapointed.

This place is lively and full of energy. Service was good. They always checked up on you. The mini pub burgers were awesome according to my son. The roasted tomato soup was good according to my daughter. My wife loved the fish and chips. The lobster mac n cheese was disappointing. It was dry and was not worth $25 for a side. The red wine short ribs were also disappointing. It did not have much flavor (kind of bland) Overall, my family loved it, but i did not.

Just like an amazing guy you met the night before, Gordon Ramsay's meal was on my mind the next morning...and I'm wondering how did I get so lucky??!  I started out night keeping my expectations low, I hate being disappointed. I started with a cocktail, the "Goodbye Blue Sky". It was a delicious concoction of blueberry vodka, sparkling wine, & chambord. For my main, I had the NY Strip w the butter bernnaise sauce. Even though it was a bit overdone (my fault for asking medium-well instead of medium), it was tender, flavorful, and absolutely THE BEST steak I've had. The accompanying grilled asparagus was cooked perfectly too.  My friend had the lamb, and at a bit too rare for me, it was damn tasty also.  We shared a side of lobster mac' n cheese. All I can say about this dish is OMFG!! With the first bite my eyes were rolling to the back of my head....the cheeses, the perfect macaroni, and the lobster....the LOBSTER! There were whole claws of meat....it was perfection!  We shared the spotted doc for dessert.  The bread pudding was just right, and the sauce not too sweet.  Yes, I'll be thinking of this meal for a while with much fondness and awe.....and know that since I have proof with the pics I took that yes, it really did happen. :)

Today I came into Ramsay's expecting great food and great service like I had in BURGR. I was sadly disappointed. The server Scott Hines, barely came around to our table, we had waited extremely long for our food, and when we were finally done he took over 30 minutes to take the last plate (mine) and bring the bill (which took him about 10 minutes to pick up our cards). The place was not busy in the slightest, so there and was really no excuse.

As for the food. The second star goes to the good salad dressing and herbs on the "herb Caesar salad with chicken" and my friends who got a good lamb burger and chicken sandwich. The chicken in my salad however was extremely dry and lacking of flavor, moisture, or anything good in chicken. I recommend going to BURGR, or the steak place in the Paris Hotel if you are looking for good food or service. And I also recommend sending Steve on one of Ramsay's TV shows so he can learn how to serve properly especially under the name of Ramsay.

My wife and I came here to treat our uncle to dinner because he was visiting. We had the following:

Appetizers:
1/2 dozen Lolli-pop chicken wings $12
Scotch Egg $11

Entrees:
Chopped salad $16
12 oz Grilled Ribeye $39
12 oz grilled NY Strip $37

Sides:
Forest Mushrooms $11
Sauteed Brussel Sprouts $11

Dessert:
Sticky Toffee Pudding $11

Drink
Innis & Gunn $8

This meal was probably one of the best meals I've had in vegas. The scotch egg appetizer was pretty good with a nice bbq sauce and it came with marinated vegas. The chicken wings were not actually wings but drumettes. The sauce was AMAZING! It tasted like a honey, bbq, sweet chili, and hot sauce all in one. This is probably the appetizer I've in vegas. I would have to put this in my top appetizer list with Carson Kitchen's Bacon Jam. 

Now to the entrees. My wife said her salad was good with a lot of texture going on with the chicken, chickpeas, avocados, shrimp, etc. My ribeye was perfectly seasoned and cooked to medium. I liked how there were 3 sauces you could choose from (i forgot the names) but the one I got tasted like an au jus. My uncle said his strip was great and he got a gravy looking sauce. The sides were great too. The pork belly that was sautéed with the brussel sprouts were melt in you mouth...so bad yet so good.

The sticky toffee pudding is Gordon Ramsay's signature dessert. That too was WINNAHS! (excuse my Hawaiian accent). It came with a toffee sauce and vanilla ice cream. It didn't taste as sweet as I thought it would be. I was so curious to know why that i actually researched it afterwards and found out that this dessert is made with dates and brown sugar. 

My uncle and I also tried the Innis $ Gunn beer. Our waiter, John, said its Gordon Ramsay's favorite beer. We both thought it was very smooth with a nice foam on top. It paired well with our meal.

Overal, I would definitely come back again. The ambience was great and we were lucky enough to sit next to the tvs. Kudos to our waiter John for the great service.  The chicken appetizer and the sticky toffee pudding were definitely the stand outs. I've  been to his Burger resto in planet hollywood and now this one. Two down, one more GR resto to go!

If you've got money to spend and a less than discriminating palate this is the place for you.  Look, I'm not saying it's bad but for $50 I expect better than bar food.  Just saying.  Fortunately for Gordon Ramsay most people in vegas are traveling on expense accounts.

Sadly, I have to give Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill at Caesars Palace, Las Vegas, a less than stellar review. I can only muster the kindness to give this restaurant two stars.  I must admit, that were my rating based solely on my latest dining experience there, I would give the restaurant three stars, and, had I based my review solely on my first dining experience there, I would have given four stars.  I'm sure that you will ask, "How does the average of 3 and 4 equal two?"  The answer: disappointment.

This will sound silly, but bear with me.  The reason I returned to P&G after my first visit is also the reason I will not return: potatoes.  Specifically, two potato dishes: the Potato Puree and the Pub Fries.  These were not ordinary mashed potatoes and French fries.  These were a demonstration of what a potato can taste  like if a fine-dining approach is taken when preparing ordinary dishes.  Every now and again you taste a dish and experience it for the first time all over again.  Such was my experience with the fries and mashed potatoes at P&G.  They made me feel that, as a foodstuff, potatoes have much more potential that I had previously imagined.  

The key to their french fries was the cooking technique: thick-cut potato planks, steamed, then lightly coated in seasoned flour, then deep-fried, then baked.  The result:  a hearty potato plank with a crispy outer crust that created the perfect seal to keep steam inside.  When you cut into them, you discovered a steamy, flaky potato meat.  These fries did not need any condiments whatsoever, and highlighted how good a potato can taste if treated properly 

The mashed potatoes had a beautiful flavor.  The fluffy peaks of this dish were topped off with a drizzle of a chive infused olive oil that exploded in your mouth, filling your entire palette with the aroma of garden-fresh chives.  The key to this explosion was temperature of the potatoes: served piping hot.

On my second visit, I ordered these two side dishes again.  This time, the Pub Fries were plain, old french fries, and slightly soggy at that.  The mashed potatoes were a salty, gluey concoction that someone had tried to repair by thinning it out with copious amounts of cream and butter.  They were served cold.  

Other highlights of the evening: arrived at 7:15pm and checked in for my 7:15pm reservation.  The hostess forgot to check me in, and when I made eye-contact with her every time she seated a walk-in customer before me, she quickly looked away and left the podium.  I approached a different hostess and was seated right away.  I ordered the seared scallops: scallops were seared on one side only. They were served in a bland seafood broth, with carrots, and artichoke hearts.  Not flavorful at all.  I ordered an espresso with dessert and it arrived cold.  The chocolate mousse trifle was sensational, though.

At any rate, I believe that what happened to this restaurant is not  so much carelessness on the part of its founder or staff.  It is a reaction to the caliber of the customer.  I spoke to the manager about the food, and he admitted that they had to change some recipes because their customers did not see the value in waiting extra time for french fries to be cooked three ways or for mashed potatoes to be prepared to order.  So, they have turned from their fine-dining philosophy to a food-mill philosophy: crank out orders.

And that is where the disappointment lies.  P&G once provided a fine-dining take on British pub fare.  It now caters to the lowest common denominator and provides tourists a place to grab a quick bite and gain some bragging rights: "I went to Vegas and ate at Gordon Ramsay's.  You know?  That guy from TV?"

Sadly, the Gordon Ramsay on TV is no longer anywhere to be found at P&G.  The Gordon Ramsay on TV preaches fine ingredients,  food prepared to perfection, good seasoning, good service, consistency, and, above all, passion and pride.  Where is the pride to be found when you don't stand by your food, and, instead, you cut corners to ramp up production.

Sorry, that's not fine-dining.  That's a factory.  I'll gladly drop $20 at Applebee's for factory food.  Not $200 at Gordon Ramsay's.

Well it was my husbands birthday and to treat him to a nice dinner we decided on the newly opened Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill.
 I had made reservations for 8pm, but we arrived around 7:30pm. There was a bit of a back up at the hostess booth. They were having trouble deciding who to seat first and there wasn't really in order to it. A little bit chaotic if you ask me, especially for a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.
