We tried the fish and chips..... Best we've ever had. Light/fluffy and very tasty. We also had the pork chops that had good flavor and cooked perfect. 

The service was good. Different than what I expected.....but in a good way. Friendly and engaged..... Even saw the manager having fun with the guests.

Yes its Vegas expensive, but overall, a great stop'

Went out with friends and ordered 2 rub eye steaks rare and medium rare unfortunately it came out medium rare and well done! The quality of the rib eye was mediocre at best. The devil eggs with crab and bacon tasteless typical of British food ! The curry chicken was spicy but bland and we could have ate at an authentic Indian restaurant. Would not recommend to this horrible place and it's all hype!!
The only reason we ate here was the close proximity of Mariah Carey show !!

We are locals to Las Vegas and this restaurant was a hard reminder on why we don't go to strip restaurants. Service was non existent. Server came to our table, took our order and we never saw him again until he dropped the check. No menu explaining, no restaurant story, no nothing. Your typical union environment that you can tell no one working wanted to be there. 

Food was all extremely bland. I can't say it was bad but it had absolutely no "pop" in flavor whatsoever. I would expect more but given the location it's your typical get them in and get them out tourist trap mentality. 

If you are a tourist reading this please try some of Las Vegas's better restaurants. Like the goodwich, Carson Kitchen, Other Mama or Glutton.

Great dinner! Made reservations for a late dinner and we were seated promptly. We both started with the onion soup which was the best we both have ever had. My wife had the fish and chips which she said were also the best she ever had, I had the beef burger, which was delicious and much better than the burger we had at his burgur restaurant at planet hollywood. Food is not cheap so be prepared but it's a celebrity chef so expect to pay for the name in front.

Over-priced pub food with a celebrity name. Fun theme, varied menu, and great service but only so-so food. 

We love all things Gordan Ramsey, just not sure if this is an accurate highlight of his talents. 

The butter chicken curry is supposedly one of the star dishes which takes for days to prepare. While the chicken was tender and the curry was decent, the basmati rice was actually one of my favorite parts of the dish. The naan was a pretty charred (which the boyfriend actually loved... Me, not so much) and the yogurt tasted like it was just plain yogurt with a bit of citrus.  I'd take lower-quality Indian buffet food over this for a fraction of the price. 

The charcuterie board came with slightly more than a single serving of each item and the cheeses of the night were a Cabot cheddar (wait, can't I get a while block of this at the store?) and what I think was a drunken goat cheese... Something that sounded oddly close to a featured cheese they had at Trader Joe's the other day... 

Over all not impressed. Kind of a let down for such a big name. What a gimmick.
The food was incredible.  Had the deviled eggs and mocha martini.  Brilliant.  Server was nice but took entirely too long to get to our table.  Bonus for bondage drag the servers were wearing.

Came here for dinner. Had the truffle chips (fries), fish & chips and a Crispin cider. The truffle chips were good before the meal. The fish & chips had a nice crispy outside that stayed crispy even after putting malt vinegar on it (Must be sorcery). The flavor was good but not the best that I've had. The Crispin cider is good for anyone that doesn't drink beer, like me. The food was fine but the thing that was a shame was our server. He wasn't bad, but he wasn't that good either. He was fine, but he seemed a bit robotic. He didn't have much of a personality and would give very short answers. He checked on us and made sure we were ok, so I guess that's what is really important. Don't need to come back on my own, but if my friends want to come back, I wouldn't refuse.

Came here on Friday night...we had a reservation for 6 but we kept calling to put the time back (6 girls getting rdy is no joke!). The server was really accommodating to us.


-- AMBIANCE --
Really cute decorations..you can see Gordon's face on a lot of walls. Also Britain flags, very cute. Waiters and waitress dressed in black and white. The skirts were cute.

-- FOOD --
We had the corn soup first. It was pretty good (3.5/5) We all order the BEEF CHEEKS with MASHED POTATOES...it was very delicious (4.5/5). My beef cheek didn't even need a knife. It was very tender. However, one of the beef cheek my friend had was a little hard. Maybe they need to work on the consistency of the entrees. But I was very happy with my plate. We also had an extra order of ASPARAGUS (5/5)...its sooooo good!! You must try it! YUMMM

-- PRICING --
Its a little pricey....but what do you expect? Its vegas + Gordan's name is on it. Some things are definitely worth the price.

-- SERVICE --
Our waitress was very friendly. She had a lot of conversations with us. She came and checked in on us on a regular. Oh and did I mention she is also very cute. They only thing I think they can improve on is getting water to the customers ASAP. We waited about 10 minutes or so before we got menus and water. 

-- OVERALL --
Definitely still a fan of Gordan's!! Will definitely come back =)

Short rib and beef cheek sandwich pretty delicious. Not $24 delicious but def still tasty

I would say all in all a good experience with a nice hefty Vegas price tag to go with some scrumptious pub food

I am a fan of Gordon Ramsay's television shows, so I was pleased when friends said they wanted to go to dinner at one of his restaurants. Since the group wanted a more casual dining experience, we decided to try the Pub & Grill. Sadly, I was not very impressed. 

We had reservations for a Sunday evening. I was disappointed when I saw that we were being seated at a table that was right next to a busy bussing station. It was not comfortable, and it was loud.  The noise made conversation difficult so it felt like we waited a long time for orders to be taken and food to arrive.  Service in general could have been a lot more friendly and attentive. 

I had the Shepard's Pie . It was fine, a good sized portion, but not something I would recommend or rush back for. Prices are high, even for for the strip. I think I'd be more likely to overlook food that was just average if the environment had been more comfortable. 

I'm still a Gordon Ramsey fan but for me, the Pub is a pass.

I was so disappointed. . . I love Gordon and am a Huge fan of his shows, books, cooking, and yes, was so looking forward to his pub here in Vegas.. But
in the form of his words it was pure " S.H.I.T." I am not sorry.. but it was 
nothing but just that. Short with the Food and horrible service.. It's like a crowd of ducks quaking and not knowing what to do.  .  . Even the Mater D was horrifying. 
The fish was uncooked and over cooked for my Fish and chips. The Potatoes were so thick it's hardly a Chip! RIDICULOUS OVER PRICED NASTINESS! 
GORDON WHAT WERE YOU THINKING!!!! This joint needs help~ Seriously Real HELP! 
I also, hope you can choose a better outfit for your waitresses ... They are horrifying!! 
OH BLAH!!! Maybe i'll be back in 6 months once they have worked out all their Kinks but I will not be having the Fish and chips again... So... Sad... So Heart broken...

OK.  Entree came out before the appetizer.  Not sure if I misread the menu but...but I was very disappointed with the BLT.  The pork belly was good but no bacon?  Really want a BLT that has crispy bacon.  Wouldn't eat here again.  Service...so so compared to what you see on TV.  Disappointing.  Not at all what I expected from Gordon Ramsey.  Live and learn.

Came on Tuesday night specifically for The Scuffle!!!! I had been craving it for so long, its one of my favorite drinks! But of course, they were out of the Guinness cream which completes the drink! That was a huuuuge bummer.... One server said he doesn't think they'll get the Guinness cream like AT ALL anymore which saddened me even more =[

We enjoyed the sticky toffee pudding! And Antwon was a pleasure. Every time I go there, he's at the same corner of the bar polishing glasses-- he is such a great character, he needs to actually tend bar, make the good $$$, and do what he does best.... INTERACT WITH GUESTS!! I came in New Years Eve, nearly 10 months ago, sat at the bar visited our friend who was the General Manager at the time, and Antwon was doing the same thing then-- COME ON, time for a promotion?!! Team Antwon!

3 stars. I think my expectations were too high, sadly I was let down. The service was great. Our server even came to our rescue when he noticed our table was a bit wobbly (not a big deal but with the stemware they give you, it's easy to see why this could potentially be a disaster). 
Okay the table is fixed and our orders are in. It didn't take long at all for our meals to arrive. I got the pub burger, my friend ordered the pork belly. They were just okay. Nothing to write home about. Forgettable. I think I'll try Gordon Ramsay BurGR next time instead.

I am not sure why anyone gave this place a low rating. It was 4 of us. Place was packed and we were hungry. They initially told us long wait time but when we explained we had a conference we needed to get to they made it happen! Good was really good! I had the Butter Squash Soup which I was soooo good! And I also had a taste of one of my counterparts dish which was the pesto chicken sandwich. It was simply scrumptious!!! This is a celebrity owned restaurant and in my opinion lives up to the expectations!

Expect to pay top dollar don't whine about paying over the top prices in Gordon Ramsay's restaurant inside Caesar's Palace.

Ok on to the review.
The service we received was fun and what I would hope for from any restaurant in Vegas. The food game out quickly and correct. The ambiance is nice. People watching from the railing tables was amazing. 
Food: I ordered the bangers and mash and it was wonderful. I see a lot of complaints about the portion but it was a nice size. No need for you to have a feeding trough amount of food. The mash was full of flavor and was perfect texture. I ordered the sticky toffee pudding for dessert and it was out of this world! 
My husband ordered the 14 oz ribeye and it was cooked to perfection and needed none of the sauce choices. He ordered his sauce on the side and never needed to touch it since the steak stood perfect alone. 

So yes it's expensive but don't go to any restaurant on the strip and expect McDonald's prices for a buffet amount of food....
I highly recommend the pub if you want a awesome meal.

In April 2015 my fiance and I celebrated his birthday in Las Vegas. We had a wonderful dinner at Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill.  It was so delicious we returned in 2016.  I had to have the beer - braised short ribs again because they were so delicious.   I wasn't disappointed the first time and the second time was even better.   My fiance had the lamb chops  last year and  this time he enjoyed a juicy steak that was cooked just right.

Both of us also had the awesome lobster mac 'n' cheese and of course the sticky toffee pudding for dessert. 

The food was super delicious, but what really keeps us going back is the service.  Manager Randy G. totally rocks when it comes to hospitality.  We had the pleasure of meeting him during our first visit and he actually remembered us when we returned a year later.  In addition, Daisy and Lisa took great care of us making sure we had everything we needed to enjoy our meal.  

Thank you Randy, Daisy and Lisa... we'll see you the next time we're in Vegas.

Cute Place burger Was GOOD..not at all great very Dry and the bread dry as well fries were very good . Staff was nice food planet Hollywoodish. Cool place to have a beer more novelty than restaurant. . Grab a drink with friends and eat elsewhere.

Stopped in for dinner after seeing a show, and had the best beer-battered fish & chips I ever ate.  The only reason for not giving a 5-star review is the price was a bit too high for a fish & chips dinner, regardless how awesome they were.  (And, I was a little disappointed that they were out of Stone IPA.)

When I saw that my brothers chose a famous chef's restaurant for dinner inside Caesars Palace I was excited to try it out. It's actually a pub. After waiting 30-minutes for a table of 7, we were ushered to a table with bar stools! They were cushioned, but when I sat down I sunk into the stool and felt like a toddler in a high chair. The first thing I noticed on the menu were the prices! Holy cow! Very pricey! The 2nd thing I noticed was the menu was limited. I decided to just drink water and my hubby and I split a 14oz steak for $38. It came with asparagus.. That's it! No salad. No soup. I can get a way better meal for the same amount at Berns Steak house here in Tampa. But this is Vegas. We ended up ordering the cheesy cauliflower also. As for the taste, the steak was quite tasty and I did enjoy it. The asparagus was average and the cauliflower was tasty.  Would I come here again? Maybe if I was going to watch a sporting event for drinks and split an appetizer but there are too many other choices in Vegas.

We loved everything about it!  The wings and short rib nachos were our favorites. The drinks were on point as well. The only thing I didn't like was the seating. We got sat at a low table with large chairs and I'm only 5'4" so my feet wouldn't touch the floor. I would definitely recommend having drinks and apps here for sure!
Great lamb burgers. Service was pretty quick despite how busy it was on a holiday week end. I would recommend if you're looking for a good old fashion burger in sin city

A bit apprehensive given the reviews but we really enjoyed the experience. The place looks great and the food and service will get there with a little time. Love the interior design and the place was packed with a 15 minute wait! We sat at the bar Matt was awesome. Place mats are very English pub looking... Love the plate presentation.

the selection of draft beers is fantastic. they even offer a draft hard apple and pear ciders. the pear was amazing and Matt was happy to let me try a sample of the apple as well.

We started with the duck poutine and the warm pretzels. Pretzels were wonderful and the English mustard was super spicy and delicious. Duck poutine was good but not a lot of confit for the price.

Fish and Chips was a mixed bag. the fish was excellent, cooked perfectly with a great malt vinegar presentation. We did not care for the "Chips" the french fries served witht he Poutine were much better.

Sticky toffee pudding an excellent. Peanut butter and Jelly dessert needed work. If I am in the Forum SHops or going to an event/show at Caeser's I will be back.

Lots of great things on the menu I still want to try.

The dual pricing Regular menu price/Harrah's club member pricing truly INSULTING and fit for a Casino buffet not a world class chef

My wife had a pesto chicken sandwich with the "Danny Boy" to drink. I had the fish and chips and an "Innis & Gunn" beer (they recommended I pair with the f&c). We both really enjoyed our meal and the drinks. Everything tasted so fresh. The cod was thick with a nice batter and it came with An excellent pea mash which totally took us by surprise how good it was. My wife's sandwich was really good and had tons of flavor.
The food was amazing. Service was great. For my first time being here it really held up to the expectations I had in mind.

The four of us thoroughly enjoyed our experience here.
While I did not like the decor much, the service was excellent, no problems whatsoever.  The pretzels with the dipping sauce were very tasty, and difficult to stay away from.  Our party ordered the Scottish salmon, two orders of Fish and Chips, and the rack of lamb.  All entrees were praised, although the Fish and chips were a bit too salty for one of us. The rack of lamb was the best I have ever tasted. I also really loved the Ramsay tonic cocktail, and am still searching the internet for a recipe for it.  The cocktail was exactly what I expected from Gordon - imaginative, a bit innovative, and delicious.  We all the had the sticky toffee pudding and it did not disappoint.  it was not a cheap meal, but worth it.

I'm not much of a Ramsay fan outside of him trashing Amy's Baking Company on the infamous episode of Kitchen Nightmare, but one co-worker I was with on my recent Vegas lives for Ramsay.  She wanted to go to the Pub, BurgR, the Steakhouse, and any other taco stand or dumpling house he might open next week.

I think I can best sum up the experience with a what I liked vs what I didn't like list:

I liked that is was not a stuffy restaurant.  The atmosphere and decor was fun and inviting.
I liked the non traditional table I was at with 2 large, cushy chairs on one side, and a couch on the other (you might not like this)
I liked the huge beer list.
I really liked my lamb chops.  The food got high marks by everyone at the table for quality and prep.

I did not like the drink list on the ipad.  It did lead to some great conversation about if we though we could get away with stealing the Ipad...but, with 4 of us at the table, and only 1 Ipad, it was a rush job to look thru the 100+ beers separate onto different web pages by category.  In the interest of time, I just picked an old, well known favorite vs. something rare or reading up and trying something new.

...and finally, what killed the experience...the serving size.  Upon looking at all the dinners as they came out, my initial though was, 'they know we did not order of the kiddie menu, right?'  While my lamb chops were great, there was only 4 lil chops for a serious price.  By contrast, Firefly, a well known local tapas restaurant, offers a $10 tapas plate with 2-3 pieces, and while maybe not as awesomely seasoned, it's still very good over there.  My Irish buddy got the Sheppards pie, and while he admitted it might be better than what momma made him...the size of it was seriously laughable.  I was not surprised when I heard he picked up more to eat.

As for that drink Ipad...Our best idea was to list it on Craigslist and sell it for cheap for immediate cash only, with an exchange in the bathroom, and quickly paying the tab in cash...and defiantly not returning to Caesars on this trip.  I'm just saying, if you ever see it on craigslist, don't go buy an Ipad from a guy in the mens room of Ramsay's Pub & Grill, it might some other guy with a clever but flawed idea.

The food tasted alright, but I'm not sure if that burger is really worth a whole $20. The following day I ate at Smash Burger, and that tasted as good, for less than half the cost. Given that Gordon Ramsey's name is attached to this place, I came in with higher than normal expectations and came out feeling that there was more to be desired. Excellent service though.
Sticky toffee pudding is a must have...i had brisket sandwich with fries...perfectly executed...husband said the fish and chips were awesome...definitely worth every penny :)

Gordon Ramsay has several restaurants in Vegas, but by Vegas standards, this one is probably my least favorite.

I say Vegas standards, because, in my opinion, you can be more discerning here. There are just so many fantastic restaurants here, and they're all pretty much walking distance from one another.

I've been here twice now. This last time, I was here for a convention, and actually favored going to Mesa Grill, however, the wait was ridiculous, so Gordon Ramsay Pub & Grill it was.

I digress, onto the food.

I've had their grilled beef burger as well as their grilled lamb burger. My issue with their burgers is mostly their bun. It could stand being a bit more fresh. It's on the drier, crumbly side. Maybe people just don't order enough burgers here, so their bread doesn't move as fast? For a burger at the $20 mark, it should pretty much be flawless. Their fries are good, and the patties themselves are great.

For a much, much better overall burger, go to Gordon Ramsay BurGR, located inside Planet Hollywood.

Service is spot on, and the interior looks great.

Food: 2
Ambience: 5
Service: 5
Value: 2

One word: Eh. That's how my experience here was. I order the pistachio pesto chicken sand which.. It lacked flavor and was  "warm" at best when I bit into it. The truffle fries were good and I liked the aioli dipping sauce. My mom ordered the fish and chips. The fish was lightly battered and were good sized.. But hers too was just warm. I really like the goodbye blue sky cocktail though. However, with these kind of prices, I was expecting better quality food. Especially since "Gordon Ramsey" put his name on it! (He has nerve yelling at all those hopeful chefs! Lol) definitely skip this place if you are at the Caesars.. We should have just opt'd for the food court. Less money and probably same quality, if not better food!

This review is only for the Sticky Toffee Pudding. 

Come here for the Sticky Toffee Pudding!

What is Sticky Toffee Pudding?

It is Sticky, Toffee and Pudding... 

Ok, really, it is a mini baked Date cake, drizzled in warm toffee/caramel sauce and served with vanilla ice cream.   If you like the warm chocolate cakes out there, you would enjoy this too. 

If you are not having dinner, and you just want dessert, they can serve you at the bar. Bartenders are nice, and sometimes you hear interesting conversations from the people at the bar.
Very good pub food. Had the Pub Spots, Deviled Eggs and Crisps I recommend this place.

Love this place! Always have and always will continue to come here though it's a tourist attraction restaurant and can be pricey. This is probably my 7th or 8th visit and I can't get enough of the food! The braised short rib is to die for and the sticky toffee pudding is a can't miss. Tonight we had Rodney as our server and he was amazing. I honestly dont think there is any celebrity restaurant in Vegas that can beat Gordon Ramsey and the service is always wonderful. Rodney was friendly and there everytime we needed him. I will be back for sure!
A good place for English food. We had lunch there. Quality food and great wait staff.

Stopped in for drinks and end up having dinner.  We sat up at the bar and had wonderful service, the atmosphere was great and our drinks and food was awesome.  I had the grilled pub burger that to me was the best burger I have had in a while.  My husband had the fish n chips and he said they were really good.  I will certainly go again.  Our bartender was friendly and very attentive.  The Ramsay signature drink if you like cucumber and gin was the bomb.

I love the Ramsey's burger place at Planet Hollywood, so I tried the pub one at Cesear's Palace this time.  Comparing the 2, the burger one at Planet Hollywood is definitely better.  The truffles chips (fries) are great, but you get a lot more at their burger restaurant than at the pub.  I had the salmon.  The sauce was too rich so I couldn't finish it.  Overall, it was expensive and not worth it.  Lunch was over $40/person---no alcohol.  I will go back to the Ramsey Burger next time.

Unimpressed for a  Gordon Ramsay restaurant! Of all his restaurants that I've been to (a lot) this was by far my least favorite. The scotch egg was good, so was the truffle fries. The pub burgers were good. The curry rice was just ok, and the rice they served me was old and crunchy. The bread for the curry had burnt marks that made me feel like I was eating charcoal. The salmon which was suppose to be their special dish was very dry. We also got the Brussels sprouts which had a good flavor but were way too hard to eat. Such a bummer, our last day in Vegas and we were looking forward to a good meal! The night before we are at BLT and it was very good! Not visiting this place again, there was nothing special.

I have been a huge fan of Gordon's for years and watched almost all of his shows. Hells Kitchen, Kitchen Nightmares, and the like but by far my favorite has always been 'the F word'. Now maybe it's because he has all those shows and how critical he is that we are eager to experience a GR restaurant! And of course he did not make my meal today and anytime you build large restaurants (franchises) then there will always be some loss of fidelity. Having said that - I was excited to try the pub here. First of all if you're gonna name it a Pub your prices shouldn't reflect that of 5 star steak house. That aside (it's Vegas - inside Caesars after all). I ordered a beer and an app at the bar oh and a water. The calamari I ordered was dreadful - it tasted more like deep fried salt pellets, which is to say that someone dumped so much salt on this dish that I'll not be tasting anything for the next 3 days. The only saving grace was the awesome water that came in a clean as opposed to my $11 pint of peroni which didn't. See picture of water below.  
Dare I say that Gordon or his staff failed in the hiring of the staff for this place - and perhaps has gotten a little smitten with himself and lost touch a little because the decor and staff uniforms are just pretentious wank! Maybe he should put this place on restaurant nightmares or get kitchen crashed or something. Sorry but being spread as thin as he is is no excuse it still falls on his rep - this place....FAIL! I would give a half more star if I could for the staff courtesy in dealing with my shocking food and delivering great H2o.

Never have had such a bad dinner... Went there  to celebrate a birthday everyone's meal was wrong including the Gluten Free one which my aunt got sick ... Waitress was slow and didn't have a clue .. Steak was cold not cooked .. Stay away

I'm a huge Gordon Ramsay fan, so I was really looking forward to visiting Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill!  We showed up about an hour before they closed, so it wasn't too busy.  The service was generally very good, though it took a little while to get the check.

I ordered the pesto chicken sandwich, which was amazing!  The chicken was cooked perfectly, and the zucchini bread balanced the pesto and roasted red peppers beautifully.  The kettle chips were only okay, and were a little hard for my taste.  I also ordered a side of swiss chard, which was wonderfully rich!  The Goodbye Blue Sky drink was excellent as well.

My husband got the classic fish and chips and absolutely loved the cook and flavor!  We never knew the "mushy peas" could be so good :)

I would highly recommend!

From the moment we arrived the service was fast and very friendly with the staff talking to you like people and not just another customer. Even with our large party there was no issues. Very friendly atmosphere. The food was excellent and beer on tap great. Would highly recommend the scotch egg.

It took 40 minutes to get our burger,
Service was horrible.we asked for 16oz beer he brought 20oz.He should ask if that is ok. 
Never came to do quality check. I asked Medium burger but I got served well done. We Eye contacted him and he turned his back and left.He did not even come and even give us our bill we had to ask someone else to get our check.

I was so looking forward to this after being a total Gordan Ramsey fan. It took 20min to be seated (with a reservation). 45 min before we finally got sorted and had drinks. They ran out of prosecco, they ran out of the beef Wellington special. The steak came out like it had been microwaved from the night before, we sent it back. 
Service was slow, the manager had to come over and readjust the bill and apologise for our experience. Appreciated the discount and free dessert to rectify but 
so disappointing seeing how high Gordan Ramsey's standards are on his show, compared to our experience. It felt like he needed to do a kitchen nightmare on his own resturant tonight.

The bf and I are avid Gordon Ramsay show watchers. We came on our first night in Vegas because we couldn't decide where to eat and this sounded as good as anything. 

We were totally stoked on the complimentary pub cheese & pretzel sticks, which were filling and delish. 

I ordered the shepherds pie which was tasty and very hearty. He ordered the fish and chips which he seemed at least satisfied by. 

I think I really wanted to try the sticky toffee pudding but I was so full by the end of the shepherds pie that it was just not gonna happen. 

I don't necessarily know that I'd go back on my next trip to LV, but I wouldn't be opposed to it either.

What the what? We had lunch here today and I am so confused by the experience. For a restaurant with this namesake, I expected a much better experience than what we got, especially if it's going to be $120 lunch.
After being seating by the hostess we waited for about 10 minutes for our waiter to greet us. Even then, I'm not sure he would have if he hadn't  noticed my girlfriend grab a glass bottle of water from a nearby bucket to at least start to quench our thirst. Then, when he came over, he stole the bottle of water from us, despite the fact we said we were very thirsty and needed lots of water. He seemed surprised and unprepared that we were ready to order, but took our order.
"We'll start with the mini lobster roll appetizer and then 2 orders of fish & chips please with an iced tea to drink." He then disappeared again and about one minute (now they're fast?) later our delicious (5 stars) mini lobster rolls showed up via a stranger, not our waiter and were consumed. Our fish & chips came soon after, also delivered by a different stranger, and while not as good as the appetizer the fish and tartar were good (4 stars) the chips were burnt on the outside and raw inside ( NO STARS ). 
The waiter never checked on us and we felt inclined to ask the random people delivering food to us for help, which they did for some things. Even telling the waiter that we wanted to order dessert. "Sticky Toffee Pudding" (3 stars) and a double espresso (2 stars). Our bill for lunch was about $110 - we left only a $10 tip which I wish the random strangers would get not our absentee server. I had intended on trying Gordon's BurGr restaurant

So here is the real deal review of Mr Ramseys place. First let me tell you in was excited to eat here as I am a fan of Chef Ramseys attention to detail and search for excellence.  So I was expecting great things. 

The calamari was light and tasty nice seasoning and sauces were good. We were off to a good start. For a main course I had the new York strip. I ordered it medium and it came medium well. Still it was very good and the sauce was nice. The potatoes that came with it were cold and not seasoned. The other veggies on the plate cold. I tried the chicken pot pie and it was not bad not great. 

Dessert was a sundae. Waiter didn't recommend anything. It was average sundae nothing special. I think the place is not bad not great better than an average pub but not what I would have expected from someone so demanding of excellence.
The food was like and decent restaurant not what you would expect from a Gordon Ramsey quality restaurant.  Subpar for what we were expecting.

I ate here this last week and I really enjoyed it.  (*extended beer list at bottom)

Beer selection was out of this world. So many unique cool things to try. Menu was very different from anywhere else in town. 

Decor is VERY VERY COOL! Very Modern British PUB!

It seemed to me to be simply a very special place that is going to bud into an elite restaurant over this next year, being that it just opened. 

I've read some of the other reviews and find some of them quite funny. I don't know about you, but I don't go to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant for the Coke? Or the pepper for that matter. LOL. 

The hostesses Maria and Karen, were sweet, one took the info and the other pleasantly showed me to the bar.

 I ate the Beef Cheek and Short Rib Sandwich. Hands down the best sandwich I have ever eaten at a restaurant. So tender it melted in my mouth. Good flavors and sauces. It was obviously carefully created by a top chef. The fries were ginormous, but it was fun for a change. Even fry addicts like me enjoy a variation once in a while. 

The service was great. Gene took really good care of me. He got my order right away despite having a near full bar. Food came out very fast. Gene seemed sincerely interested in giving me a great experience and frequently checked back. To ask how I liked it. He was quick with the beers and had a smile the whole time. 

The bar did seem a bit messy through-out. Piles of napkins and crumbs and what not. But not a big turn off but would expect it to be cleaner. 

A manager did stop by (Eva.. Evie..Eve) to kindly check up to make sure everything was good. It was nice because I did not expect it sitting at the bar. 

I plan to come back frequently to this place. Seems like a good spot to hang out. Prices all seemed reasonable to me. I will gladly pay more for better product (duh!). 


Now good part. They have like 84 beers at this place. I will update it in the future. Here's what I recognized and remember from the beer list: 
Innis and Gunn
Blue Moon
Coorslight
Miller Lite
Pyrmid
Stella
Magic 9
Moa Method
Boddingtons
Guinness
Strong Bow
Bass

Delerious Tremmens
Duvel
Chimay (blue and Red)
Corona
Henry Wienharts
Heiniken
Heiniken lite
John Henry 3 Lik spiker
Belhaven
Fuli
Dogfish head 90
Ballast Point
Meantime Coffee something
Chocolate Stout

Had a solo dinner here, I ordered a lamb burger because I'm a sucker for lamb burgers. I had high expectations since Gordon Ramsey's name is attached to this place but I was so underwhelmed. The burger was good but it's not something I'd go back for. 

The service, on the other hand, is exceptional!! My server was very gracious (sorry to say I cannot remember her name!) and the manager came twice to check up on me throughout the night.

Food is OK, wifi connection is great and if you like to people watch, grab a spot by the "patio" railing. Yes it's noisy but it's also very entertaining watching the people who pass by.
My family went here after a show at the colleseum . The indian fare we ordered was horrendous. The pub grub was ok .

Honestly the BEST fish and chips I've ever had, including many places on the coast! The waiter was so nice, which is pretty hit and miss in Vegas. My daughter had the lobster rolls,which were delicious also. Wish I would have had room for dessert! The picture is after I had eaten half of it, sorry about that, but just the best, light and flakey fish ever.

Our server Micheal was awesome . We were one of the first tables in there at 11 am , he was patient with my in laws, who were celebrating over 30 years of marriage and a birthday too. He was helpful with suggestions . Food was great , pesto chicken sandwich , truffle fries and fish and chips . Great service and good food. Thank you .

Food was good. Service excellent, friendly and responsive. 

But if you're English you'd be disappointed if you ordered an English meal because it doesn't taste the same. It's good but just not the same. I ordered bangers and mash and the sausages are not near what english sausages taste like. I also had the Scotch egg and had sticky date pudding for dessert - both were very nice and worth the price - again just not the same.

So in summary excellent menu unless you're an English person looking for a bit if the old country.

One more thing I sat at a table with high back chairs. The chairs were comfortable but it feels too low compared to the height of the table.

Just stopped in for drinks but those drinks were worth a review. I had the Pub Crawl. A ginger and bourbon concoction that was fantastic. Wife had the Blueberry Smash. Awesome and I don't generally even like blueberries. Our bartender Tom even gave us a free drink experiment using basil, ginger and lemon. Don't even remember the liquor base but it doesn't matter. I think we'll be returning this week for dinner because the fish and chips next to us looked and smelled amazing.

I never ate at a Gordan Ramsey restaurant So I was excited to be wowed. I  was going to have dinner there but after my lunch experience I decided to go to Hugo's cellar on Freemont st (highly recommend) All I was looking for was something light to hold me over for awhile so my brother and I ordered just some soup I had the chicken leek with broad noodles and truffle fries off the happy hour menu. my nephew had a bacon burger and Fries my brother had a bowl of split pea. my soup was bland and flavorless more like grease and water only two curl noodle not broad. the fries were like Mcdonalds with some and a small some of truffle spray
my nephew only ate half of his burger so my bro and I took a few bites and to say the least not impressed again very little flavor the bacon was a little under cooked. All they sell there is the name. You better off at the lobby bar and grill in the hotel. I mean if they can't do soup and burgers for lunch than dinner is out of the question. Its was Hells kitchen alright.. Bloody Hell Gordan.

This restauraunt completely affirmed the stereotype about bland British food. The $40 ribeye was beyond disappointing. It was ordered medium-rare and came out well the first time, rare the second. The "seasonal" vegetables (vegetableS plural) that came with it were 4 fat, unseasoned sticks of asparagus. Pitiful.

Also, the busser dumped a drink all over us right as we were getting ready to leave. 

Giving 2 stars because our server was solid and the craft cocktails were pretty good. However, I cannot recommend this restauraunt to anyone.

The service was like a Greek tragedy and you hoped the food contained poison so that the evening would end early.   I haven't complained to the manager about service in years, but that changed last night.  While GR's pub food is generally fine, the overall experience was horrible.

I may be bias as I am slightly in love with Gordon but this experience was amazing. 
I had the fish and chips how could you not right?! Al had the lamb burger and they were both so flavoursome and decent portions which I wasn't expecting. We did not have a long wait for a table either which was an added delight. 
The decor was really cool like an English pub and the menu had something for everyone but not to big either. The service was exceptional we actually had a uk waiter who we had a great chat with. The meal was presented well and cooked to perfection. I look forward to our next Vegas trip and will definitely hit this restaurant up again. 
The only let down to this meal was that Gordon did not make an appearance while we were there, however look at the picture I post with this I got the next best thing lol!!!

This place is good! Chef Ramsay's restaurant was solid! I'm sorry but I really couldnt find anything to talk badly about it. The boyfriend and I made reservations for Valentine's day. We got there 15 minutes early and got seated right away...surprisingly the place wasn't crazy busy. Drinks were very good...had the Belgian margarita and a 20 oz pint of innis and gunn. Both drinks rocked! Started with a scotch egg appetizer..then had bangers and mash as my main. The boyfriend had fish and chips. Both dishes were solid! Very tasty! I wish I had that fish batter recipe! Soo good! Bangers were tasty as well! Finished with sticky toffee! Very good! Service was definitely on point. We had a great experience and don't understand why yelpers don't want to give this place more stars! Come on people! Yes, its pricey..but its Vegas and a celebrity chefs restaurant! So you should know the drill! Good place!!

Came here to enjoy lunch on our first day in Vegas. We ordered the Cheese & Charcuterie Board, the Fish and Chips, and the Sticky Toffee Pudding. Absolutely loved the fish and chips - served as it should be - just like back home in the UK. The waiter was incredibly informative, offered up nuances and backstories to the items we had ordered. The real highlight though, was the Sticky Toffee Pudding! Beyond gorgeous! I will be looking for Ramsey's recipe in order to make it at home! Check this place out for sure!

So, i read the reviews before going to Gordon Ramseys to get some fish and chips....like everything else thats reviewed, you have to choose who to believe
My wife is from england so her opinion on fish and chips really means something
I think "delicious" was the only word she said until her plate was clean

Anyone who said that the service was bad, obviously did not have Afro as a waiter....he was funny, personable and just a pleasure to be around. Nice guy.
Ask for Afro and enjoy
Amazing ! First class food and treatment. Calamari, lobster rolls and pastrami sandwich ... Sooooo good. Thank you Randy for making my birthday extra special ! Can't wait to come back.

Meh.. it was ok... 
nothing to rave about at home.  The name really got us at the door and Im pretty sure for most people.  We were hungry did a lot of shopping wanted a quick drinks and food.    And we were in the area.  It was busy waited 10 minutes for a table.  The restaurant itself was cool, the decor was "ragged British" leather, dark colours, and metal.  The menu wasn't to big but had options.  I went it a caesar salad and onion soup.  Friends had drinks.  Coming to Vegas its all about eating for me, service was ok we wanted to order more drinks but it was hard to get our servers attention, we ended up rushing out.  Food, I had pretty much appys it was ok, I cant say for other menu items because I didn't try it.  Overall it was ok.

Just celebrated my birthday with family and friends at Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill. My sister wanted to go there and try the Scottish Eggs and it was not on the menu. The waiter was able to get it for her even though the item was being removed from the menu. I tried it, and it was delicious. I ordered the fish and chips and the fish was outstanding. I'm not a big french fry lover and I ended up giving them to my brother-in-law who had the Shepherd's Pie. He said it was very tasty. At the end of the meal, the waiter brought over a Stick Toffee Pudding to celebrate my birthday. YUM! The fresh caramel sauce just clinched it and I can't wait to go back again.
Service was terrible, server William was arrogant and rude. Steak was overcooked, server didn't seem to care. Rest of the food was pretty good. Not what I had expected.

The food was good but the service was slow and the bill for four came to $225. Yikes. 
We had two appetizers, fish & chips, a chicken pot pie, a pot pie sampler, a Caesar salad, one alcohol drink, three sodas and two desserts. Does that sound like a $225 meal to you? 
$29 for two pieces of fish and shoe string fries? Really?

There was a side order of Yukon Gold mashed potatoes listed on the menu for $12 or $13. Those potatoes would have to perform a dance or stand up routine to be worth that kind of money. This is pub food not fine dining.

The only reason we went was we had $125 worth of gift certificates we had to burn and this place had space available on a Saturday evening. We never expected to have to add $100 to cover the bill.

Wow! Food was off the charts and the service was spectacular! We started with the fried pie sampler and then split a burger. It came out promptly (we told our server Sara S. that we had to catch a flight) it was out of the world! Also came with a homemade garlic mayo (I personally detest mayo, but could not get enough of it!) We finished the meal with sticky toffee pudding (heavenly). My eyes were rolling in the back of me brains! Not sure why there are so many mixed reviews...we will definitely be back again!

I can't believe the negative reviews on here. We just finished lunch and the fish and chips blew my mind. Hands down the best I've ever had including England, and that is seriously saying something. I don't know what kind of voodoo they used to to make that breading but it was light and crispy and shattered like glass when you cut it. 

As for service, impeccable. Our water was filled so smoothly my husband commented that he hadn't even noticed it happening. It was like a well practiced production where everything appears and disappears seamlessly.

You will spend $100. It isn't fancy food it is straightforward and done really well. If you are looking for something fancy then it isn't the right place. If you appreciate food done right then here is your place.

For drinks and snacks while watching a game ok. For a real meal, find any of the 1000 other places on the strip to try. 

Service was slow and lackluster. Knowledge of the menu was way below par for a restaurant with this claimed pedigree.  Bottom line, trying to do upscale British food is a lose, lose.  Shepard's Pie was bland and about half way though butcher paper was found nestled in  with the plain mash potatoes which topped this wreck.  


Stick to beer and fish sticks. You would be better off with that.   They really don't do much well for the price.

Yikes. .. was I disappointed or what. this place was so expensive and so under par that I am amazed it came from the same team that brought me Gordon Ramsey Steak - and "holier-than-thou-TV Chef-erie". Common Gordon - whip these underling's butts into shape - please.

We started with the lobster-rolls for 21 bucks - for 2 small ones. And when I say SMALL --- they were essential common dinner rolls with a tablespoon of so-so lobster salad (or should I lobstery say celery salad) on top (not even in it). This would have been one of my grunge snacks in college when I was going to school in Boston, using left-overs from my dad's dinner visit the night before, and some hamburger bun from the pantry. Gordon! GORDON!

The best dish I had was the pea soup with crème fresh - a little watery but tasty. At least tasty in light of things.

My companion and I had hoped that things would go up from here - however - the truffle fries were oily, mushy and Luke warm (obviously left under a heat lamp for too long) ... the fish was over cooked and the breading fell off too easily (obviously under the same heat lamp no doubt). ... and the minted mashed peas were cold (I was really looking forward to these too).

Total bill for all this (a couple of appetizers and one main course to split) was around a hundred bucks.

SAD

Luckily I Bitched loudly - and the very nice manager gave me a discount on the bill, and a free dessert (a really tasty sticky toffee pudding - the best thing that we had here). So come here for dessert and get the pudding: it is served at room temperature and comes out of a big common pan - so no immediate cook-prep required. The theory - like in the army - keep things simple.

When I went to the bathroom (not because of the food) I noticed that there are hundreds of seats here - many of them full - and the food rushes out quickly to them all - so obviously the kitchen prepares their dishes more like TGI Friday's rather than Gordon Ramsay Steak: fast and finished quickly. But at TGI Friday' you get what you pay for.... and at Gordon Ramsay's Pub & Grill: YOU DON'T.

The service here was splendid, the server was a little older and loves to explain us the menu. I really thought the fish batter and chips were okay... The buffalo wings though were exceptional. but what made me fall in love with this place was was the dessert. I don't even remember the exact name of the dessert, all I know was that it was a triple chocolate dessert like crepe brûlée in a glass cup. It came with these mini chocolate chip cookies I couldn't get enough of. Like I really loved it!!

$51 for fish and chips, a beer, and tip. Service was great. Fish and chips was crap. Batter soooo thick. Fries cold. I wish I could yell in Gordon's face like he does to others on TV. Don't waste your time eating here unless you have money to burn.

I would not come back.  The prices were high for bar food and there were several misprints on the menu.  I expected more from Gordon Ramsey.  Food was average.  The one good thing was the devil eggs... If you find yourself there, get them!

The food was good, but it was outrageously expensive.  We ordered fish and chips (excellent), a hamburger (ordered medium, which was practically raw), soft pretzels (quite nice!) and bacon wrapped dates.  The food was good, but not really much better than what you would find at any brewpub across the country.  Certainly not worth what we paid, however, that could be a Vegas thing and not a Gordon Ramsay thing.

I went to the self named pub of Gordon Ramsay to see if it truly lived up tie the greatness of the man who it was named after. And I must say, it certainly did.

At first glance you can see by the decor the theme they were going after; a charming casual place that served bold flavors. The menu was appropriately priced for Vegas and the food was modeled after a traditional English pub with keeping its American guests in mind. The beer list had a nice blend of English ales and some good American craft beers among the standard miller lite. 

As for the food, I had the corned beef sandwich as a few bites of the lamb burger. Both were outstanding in flavor and well portioned. Having them accompanied by a 90 minute IPA, my lunch was set. 

I give my recommendation and hope you have a chance to try it.

The food is pretty average but the prices are insane. $30 for fish and chips? I guess they are tourist prices but for those prices there is better food in Vegas. 

Ordered the calamari to start. It's pretty generic and come w tartar sauce and some homemade version of ketchup. Unfortunately they don't have regular ketchup for fries. They just have their version which has horseradish in it. Not a fan. Lobster roll was fine. Nothing special. Pastrami sandwich was also fine. All in all, everything was just ok.
Had the Dish and chips...flavorful...but not hot...sort of tasted like it had been in the window for too long before serving. Sweet pea salad was good.

Maybe I'm giving the poor review because I went to BurGR the night before and had such a great dining experience. Food and service were mediocre. After eating at BurGR I was motivated to try all of Gordon's pubs. Disappointed. Appetizers were good.

Hungry, hot, overworked (came to Vegas for a business trip, sadly not fun) my coworkers and I decided to try this place since it was close by and seemed to have lots of items that would be filling.

Pros first!
- Their burgers were AMAZING. The meat is cooked perfectly and portions were just right. 
- The fish and chips were great and portions were HUGE. I could only finish half of it. 
- Our server was really nice and gave us free pens at the end of our meal (sucker for free stuff..)

Cons... one kinda big con actually....
- When we arrived we had no reservations, BUT we saw the entire front section was open with about 15 tables or so. However, when we asked for a table, they told us there was a 30 minute wait...but their were tons of available tables... none the less we were all hot and tired and decided to just wait it out and ended up only waiting 15 minutes, but still...you would think with all those available tables they could give our small group of 4 one table. Guess they were ALL reserved since on our way out the tables were still empty.

Being a longtime fan of Gordon Ramsey, I must admit that my expectations for this Pub were pretty high.

Our server was very friendly and pretty good. We started off with the Pretzel Appetizer - not any better than any other pretzel appetizer you could get at any sit-down restaurant. We then ordered the scallops, mashed potatoes and lobster mac & cheese.

Scallops - they were cooked decently, but surprised by how tasteless and bland they were
Mashed Potatoes - Very tasty and very lumpy, but in a charming way
Lobster Mac & Cheese - Not as tasty as I was hoping. Was even more disappointed when I CHOKED ON PIECES OF LOBSTER SHELL in my food.

I did notify the server about the shells who then spoke with one of her bosses not more than 5 feet from me who said they didn't shuck the lobster from the shell, but that it comes pre-done. Now there are 2 things that really bother me about this situation: 1) I paid $27 for Lobster Mac & Cheese and it appears that quality is not a priority for this restaurant. 2) The manager didn't even take the time to come and apologize to me. I wasn't expecting this to be comp'd, but an apology for serving me lobster shells in a dish that is supposed to be void of it I think merits at least an apology.

This place was very yummy! I was excited to come here because I have been to the other two Gordan Ramsay restaurants in Vegas and wanted to dine at this one as well. I met to co-workers there and it was a nice place to sit and chat since we hadn't seen each other in a while. I loved our waiter. He was really nice and made recommendations for us when I asked. It did take a while to have the food come out but since we were talking a lot we didn't mind.

I started dinner off with a cocktail. I had the spiced cider which was amazinggg. If you like any kind of ciders or if apples are your favorite fruit get this drink. It was very tasty. I also loved that they brought out pretzels and bread as a free appetizer. They give you a roll and three different kinds of pretzels along with a horse radish cheese dip and butter. Amazing and a great touch to the start of the meal. I got the Beef Cheek stew because our waiter said that if you wanted to try something different to eat that. I really enjoyed it. The beef was so so tender, maybe just a bit on the salty side. I was surprised because it wasn't so much of a stew as it was just beef with potatoes and veggies. I still enjoyed it though-I love when my beef is tender. We also got a side of the Yukon potatoes. They were great and went really well with the beef. I would get these as a side again. Then for dessert we had the chocolate dessert. I forget what its called but it has three different kinds of chocolate mousse in between chocolate cake and topped with whipped cream and chocolate caiver. It's served in a mason jar which I thought was cute. It was Delicious! And my favorite part of the meal (of course). I would get this again.

I really liked this restaurant and would go here again. The next time I plan on getting the mini sliders because I noticed a ton of people got them and they looked amazing! I also want to try the French Onion Soup. Excited to go back soon! :)

Vegas trip with my wife and friends and we decided to eat here cause of the long wait at the buffet. I believe the servers name was Alan, he was an amazing server, answered questions well, friendly and polite. Only reason why its a three star was because the food was ehh.. If youre craving greasy buttery salty food this is the place to go, if youre not, ehh not the best place. We ordered the two famous Burgers, they were okay but other than that we tried the fish and chips and salad, an 4 people ordered and left more than 50 percent of the food. Server got it those extra stars! But who knows, maybe we just all have different tastes.

All stuff were very friendly and great job!!
Casual and confutable seat and big restaurant. I wish they have more choice of salad menu!

Kitchen Nightmare
I took a few days off last week to celebrate yet another year getting away from me. My wife and I went to Vegas, not for the gambling but for the entertainment and food. We stayed at Caesars Palace and one evening we thought we'd try the "Gastro Pub" experience offered by none other than Brit Bad Boy, Gordon Ramsay. Truth be told, although I love to cook, I'm not a huge fan of cooking shows, and shows where Mr. Ramsay makes a buck by humiliating what are often hardworking (albeit out of their depth) restaurateurs I find less than edifying. As a fellow reasonably foul-mouthed Brit bad boy who has been known to yell on occasion, maybe I just find it too close for comfort.

In any event, I love good Pub Grub so we gave it a shot. In their defense, the beer menu was excellent and the chips (French Fries for our US cousins) were authentically soggy and British... but beyond that, the food was just horrible... by far the worst we had all week. What was especially galling was the pretense that this was in some way Great British cuisine. Let's all agree on something... much (if not most) British food is horrible... really horrible. It's food made by poor people from less than great ingredients, typically over cooked under spiced and dull. It may have won us the British Empire... but it would get one star on Yelp on a good day. It is possible to do British staple dishes really well, with great ingredients and proper care Bangers and Mash or Fish and Chips can be killer... that's what's behind the current craze of "Gastro Pubs." Unfortunately, done poorly Brit Grub just sucks... as did the Fare at Mr. Ramsay's Caesars Palace joint.

To start with the bread was stale. I had the fish and chips with mushy peas; my darling wife had the "mixed grill". The fish bore absolutely no resemblance to real Fish and Chips, and the mushy peas were simply green peas which had been pulsed in a blender for a couple of seconds... not remotely authentic. The mixed grill (to phrase it how Gordon himself might) was "F*@king atrocious". The steak was perhaps passable (though over-cooked and served cold), the weird pork belly thing was a revolting gelatinous mess, and the lame lone shrimp was either horribly spiced or perhaps spoiled. The waitperson did her best, and when I pointed out the shortcoming she apologized but made no effort to resolve.

Mr. Ramsay, if you are going to use your brand and our heritage to foist over priced high concept but poorly executed crap to an unsuspecting world, would you at least take the "British" part out of your promotion to save us the national embarrassment.  There are a thousand chip shops or hole-in-the-wall cafes up and down our damp nation which wouldn't dream of serving up the swill you deal out in Vegas. It is (by the way) entirely possible to do that kind of fare well in a Vegas context, Todd English proves that to be true every day of the week. If the menu at Caesars was ever decent, it is being betrayed by your team there... sort it out!

If this makes it to your hallowed halls, we ate on September 10th and our check number was 1884527.

We went to GR's P&G this afternoon for lunch and, I won't ask forgiveness for being blunt, this place was absolutely terrible and the only black mark on an otherwise perfect tour of Vegas' fantastic dining experiences. 

I must also say that we have very forgiving natures when it comes to restaurants, and that neither of us are food snobs; we simply like good food, whether it's from a proper gastro-pub or from a fine restaurant. This of course was neither. 

I ordered the little sliders (I forget already what they called them, having all day tried to repress the memories). I don't mind paying good money for good food or for good quantities. These sliders fit none of those descriptions. Each was as small as a silver dollar, greasier than anything from a proper pub, and to be quite honest flavourless save for the strong garlic butter the came with. A "plate" of three of them cost 14 dollars. The "chips" were greasier than a fast food place, were not crisp, and flavourless to match the sliders. These little greese-bars were nine dollars alone. 

My charming companion tried the shepherd's pie. Being the verbally generous thing she is, she could only say that the dish wasn't terrible. A 22 dollar bowl of tripe is not what you'd expect from a fancy chef's establishment. Having tasted the pie myself, I could not be so forgiving in my description as her, nor could I really come up with something intelligent and so instead made, I think, an awkward face upon tasting it. 

The one thing I will say was pleasant was the service. The hostess was very friendly, and the server was rather attentive and pleasant. This, combined with the fact we were terribly hungry when we arrived, was the only thing stopping us from walking out. 

Again, I must point out that I am not snobbish when it comes to food. This place was terrible for cheap food, let alone for something this expensive. In our time at Vegas, I have eaten fantastic burgers at "I Heart Burger", "The Grand Lux Cafe", and KGB (Kerry's Gourmet Burgers" . . . Each of these phenomenal burgers were cheaper than my tiny little sliders and had flavors I cannot even describe. If you feel the need for a good burger, I would recommend any of those. 

I feel I must end this review on a positive remark . . . their little symbol of the Union Flag within an English Bulldog was cute.

We stopped by here last weekend around 4pm for Lunch to a medium sized crowd dining while watching football.  We didn't have reservations although they take them and were sat in 10 minutes.  We had the luxury of being seated at a low standing coffee table w/ two king chairs on one side and a huge sofa on the other.  Since our party consisted of me, my wife, my 6 month old and our 3 year old, the seating was perfect.  Our waitress came by within 2 minutes of us being sat to take our drink order.  For a gastropub, the "hard stuff" concoctions were a little limited (about 10 to choose from - zero tequila based beverages) as the majority of their libations are Beers.  Not a bad thing for a gastropub, but I like having variety open.  We ordered a very tasty Bourbon drink that immediately put a smile on my wife's face and I ordered a Rum concoction that tasted like a Watermelon Cooler.  To start we ordered the "Chilled Shrimp Salad" - poached in lemon-beer shandy, light ginger-mayo, w/ red cocktail sauce.  It came out in about 8 minutes and my 3 year old couldn't stop eating "his shrimpys".   Very good dish.
For our entrees, I ordered the Traditional Shepherd's Pie and the Beef Short-Rib & Cheek sandwhich - on hearth baked sourdough, horseradish mayo, roasted red pepper jam, red onion marmalade.  The Beef Short Rib was one of the best sandwich's i've had.  Dipping it into the horeseradish infused ketchup made all the difference too.  Couldn't get enough of this flavor bomb.  The Shepherd's Pie was also very good, but too traditional.  I would have preferred more gravy and less potatoes.  It was VERY traditional.  Not a bad thing, just hoped he would have kicked it up a notch.  Overall, the meal came out to $100 w/ the two drinks ($30) so overall, medium priced for a Casino meal and would go back.

Ate here on the 19th and it was the best meal we got in Vegas..the pretzels were delish and the Yorkshire fish and chips were the best I have ever had so moist and to thick and the chips were so different and good~~also go the Shepherds Pie and it was savory and so tasty~~but dessert takes the cake a triple choc triffle and a peanut butter and jelly cobbler were the total stars of the night~~will definitely eat here the first night every time we come to Vegas

Was at Caesar's on business...finished up about lunch time and ducked into this place for a bite to eat. Ordered the sliders and a caesar salad. Both items were tasty enough, but they also had issues. 

Not that there is a lot of leeway on a small piece of ground meat, but the sliders were medium well or well done. Waitress didn't ask, so I would assume they'd come medium...no such luck. I mentioned this to the waitress, and she replied that she would "tell the chef". That was the end of the subject. No offer to take it back and refire, take it off the check or at least apologize. FAIL. 

The caesar salad was good, but drowning in dressing. Ordered without the anchovies, and it came with them, as I found out by accident when I ate them. FAIL. 

Joined the Caesar's loyalty club to save a couple bucks too, and they didn't apply correct pricing on the check. FAIL. After pointing this out, they finally corrected the bill.

Out the door, $35 for less than a quarter pound of burger with cheese and a caesar dressing salad with lettuce. Pretty embarassing, IMHO. 

*Memo to Gordon: This place won't last long, serving mediocre and poorly prepared food. Service and preparation of the food was sadly lacking...basically a disorganized and lacking establishment. Let's just say I'm not eager to bet another $35 that it was just a "bad day". Despite this, I'm trying Gordon Ramsay Steak tonight...I PRAY that it's up to snuff. Otherwise, this guy is DONE with Ramsay restaurants. This was a Kitchen Nightmare for sure. Maybe you need to check up on your shops more often!

We almost didn't go here because the reviews said it was hit or miss. My husband and I decided to try it for happy hour. At first, when it took 15 min to get a draft beer and a soft drink, we could understand the reviews. We ordered deviled eggs and devils on horseback. The deviled eggs came out. They were great. Then the manager came out and said they had burned the bacon on the 2nd appetizer. He apologized and gave us 2 little dishes of chicken pot pie. And the devils on horseback came out within 2-3 min later.  Just that little thing with the manager made all the difference. It made us feel better and not just part of the huge vegas crowd.  We definitely will go back for a meal next time we are in vegas !

Besides seeing Chef Christina, the fish and chips were amazing.  Fish was perfectly battered, not too light, not heavy at all!  Good crispiness!  
Had the lobster and crab rolls as a starter.  Again, party in my mouth!  
Am glad to have tried another GR establishment!   Keep it up!

I have lived in Las Vegas for 13 years. Over the years when friends come into town for birthdays or business, I've been to many of these celebrity chef restaurants. Some live up to the hype. This one does not.

The Service: Our waiter had no personality. He delivered his opening spiel with all the charm of a robot. He performed his duties adequately but definitely did not go above or beyond. We ordered two desserts to split between the four of us. When they arrived we asked the server for two more plates but we never got them.  None of the employees seemed like they wanted to be there.

The Food: Enjoy the pictures of the bread? That's all you're going to get. They no longer serve it. I had the Shepard's pie which I thought was a little bland. Unfortunately there is no salt or pepper on the table. So I couldn't season it. My friends had the Fish & Chips. They remarked that it looked smaller than it used to be but was still good. Lobster Mac & Cheese is creamy and delicious. Sticky Toffee Pudding is indeed very good.

Overall, I was disappointed and it's way overpriced even for Strip food.

This restaurant is located in cesars right next to Mariah and Celine. It's actually a great place for large groups to come because they can accommodate big parties. Also good for people who like the drink beer ( even though it's pricey). They take reservations and make sure you do so you don't have to wait. The waiters and servers are really nice. Our survey Rodney was great!  He was friendly and waived or cake cutting fee!  Because if him I added an extra star. 

So why only three stars?  For the food and the price. Looking at the menu its traditional pub food. We ordered steak and ale pie, shepards pie, burgers, fish and chips, bangers and mash and short ribs... Basically almost everything on the menu.  Sounds really good. I never really crave this kind of food but I  thought it was great change. After ordering we were all really excited but the food took forever to come!!  I swear it was 45 mins. Granted we did have a bigger group of 8 but I thought it was still too long. I ordered the lamb burger upon recommendation. For 25 bucks a burger... I expected more. I tried Gordon ramsays burger place in planet hollywood and I thought that was way better. The meat was juicier and was less dry. The fish and chips were good and so was the steak and ale pie. When I say good it's not amazing or a must try. It's decent.  But it wasn't worth 30 dollars a dish. I think they charge for the atmosphere which is great but the food was sub par.  

This is a good option if you like pub food and enjoy the atmosphere more than quality of food. We had a great time with great company but I don't think I'll pick to eat at this place again. :)

Ordered the filet for dinner and got the weirdest thing I've ever seen that I should have taken a photo of :-(
I ordered it medium rare...it came not only medium but the "filet" was cut in half and cooked on both sides before.  I complained and the waiter said that really was a filet (eh?  weirdest one I've seen and I don't think it's good practice to cut it in half before cooking it).
The one they replaced it with was indeed a filet and cooked properly.  The sides were terrible.  I don't know why Gordon Ramsey put his name on this...if this were on any of his shows, he'd ream out everyone in the kitchen and the wait staff for what happened :-P

This is really the worst pub I have ever eaten at!  We should have left after looking at the menu, but I figured it really could not be that bad.  WOW was I wrong.

Fish & Chips; thick soggy batter with white mush inside for fish and Zero flavor.  The chips big huge block like sticks of greasy mush potato.

Brook Trout; a slab of fish with no flavor and root vegetables that tasted just like dirt.

So ok maybe the chef had a bad night, like he forgot his seasoning apron.  I could see a off night, but I can't  see horrible service.  Not in Vegas where ever casino has at least three great restaurant and five or so ok ones.  Our waitress or lack of one was awful she literally was never there.  I had to grab someone walking by every time we needed any thing drinks, bread, our order, and check.  Ok all that and a bus boy that spilled twice all over the table.  First time pouring water, he just kept pouring even after he had left the glass.  Second time picking up our plates, spilling what ever buttery watery juice came with the trout all over the table and my iPhone.  Each time he did this he never apologized or said a word.   Guess I can say, just don't go.  Go anywhere else, there are so many options

Food was great! Very rich onion soup. However, the high top table seating is the worst! The padding on the stools really sunk in making it hard to sit up straight, not to mention the rungs on that stool were pretty far down so your feet dangle. Very uncomfortable!  Made most of our party miserable. As I said though, food was great! Would come back if we could get a low table.

Server had the personality of a door nail, rushed us to make an order, described nothing about the drink menu or dessert menu

Portions are very small

Drinks were slow to arrive, we finished our meal and our round of drinks arrived in team for us to leave

Go to BURGR instead, cheaper and much better environment all around

Horrible, awful...unbelievably ridiculous! My family and I came here on Saturday night excited with high expectations.....to say we were disappointed is an understatement. After 35mins, asking another waitress to track down our waitress and complaining to the runner our food arrived cold, not all six entrees (burgers and chicken sandwiches) were brought out together...and the best part, 1 entree was missing!!!!! Oh, and we were still charged for the missing entree.....only after we complained was the item removed from our bill.

The most annoying part...they automatically charge 18% gratuity for parties of 6 or more.....smh, that explains why we weren't offered any type of apologetic gesture... Our waitress did apologize for the mishap when she brought us the check, but nonetheless....we couldn't wait to leave. 

The best part of the evening.....the sweet, attentive older Latina woman who kept refilling our water glasses. Give that lady a raise!

Convenient spot. Hubby had BLT and maple flavor of bacon over powered the sandwich. I had the wedge salad: blue cheese, tomato, onion, egg, bacon dressing. Maple flavor complemented the salad. Good service.

I went to Caesars Palace to eat at the Bacchanal buffet for dinner. Unfortunately it was filled to capacity, we were turned away. So we opted for Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill.  What a mistake!

We order the fish and chips  ($30). I've had better fish and chips at Long John Silvers and H Salt. The fish was dried out and crumbly. The French fries were soggy and limp.   For $30 definitely not worth it. 

The Mac and cheese with lobster ($28).  I've had better Mac and cheese out of a box, really!  The sauce was watery And the few tiny bits of lobster were not so tasty. 

The steak and ale pie. Basically it's a Shepard's pie made with beef instead of lamb.  The crust was soggy and the meat was so tasteless. 

I'd like to invite Gordon Ramsey to go and dine on some of this cuisine that bears his name. I don't think he'd approve. 

Very very pricey for less than average tasting food.

Back again after my wonderful first experience and craving for the best salmon I've ever had. This time around, we got seated right after walking up to the hostess without a reservation. It was around 6pm on a Wed night. Very different experience compared to the first time. 

Things have changed a bit since the first time I was there. First, the yummy complimentary bread is now $8. Second, the bar menu with the sliders is not available anymore. Third, my salmon is now prepared differently.  However, it was still perfectly seasoned, and skin, perfectly crispy. Unfortunately, my fish was still raw inside. Upon showing this to my waiter, he took it back to refire me a new one. I watched my family eat their yummy dinner as I waited for mine. Time seemed to have passed very slowly as I waited. When my refired salmon finally came out, it was as tasty as I could ask for.  To my surprise, my salmon was taken off the bill, and we were also offered a dessert of choice. This kind of service has ensured my return. 

While this place is pricey, the quality of the food and service matches it.  I just hope that changes in the future are more positive than negative.

I never went to a Pub and neither did my parents or my brother, so this was a first. 

The place is quite dim, but adds to the atmosphere. The seating is quite unconventional in my opinion. There are the couches or benches that have tables that seem quite low. A taller table would be very beneficial. 

When I went there, the service was great and spot on. 

The Food:
The lamb burger is delicious! Order that sucker as medium rare and you'll have no regrets. I was pleased on how much french fried it came with. Personally I think its around $2-5 over priced, but hey its a dish from an A list chef. 
The steak with potatoes and asparagus was very tasty and quite large, and I think it was worth the money.
The chicken sandwich is quite gigantic and wast good, not as good as the burger or steak in my opinion.

Only go, If you've been planning on eating at a Ramsay establishment for a while and have the money. 

Would I recommend it? Definitely, especially if they wanted to have an experience at a Pub. 

I'd give it around a 4.2/5

Great beer selection for a Vegas restaurant. Tried the UK flight, all very tasty. The atmosphere is great, plenty of TVs for watching sports - so the pub feel is legit. Tried the fish and chips, despite the $30 price tag. (oh yeah this is Vegas) Pleasantly surprised, fish was fresh and breaded and fried to order. Bland flavor but sauce and vinegar were provided with so no biggie. The chips (fries) were delicious. Big on flavor. Great experience would recommend to others!

Love love loved this restaurant! The food was fantastic and the desserts were out of this world amazing! The manager, Randy, was incredibly welcoming, friendly, helpful and made it our favorite restaurant to visit on the strip!!
If you like your steak medium rare, order it medium. All of our steaks were rarer than expected.

This is our favorite restaurant on the Las Vegas Strip!  The food is absolutely AMAZING!  Our waiter, Scott F., was so FABULOUS and very knowledgeable when we asked about the cocktails and he helped pair the perfect cocktail with our entrees.  You have to try this restaurant and ask for our favorite waiter, Scott F...you won't regret it!  :)

Thought this was a fun place to eat. This was the first time I was able to have bangers and mash, and it left me wanting more. Also I am a fan of Fullers beer. I had to ask but they did have ESB on draft. I must say it has never tasted so good. If I am ever in Las Vegas again I will definitely be going back!  Service was good too.

Excellent service and food, I had the bangers and mash with a pint. Food was prepared with care and the atmosphere is lively. I particularly have to compliment the service of Scott F., who provided communicative and excellent service.

LOVE this place. As soon as we sat down the bartender took care of us. The beer selection was great. Bartender that helped us was RAY RAY. He was amazing and made the whole experience awesome. We planned to have 1 drink each but ended up wih a lot more. Favorite bar in ceasars. Amazing service. Thank u ray ray
Will be back again!!!

My husband and I are huge fans of ramesys  so we were quiet excited to go to his pub and grill. We were worried that everything wouldn't live up to our expectations. the entire experience exceeded our expectations! I order the chicken sandwich and he got the shepherd pie. Both were amazing and we will for sure be back.

Gordan Ramsey needs to make a visit and yell at someone!! read on to see why!

A local recommended this place as they had the best fish in chips in town, so my husband being a big fan of fish and chips, we thought hey why not? 

Well, once we got seated, I looked around that people had pretzal breads at their tables, and I thought, looks good and cant wait to try. 

Once we ordered our drinks, and food, there was no mention of bread coming or anything. So I looked at the menu, and did not see it on the menu to order it. We thought, it must come later.

So after about 15 min, we got our drinks, and no bread.
Another 15 min, no bread. by this time, we are like WTF? Our waitress did not even come by!! UGH. I am hungry and mad

So 10 more min, she came by and we asked about the bread, and she said, " you have to order it". well by this time, our dinner was coming, and we said no.

Our food finally came. I ordered the Salmon, and I had asked if it was salty, and she said no. well first bite: SALTY!! UGH! Oh and it said it came with garlic chips, so I was expecting FRIES! as the rest of the menu had CHIPS (which are fries). Well you know what they were? SMALL ASS 4 pieces of garlic american chips. So small I didnt even see them!!! 

the fish and chips were OKAY, notthing special. I have had much better in Seattle and in dana Point, CA. 

So overall:

1. SERVICE: SUCKS! ( water NEVER got refilled)
2. FOOD is WAY TO Overprices for what you get (I can get much better food for the same price in Vegas)
3. FOOD IS OKAY, nothing WOW.

I will never come back here again, and I do not recommend it at all. horrible horrible. Dont waste you time. Vegas is about fun and good food, well this is not one of them. 

Gordan Ramsey, sorry  this place is not so good.

Wow. Pitiful, pitiful meal!

I asked the hostess if I could get a good Veg option and I was told "Absolutely I'm a Veg myself and I eat here all the time."
